detailedDescription:
**Property Reference RA0083**

Presented to the market chain free is this spacious 4/5 bedroom family home situated in a quiet location.

Arranged over approximately 2000 sq ft the accommodation on the ground floor comprises of spacious through lounge, bedroom with access to bathroom, and extended 22ft kitchen dinning room to the rear of the property with direct access to the garden.

On the first floor there are 4 bedrooms and a bathroom. Three of which are well proportioned whilst there is smaller office sized room. The property is light and contemporary throughout and offers the perfect accommodation for a large family.

Elmdene Road is situated approximately 0.6miles from Woolwich centre where there are various modes of transport available to central London, these include the South Eastern Rail, DLR, the Thames Clipper and Cross Rail in the not to distant future. The open green spaces of Plumstead Common and Woolwich common are also situated close by and there are currently 2 Ofsted Outstanding Primary Schools under a 0.5 miles from this location.

Properties of this size are rarely available to the market so contact us now to organize your viewing.

detailedDescription:
Ultra modern, fifth floor, one bedroom apartment, situated in a well maintained exclusive block which forms part of an extremely desirable development..

Internally the property is extremely spacious and briefly comprises; an open plan reception room, with a high end kitchen and access to your private balcony. A large double sized bedroom and a sumptuous three piece bathroom suite completes the accommodation.

Located within the popular Greenwich Millennium Village, offering superb transportation and quick access to North Greenwich for the O2 and Jubilee Line. There are also many frequent bus links in to Greenwich, Blackheath and the Royal Standard where you will find further amenities, highly regarded schools, along with beautiful green spaces for you to enjoy.

Further benefits of note include; concierge, double glazing and long lease.

detailedDescription:
Exp are delighted to bring to market this lovely studio apartment with a separate bedroom area found on the ground floor of this impressive semi detached Victorian house located close to Blackheath Village and sold chain free.

The property briefly comprises of a large living / dining area with direct access to the communal gardens, separate bedroom area, modern kitchen and a three piece bathroom suite.

Added benefits include gas central heating, and residents parking with access to apartment from either front main entrance or rear.

The property also has security bars. To the rear is a large communal gardens and courtyard. This is a perfect flat for a first time buyer or a buy to let landlord as the property is sold chain free. The property is very convenient for transport links with buses stopping for Blackheath Station, 0.7 miles, Greenwich and North Greenwich, 1.9 miles. Blackheath Common, (0.4 miles), and Greenwich Park, (0.8 miles), are both just a short walk and Blackheath Village with its array or restaurants, bars and boutique shops is only 0.6 miles (approx 12 mins walk).

Situated on the popular Greenhaven Drive development in Central Thamesmead with great views overlooking The River Thames is this lovely, two bedroom 2nd floor purpose built flat. Entrance door. Radiator. 2 storage cupboards. Laminate wood flooring.

Double glazed window with views over looking River Thames. Two radiators. Laminate wood flooring.

Kitchen

Double glazed window with views over looking River Thames. Range of wall and base units with rolled top work surfaces. Radiator. Plumbed for washing machine and dishwasher. Built in oven and hob with extractor fan over.

Double glazed window to rear. Radiator. Laminate wood flooring.

Double glazed window to rear. Radiator. Laminate wood flooring.

detailedDescription:
Stunning one bedroom apartment situated in Bayliss Heights in the immensely popular Greenwich Millennium Village development, North Greenwich.

This bright, airy and very spacious one bedroom apartment is beautifully presented and in immaculate condition. Being one of the largest styles of one bedroom apartments on the development, accommodation comprises of a spacious lounge with a sleek and stylish open plan kitchen, large double bedroom, modern bathroom and large storage cupboard.

Further benefits include a large sunny balcony and concierge services. The development is located minutes from North Greenwich tube station (Jubilee Line), the Emirates Cable Cars and the O2 with the many attractions within, including bars and restaurants and shops. Other notable amenities within walking distance include, schools, the river bus, local retail park and supermarkets.

detailedDescription:
A modern four bedroom, three bathroom semi-detached family home. Benefitting from a stunning open plan ‘L’ shaped kitchen/ living room area, three bathrooms and integrated garage with driveway.

*29ft open plan ‘L’ shaped kitchen/living room* *bi fold doors to garden* *four double bedrooms* *three bathrooms* *balcony access from master bedroom* *off street parking*<br/><br/><b>Key Terms</b><br/>The vendor has advised us that there is an Estate Charge of approximately £200.00 Per Annum.

Entrance Hall:

Stairs to first floor. Tiled flooring. Access to garage.

Ground Floor Cloakroom/WC:

Fitted with a white two piece suite comprising of an enclosed cistern WC and a vanity wash hand basin. Tiled flooring. Part tiled walls.

Diner/Family Room:

Carpet as fitted. Double glazed windows to front and rear. Bifold doors to rear. Tiled flooring. Feature vertical radiators. Kitchen area fitted with a range of modern wall and base units with complementary work surfaces and island with breakfast bar. Two integrated stainless-steel ovens with separate hob, filter hood and mirrored glass splash back. Two Integrated stainless-steel microwaves and two integrated warming draws. Wine cooler, 'American style' Fridge/freezer to remain. Integrated dishwasher and tumble dryer.

Landing:

Carpet as fitted. Storage cupboard with mega flow system. Access to loft with pull down ladder.

Bedroom 1:

Two double glazed windows to front. Access to balcony.

En-Suite Shower Room:

Fitted with a white four piece suite comprising of a low level WC, tile sided bath, shower cubicle with shower over and a vanity wash hand basin. Chrome style towel rail. Tiled flooring. Tiled walls. Opaque double glazed window to rear.

Bedroom 2:

Two double glazed windows to rear. Carpet as fitted.

En-Suite Shower Room:

Fitted with a white three piece suite comprising of a shower cubicle with rainfall shower, low level WC and a vanity wash hand basin. Chrome style towel rail. Opaque double glazed window to side. Tiled flooring. Tiled walls.

Bedroom 3:

Double glazed window to front. Carpet as fitted.

Bedroom 4:

Double glazed window to rear. Carpet as fitted. Fitted storage cupboards.

Bathroom:

Fitted with a white three piece suite comprising of an enclosed cistern WC, 'L' shaped bath with rainfall shower over and a vanity wash hand basin. Tiled flooring. Tiled walls. Chrome style towel rail. Opaque double glazed window to rear.

Rear Garden:

A landscaped garden with decking area. Steps down leading to artificial lawn. Shed to remain.

Garage:

Integral to front.

Driveway:

Parking for one car.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
"I have lived in this house for more than a decade and thoroughly enjoyed every minute. The house is spacious and easily flows from the front door through to the secluded sun trap of a garden.

What The Seller Says -

"The light and airy kitchen is my favourite space and I am really going to miss it.

My fellow residents on Pelton Road are really friendly, so the new owner will quickly get to know their neighbours.

As far as i’m concerned, the location couldn’t be better. If you like outdoor spaces, Greenwich Park is just 5 minutes away while the river Thames towpath is literally at the end of the road and a great place for a wander.

There are loads of local independent shops nearby and Greenwich centre with its pubs, restaurants and shops is just a short stroll - along with the Naval College, Museum and Cinema.

Central London is a few stops away by train, but there is also easy access to buses, DLR, underground and the Thames Clipper if you want to travel in style!

Maze Hill is a great place to live. The combination of a quiet neighbourhood but with so much to see and do on your doorstep made me fall in love with the area. I love it so much, i’m staying local."

What The Agent Says -

Spacious Victorian period house, in a great position just moments away from the River Thames path.

Inside you will find a lounge to front with feature fireplace and bespoke cabinets, dining room to rear offering fitted storage and direct access to a lovely bright kitchen, which includes some integrated appliances and direct access to a south facing private garden.

The garden is very private, has a built in shed and decking.

Upstairs you will find two double size bedrooms, both of which have fitted storage and a brand new en-suite shower room and brand new bathroom, with rain shower over bath.

Further benefits include double glazed sash windows, original wood floors, gas central heating and period style radiators.<br /><br />
title: 2 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
"When we viewed this period property we knew it was for us with its off-street parking, large windows, high ceilings, fire place and rear garden - it ticked all the boxes.

We were already living in the area so we knew how convenient and practical the area was, having great connections with trains and buses into central London and the local amenities, so

When we bought the flat it was in a tired state and in need of tlc. The flat has had two refurbishments in our six years here, the last one being two years ago including a brand-new combination boiler, and it’s such a cosy welcoming place to come home to after a long day at work.

Our garden, plus the green open spaces the area has in abundance, really disguise the fact that you are living in central London, and we found it to be a Godsend during the lockdown period. Combined with a great community feel and wonderful friendly neighbours, this all helped immensely and we feel so lucky to have lived here during this tough period.

We love living here and will take many cherished memories with us when we leave, but it is time for us to pass this wonderful home on to new people and wish them the happiness we have found here and hope they treat this home with as much love and care as deserves."

As the vendors say, this garden flat offers so much! With two double bedrooms, a wonderful open plan living space, off street parking, and a share of the freehold.

Highly recommended.<br /><br />
title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Situated within half a mile or so of highly regarded St. Thomas More rc primary school and with Kidbrooke station about a mile away, this three bedroom end of terrace house backs on to open space and has the benefit of plenty of off street parking. Offered with ground floor bathroom/wc and first floor wc, there are built in wardrobes/cupboards to all bedrooms and no onward chain. With a sizeable conservatory, the full width of the property, why not take a look - we hold keys.

Entrance hall Front door, double glazed window to side, radiator, understairs cupboard, tiled flooring

lounge 14' 8" x 12' 7"into recess (4.47m x 3.84m) Double glazed window to front, coal effect electric fire, radiator, fitted carpet.

Kitchen 13' 5" x 5' 7" (4.09m x 1.7m) Double glazed window to rear, fitted wall and base units with granite tiled work surfaces and splashbacks, space for fridge, dishwasher and free standing cooker, stainless steel chimney hood, radiator, tiled flooring

conservatory 17' 2" x 9' 7" (5.23m x 2.92m) Double glazed, four radiators, storage cupboard with granite tiled work surface.

Bathroom 5' 7" x 4' 8" (1.7m x 1.42m) Double glazed window to rear, white suite comprising panelled bath with mixer tap and shower over, wash basin, w.c, heated chrome towel rail, tiled walls and flooring

landing Double glazed window to side, radiator, loft access, fitted carpet

bedroom 1 10' 8" to fitted wardrobes x 9' 2" (3.25m x 2.79m) Double glazed window to rear, fitted wardrobes, radiator, fitted carpet.

Bedroom 2 10' 9" x 7' 2" to fitted wardrobes (3.28m x 2.18m) Double glazed window to front, fitted wardrobes, radiator, fitted carpet

bedroom 3 9' 4" longest point x 8' 1" widest point (2.84m x 2.46m) Double glazed windows to side and rear, built in storage cupboard, radiator, fitted carpet

separate WC Double glazed window to rear, wash basin, w.c, tiled walls and flooring

outside Well tended rear garden measuring approximately 58', patio area, outside light and tap, mainly laid to lawn with flower borders, shed, greenhouse, gated side access.

Parking to front for 3 cars

Preliminary details, awaiting validation

title: 3 bed end terrace house for sale

detailedDescription:
Located in the heart of the Royal Arsenal Riverside, offering appealing design, this bright and spacious apartment features a large private balcony.

Through the grand gated entrance into the private courtyard, the modern design of the development blends beautifully with the original character of the historic façade.

From the communal courtyard entrance there is a lift to the fourth floor where the property comprising an open-plan living space including fitted kitchen with Bosh appliances. There is a modern bathroom suite and a good sized double bedroom.

The local transport options are excellent with Woolwich Arsenal train station/DLR, Thames Clipper riverboat service and Woolwich Ferry all conveniently situated nearby. The immediate area is also set to benefit from the arrival of the new Crossrail station which is due for completion early next year.

Ideally positioned for an array of local shops, patisseries, restaurants and bars creating the unique village atmosphere, this apartment is an ideal first home or investment.

Leasehold: 115 Years
Ground Rent: £150
Service Charge: £2,100

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Today, Tomorrow, Together

In the heart of Thamesmead, Southmere, is a collection of 1,2 and 3 bedroom apartments available through help to buy and outright sale. A selection of apartments as well as 3 and 4 bedroom townhouses will be available through Shared Ownership.

Wonderful things are happening in Southmere and we’ve got big plans for the future. Our first launch will include homes for outright sale followed by Shared Ownership homes along with a new public square, civic building including library, a gym, café and other commercial and community spaces to follow. Crossrail is on the horizon at Abbey Wood, making the commute into London much quicker, Canary Wharf will only be 11 minutes away.

You’ll never struggle for space in Southmere with more than double the amount of green space per person than the London average and homes overlooking the Southmere lake.

We’re excited about where we’re going and we want you to come on the journey with us.

Pricing will be available when this development launches.

What is Shared Ownership?

Available to purchase through Shared Ownership, purchasers are able to buy as much of the property as they can afford, from 25 - 75%, paying a low cost rent on the remaining unpurchased 'share' of the home. What's more, your mortgage deposit is based on the value of the share you buy, not the full market value, making these high-spec homes even more affordable in such a sought after location.

Register your interest for Shared Ownership and be kept up to date with progress on the development and to be invited to the sales launch.

About Southmere So

In the heart of Thamesmead, Southmere, is a collection of 1,2 and 3 bedroom apartments available through help to buy and outright sale. A selection of apartments as well as 3 and 4 bedroom townhouses will be available through Shared Ownership.

Opening Hours

Mon-Fri 9am-5pm

title: 3 bed town house for sale

detailedDescription:
This deceptively spacious four-story end of terrace period home sits conveniently in the heart of East Greenwich, close to Maze Hill mainline station and local shops.

This beautifully presented home has three good sized bedrooms, a through lounge, a charming kitchen and a stunning four-piece bathroom suite. There is also a beautiful westerly mature rear garden which is secluded and sees plenty of sunshine and side access which has handy storage solutions both internally and outside.

This property really has it all from the curb appeal to the versatile living accommodation, a simply must see home as conveniently position between East and West Greenwich with a number transport links on your doorstep.

Early viewing are highly recommended

EWS1 Certification is available for this property - A2 rating (no remedial work required)

Situated within the ever popular and highly sought after Greenwich Peninsula development is this one bedroom apartment which can accomodate the ultimate city living.

Internally, the property has a fitted modern kitchen and bathroom suite complete with thermostatic shower and heated chrome towel rail. The south west facing balcony gives views across the City and Canary Wharf, a glorious spot to enjoy the evening sunset.

The building, surrounded by well-maintained landscaped gardens, benefits from an enviable location due to its proximity to North Greenwich Underground Station and ‘The O2’ within short walking distance, no further than an 8 minute walk.

North Greenwich Underground Station, within 0.4 miles, offers car free pedestrian access to the underground and bus services. Plus your journey into central London couldn’t be easier, with 10 minutes journey time to London Bridge on the Jubilee Line. A 2 minute underground journey to Canary Wharf provides access to further shops as well as access to the DLR and, in the future, Crossrail. The Thames Clipper offers a boat service into the City with various stops. Access to North London is provided by the Blackwall Tunnel which is within 0.5 miles.

'The O2' provides popular music and arts events, a multi screen cinema, bowling alley and a large selection of venues for food and drink. The 'icon Outlet' offers many designer stores, including Kurt Geiger, Hobbs, Nike, and Calvin Klein. Several large supermarkets (Sainsbury's, asda, Aldi, Lidl) are within a short walk on the Thames Path; the estate also houses an Ikea and B&Q.

A local Co-op and Tesco are just a couple of minutes’ walk from the apartment, together with a chemist, doctor surgery, hairdressers and other local services. Further afield, Greenwich Park and the iconic market are reachable via a short walk or cycle along the Thames Path. Away from the buzz, Blackheath provides a village feel with artisan bakeries, a farmer's market, and shops.

You will require a deposit to obtain a mortgage for this property

To meet the requirements for this property we require as a guideline, a minimum household income of £41,499. If you are offered the property, your ability to afford this property will be assessed at your financial interview. Please note that applicants should purchase the maximum share that they can afford and sustain.

Only applicants who are registered with London and Quadrant will be eligible to be offered the property for our schemes. Please visit our website to register. Please ensure to keep a record of your unique registration number.

Your home is at risk if you fail to keep up repayments on a mortgage, rent or other loan secured on it. Please make sure you can afford the repayments before you take out a mortgage.

These particulars are of opinion only, are intended to give a fair description and do not form the basis of a contract. The descriptions and all other information are believed to be correct as of June 2021.

detailedDescription:
Guide £675,000 - £700,000.

One of the most desired roads in Abbey Wood, New Road passes through the historic Lesnes Abbey Woods with it's spectacular array of seasonal-changing colours and wildlife; a truly beautiful spot in South East London. This home is situated on arguably the better end of New Road as you're just a 0.2 mile walk to Abbey Wood Train Station, where the eagerly anticipated CrossRail is set to open next year.

The property oozes with kerb appeal with it's beautiful exterior of Victorian-style Character featuring imposing bay windows with conical-roof design above the master bedroom, and boasts a Driveway providing Off Road Parking with plenty of space for two cars.

The accommodation comprises a Porch, a welcoming Entrance Hall with high ceilings in keeping with the character of the build continuing throughout much of this home. There is a 27' Through-Lounge filled with natural light, and two chimney breasts add to the aesthetics of the room. The family-sized Kitchen Diner features an integrated oven and hobs, space for appliances, and a utility cupboard housing a combi-boiler and plumbing for washing machine. Moving upstairs, the property offers a spacious Landing, a family bathroom consisting of a 3pc suite, and Three Bedrooms of generous proportions (the master bedroom measures an impressive 18' x 14'4).

Accessed via the Kitchen is a beautiful, well-tended Rear Garden of over 90, and south-westerly facing; your very own paradise in this corner of London. There's plenty of lawn, plus flower beds and shrubs, trees, and a storage shed.

Several houses in this street and local area have added extra living and bedroom space including conservatories, extensions, and loft conversions. With all that space in the garden expanding this home shouldn't cause too much of a dent in your outdoor space. (Subject to the necessary planning permissions, of course.)

If you've not been to Abbey Wood before, we highly recommend a visit, not only to come and see this great home, but also to explore this charming town and it's gardens, parks, multiple woods, ponds, Lesnes Abbey Ruins, the lake, nearby nature reserves and plenty more.

You'll also have a choice of several Supermarkets nearby, and the property falls under the catchment of 'Good' Ofsted rated primary schools, and bus routes provide good access for several secondary schools.

Book your viewing here today, call James Gorey Estate Agents now before it's gone!

title: 1 bed flat for sale

address: No.2, 10 Cutter Lane, Upper Riverside, Greenwich Peninsula SE10
detailedDescription:
Being one of just 41 individual apartments created by Tom Dixon in No.2 Upper Riverside, these sought after homes use industrial materials throughout lending a strong British narrative, and make reference to the history of Greenwich. The interiors strike a contemporary balance combining natural and warm materials like copper, leather and wood with bold sculptural forms.
The kitchen utilises the traditional enamelling processes of London's sign makers and hand-crafted copper cabinetry. The bathrooms create an immersive colour experience. The rich tones of the glazed tiles are complimented by the dichroic glass which adds a hint of technicolour to the space.
Located in Upper Riverside, one of five buildings designed by som, responsible for The Burj Khalifa in Dubai, these stunning buildings provide exclusive living with your own Upper Riverside Club. This gives you access to a 15th Renew floor given over entirely to your well-being, with 20m pool and spa pool, steam room and two well equipped gyms. An amazing residents terrace on this floor, accessed directly from the pool and gym provides you with fantastic panoramic views. A 24 hour concierge team is on hand to assist you in any way they can and are located on the Tom Dixon designed ground floor.
Call us now to book your appointment to view!

title: 2 bed property for sale

detailedDescription:
Basement Studio Flat, Flat 1,35 St Johns Park, London, SE3 7JW

Overview
Hammer Price Homes are delighted to present for sale by online auction this vacant & chain free lower ground floor studio flat located on the highly sought after St Johns Park.

The property, which has its own entrance, briefly comprises: There is an entrance hallway leading to a well sized living / bedroom, kitchen and bathroom with separate W.C. The gardens are not communal and parking is on street.

The property is in need of some enhancement throughout and would be suited to those looking for a modernisation project.

To view this property please visit the Hammer Price Homes website, register as a buyer and book your place on an open day.

Location

St Johns Park is extremely well located close to a host of local amenities and is within walking distance to the popular Greenwich Park. The property is also well placed for commuters, with access to the A2 closeby and Westcombe Park train station is within walking distance from here.

Other Information
Tenure – Leasehold (989 years remaining) – share of freehold

Ground rent: Peppercorn

Maintenance charges: £30 per month

Please note that the lease and land registry information is available for download from the hammer price homes website, please review the documents prior to bidding.

Boiler – Please be advised that the boiler for this flat is in a small communal store and will need to be moved into the actual by the new buyer post completion. Photo of the boiler is on the listing.

Auction Details
** Open to mortgage buyers also. 90 days to complete, no deposit payable**

Please note that there is a Reservation fee (2.4% Inc. VAT subject to a minimum of £3,000 Inc. VAT) payable by the buyer on winning the auction. The reservation fee does not constitute part of the sale price, this is the auctioneer's fee and is to be paid over & above the sale price paid to the Vendor.

Auction ends – Wednesday 28th July 2021 at 1pm

Bidding Window Opens – Monday 26th July 2021 (Bidding will not be possible until this time)

Starting price - £199,500 (Reserve price is higher & unpublished, typically the starting price will be 15 – 20% below the Reserve figure as per our Buyer Terms)

Viewings
We are working within government safety guidelines at all times, hosting tightly controlled open days. This property is vacant which means we should comfortably be able to follow social distancing guidelines.

We allow a maximum of 2 bookings per 15 minute time slot. Attendees are allowed to bring one other person with them to a viewing provided that they are within the same household /support bubble.

Viewers must to stick to their time precisely, and keep to the 2 metre rule if in the property at the same time as another viewer.

The wearing of face masks are required at this current time so viewers are asked to ensure they bring one with them, our host may have a small supply with them for those that have forgot to bring one. We will endeavour to supply hand sanitiser fluid at entrance and exit. Viewers are responsible for keeping up to date with local Government restrictions/guidelines and following them appropriately.

Property Details
Approx. Gross internal floor area – 480 sq ft / 44.6 sqm

Lower Ground Floor
Comprises of an entrance hallway leading to these rooms:
Living / Bedroom – 18'4 x 16'3 (5.60m x 4.96m)
Kitchen – 10'2 x 8'4 (3.10m x 2.54m)
Bathroom – 8'7 x 7'10 (2.62m x 2.40m)
W.C. – 4'6 x 2'11 (1.37m x 0.88m)

Parking
On street

How to make an offer
Offers can only be made via the online auction in the form of a bid once the bidding window has opened. No offers will be accepted outside of the auction process.
Once a sale has been agreed (STC) and a price agreed then no further price negotiation will take place. This sale price is fixed at the winning auction price and the buyer honoured to pay it. Any subsequent attempt by the buyer to contact the vendor direct to renegotiate on price would hold the buyer in breach of our terms. Should the buyer withdraw then they may have to forfeit the reservation fee. Please read the buyer terms and faq’s on the site for more details.
This is a probate property and is sold as seen. The vendors / solicitor may not be able to answer the usual pre-contract questions

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
John Payne are delighted to welcome to the market this stunning two bedroom semi-detached house located in the popular Rectory Fields, which is perfectly placed for both Greenwich Park and Blackheath.

Built in the 1840s, the property has a wealth of original period features and has been upgraded and well-maintained by the current owners. The property offers ample living space, comprising two spacious reception rooms, a modern kitchen with conservatory dining area, and a downstairs shower room. As you ascend to the first floor you are welcomed by a large master bedroom and a second bedroom leading onto a family bathroom suite.

Further benefits include ample storage from a cellar and cloakroom and a well-kept rear garden with day-round sunlight.

Located on the Blackheath side of the Rectory Fields Conservation Area, it is only a short walk to the convenient M&S Simply Food and independent shops and cafés of Blackheath Royal Standard. Westcombe Park mainline train station is a 15 minute walk away and offers regular links to London Bridge and the City. There are frequent buses to Blackheath Village (for boutique shopping, restaurants and direct trains to Charing Cross), North Greenwich (for the Jubilee line) and Greenwich (for its markets and the DLR).

For further information or to arrange a viewing please contact our Blackheath Standard office today.

detailedDescription:
Truepennys are delighted to offer to the market this outstanding 16th floor, one bedroom, sub-penthouse apartment in the sought after Precision development in Greenwich, SE10.

The apartment has been finished to a high standard with bespoke interior design finishes throughout and accommodation comprising a bright and spacious living open plan living room with engineered wood flooring, floor to ceiling windows with access to a large private balcony. Fully fitted designer kitchen with quartz stone worktop and up-stands, integrated Zanussi appliances, designer curved feature taps with hose-spray extension and an instant boiling water tap.

Generously proportioned double bedroom with woven carpets and built-in mirrored wardrobes. The stylish tiled bathroom includes a bath with shower over and features including a chrome heated towel rail, digitally controlled Smart Taps, Smart Mirror with LED lighting, shaver socket, digital clock and de-mist pad, walnut vanity unit with integrated storage space and black porcelain worktop.

The property is conveniently located moments away from the River Thames with Greenwich Town Centre only a short walk away providing an excellent array of shops, restaurants and the open spaces of Greenwich Park. Excellent transport links into central London and Canary Wharf via the A2, North Greenwich Jubilee Station (frequent bus route every 10 mins) and Maize Hill over ground Station.

Further benefits include use of a landscaped communal roof garden and secure underground bike storage.

detailedDescription:
Five Floor Property - Ideal For Investment - Beautiful Garden Terrace - Potential For Residential Above - Well Sought After Area - A Short Walk To Blackheath Rail Station - In Close Proximity To Greenwich Park - Located On A Busy High Street - Freehold Property

Durden & Hunt welcome to the market a five floor property in Montpelier Vale, a freehold property located in the delightful Village of Blackheath in South East London. The property is situated in a conservation area a stone's throw from the heath, Greenwich Park and the start of the London Marathon. The village boasts a host of restaurants, bars, shops and Blackheath Hall. The property is also in an ideal location, being situated a short walk from Blackheath Rail Station, which provides access to Central London.

The property is spread over five floors and was once two shops, which gives the future purchaser the potential of a substantial retail offering with a beautiful garden terrace with potential for residential above.

The property consists of:
A 633sq ft ground floor basement which was used as a night club which had a capacity of 100. There are also both female and male toilets in the basement with two exits.

The main floor on high street level which was used as a wine bar, and is glass fronted spanning the full front of the property, along with a kitchen area, which comes to a total of 1044 sq ft. The garden patio area is a hidden gem spread over 952 sq ft, with a service yard of 32 sq ft.

The second floor has both male and female toilets, with a VIP lounge bar spread over 737 sq ft.

The third floor has three rooms currently used as storage and office space with another kitchen area.

The roof space has velux windows and could easily be converted into a living accommodation and has four separate rooms.

The premises is licensed to sell on trade available on request.

The property has been owned by the current owner for 30 years and due to its location on the busy high street, is well sort after. This wonderful property must been seen to understand its true potential.

Offers in excess of £2,000,000

title: 4 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
"We see our property as a haven amidst the busy hustle and bustle of the surrounding area. Set back from the main road enough to enjoy relative peace and quiet, it benefits from mature front and rear gardens.

Having been a happy family home before being rented out since 2007, it provides bright, comfortable and flexible living. The two main reception rooms can be separated and the conservatory has been used as a laundry/utility room, a study, a music room and even a greenhouse!

Visitors often comment on the welcoming atmosphere in the house and there are excellent transport links and a variety of shops, restaurants and parks within easy reach.

The main works we have carried out are as follows: In 2006 we fully re-wired and re-plastered the house, and also installed a new kitchen and bathroom. The original floorboards have also been stripped and varnished and in 2009 we installed brand new bathroom windows. In 2012 a new flat roof was installed on our extension and a sun pipe was installed in the cloakroom - not to mention the loft having full insulation. 2013 brought along a new boiler and fresh upstairs plumbing, with a Worcester/Bosch combination boiler. More recently, in 2017 we placed new bathroom flooring and plumbing, new conservatory doors - which are guaranteed for 10 years - and just last year a new main roof was installed, guaranteed for 15 years."

As the sellers say, this is a wonderful family house at the end of a cul-de-sac, superbly located for the retail park shops, Westcombe Park Station, and buses into Greenwich and North Greenwich tube.

So much love and investment has been made into keeping this property really well-maintained, and is ideal for a new owner to benefit from!

Highly recommended.<br /><br />
title: 3 bed end terrace house for sale

detailedDescription:
Purplebricks are delighted to present this beautiful three bedroom semi-detached family home in the popular Shooters Hill area. This home is offered chain free.

This home will largely suit a young and growing family who wish to take advantage of the excellent local schools and the fantastic local amenities whilst looking for a home to put their own stamp on. Whilst this property is ready to move straight into, it provides the potential to extend to the rear and in the loft subject to planning approvals.

The home comprises of a spacious entrance hallway with under stair storage, two separate reception rooms, a well presented galley kitchen with direct access onto the private rear garden. The garden comprises of a decked section and a lawned section along with a outhouse that contains electricity and double glazing. Upstairs, there are three good size bedrooms and a large family size bathroom which contains a freestanding bath and separate shower cubicle.

This home is situated in the ever popular Shooters Hill area and offers a range of excellent local schools including Christ Church of England Primary School. There is also a range of great transport links nearby with excellent bus routes in close proximity along with Falconwood Station and Eltham Station nearby.

Viewing is highly recommended.

detailedDescription:
"Our flat in Charlton was our first family home. We loved our three years living there and were reluctant to leave.

What really attracted us to the property was the brightness of the flat at all times of the day and the fabulously peaceful location. The clever layout of the flat meant we had distinctive living spaces that didn’t encroach on each other, allowing us to use the space in different ways simultaneously.

The flat itself is a blank canvas allowing someone to really make their mark on the property. Lansdowne Lane is so peaceful and offers a piece of the countryside whilst living in zone 3 of London. Our neighbours are wonderful and have lived for years on the street - no one seems to want to move out of the area!"

As the seller says, this is an ideal first time home and is in a pleasant residential area. Lansdowne Lane is part of the Charlton Village Conservation Area, and this attractive building is perfectly located for the shops, park and station.

Chain free and highly recommended!

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
"Living is easy in our century-old house. We have lived here for more than fifteen years, bringing every room up to scratch for modern living while lovingly maintaining period features.

We were attracted to the expansive feel of the house, which is open to the sky as it is positioned above neighbouring roads and has soaring views of iconic London buildings from the rear.

The kitchen and dining room has been our sociable open plan space for cooking, eating and chatting, featuring a high ceiling and a period wood burner that has been the cosy backdrop for many suppers with family and friends during colder months. In warmer weather, we open the French doors into the conservatory and in turn those French doors on to the decking and garden, creating a flowing light-filled space for summer gatherings.

The well-stocked mature garden features seating in three separate areas to catch the sun’s rays across the year, whether it’s a coffee on the patio, a seat at the secluded end of the garden or a glass of something on the decking, watching magnificent sunsets over roof tops.

The front room has period features including a working fireplace and we have spent many happy evenings reading and relaxing in this quiet comfortable room."

As the sellers say, this is a wonderful and light family house, and what a location! Right in the heart of Charlton slopes, this property is ideal for those seeking close proximity to Blackheath Standard, Westcombe Park station and Ofsted 'outstanding' Sherington Primary School.

The house is bursting with potential (if desired) for a large loft conversion that would have the most spectacular Docklands views.

Highly recommended for any couple or growing family.<br /><br />

Accommodation comprises a spacious open plan living room and stylish kitchen equipped with a range of integrated appliances, a generous sized principal bedroom fitted with built in wardrobes, a chic bathroom suite and a large walk in cupboard providing ample storage in the hallway. There is a good size private balcony off of the lounge which offers fabulous views over the private residents only winter garden.

The property is ideally located for existing transport links which include Woolwich Arsenal DLR/br stations (0.3 miles), Thames Clipper (0.4 miles) and woolwich Ferry South Pier (0.8 miles). The eagerly awaited Elizabeth line is on site and is due to open in the first quarter of 2022!

detailedDescription:
An attractive and well-proportioned Edwardian semi-detached property. This three bedroom home is situated on an elevated plot within the desirable Belmont Hill Conservation Area.

The current owners have lovingly kept this home, retaining much of its original splendour and character. The ground floor boasts a welcoming entrance hall with the original tiled flooring, turned staircase and ornate cornicing. The first of the three reception rooms is the beautiful bay fronted living room with period fireplace, picture rails and cornicing. Down the hall is a dining room with a fireplace and french doors to the rear garden and a well-designed kitchen that opens into a further living room. The first floor has three spacious bedrooms, two of which with feature fireplaces. The master bedroom span the width of the house with a large bay window. A modern tiled bathroom and additional shower room complete this floor.
The charming south facing rear garden has attractive stone paving surrounded by various trees and flower beds.

Boyne Road is conveniently located for access to both Blackheath Village and Lewisham Station. Blackheath Village provides an array of shops, bars and restaurants with the glorious open heath beyond. For transport, Lewisham Station is zone 2 and offers regular and fast services into Canary Wharf, Bank, London Bridge, Charing Cross and London Victoria, among others.

title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
Acorn are delighted to welcome to the market this truly unique detached residence on a sought after road in SE2.

Offered to the market in immaculate order, the flexible accommodation is arranged over three floors and on the entrance floor comprises bright front lounge with rounded bay window, shower room, two light double bedrooms and a fantastic open place kitchen diner with ample fitted units, integrated appliances and breakfast bar. The first floor comprises two well proportioned bedrooms, with the rear bedroom enjoying great garden views, and shower room. The lower ground floor offers mass storage, office, utility area and a huge fifth bedroom and full bathroom suite.

Fully landscaped, the rear garden offers a large patio area, perfect for entertaining, and a lower lawn space with rear decked area and brick store. To the front, this fantastic property offers ample off street parking and a well presented garden area.

Priory Drive is a highly sought after road locally, and is within a mile of Abbey Wood Station.

address: Paradise Path, Birchdene Drive, London SE28
detailedDescription:
This is a purpose built flat, built circa 2003, in a modern 3-storey apartment block made up of 5 other similar residential flats. It comprises an entrance hallway, a bright and spacious living room, separate modern fitted kitchen, two double bedrooms, a family bathroom, storage, all maintained and presented in good condition throughout. Additional benefits include an allocated open air car parking space. The property is held on an unrestricted 125 year- leasehold commencing on 1 April 2003.

It is located in the residential area of Central Thamesmead, within a short distance of the town centre offering access to several local amenities including high street retail outlets, three large supermarkets; and access to parks, lakes, a leisure centre and River Thames Path, all within short walking distance. Also close to several local schools such as the Windrush Primary school, St. Margarets Clitherow Primary school and the Woolwich Polytechnic for Boys and Woolwich Polytechnic for Girls separately located just a stone's throw from the property.

The location also benefits from frequent and short bus services connecting the neighbourhood with Woolwich, and Abbey Wood centres, with their bus transport links and train stations offering DLR and mainline national rail services to Greenwich, North Greenwich, London Bridge, Canary Wharf, Bank, City Airport, Stratford, Charing Cross and Blackfriars etc. The location also benefits from a direct bus route to North Greenwich station with its arena, cinemas, restaurants and other entertainment spots.

The area will benefit from CrossRail (the Elizabeth line) which is expected to be operational from the first half of 2022. This line will improve connectivity providing a direct route to Canary Wharf, Central London (Liverpool Street, Paddington, Bond Street), Heathrow Airport and Reading which offers an added benefit to commuters and the area.

title: 6 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
This superb Victorian family home offers welcoming and well presented accommodation which is just shy of 1350sqft. The property is exceptionally well presented and boasts period features with high ceilings, bay windows and stripped wood floors.

Briefly comprising of an entrance hallway, lounge through diner with attractive fireplaces, a cloakroom/w.c., and a modern fitted kitchen/diner on the ground floor. Upstairs you will find three good size double bedrooms and a contemporary bathroom with walk-in shower and a good sized bathtub. There is scope to extend in the future by way of a side return or loft conversion should you ever wish to expand the space (subject to planning).

Other benefits to this lovely home is double glazing throughout, gas combi central heating with a new boiler installed two years ago. There is also a very good sized cellar and lots of other storage closets throughout the property.

The generous rear garden is well established with lovely plants and trees and has a composite decked area which was installed two years ago which serves as a peaceful area in which to dine or just chill out. The exterior of the house was repainted only this year.

Location

Located in a lovely, family friendly neighbourhood only an approx 3 minute walk to Charlton train station with regular trains to London Bridge, King's Cross, Waterloo, Farringdon, Charing Cross and Cannon Street. Journey time from Charlton to London Bridge is 16 minutes.

In addition, Charlton station is two stops away from the new Crossrail station in Woolwich.

Beautiful Greenwich and Blackheath villages are only an approx 25 minute walk from the property and there are also regular buses direct from Priolo Road.

North Greenwich Tube Station (Jubilee line) is an approx 10 minute bus ride from the property. There are also lots of new restaurants and developments along the riverside towards the 02 arena.

There are also lovely parks in Charlton all within 10 mins of the property as well as several popular schools making this a great choice for families and professionals alike.

Viewings are highly recommended

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
A well-presented and spacious two bedroom purpose-built apartment with a secure underground parking space.

Situated on the second floor of this small and exclusive block of just 16 apartments, in addition to the two bedrooms are two bathrooms, and a generously-sized open plan kitchen/living room with integrated appliances and access to a private balcony.

Additional benefits include a large communal residents terrace, lift service, compliant EWS1 certificate and a long lease.

Location wise it couldn't be better, Deptford Bridge DLR station is just a few yards away, providing swift access to Canary Wharf. Greenwich Mainline station is just up the road and shops, restaurants, markets and the Royal Park are just further ahead.

All in all this is a lovely apartment representing an ideal first time purchase and early viewings are highly recommended.

The Sellers Say: "This has been our home for almost 8 years. We're very lucky to have both a parking space and a great location – a short walk to Deptford High Street and Greenwich town centre, as well as the DLR and overground.

It's a lovely, friendly small block of flats and we'll miss our neighbours and soaking up the sun with them on our terrace."<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
Overview

Hunters Dartford are proud to present this spectacular 3 Bedroom Semi-Detached new build home in the heart of Eltham.

The ground floor comprises of a lounge, shower room, beautifully designed kitchen / diner (with breakfast bar) & patio doors which lead you to an amazing garden space which is low maintenance.

Moving upstairs you will find the master bedroom with en-suite, double bedroom, single bedroom & shower room.

Outside to the front you will find a large drive with ample parking for several cars.

This house has excellent links to the A2, M25 and M20 taking you to Dartford Crossing in less than 30 minutes & Blackwall tunnel in less than 10 minutes.

Eltham High street is approximately a five minute drive with an array of shops, cinema & plenty of restaurants & greenery (perfect for those afternoon walks or jogs).

Eltham Station will take you to central London in approximately 30 minutes away taking you to stations such as Charing Cross, London Bridge & London Victoria.

There are many primary & secondary schools in the area.

Primary schools include : St. Stephen's Primary School, St.Vincent's Catholic Primary School, Burnt Ash Primary School, St.Mary's Catholic Primary School, Haimo Primary School & Green acres Primary School.

Secondary schools include : Eltham Hill Secondary School, The Harris Academy & Crown Woods Academy.

Please contact us for the opportunity to view this exceptional home.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
"What really attracted me to this apartment was the large windows everywhere and how big, bright and spacious every room is.

The layout is perfect; the two big windows in the living room and dining area allow the sun to fill the space in the morning as you have your breakfast or lunch and then shifts over to the other side of the room later in the evening as you relax on the sofa. The space is incredibly cosy all year round and was so easy to make a home.

It is located in a charming, peaceful and residential area, full of greenery and surrounded by beautiful parks. Having the lido five minutes away made it very easy for me to keep active with my daily swims, too! With easy access and connections to Greenwich, Blackheath and central London, you are close enough to all of the action yet far away enough to enjoy your own private sanctuary.

It has been my lovely home for the past two years and I am very sad to say goodbye to it, having to move much earlier than anticipated due to a change in circumstances. I am sure that whoever moves in will be able to call it home as quickly and as easily as I did."

As the seller says, this is a really spacious ground floor apartment offering well- proportioned rooms. The flat has a lovely double aspect living room, separate kitchen, large bedroom and a tiled bathroom with shower. It benefits from double glazing, central heating, and shared off street parking to the front.

Viewing is highly recommended and offered completely chain free!

Lease is Approx. 93 Years Remaining.

1 Hyde Vale is an exclusive development on one of West Greenwich’s most sought after roads featuring a selection of new build townhouses located moments from Greenwich Park. Situation

title: 3 bed detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
A lovely and bright three bedroom modern house set within a private mews in one of the most popular areas of West Greenwich. The house offers great living space on the ground floor with both the reception room and the separate kitchen leading out on to the delightfully peaceful and secluded patio garden with lovely woodland views. All three bedrooms and a family bathroom are located on the first floor with the master bedroom benefitting from an ensuite shower room and built in wardrobes. The house has been well maintained by the current owner with recent upgrades having been completed to the kitchen and bathrooms and has a modern and neutral decor throughout. The mews itself is also well maintained and with the added benefit of allocated residents parking, would make a lovely family home.

Situation
Clayton Mews is a secluded private mews located just off of Hyde Vale in one of the most sought after areas of West Greenwich. The house is located moments from Greenwich Park and the open spaces of the nearby Heath. Greenwich Mainline and DLR Station is within close proximity offering a swift commute to the City, Canary Wharf and beyond. Also a short walk down the hill is Greenwich Market which offers a wonderful array of independent shops, pubs and restaurants.

detailedDescription:
Comments from the owner:
What do you love most about your home?
We have cherished renovating this Victorian home over the past ten years, turning it into a five-bedroom family home, which includes, large rooms and high ceilings, and an overall feeling of ample space for children to grow and explore. Including an easy to care for, safe and family-friendly garden, which is great for entertaining and direct access from the kitchen, with a great sense of privacy.

What do you love about the area?
We have loved living in this welcoming community, with excellent access to schools, parks, transport links and shops. We love having Charlton park on our doorstep as-well as Maryon Wilson park, where the children love seeing the animals.

Property Details:
Boasting extensive, light and spacious accommodation over three floors, with stylish interiors and a wealth of period elegance throughout, this stunning five bedroom family home, ideally located in a popular and friendly residential road close to transport links and amenities.

Accommodation comprises entrance hall with access to guest WC and stairs rising to the first floor and also descending to a useful basement cellar area.

To the ground floor, the bright and spacious double length reception/dining room enjoys ample space for relaxing and entertaining, with attractive bay window to the front, feature fireplace, engineered wood flooring and door to the rear out onto the low maintenance paved garden. To the rear of the property, the beautiful open plan kitchen/diner is flooded with natural light from dual aspect windows and b-folding doors spilling out onto the garden.

The kitchen area itself comprises a modern range of matching white fronted wall and base units with work surfaces and metro-tiled splash-back, incorporating inset sink unit, gas hob with overhead extractor, wall mounted electric oven, and further space for appliances.

To the first floor, there are three well proportioned bedrooms - two doubles, with inbuilt wardrobes and attractive bay to the front aspect master, and a generous single - plus a family bathroom with contemporary style corner bath suite, and separate shower unit. To the second floor, there is an inviting master bedroom with en-suite shower as well as access to useful eaves space, plus a further double bedroom.

The property is conveniently located within easy access of Charlton station with connections into London Bridge, as well as numerous regular bus routes serving the surrounding area and providing links to North Greenwich, Greenwich and Woolwich for Jubilee Line, DLR and Elizabeth Line connections. There are a range of shops, eateries and amenities within easy reach, as well as the Stone Lake Retail Park offering a variety of branded shopping.

The area is also well served by excellent local schools, including Sherington and Invicta Primaries, and Leigh Academy in Blackheath, as well as lovely open spaces including Charlton Park, Hornfair Park and Oxleas Woods. Blackheath is also within easy reach with it's fashionable amenities and wonderful common.

detailedDescription:
A beautifully presented, and bright, two bedroom Victorian terraced house, that measure circa 745 square foot and is located on the quiet residential street in East Greenwich!

In excellent order throughout, the property comprises a lovely, double aspect, 22ft through reception room with feature fireplace. This then leads on to a well fitted galley style kitchen. To the rear of the ground floor is a well presented bathroom. Upstairs there are two double bedrooms. There is a 17ft east facing private garden and a partly boarded loft.

Earlswood Street is a hugely popular road in East Greenwich, that is located just off Trafalgar Road and is just moments from local shops and restaurants within the town centre. The Royal Park with Observatory is also close by, as is mainline rail, riverboat service and DLR. There is no chain!

address: Sir Francis Drake Court, 43-45 Banning Street, Greenwich, London SE10
detailedDescription:
A superb and bright two bedroom 6th floor penthouse that has wonderful river views from a large balcony, and measures circa 717 square foot. EWS1 compliant!

In very good order throughout the property comprises of a large kitchen diner, which then leads on to a super balcony which has views of the river and Canary Wharf beyond. There are two good sized double bedrooms and a well fitted bathroom. The property also features ample storage and a secure parking space. It's worth mentioning that the property is currently a shared ownership with L&Q, but rest assured we are selling it in its entirety!

Sir Francis Drake Court was built approximately 11 years ago and forms one of the first phases of the super popular, River Gardens Development. This is perfectly located just in to East Greenwich, hugging the river Thames, just slightly west of the Old Naval College. The town centre is just a few minutes away, and offers a wonderful array of shops and restaurants, along with mainline rail, riverboat service and DLR. The beautiful Royal Park with its Observatory is also within a 5-7 minute walk.

detailedDescription:
Situated on this ever popular tree lined road comes this extended and much improved four bedroom 'Corbett' family home. Internally the accommodation is offered in excellent decorative condition throughout and is arranged to provide: An open plan lounge through to the extended integrated kitchen, three bedrooms to the first floor with a family bathroom and a second staircase to the master bedroom with en-suit facilities. The garden to the rear is very low maintenance with driveway to the front for off road parking. Well located for access back to Eltham mainline train station offering a frequesnt service to and from Central London and also the sought after Gordon primary school. Oxleas wood and Eltham Park North & South are within a short strool from the front door. Viewing is a must. EPC rating D

Entrance

An original style door with stained glass leaded light insert to the entrance hall.

Stairs to the first floor, radiator, dado rail, picture rail, ornate coved cornice, ornate centre ceiling rose, numbered casement window to front, original stripped wooden flooring, under stairs storage cupboards.

Rear Garden

address: Red Lion Lane, Shooters Hill, London SE18
detailedDescription:
**Property Reference RA0083** A simply stunning three bedroom 1930's semi detached family home situated in a quiet road in the the popular Shooters Hill Area. This property has undergone an extensive program of refurbishment resulting in a light and contemporary accommodation across an approximate 1000 sq ft. The accommodation comprises of front reception room with feature original 1930's fireplace, amtico flooring and modern grey plantation shutters, the second reception has been extended to now boast an open plan Kitchen/living area with herringbone floors, modern grey units and built in appliances, a separate utility room completes the ground floor layout with direct access to a beautifully landscaped rear garden. The first floor layout is typical of that of a 1930's house with two larger bedrooms, smaller room and luxury high specification shower room.

Red Lion lane is within easy reach of so many local attractions such as Oxleas Woods, the popular Severndroog Castle, the Red Lion Pub, Shooters Hill Golf Club and Shrewsbury Park. Christ Church Primary School is also situated closeby.

For Transport there are bus routes within 0.5 miles which will take you to Blackheath, North Greenwich, Woolwich and Eltham where rail services are available to both London Victoria and London Bridge.

Call now to organise your appointment and avoid disappointment.

detailedDescription:
Today, Tomorrow, Together

In the heart of Thamesmead, Southmere, is a collection of 1,2 and 3 bedroom apartments available through help to buy and outright sale avaiable to view.

Prices starting from:


  • 1 beds starting from £312,500
  • 2 beds starting from £390,000
  • 3 beds starting from £547,000


Wonderful things are happening in Southmere and we’ve got big plans for the future. Our first launch will include homes for outright sale followed by Shared Ownership homes along with a new public square, civic building including library, a gym, café and other commercial and community spaces to follow. Crossrail is on the horizon at Abbey Wood, making the commute into London much quicker, Canary Wharf will only be 11 minutes away.

You’ll never struggle for space in Southmere with more than double the amount of green space per person than the London average and homes overlooking the Southmere lake.

We’re excited about where we’re going and we want you to come on the journey with us. Register your interest for outright sale at Southmere to book your viewing appointment.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
"i’ve lived here for six years after settling in very easily to the flat and local area with all the amenities it provides.

It's so ideally situated for anyone who needs to commute into town, as the train station is only a 5 minute walk (links to Charing Cross, London Cannon Street, London Bridge and Kings Cross St. Pancras), or a 10 minute bus journey to North Greenwich which goes into town or direct to Stratford. Over the last few years the retail park has been substantially developed and now includes every amenity anyone would ever need, including a 24/7 gym on the other side of the road. I cannot emphasise how much I will miss being this close to something with literally every shop on its doorstep.

I'm quite into cycling, so local areas that i’ve explored and discovered in lockdown extend beyond the local green spaces such as Greenwich Park, Blackheath, Maryon Wilson and Charlton Park, but also the Thames Path which is a great cycle route, and Woolwich Arsenal which will soon have a Crossrail.

I completely renovated the flat before moving in, replacing the floors, bathroom, kitchen, boiler etc. But I was originally attracted to the large amount of space and light it has for a two bedroom place so ideally situated. There is an abundance of storage throughout and each room is a very generous size, and as I let the second bedroom out it was very important for me to be able to offer decent accommodation to a housemate. I knew it would fit the bill for something that I could settle in for several good years and it has served me really well!

As the seller says, this flat epitomises the value of a top 'location, location, location'! An ideal first time purchase with everything right on your doorstep. Who needs a car anymore?

Viewing is highly recommended!

Lease has approx 94 years remaining.
Service charge is approx £1084pa including the £10pa ground rent.<br /><br />

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
It is truly exciting to present you with this spectacular Georgian House located in the heart of lively, charming and family friendly Greenwich.

Set across over 3,590 sq ft (including a 775 sq ft self-contained annex studio), you will find an impressive and imposing property which has been refurbished and extended to the highest specification. The current owners spared no expense in creating the perfect family home in which they have cherished great memories and growth for the last decade.

As you enter the property, a grand reception room charmingly greets you with wooden parquet flooring and a wood-burning stove. Moving further into the house, you are presented with a dining room which offers a great, and even private, environment for dinner parties and entertaining. Entering the kitchen area, you will also find a more casual dining booth great for informal meals and conversations. The bespoke hand-painted 'Plain English' kitchen boasts integrated Gaggenau appliances including a main oven, hob, steam oven, microwave, warming draw and wine fridge. The kitchen also boasts extensive work surfaces, an impressive walk-in larder and double height ceiling with rooflights creating a bright and appealing space. At the back of the main house bi-folding doors open directly onto a double-width garden with barbeque and expansive seating area placed across over 1,000 sq ft of outdoor space, perfect for enjoying a great weather with guaranteed privacy.

Upstairs to the house you are four principal bedrooms, two of which have en-suite bathrooms including the wonderful master bedroom which also possesses a walk-through wardrobe. All bedrooms contain integrated air-conditioning. There is also a separate study/office at the first floor. On the lower floor you will benefit from the utility room, a shower an extra bedroom. The house has a lovely decor touch throughout. Fantastic and convenient features such as fireplaces, double-glazed wood sash windows, wooden floors, underfloor heating in the family bathroom, en-suite, kitchen, basement and studio ground floor complement the treat presented to you. This is a great and rare opportunity to purchase a home suitable for a large family in such a central location.

An awesome feature to pique your interest once and for all is the two-storey self-contained annex studio you find at the end of the garden. Presented with an imposing vaulted reception room, a kitchen with folding doors which can be closed off, a bathroom, and double bedroom with eaves storage on the upper floor. You could make numerous uses with this studio, including using it as a guest accommodation, live in nanny, office, music or playroom, gym, etc. This studio is bigger than many studio and 1 bedroom properties in London. We are sure you will apply a great imagination for the use of this extra 775 sq ft available to you.

It is said that there is only one street named Royal Hill making it unique in Great Britain. Royal Hill is located next to Greenwich Town Centre, just off Greenwich High Road. Circus Street and Burney Street are adjacent to Royal Hill. It's moments away from Greenwich - Overground (0.15 miles), Greenwich - DLR (0.24 miles), Cutty Sark - DLR (0.29 miles), Deptford Bridge - DLR (0.58 miles) which offers quick access to the City and Canary Wharf in under 20 minutes. You will benefit from the convenience of numerous shops, bars, restaurants, boutiques as well as the Greenwich Market. Excellent road links means the Channel Tunnel can be reached in an hour and the M25 in under 20 minutes allowing for easy holiday and weekend away departures.

Your next home is situated 4 minutes’ walk to the majestic Greenwich Royal Park. Attractions nearby include the world-famous Royal Observatory, historic Greenwich Meridian Line, Cutty Sark, Maritime Museum, Queens House, Greenwich Market and the Old Royal Naval College. Maritime Greenwich has been designated a unesco world heritage site since 1997 and the area includes many fine mid to late Georgian streets and squares.

This house is a wonderful base for enjoying the rich cultural and academic institutions situated nearby (Blackheath Halls, Trinity Laban Conservatoire, Deptford Theatre, University of Greenwich) or just enjoy the myriad of eating, cinema and sporting opportunities nearby, which are all within walking distance whether at trendy Greenwich or elegant Blackheath. Enjoy wonderful walks and safe cycling next to this historic river. There is something for everyone to enjoy.

Myriads of historical figures, writers, and artists were born or lived nearby, from King Henry VIII, Queen Elizabeth I to Cecil Day-Lewis, General James Wolfe, and the author Edith Nesbit. This tradition continues to the present day.

Contact me for more details or to arrange a viewing!

*Please quote reference "nso" upon enquiry

detailedDescription:
This expansive property has been decorated to a high standard and retains much of its period charm while having being modernised throughout.

Entering the house on the ground floor you have a light-filled double reception room with bay window, a W/C just off the hallway, under stairs access to the wine cellar which is a great storage space and a beautifully bright extended kitchen diner providing double door access to the south facing garden measuring circa 58sqft from the side return.

On the first floor you have a very generously sized front master bedroom with bay window encouraging plenty of natural light to fill the room throughout the day, double bedroom with built in storage in the alcoves around the chimney breast, family bathroom suite, storage cupboards in the hallway which is ideal for storing linen and a double bedroom to the rear of the property which has deep built in wardrobes incorporating a dresser and benefiting from views out to the back garden.

Occupying the second floor of this exceptional house is the converted loft space where there is a further double bedroom with built in wardrobes, eaves storage, en-suite shower room and finished off with a Juliet balcony looking out to the south side and with beautiful views of the London skyline from the front.

Superb transport links are found very close by including Maze hill mainline station(London Bridge 15mins), frequent bus services to North Greenwich(Jubilee Line), Greenwich and Blackheath Village where you will also find boutique style shopping, independent cafés, restaurants and bars.

address: No.5, 2 Cutter Lane, Upper Riverside, Greenwich Peninsula SE10
detailedDescription:
A super 3 bedroom home having floor to ceiling windows with amazing river views throughout linking you to the outside. A particularly well appointed luxury home located on the 8th floor of Building 5 Upper Riverside. The open plan flow works well, with defined living areas linking the kitchen, dining and living spaces with the decked balcony making a spacious living space.
The home benefits from a fully fitted kitchen with integrated appliances, underfloor heating and an individual intercom system; meaning that your 24-hour concierge service is easily available, there is ample desk space available for those working from home too and the 3 bedrooms are all of generous size.
Being one of five buildings designed by som architects, responsible for the Burj Khalifa in Dubai, each building having its own interior designer. Knight Dragon has created the fantastic interiors of this particular building with colours, textures and natural palettes influenced by the ever changing river.
These stunning buildings provide exclusive living with your own Upper Riverside Club, giving you access to a 15th Renew floor given over entirely to your well-being, with 20m pool and spa pool, steam room, two well equipped gyms, private dining room, business suite, cinema and media fun room, and roof top residents terraces, Riverside living is more than just your home, Greenwich Peninsula gives residents places and spaces to connect with your neighbours and really become a community, with events organised by the lifestyle manager, exhibitions at the Now Gallery, Farmers markets, seasonal craft markets and a summer of activities.
Call us now to view!

title: 3 bed property for sale

address: No.5, 2 Cutter Lane, Upper Riverside, Greenwich Peninsula SE10
detailedDescription:
A private decked balcony with views over the landscaped gardens is a lovely feature of this 3rd floor home in Building 5 Upper Riverside. Boasting floor to ceiling windows, providing an abundance of natural light, smart fitted kitchen and bathrooms, engineered wood flooring with underfloor heating, this apartment offers quality and style throughout. There are 2 generous double bedrooms, both with fitted wardrobes, the master bedroom having a stunning ensuite, there is ample space for a desk for those who would prefer working from home in either bedroom or the reception room. The interior was designed by Knight Dragon, inspired by the river, the rich palette reflects the natural materials found on the water's edge.
Upper Riverside comprises a family of five light filled, glass and stone towers, with roof gardens cascading to the edge of the Thames, occupies one of the best riverside locations in London.
The gardens connected to the riverfront will have some fantastic restaurants, river cafes, retail outlets and lively public spaces, including London's first linear park, 'The Tide'. Upper Riverside neighbourhood links to Peninsula Square with access to North Greenwich Underground (Jubilee Line), 2 Mins to Canary Wharf and 8 Mins to London Bridge! The O2, with it's numerous international restaurants, Icon Designer outlet and buzzy social areas, and the soon to be completed Design District, are all within a few minutes walk of your home.

title: Studio for sale

detailedDescription:
Enviably located in a popular residential area, close to transport links, excellent local schools and amenities, this beautiful four bedroom family home boasts expansive accommodation over four floors, elegantly finished to a high standard throughout whilst retaining a wealth of period appeal, including stripped floorboards, feature fireplaces, ornate cornicing and wood paneling.

Accommodation comprises entrance hall to the ground floor with access to a useful guest WC and utility room, leading into the bright and spacious front aspect reception room with attractive near full height feature windows, impressive space for relaxing and entertaining, and roll-up projector screen for those cosy movie nights with the family!

To the rear of the property, a further reception room enjoys a quiet rear aspect, as well as an open brick surround chimney recess. To the lower level, the superb open plan kitchen/diner, with two walk-in storage/cupboards/pantries, provides fantastic family living space, with stairs rising to a dual aspect sunroom, flooded with natural light from double doors opening onto the private garden. The garden has rear access to Halstow Road, making it a perfect place for storing bikes and scooters.
The kitchen area itself comprises a sleek range of matching white fronted units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, gas hob with overhead extractor, electric oven, and further space for appliances.

To the first floor, there are two well proportioned double bedrooms, each with inbuilt wardrobes and with a wonderful feature fireplace with marble mantel surround and tiled insert to the front aspect master bedroom. A stylish shower room completes the first-floor accommodation with a modern walk-in shower suite and elegant tiling. To the second floor, there are a further two double bedrooms, plus an inviting family bathroom with a free-standing roll-top bath and antique bathroom fittings.

The property is conveniently located with easy access to Westcombe Park station, with regular bus routes providing connections to North Greenwich for Jubilee line, and Greenwich for the DLR. The A2 is also easily accessible for vehicular routes out of London. The area is well served by local shops and amenities, with nearby Greenwich offering an array of fashionable shops, bars, restaurants and markets.

Additionally, the superb O2 complex, with its cinemas, concerts and shows, as well as a variety of restaurants, bars and eateries, is within easy reach, as is the Greenwich Centre, housing a leisure centre, gym and swimming pool, library and gp surgery. East Greenwich Pleasaunce is just a short stroll away, and is a delightful outside space with many community events, farmers markets, festivals, outdoor cinema, and under-fives play club. The property is also in the catchment area for excellent local schools.

Comments from the owner:

What do you love most about your home?
I love the uniqueness of our property - the versatility of the space and the combination of modern and original features. The front room-with its original wood-paneling, high ceilings and huge windows-and neighboring reception room, as well as the vast basement kitchen/diner and family room leading to the garden via a sunroom, means there is so much flexible living space. It's a great house for entertaining, and we have felt very fortunate to have so much adaptable working space during lockdown. There's also so much storage space, and it feels like we are yet to fully grow into the space available.

What do you love about the area?
It will be a huge wrench to leave the area. For us, it has been perfect - the outstanding primary school just around the corner and the proximity of the station means you can leave the house 2 minutes before you need to be at either! East Greenwich Pleasaunce is a real hidden gem - the cafe, playground and community center are a regular part of our lives. The house is also perfectly positioned near Greenwich Park, and both Greenwich and Blackheath Village, and we have the best neighbors!
