agency_name: James Gorey Estate Agents - South East London and North Kent
detailedDescription:
£675,000 - £700,000.

Must be seen! Time to up sticks to the outskirts of London where you can still take advantage of an easy commute, but also enjoy the peaceful setting of Bostall Woods adjacent to your home, giving you a year-round spectacle of changing colour and scenery to the backdrop of your own castle.

Briefly, the accommodation comprises of a Porch, Entrance Hall, Through-Lounge, Dining Room, spacious Kitchen Breakfast Room with steps down to a lower level, formerly a garage but now utilised as additional living space with tucked away storage, and a large store room, currently used as a gym, with direct access to the front where the drive is. To the first floor, there is a Landing, a large Master Bedroom with impressive En-Suite Bathroom, a further Two Double Bedrooms, a Single Bedroom and a Family Bathroom. Externally, the property boasts a Driveway for 2 - 3 cars, and a tiered Rear Garden, the entry level from the kitchen and through lounge has a generous patio area for sociable entertainment, with an external WC. The mature terraced garden also offers direct access into the woodland.

Commuters can take a 1 mile walk to Abbey Wood Train Station or jump on the bus which is just meters away, and with Cross Rail set to open in 2022, Abbey Wood will benefit from even better transport links. There are 'Good' and 'Excellent' Ofsted rated schools within easy reach of the property, as well as shops, parkland, and local supermarkets by car or bus.

If you're looking for something unique, and have struggled to find adequate accommodation size, come and take a look at this sensational home. Call James Gorey Estate Agents today! And hurry - it could be snapped up sooner than you think!

address: Hampton Apartments, Duke Of Wellington Avenue, Woolwich, London SE18
detailedDescription:
A fantastic waterfront apartment, set within this highly desirable Berkeley homes development. Resident will benefit from access to a range of first class facilities.

Location

Royal Arsenal Riverside is perfectly located for the forthcoming Elizabeth line Crossrail station which offers connections in to Canary Wharf of 8 minutes and Liverpool Street of 14 minutes. Additionally Royal Arsenal DLR is just 0.5 miles away while the Thames Clipper service is 0.3 miles away.

All times and distances are approximate.

Description

A superb three bedroom waterfront apartment in this highly desirable Berkeley homes development. The immediate reaction upon entering is how much natural light is offered within the apartment, which is predominantly absorbed via the floor to ceiling windows throughout. Internally there is an open plan living area, with a high specification kitchen which houses a range of designer appliances, two designer bathroom suites, plus there is plenty of storage on offer. Externally a full length balcony boasts sublime views overlooking the River Thames, and in addition there is a further balcony overlooking well manicured gardens.

Berkeley homes is a developer renowned for outstanding luxury, and this is reflected throughout the apartment, through various high end fixtures and fittings, and endless attention to detail ensuring the highest quality finish. Busy professionals also require first class facilities, and this development certainly does not disappoint.

All residents will benefit from access to a 24 hour concierge service, a large fully equipped gymnasium with state of the art equipment, a heated indoor pool and a private screening cinema.

Please note: We have received confirmation from the owner of this property that an EWS1 form has been provided by the Freeholder.

Square Footage: 1001 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 994 years remaining

detailedDescription:
Chain Free

A well-presented bedroom 2 bathroom apartment situated on the sought after Thames Gateway development in the popular West Thamesmead area which offer superb transport links into both Woolwich and Abbeywood where the new Crossrail link is opening soon.

Boasting a en-suite shower to master bedroom, spacious living room, modern fitted kitchen, two double bedrooms and a modern bathroom wc, balcony with river views, gated allocated parking, ample storage, entry phone, double glazing and central heating.

Location

Thamesmead has benefited from its many new developments in recent years, there are lots of bus routes connecting Thamesmead to Abbey Wood, Plumstead and Woolwich including the DLR, It is also a short walk along the river Thames to get to Woolwich Arsenal Station. The next stage in the development of the area will be the construction of Crossrail in Abbey Wood and Woolwich, a development tipped to encourage the growth of local house prices by the time it is opened in 2018.

Ground rent £200 per year

title: 1 bed flat for sale

address: No. 1, 18 Cutter Lane, Upper Riverside, Greenwich Peninsula SE10
detailedDescription:
What lovely home! This 9th floor, 2 bedroom home with views is ready to go and is offered for sale Chain Free. There are floor to ceiling windows, flooding the property with natural light. From the engineered wood flooring with underfloor heating, to the smart fitted kitchen and bathrooms, this apartment offers quality and style throughout with all the modern touches expected.
The interiors of this building in Upper Riverside were designed by State of Craft, and the 4 remaining buildings interiors each by other renowned designers. Amenities are shared throughout all 5 buildings, including cascading roof terraces, swimming pool and spa, multiple gyms, work stations, cinemas and media rooms.
The apartment benefits from two generous double bedrooms, both with views, imagine waking up to a super view every morning? Both have fitted wardrobes, and the master bedroom also has a stunning ensuite with twin inset wash hand basins to marble surround and there is a large shower enclosure.
You will become part of the exclusive Upper Riverside Club, think of it as a relaxed, unstuffy and welcoming members club, with private access to the gyms, steam room and spa pool, a 15th floor swimming pool with panoramic views, rooftop terraces, shared spaces, cinema and more.
The gardens connected to the riverfront have some fantastic restaurants, river cafes, retail outlets and lively public spaces, including London's first linear park, 'The Tide'. Upper Riverside District links to Peninsula Square with access to North Greenwich Underground (Jubilee Line), 2 Mins to Canary Wharf and 8 Mins to London Bridge! The O2, with it's numerous international restaurants, Icon Designer outlet and buzzy social areas, and the soon to be completed Design District, are all within a few minutes walk of your home.
We look forward to being to show you around this super home.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
JLL are delighted to present to market this fantastic 3rd floor two bedroom apartment in the popular New Capital Quay development, conveniently located within a short walk from the Cutty Sark DLR and Greenwich for both the DLR and mainline station both offering direct links to City, Westend and Canary Wharf.

Admirals Tower is a completely private development and is being catered for by its own concierge service which offers security and convenience for post and parcels and also a Waitrose supermarket on site.

The property comprises of a light spacious open plan living room to modern fitted kitchen, which opens onto a balcony which offers sweeping views across the river Thames which depicts many of London's Landmarks. Two good sized bedrooms, one which has been redesigned to cater a home office and a walk in wardrobe, a contemporary family bathroom and large hallway cupboard which offers ample storage space.

Located moments from the open expanses of Greenwich Park, this unique old town, famous for its maritime history, has an excellent selection of restaurants, pubs and shops, as well as a Picturehouse cinema and a theatre. The Old Royal Naval College, designed by Sir Christopher Wren in the 18th century, hosts a popular programme of events in the gardens, including concerts, an open-air theatre and a jazz festival.

The building has a clear EWS1 which will cause no issues on obtaining a mortgage and the property is also offered completely chain free. Early viewings are highly recommended

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Located on the most sought after road in West Greenwich and with views directly into Greenwich Park, is this magnificent six double bedroom five storey Grade II listed Georgian house with a landscaped garden and garage to the rear which has potential to extend.

This outstanding house offers generous living space and many features including; very high ceilings, cornicing, solid wood flooring, sash windows, feature radiators, period fireplaces, integrated sound system, under floor heating and gas fired central heating.

The property boasts an impressive entrance hall, which leads to the double reception room with high ceilings and two fireplaces. Also on the ground floor there is a guest W.C and steps to the rear of the property which lead to the well maintained lawn. To the lower ground floor there is a large integrated family kitchen with island which is perfect for entertaining as well as an informal seating area which leads to the patio, as well as a utility room and large storage cupboard. On the first floor of the property there is a superb and large double bedroom to the front with high ceilings and plenty of storage, as well as a family bathroom and a further double bedroom looking to the rear. The second floor incorporates the large master suite with en suite shower and built-in storage as well as a smaller bedroom to the rear of the property. To the top floor of the property there is a good sized bedrooms currently used as a study/office and a gym room and another bathroom. The views from the front bedrooms are fantastic, directly looking into Greenwich Park.

To the rear is a landscaped garden with terrace, lawn and flower beds with a large garage and rear access. The garage is accessed from a small mews behind and has potential to create an additional floor as many neighbouring houses have done. All interest parties should make their own enquiries to this.

This is an incredible home and is sold chain free. Your immediate viewing is essential.

Crooms Hill is commonly thought of as the best road in Greenwich. It is in a prime position directly facing Greenwich Park and the house is just a two minute walk into to the heart of Historic West Greenwich. Greenwich is the home of Greenwich mean time and the meridian line and one of London's prettiest locations. It maintains a quaint rural village feel and is steeped in history from roman remains and ancient burial grounds, to the old royal naval hospital, the royal observatory, the national maritime museum, and the spectacularly restored cutty sark ' the last of the great tea clippers. Greenwich's covered market is one of London's best and attracts people from all over the capital. It offers wares from local artist-makers, fashion designers, foodies and antiques traders. Tuesdays, Thursdays and Fridays are dedicated to antiques, with Wednesdays, Saturdays and Sundays devoted to food, arts and crafts. Surrounding the market, you'll find characterful boutiques and independent shops offering everything from toys and clothes to organic fruit and veg, artisan breads and cheeses. Plus, just 15 minutes down the road, you'll find all the big high street and designer names at Westfield's Stratford shopping centre. There are fantastic transport links, including tube, DLR, mainline rail, bus, riverboat, foot tunnel and cable car. The area is mere minutes from canary wharf, the city and central London; just one of the reasons why it's increasingly popular with young professionals and commuters. The o2 is close by along with a huge selection of shops at Greenwich peninsula as are the bars, restaurants, boutique shops and farmers market of Blackheath village.

An outstanding character property built around the walls of the former Royal Military Academy.

Upon entering the property, there is a large open plan sitting room, kitchen and dining room. The kitchen is modern, spacious and fully fitted. The open plan room has impressively high ceilings and vaulted windows and doors that let in a wealth of natural light. The doors open out onto a private courtyard. A real mix of historical and modern styles peer though well-kept communal gardens and smart streets.

Woolwich itself, already a commuter hub is about to receive a massive boost from the opening of the Elizabeth line (Crossrail), bringing the heart of the city closer to your door.
This is a beautiful and unique apartment in fine condition and also benefits from allotted parking and on-site fitness facilities.

Powis Street shopping facilities are a ten-minute walk and Shooters Hill is nearby. For weekend entertainment, Greenwich Park, Blackheath Village and Oxleas Woods are all easily accessible. The immediate area is quiet and green and the streets are lined with mature trees.

There are two generously sized duel aspect double bedrooms; both of which have doors that open out onto the courtyard. The bathroom is modern and generous in size, with bath and shower. There is also a convenient utility cupboard that houses the washer dryer.

address: No.2, 10 Cutter Lane, Upper Riverside, Greenwich Peninsula SE10
detailedDescription:
Being one of just 41 individual apartments created by Tom Dixon in No.2 Upper Riverside, these sought after homes use industrial materials throughout lending a strong British narrative, and make reference to the history of Greenwich. The interiors strike a contemporary balance combining natural and warm materials like copper, leather and wood with bold sculptural forms.

This 10th floor studio apartment enjoys a direct river view from its large private balcony, and is larger than the average studio home, with adaptable accommodation using the featured sliding 'wall'.
The kitchen utilises the traditional enamelling processes of London's sign makers and hand-crafted copper cabinetry and the bathroom creates an immersive colour experience. The rich tones of the glazed tiles are complimented by the dichroic glass which adds a hint of technicolour to the space.

Riverside living is more than just your home, Greenwich Peninsula gives residents places and spaces to connect with your neighbours and really become a community, with events organised by the lifestyle manager, exhibitions at the Now Gallery, Farmers markets, seasonal craft markets and a summer of activities.

Find this home in Greenwich Peninsula's Upper Riverside neighbourhood. Designed by world-famous architects som, the 5 prism towers cascade along the riverfront. Located 300m from North Greenwich bus and tube station, adjacent to the Emirates Air Line and opposite North Greenwich Pier, transport links are readily available. Residents of Upper Riverside enjoy the full set of exclusive residents' amenities listed above.

Plot 59

The Area

Discover another side to city living. One that offers you a vibrant, modern community alive with things to see and do, alongside convenient transport connections. Together with a sea of green open spaces where you can relax and unwind, as well as inspiring places steeped in history. At Synergy, no sacrifices have to be made.

Step outside Synergy and you’ll be greeted with a wonderful range of high-street shops, supermarkets, and larger stores. The area’s heritage also brings a wide selection of historic attractions close to home, from the National Maritime Museum and the Cutty Sark, to the Royal Observatory Greenwich.

Take your pick from over 50 parks and open spaces in the Royal Borough of Greenwich and you’ll soon forget about the stresses and strains of modern life. Pack a picnic, pound the paths, turn the pages, whatever helps you relax, there are so many beautiful places in the neighbourhood to visit.

Travel Options

Synergy’s excellent transport links bring everything you find great about central London within easy reach. Be it the galleries, museums, theatres, sports, restaurants or entertainment. Although you don’t have to travel far to enjoy a wealth of amenities. Close by is everything from supermarkets, cinemas and historic attractions, to eateries, bars and gyms. The choice is yours.

What’s more, all you love about Central London is within easy reach too; both Westcombe Park Overground (Zone 3) and Charlton Overground (Zone 3) are only about a 10-minute walk.

The City

Many believe that London is the most dynamic and cosmopolitan city in the world. It’s an opinion of course, but what is certainly true is that London is a melting pot with districts as diverse as Soho and Mayfair or Westminster and Chelsea. It has a history that dates back over 2,000 years and is a treasure trove of shops, restaurants, galleries, museums and theatres.

A city such as this harbours a great deal of talent and ambition both in the past and present time. This is evident in the architecture, the enduring societies and guilds and the many celebrated seats of learning. The pioneering spirit that made London the capital of the British Empire and its appetite for art, fashion, music, tradition and innovation continues to this day and will continue indefinitely.

It’s little wonder that more than 8 million people call London their home.

About Synergy

A tale of two cities

Choose Synergy and youll discover it to be the perfect balance between city life and natural surroundings. This large, unique development effortlessly blends contemporary urban design with beautiful green landscaping to create a welcoming, attractive and lively community feeling. A feeling that you will discover extends into the surrounding, sought-after area of Charlton. A new home here will give you everything you could possibly need.

All you love about London is there for the taking

Travelling around London couldnt be easier from our new homes in Charlton. Both Westcombe Park Overground (Zone 3) and Charlton Overground (Zone 3) are around a 10-minute walk away, giving you simple access to all the City has to offer.

However, you dont have to go far to enjoy a wealth of amenities. Close to home is a good choice of supermarkets and high street shops alongside independent and well-established restaurants and bars. And for those with children, youll find a range of Ofsted-rated Good and Outstanding schools for all ages nearby.

Escape to a whole new world

Close to Synergy is another world. A green, tranquil one where you can easily escape to for those moments when you want to relax. With more than 50 beautiful, leafy parks and open spaces to enjoy close to our collection of property for sale in south east London, youll find Synergy really is the best of both worlds.

  • All you need and want within easy reach Synergys great transport links bring galleries, museums, theatres, sports, restaurants and entertainment closer, but youre also never far from plenty of parks to relax in.
  • Effortless journeys, to whatever part of the capital Synergy is really well connected, meaning you can be at Canary Wharf in 26 minutes and London Bridge in 16 minutes. Travelling by car is equally as simple with the South Circular just a few minutes away.
  • And in a moment, the City is left behind you theres a sea of green open spaces in the local area where you can go to escape the stresses and strains of modern life.
  • Take a short walk or drive to school whether your children are younger or older, youll find a variety of Good and Outstanding Ofsted-rated schools close by.
  • Live in harmony everything about Synergy has been carefully considered, from the contemporary urban design to the beautiful natural landscaping.

Abbey Wood has benefitted from its own mainline station and the opening of the DLR station at Woolwich Arsenal, whilst the next stage in the development of the area will be the construction of Crossrail, a development tipped to encourage the growth of local house prices by the time it is opened .

Early Viewings Are Highly Recommended

address: Jefferies Lodge, 48-60 Footscray Road, London SE9
detailedDescription:
*** retirement apartment ***
Plot 17 is a two bedroom apartment on the first floor and includes a second WC, includes carpets, curtains, light fittings
This beautiful apartment comes with a fully fitted kitchen, spacious living room, separate shower room and a large bedroom.

The kitchen has been designed for practicality, with a fitted fridge, freezer and a waist-height oven to save bending down. There’s also an integral washer/dryer fitted. The bedroom comes complete with fitted wardrobes as well as TV and telephone points, with even the smallest details considered.

About the Development

This stunning retirement development of one and two bedroom apartments is in a fantastic, central location, close to all the essential amenities and public transport. Jefferies Lodge is home to 38 apartments and includes an Owners' Lounge with a built-in coffee bar, creating the perfect location for socialising with like-minded neighbours. The development is within easy reach of the local shops, supermarkets and tourist attractions, so you can enjoy an independent, active retirement.

Social and communal lifestyle

Communal gardens are carefully landscaped, giving you the perfect place to relax and enjoy an afternoon cup of tea, without having to worry about the maintenance and upkeep that a large garden so often demands. The carefully designed Owners’ Lounge comes complete with a coffee bar and is a popular feature, providing the perfect venue for entertaining, participating in activities organised by your Lodge Manager, or just relaxing with a book. Events include everything from fish and chip suppers, to tea dances, giving you the chance to socialise as much as you like throughout the year.

The fully furnished Guest Suite provides an ideal space for your family and friends to stay over when visiting, while a lift to all floors is installed for your convenience.

Safety and security

This apartment comes complete with a 24 hour emergency Careline system, while a camera entry system is installed as standard, so you can feel safe and secure in your retirement. Intruder alarms and fire alarm systems are fitted throughout the Lodge, while a Lodge Manager is on hand to assist you with anything else you might need. EPC Grade B. A beautifully presented two bedroom two bathroom apartment on the 2nd floor of Madison Building within the sought after OneSE8 development.

This stunning apartment briefly comprises a beautiful open plan kitchen reception with private balcony, a spacious master bedroom with walk-in wardrobe and en-suite bathroom, a large second bedroom, a lovely modern bathroom and plenty of storage in the hallway.

One SE8 offers a wealth of amenities including 24-hour concierge, residents gym and lap pool. title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A truly wonderful, four bedroom, Victorian family home, located within the always sought after Halstow catchment and backing on to the East Greenwich Plesaunce.

Internally the property is presented in very good order throughout and comprises; a 25 foot through lounge, a modern kitchen large enough for a dining table and a WC completes the ground floor. On the first floor you will find three double bedrooms and a beautiful four piece family bathroom is also on this level. The top floor consists of a large bedroom with stunning, panoramic views of the Plesaunce. There is also an en suite shower room and eves storage on the top floor.

The property is well situated for excellent local transport links with Westcombe Park and Maze Hill (London Bridge, Cannon Street and Thames Link) Mainline stations as well as North Greenwich for the Jubilee Line and many frequent bus links in to Blackheath and Greenwich Village.

Further benefits of note include; some original features, gas central heating and is being sold with no onward chain.

address: Duke Of Wellington Avenue, Royal Arsenal, London SE18
detailedDescription:
Discover the Royal Arsenal Riverside Community with this modern, stylish offering from The Imperial Building.

Located on the 8th floor, this two-bedroom property is immaculately presented and benefits from naturally bright rooms as the flat takes advantage of its south facing full length balcony. The dual aspect windows in the lounge and the large windows in the bedrooms enjoy river views and look out across the whole of the historic Royal Arsenal.

The high specification open plan kitchen has fitted appliances that include a ceramic hob, oven, microwave, dishwasher, fridge and freezer.

The main bedroom has a good range of fitted wardrobes as well as an en-suite shower room. There is also a good sized family bathroom.

Imperial Building is situated 5 minutes walk from the Thames Uber Boat service, the Woolwich Arsenal DLR and the Crossrail Station which is due for completion in 2022.

There are an abundance of on-site facilities at Royal Arsenal including a medical centre, dentist, resident's gym, cafes, pubs, shops and a 24 hour concierge as well as the new landmark Woolwich Works cultural hub. There are also river walks and the Thames cycle path.

detailedDescription:
With a superb 90ft south facing garden and superb potential to extend and enhance, is this spacious three bedroom, two bathroom, semi-detached 1930's home in this popular location very close to Kidbrooke mainline station and sold chain free.

The property would benefit from modernisation throughout although does benefit from gas fired central heating and a modern downstairs wet room.

The accommodation briefly comprises; entrance hall with understairs storage, two good reception rooms with interconnecting doors, kitchen with pantry cupboard and a large modern wet room which has been converted from the garage. Upstairs is a large master bedroom, second double bedroom, a generous single bedroom and a bathroom with separate WC. To the rear is a 90ft south facing garden with patio, extensive lawn and two brick built sheds. There with is off street parking to the front for two/three cars.
Many neighbouring properties have had significant extensions and loft conversions. Any interested parties should satisfy themselves to any relevant planning consents.

This is a great family home with excellent potential and viewing is strongly recommended. There is no chain. Video tour can be seen at

Woolacombe Road is a popular residential road conveniently located just 540 metres from Kidbrooke Mainline station, (rebuilt in 2021) and is just 17 minutes to London Bridge with trains also running to Charing Cross, Victoria and Cannon Street. The property is located just 800 metres from the new and prestigious Kidbrooke Village and 1.1 miles to Blackheath Village (one stop on train) with its array of boutique shops, bars and restaurants. There are many parks and green open spaces to enjoy, including Hornfair Park (with the Charlton Lido, cafe, tennis courts and bmx track within its bounds), Charlton House (gardens, play area and skate park), Oxleas Woods, Shrewsbury Park, Blackheath Common and Greenwich Park.

detailedDescription:
**show home furniture pack included**

**Less than 10 apartments remaining- Don’t miss out**

Fairview New Homes – Synergy

A brand new community of 1,2 and 3 bedroom apartments and 4 bedroom houses in Charlton



Plot 26

A 822 sqft two double bedroom apartment located in Charlton, comes with a fully-fitted L shaped kitchen with integrated appliances. It also features outside space in the form of a 91 sqft balcony.

The Area

Discover another side to city living. One that offers you a vibrant, modern community alive with things to see and do, alongside convenient transport connections. Together with a sea of green open spaces where you can relax and unwind, as well as inspiring places steeped in history. At Synergy, no sacrifices have to be made.

Step outside Synergy and you’ll be greeted with a wonderful range of high-street shops, supermarkets, and larger stores. The area’s heritage also brings a wide selection of historic attractions close to home, from the National Maritime Museum and the Cutty Sark, to the Royal Observatory Greenwich.

Take your pick from over 50 parks and open spaces in the Royal Borough of Greenwich and you’ll soon forget about the stresses and strains of modern life. Pack a picnic, pound the paths, turn the pages, whatever helps you relax, there are so many beautiful places in the neighbourhood to visit.

Travel Options

Synergy’s excellent transport links bring everything you find great about central London within easy reach. Be it the galleries, museums, theatres, sports, restaurants or entertainment. Although you don’t have to travel far to enjoy a wealth of amenities. Close by is everything from supermarkets, cinemas and historic attractions, to eateries, bars and gyms. The choice is yours.

What’s more, all you love about Central London is within easy reach too; both Westcombe Park Overground (Zone 3) and Charlton Overground (Zone 3) are only about a 10-minute walk.

The City

Many believe that London is the most dynamic and cosmopolitan city in the world. It’s an opinion of course, but what is certainly true is that London is a melting pot with districts as diverse as Soho and Mayfair or Westminster and Chelsea. It has a history that dates back over 2,000 years and is a treasure trove of shops, restaurants, galleries, museums and theatres.

A city such as this harbours a great deal of talent and ambition both in the past and present time. This is evident in the architecture, the enduring societies and guilds and the many celebrated seats of learning. The pioneering spirit that made London the capital of the British Empire and its appetite for art, fashion, music, tradition and innovation continues to this day and will continue indefinitely.

It’s little wonder that more than 8 million people call London their home.

  • Chrome downlights with ‘white light’ LED bulbs
  • Chrome heated towel rail
  • Shaver point
About Synergy

A tale of two cities

Choose Synergy and youll discover it to be the perfect balance between city life and natural surroundings. This large, unique development effortlessly blends contemporary urban design with beautiful green landscaping to create a welcoming, attractive and lively community feeling. A feeling that you will discover extends into the surrounding, sought-after area of Charlton. A new home here will give you everything you could possibly need.

All you love about London is there for the taking

Travelling around London couldnt be easier from our new homes in Charlton. Both Westcombe Park Overground (Zone 3) and Charlton Overground (Zone 3) are around a 10-minute walk away, giving you simple access to all the City has to offer.

However, you dont have to go far to enjoy a wealth of amenities. Close to home is a good choice of supermarkets and high street shops alongside independent and well-established restaurants and bars. And for those with children, youll find a range of Ofsted-rated Good and Outstanding schools for all ages nearby.

Escape to a whole new world

Close to Synergy is another world. A green, tranquil one where you can easily escape to for those moments when you want to relax. With more than 50 beautiful, leafy parks and open spaces to enjoy close to our collection of property for sale in south east London, youll find Synergy really is the best of both worlds.

  • All you need and want within easy reach Synergys great transport links bring galleries, museums, theatres, sports, restaurants and entertainment closer, but youre also never far from plenty of parks to relax in.
  • Effortless journeys, to whatever part of the capital Synergy is really well connected, meaning you can be at Canary Wharf in 26 minutes and London Bridge in 16 minutes. Travelling by car is equally as simple with the South Circular just a few minutes away.
  • And in a moment, the City is left behind you theres a sea of green open spaces in the local area where you can go to escape the stresses and strains of modern life.
  • Take a short walk or drive to school whether your children are younger or older, youll find a variety of Good and Outstanding Ofsted-rated schools close by.
  • Live in harmony everything about Synergy has been carefully considered, from the contemporary urban design to the beautiful natural landscaping.

This 2016 development is conveniently located for Blackfen, Eltham, Sidcup and within walking distance of Falconwood train station. It is situated in a quiet neighbourhood and a large parade with a variety of shops can be found just across the road, as well as the stunning Avery Hill Park and direct bus connections to Blackheath and North Greenwich.

The well-maintained property briefly comprises a large open plan lounge, leading to a fully fitted kitchen with modern appliances, two bedrooms with an en-suite to the very spacious master bedroom and a good-sized family bathroom.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
*Guide Price £1,100,000 - £1,150,000*
chain free! John Payne are delighted to bring to the market this unique, rarely available two bedroom end of terrace house situated within the popular Ashburnham triangle in West Greenwich.

Converted from a Victorian Baptist Church, the property has been lovingly refurbished throughout by its current owner and boasts a wealth of beautiful features.

The accommodation is arranged over three floors and comprises a beautiful open plan, dual aspect kitchen reception room with integrated appliances, beautiful feature windows and a high vaulted ceiling. Large master bedroom with bespoke fitted storage and newly fitted ensuite shower room, second double bedroom with built in storage, three piece modern family bathroom and a large entrance hallway with ample storage.

Externally to the rear you will find a secluded, low maintenance decked private garden, the perfect spot for alfresco dining.

Devonshire Drive is considered one of the premier roads in West Greenwich and is located just a few moments from mainline rail and DLR. The town centre is only a short walk away and offers a superb collection of shops and restaurants, dotted around the marketplace, along with riverboat service and the royal park with Observatory.

detailedDescription:
Valley House (SE7) | Available for £93,750 (25% of full value £375,000)

Online and On-site Viewings Available - Register your interest to book your viewing

Close to Canary Wharf, with quick transport links into Central London. Minutes from desirable Greenwich and Blackheath, Valley House offers a unique collection of 1,2 & 3 bedroom Shared Ownership homes designed with you in mind.

Apartments and duplexes ready for you to make your own

Whether you are taking your first step on the property ladder or looking to move to a larger home there is a home to suit you. Each apartment benefits from a stylish open plan kitchen providing the ideal space to experiment with food, private outdoor space to entertain friends plus parking to select apartments.

What is Shared Ownership?

Available to purchase through Shared Ownership, purchasers are able to buy as much of the property as they can afford, from 25 - 75%, paying a low cost rent on the remaining unpurchased 'share' of the home. What's more, your mortgage deposit is based on the value of the share you buy, not the full market value, making these high-spec homes even more affordable in such a sought after location.

About Valley House So

Valley House, SE7 - a development of one, two and three bed Shared Ownership homes located in Greenwich.

Opening Hours

Mon - Fri, 9am - 5pm

detailedDescription:
Valley House (SE7) | Available for £120,125 (25% of full value £480,500)

Online and On-site Viewings Available - Register your interest to book your viewing

Close to Canary Wharf, with quick transport links into Central London. Minutes from desirable Greenwich and Blackheath, Valley House offers a unique collection of 1,2 & 3 bedroom Shared Ownership homes designed with you in mind.

Apartments and duplexes ready for you to make your own

Whether you are taking your first step on the property ladder or looking to move to a larger home there is a home to suit you. Each apartment benefits from a stylish open plan kitchen providing the ideal space to experiment with food, private outdoor space to entertain friends plus parking to select apartments.

What is Shared Ownership?

Available to purchase through Shared Ownership, purchasers are able to buy as much of the property as they can afford, from 25 - 75%, paying a low cost rent on the remaining unpurchased 'share' of the home. What's more, your mortgage deposit is based on the value of the share you buy, not the full market value, making these high-spec homes even more affordable in such a sought after location.

About Valley House So

Valley House, SE7 - a development of one, two and three bed Shared Ownership homes located in Greenwich.

Opening Hours

Mon - Fri, 9am - 5pm

detailedDescription:
Georgian properties tend to be rare in London and certainly rare in Blackheath. This home has been meticulously decorated to highlight its best features and provide its new owner the ideal layout for today's modern living style.
This home comprises a cosy living room to the front, where you can watch TV while you listen to the rain in the winter nights.
While the kitchen/dining area will be the space where you will entertain your family and friends, where you can take advantage of the openness of the space.
The bathroom will certainly impress those who love a bath, and once again our client did not forget about the original features and unique details.
The bedrooms are spacious & bright and could even accommodate an en-suite shower room in the first floor for those who prioritise privacy.
The garden is an ideal suntrap, and also very private and green.
To fully appreciate this home we recommend that you arrange your viewing.

detailedDescription:
A beautiful four bedroom, two bathroom, Edwardian home with a landscaped garden and located within the sought after Charlton Slopes close to both Charlton and Westcombe Park Stations and sold chain free.

The property is in very good decorative order with features including; high ceilings, wood flooring, cornicing, period fireplaces, double glazed windows and gas fired central heating. The accommodation is arranged over three floors and comprises; entrance hall with under stairs storage, two good sized reception rooms (that have been opened up to form a large through reception room) and a large kitchen breakfast room with modern kitchen and integrated appliances. On the first floor are two large double bedrooms and an attractive modern bathroom with separate shower and bath. The top floor provides two further bedrooms, one of which is with ensuite shower room and eaves storage. To the rear is a superb landscaped garden with two terraces, artificial lawn and flower bed borders.

This is a wonderful family home and is sold chain free. Your immediate viewing is a must.

The property is conveniently located just 445 metres from Westcombe Park Station, 492 metres from Charlton Station and 1.46 miles from North Greenwich Jubilee and the O2. Blackheath Standard with all the daily conveniences is 0.48 miles, Blackheath Village with its array of boutiques, bars and restaurants is 1.27 miles and the shops at Greenwich Peninsula are within 385 metres. The ofsted outstanding Sherington and Invicta Schools are a few minutes' walk whilst many beautiful green spaces are found close by, including Royal Greenwich Park, Charlton Park and Maryon Wilson Animal Park.

title: 4 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
Situated in this outstanding and highly sought after road very close to the bars, restaurants, boutique shops, farmers market and mainline station of Blackheath Village. A beautiful and spacious three bedroom bi-lateral conversion (freehold), laden with original period features and spanning across the first floor of two Victorian houses.

The accommodation includes a beautiful 13'10 x 12'0 living room with period style fireplace and bespoke alcove units and an attractive modern kitchen with dining area. There are two identical 10'5 x 9'0 bedrooms, a very large 15'3 x 12'1 master, superb bathroom with freestanding bath and chromed heated towel rail and separate WC.

The property is in excellent decorative order boasting wood flooring, gas fired central heating, fireplaces, high ceilings, cornicing and sash windows. The property itself was the subject of a considerable and sympathetic renovation a few years previously and therefore boasts not only a wealth of original victorian features, but also benefits from having had new plumbing and electrics as well as new roofing and recently brand new guttering across the front of the property.

The property also has the huge added benefit of the ownership of a rear paved garden with beautiful views over the significant green space of the adjoining communal flower gardens.

This is an impressive home and will be very popular, affording as it does such good access to Blackheath and Greenwich. Your immediate viewing is essential and there is no chain.

The property is in an excellent location and is perfect for the commute into the City, Waterloo or Chiang Cross with Blackheath Station only 0.3 miles away, Lewisham Station and DLR is 0.7 miles and Hither Green is 0.7 miles. The popular open spaces of Blackheath Common, (0.4 miles), Greenwich Park, (0.8 miles), and Manor House Gardens, (0.4 miles), are all within a short walk.

detailedDescription:
"This was my first property purchase and i've really enjoyed living here the past 3 years. I chose it because of how much character it had with beautiful high ceilings, beams and aspects left from it being part of a Slazenger ball factory.

Since living here i've installed plantation shutters, added some finishing touches and have been proud to call it my own.

There's a quiet community feel here and the adjacent flats have all been so friendly, with us having WhatsApp and Facebook groups. The surrounding area has lots of amenities and 24-hour transport links, useful for commuting to the city, visiting friends and coming back late!

There's Woolwich Dockyard, Woolwich Arsenal and buses all within 15 minutes' walk, plus the Elizabeth line will be opening soon which will take 20 minutes to Tottenham Court Road. There's lots of greenery with Woolwich Common, Charlton Park, Greenwich Park, or a walk along the Thames nearby.

There's lots of choice when it comes to local shops in Woolwich and Charlton, or a great bakery to get a coffee and croissant in Blackheath.

My circumstances have changed now and i'm looking to move back nearer to friends and family, but i'll definitely miss calling this apartment home."

The sellers words perfectly encapsulate our thoughts on this apartment: A quality home in a stunning building! Such a charming property that is ideal as a first time purchase or for a buy to let investor.

Highly recommended!

Lease - 121 years approx remaining.
Ground Rent - £300pa.
Service Charge - Approx £800pa<br /><br />

title: 3 bed end terrace house for sale

detailedDescription:
This stunning late Georgian townhouse offers fantastic light-filled living space over four storeys, five bedrooms, a utility room and a beautiful landscaped rear garden. Set back from the road to give a greater sense of privacy, you enter the house on the ground floor into the entrance hallway with oak parquet flooring. There is a feeling of space and light throughout the house. The hallway leads through into the kitchen and dining room which features a hand-crafted deVOL kitchen complete with integrated appliances and lovely period style features such as the belfast sink and brass taps. With large sash windows on both sides flooding the room with natural light, parquet flooring and a working fireplace with marble surround, this is an incredible family and entertaining space. There is a double reception room situated on the lower floor offering the flexibility as a living room plus children’s playroom or study which can be separated by closing double doors. There are elegant glazed double-doors which lead out into the delightful landscaped rear garden providing a wonderfully secluded and leafy environment for both families and outdoor entertaining. The principal bedroom is on the first floor as well as a shower room and further bedroom overlooking the garden. There are a further three bedrooms and a family bathroom with a bath, separate walk-in shower and WC on the top floor featuring stylish Mosa tiles and a skylight. Each room has its own unique colour scheme designed by Farrow and Ball to give a very stylish and modern yet individual feel to the property. Other more practical features include a utility room and separate guest WC on the ground floor, a wine cellar plus extensive storage in the basement and generous easily accessible fully boarded loft storage. The house is offered in excellent condition having undergone an extensive schedule of renovation in 2018 including a new Welsh slate roof and loft insulation, new kitchen and bathrooms, complete rewiring and underfloor heating installed in all bathrooms. This is an incredible opportunity to purchase an elegant completely readymade home on arguably West Greenwich's most desirable road.

Situation
Hyde Vale is a sweeping road in West Greenwich which has recently been closed to through traffic creating a wonderfully quiet residential road. All of Greenwich's shops, bars and restaurants are within easy reach as are all the historical places of interest such as the National Maritime Museum, Royal Observatory and the Royal Naval College. It's a short walk from both Cutty Sark and Greenwich DLR stations as well as the Mainline Rail Station at Greenwich giving fast and convenient access into Canary Wharf and the City.

A Completely Renovated Georgian Townhouse

Moments From Greenwich Park And Greenwich Market

Stunning Period Features

Professionally Designed Front And Rear Gardens

A Short Walk To Greenwich Mainline And DLR Station

Fantastic Living Space And Five Bedrooms

Two Bathrooms Plus Additional Utility Room And Guest WC

detailedDescription:
***Guide Price £600,000 - £625,000*** "Lemmon Road is definitely a hidden gem. We've lived here for twelve years and have very much enjoyed being part of this friendly community.

The house is incredibly practical with large rooms, easy parking and a downstairs toilet. We've also installed bespoke storage in every nook and cranny; essential in a family home!

The south-facing garden has been a real pleasure, especially during lockdown. It is a complete sun trap and we have spent many years cultivating an easy to maintain, wildlife friendly garden.

The house is perfectly located, being only a five minutes walk from both Greenwich Park and the shops / restaurants on Trafalgar Road. It is a short walk into central Greenwich and there is a regular train service into London from Maze Hill station.”

What The Agent Says -

This owner occupied house is located in a quiet location, just moments away from Greenwich Park.

Inside you will find a very spacious living room, with dining space and direct access to the south facing garden. Downstairs you have the benefit of a guest WC, which always comes in handy and the separate kitchen was fitted in 2015 and features some integrated appliances and a fitted drop down table.

Also downstairs there is a built in shoe rack, with some other useful units located underneath the stairs and a further storage room.

Upstairs there are two large bedrooms, a small double bedroom, a fully tiled bathroom suite with shower over bath, as well as an airing cupboard and direct access to a loft, which comes with a pull down ladder.

There is off street permit parking to the rear of the property, accessed through the garden and residents can also still apply to the local council for residents permit parking, on street.

The beautiful riverside pubs, Greenwich town centre and the O2 centre/North Greenwich tube station are all within very easy reach of this location.<br /><br />

The property located on the first floor comprises:

  • Kitchen: White base and wall units with Manhattan marble worktop and tiled splashback. Integrated Zanussi appliances in excellent condition. Engineered oak flooring.
  • Bedroom One: Double bedroom with large floor to ceiling window and beige carpet.
  • Bathroom: White suite comprising panelled bath with shower over and glass shower screen, WC and hand washbasin with mirror over. Full height tiling around the bath. Extractor fan. Heated towel rail. White tiled flooring.
  • Outside: Juliet balcony, communal garden, gym and swimming pool and full concierge service.


What happens after I register my interest?

After registering your interest for a Peabody home, you will receive an email confirmation from us. The email will confirm what you need to do next to secure a property viewing which includes completing a financial assessment with a mortgage advisor and completing the Shared Ownership Application Form.

If you don’t receive this email within an hour of your registration, please check your spam or junk folders and set your spam filter to allow incoming emails from Peabody. If you still haven’t received the email after checking here, please contact and our team will be able to help you.

detailedDescription:
Set back from the road and positioned behind a large gravel drive this property benefits from ample off street parking and offers an abundance of ‘curb appeal’. You enter into a spacious hall with high ceilings, ornate cornicing and wooden floors, a theme that runs throughout most of the house. To the left are the two main reception rooms that are joined by interconnecting doors. Both rooms have feature fireplaces, high skirting boards and incredible decorative ceilings and cornicing. Furthermore, these rooms have impressive arched sash windows with original wooden shutters. Across the hall is a great study with a fireplace and built in cabinetry. At the end of the hall is the modern kitchen breakfast room which is made up of contemporary units with a stone work surface and central island with breakfast bar. Off the kitchen is a lovely half brick conservatory with two sets of French doors out to the garden. A WC and garage complete this floor. There are stairs down to the basement where you find a large utility room and a further room that would make a great gym/cinema room. On the first floor are three large double bedrooms, all of which have original fireplaces. There is an en-suite shower room with the main bedrooms and a large family bathroom with a free standing bath. On the top floor are three further double bedrooms, a bathroom and another room that is being used as a gym/store room. The rear garden is over 120ft long and is mainly laid to lawn with a large stone patio and is surrounded by mature trees and shrubs.

Kidbrooke Grove is a particularly popular location. It takes just a stroll of a few hundred yards to bring you to the heath. Beyond the heath in one direction, Blackheath Village provides a wonderful array of shops, bars and restaurants. In terms of transport, Blackheath Station provides regular services into London Bridge, Cannon Street, London Victoria and Charing Cross. Alternatively, one stop down the line at Lewisham Station, the DLR has regular services into Bank and Canary Wharf. Looking north across the heath is Royal Greenwich Park with Greenwich’s historic town centre found through the north gates.

address: Greenwich Millennium Village, The Village Square, West Parkside, Greenwich SE10
detailedDescription:
Sophisticated two bedroom apartment on the fourth floor. Accessed via a stylish, secure entrance lobby with a seating area for visitors and space for working, this apartment provides the perfect balance of style and practicality, ready for you to enjoy by yourself or with friends. What's more all residents will have access to the private podium garden and bookable games room providing a haven to escape too

Greenwich Millennium Village

Described as one of the most exciting new residential neighbourhoods in Europe, Greenwich Millennium Village is a contemporary development that offers a different quality of life. Situated on Greenwich Peninsula, a short distance from the historic charm of Old Greenwich, it is just one stop on the Jubilee line from Canary Wharf and four stops from London Bridge.

Greenwich Millennium Village offers 21st Century living in a peaceful green setting, just a short walk from the O2 and North Greenwich station. Swathes of open space include the established Ecology Park, a large central park and podium gardens, linked by green corridors and tree lined avenues. The layout of the village gives priority to people over cars, with lively and intimate streets and a Village Square forming a focal point. The master plan also includes the amenities that every thriving community requires, with shops and facilities within a short distance of every home, and an architecturally stunning primary school and health centre at the heart of the village.

An immaculately presented top floor (sixth floor), two bedroom, two bathroom modern apartment benefiting secure gated allocated parking and two private terraces. Positioned within close proximity of the shopping amenities of Woolwich town centre.

Comprising a 27 sq ft open plan living area and kitchen with integrated appliances with a large South West facing balcony with lovely views. Benefitting from two double bedrooms of which the master boasts an en suite shower room, built in wardrobes and further East facing terrace. There is an additional three piece family bathroom with shower over bath making this dual aspect apartment a rarity within the development. Beautifully designed throughout with wood flooring, carpets in the bedrooms and tiled bathroom floors, high quality fixtures and fittings and ample storage. Added benefits include off street allocated parking, video entry system, and NHBC warranty included.

This unique flat is positioned within close proximity of the popular shopping amenities of Woolwich Town Centre offering a wide range supermarkets, shops, restaurants and bars. A short walk to Woolwich Arsenal for DLR, South-Eastern and Thameslink Lines easy connections into North Greenwich station for the Jubilee line. Further popular transport links include the river boat, Woolwich Ferry, City Airport as well as the highly anticipated Elizabeth line/Crossrail due to arrive in 2022.

The buildings have been carefully considered to create a strong visual impact, accentuated with sensitive design details to provide a sense of individuality and style. The apartment has been built to maximise space and light and finished with a high specification to ensure an excellent level of comfort, security and quality.

title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
Guide price £500,000 - £525,000

Acorn are delighted to present this spacious three double bedroom home situated just minutes away from Eltham High Street and Eltham Station.

The accommodation comprises; an entrance porch and hallway, huge through lounge, fully fitted kitchen with access to a downstairs shower room, and conservatory that leads onto the garden with a summer house to the back that has electric.

To the first floor is the family bathroom and three double bedrooms, the master and second bedroom both have large fitted wardrobes.

Additional benefits include; side access and storage for bikes/motorcycles, off street parking for 2 + cars, double glazing and gas central heating.

Eltham Station is just 0.6 miles away which offers fast and frequent direct services into London Bridge, Waterloo East, Cannon Street, Charing Cross & London Victoria. Eltham High Street is just moments away and offers comprehensive shopping, bars, restaurants and the recently built Vue cinema.

If Schools are a priority then this really isn’t one to miss out on as there is a selection of primary & secondary schools available within the immediate area including the Ofsted Outstanding Harris Academy Greenwich and Eltham Church of England Primary School.

The property is located just 0.3 miles from Sutcliffe Park & Nature Reserve which over recent years has been completely transformed and also offers access to Sutcliffe Park Sports Centre which accommodates an indoor Skate park, Clip 'n Climb climbing wall, Athletics tracks and much more!

Energy Efficiency Rating E.

detailedDescription:
One of the larger two bedroom apartments within the development this stylish property offers an abundance of character and charm.
Prior to the conversion, the old military hospital was built in 1865 and is surrounded by more than seven acres of grounds.
As well as the beautifully maintained grounds
of the estate, this development also offers a tennis court, gym, swimming pool, sauna, residents bar and onsite concierge.
The Shooters Hill area also offers many pleasant parks and green open spaces to enjoy which include Shrewsbury Park and the ancient Oxleas Wood.
A frequent 24 hour local bus service means you are well connected to Blackheath, Woolwich and North Greenwich offering excellent transport links into Central London and Canary Wharf.
This property also features allocated parking and the current lease is being extended to 999 years.

detailedDescription:
Impressive and extensively refurbished to a very high standard, is this large and versatile three double bedroom modern townhouse with a fantastic 95ft landscaped garden located opposite the popular Oxleas Woods.

The property is newly refurbished and is in outstanding decorative order throughout. Features include wood flooring, double glazed widows, feature radiators, bespoke built in storage and woodwork, feature lighting, marble worktops and cat 5 cabling.

Arranged over four levels the accommodation comprises: On the entrance level is a large living room, WC, utility room and access to the garage with steps down to a large kitchen diner with luxury kitchen, integrated appliances and bi-folding doors to the garden. The first floor provides two double bedrooms, both with built in wardrobes and a very attractive modern bathroom. The top floor with a skylit landing has a third double bedroom again with built in wardrobes.

To the rear is a fantastic 95ft landscaped garden with feature fences either side, extensive deck, lawn and a feature shed with secret door. There is off street parking to the front.

This is a superb home in immaculate condition and has to be seen. There is no chain. Virtual tours can be seen at

The property benefits from an excellent choice of commuting links from its doorstep being only a short bus journey to either North Greenwich for Jubilee tube line, Woolwich for DLR (Crossrail due in 2021) or Blackheath/Woolwich/Eltham/ Welling/ for national rail services. The popular open space of Oxleas Woods with Severndroog Castle is opposite.

title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
This property boasts high ceilings throughout, as well as an abundance of period charm. At the rear of the flat is an extremely impressive open plan kitchen/reception room with a large south facing feature bay window that overlooks the beautiful communal garden. There is a feature fireplace and a modern kitchen that runs along one wall. The main bedroom has room for a double bed and enjoys built-in storage and ample light courtesy of a large wooden sash window. There is a smaller second bedroom that would be ideal as an office or cot room and a fully tiled bathroom with a walk-in shower. The property benefits from private parking and is moments from Blackheath Village.

The Paragon is ideally situated to take advantage of all that Blackheath has to offer. A short stroll along the Heath will take you to the village where you will find an array of boutique shops, bars, cafes, and restaurants. A walk across the Heath will bring you to Royal Greenwich Park with the historical town centre beyond. For those looking at transport, Blackheath Station provides regular services into London Bridge, Cannon Street, London Charing Cross and London Victoria.

Greenwich Square is created around a vibrant public square, including leisure facilities, gp/Surgery, library, swimming pool and gym with around 30 different exercise classes for both adults and kids including Yoga and Pilates. There is a range of retail amenities as well as providing a diverse mix of apartments, maisonettes and townhouses.

Maze Hill station is a short walk away, just two stops from London Bridge and North Greenwich tube is just a ten minute bus ride away. Numerous bus routes into Greenwich offer further overground and DLR connections to Canary Wharf and East London.

Comments from the seller:

"I was one of the first residents to move into Lambarde Square, and it has been an absolute blast over the past few years. The balcony receives sunshine all day in Summer, but it is also exceptionally cosy in the winter. There is a bus stop right outside which gets you to the O2 in 10 minutes. You can walk to ikea or down to the river in under 10. It's surrounded by great pubs, and you have all the shops you need along the Trafalgar Road. I will miss the place greatly and am only selling due to a change in personal circumstances."

Greenwich Peninsula is a vibrant community offering a large variety of activities within short walking distance.'The O2' provides access to world class events, as well as offering a large selection of venues for food and drink. The 'icon Outlet' offers many designer stores, including Kurt Geiger, Hobbs, Nike, and Calvin Klein. Several large supermarkets (Sainsbury's, asda, Aldi, Lidl) are within a short walk on the Thames Path; the estate also houses an Ikea and B&Q. A local Co-op and Tesco are a few minutes walk of the flat.

Further afield, Greenwich Park and market are reachable via a short walk or cycle along the Thames Path. Away from the buzz, Blackheath provides a village feel with artisan bakeries, farmer's market, and shops.

North Greenwich Underground Station, within 0.4 miles offers car free pedestrian access to the underground and bus services.Your journey into central London couldn’t be easier, with 10 minutes journey time to London Bridge on the Jubilee Line. A 2 minute underground journey to Canary Wharf provides access to further shops as well as access to the DLR and, in the future, Crossrail.

The Thames Clipper offers a boat service into the City with various stops.

Access to North London is provided by the Blackwall Tunnel which is within 0.5 miles.

detailedDescription:
Guide Price £700,000-£735,000. In this exceptional Heath fronting location very close to Blackheath Village and Greenwich Park, is this huge two double bedroom apartment with a private terrace, fantastic communal garden and off street parking.

The property is in good decorative order yet still offers scope to enhance. Features include; very high ceilings, period features, cornicing, stripped floorboards, fireplaces, sash windows and gas fired central heating.

Found on the first floor of this grand semi-detached period house, the accommodation comprises; a large entrance hall with storage cupboard, a good size kitchen and a bathroom. There is a superb 19'1 x 14'8 reception room with feature fireplace and direct access to a private terrace overlooking a vast communal garden. There are two double bedrooms including a huge 17'2 x 14'10 master with built in wardrobes and both with outstanding views directly over the heath and towards Greenwich Park. The property has the added benefit of being sold with a share in the freehold, chain free and an off street parking space to the font.

This is a wonderful home and viewing is highly recommended. Video tours can be seen at

Vanbrugh Terrace is a highly prestigious location directly fronting the Heath. An outstanding location to take advantage of local amenities in almost all directions. Walking south, just 0.45 miles, you will arrive in Blackheath village which offers an array of boutique shops, bars, restaurants and farmers market giving a genuine feeling of village life inside London. 0.55 miles to the northwest you will find the historic Greenwich town centre and Royal Greenwich Park is just 218 metres away. Finally, 0.39 miles to the east is Blackheath Standard, with daily conveniences including M&S Food Hall. Blackheath Station, Westcombe Park Station and Maze Hill Station are all just a short walk. With the DLR within easy reach from Greenwich.

title: 3 bed property for sale

detailedDescription:
Chain free! A rare addition to the market, dating from the late 17th century, is this four storey Grade 2 listed family home, comprising four bedrooms and two bathrooms and is situated on the much sought after Royal Hill in West Greenwich.

This property is a true gem and retains many of its period features throughout such as beautiful fireplaces, wooden panelling, staircase, doors, original sash windows and many more. Measuring over 1800 sq ft the property offers spacious accommodation throughout over four storeys.

To the lower ground floor you will find the kitchen which benefits from ample storage space within original panelled cupboards and dresser.

The characterful family bathroom with a freestanding bath, his and hers basins and WC, next door to which is the utility room with further WC.

To the ground floor this is where you’ll find the beautiful through reception room which has a wealth of period and creative features and a French door leading to the garden.

On the first and second floors the sleeping accommodation comprises two substantial double bedrooms to the front and a further two double bedrooms at the rear of the property. On the second floor there has been a stylish shower room and WC added.

Externally to the rear you’ll find a secluded private garden with lots of low maintenance wild flowers, shrubs and trees.

At the end of the garden you’ll find a garage and the property also has rear access for vehicles and an off street parking space. Furthermore planning permission has been granted for demolition of existing garage, rear boundary wall and fence and construction of a single storey outbuilding and new rear fence plus removal of three trees. This would be the perfect addition to the property allowing you to have a home studio, gym or work from home office.

Royal Hill is located within moments of Greenwich Park and is within close walking distance of the shops on Royal Hill, Greenwich Picture house, Greenwich Theatre, Greenwich Town Centre, Greenwich Market and a plethora of other amenities, including bars and restaurants.

Access to Greenwich DLR, Cutty Sark DLR, Greenwich Mainline Station and the Thames Clipper are a short walk away, making light work of a commute into the City, Canary Wharf and the West End.

The property has been regularly updated and maintained over the years and the wealth of period features sensitively conserved. This is a fantastic opportunity to purchase a truly special property and for that reason early viewing is highly recommended.

address: Compton House, Victory Parade, Royal Arsenal SE18
detailedDescription:
Stylish & contemporary, larger than average, one bed apartment, on the 6th floor of a recently constructed block, at the top end of this landmark development, adjacent to the river, east of Greenwich. Fitted to a high standard, the property benefits from a substantial reception with Karndean wood effect flooring & access to a spacious balcony, ample storage space and open plan kitchen with a range of integrated appliances and stone worktop.

Area

The Royal Arsenal is a former munitions factory & storage facility with a history dating back to 1671, that is being tastefully transformed to provide a blend of converted & new build residential properties, together with a central open space, bars, restaurants and an hotel.

Beautifully landscaped, the builder has taken great care to create a development that is a pleasure to live in, rather than yet another sterile 'stack of boxes'. It retains a real sense of community yet retains a high degree of peace and tranquility, away from the 'big smoke'.

The development currently offers

* 24 Concierge & Security
* Waterside Club, with pool, gym & private cinema room
* BodyWorkshop Health & Wellbeing Centre
* Two Youngs "gastro pubs" The Dial Arch & The Guardhouse
* Con Gusto Italian Restaurant
* Craft Beer & Pizzeria, The Taproom
* Three on site cafés
* Health Centre
* Chemist
* Dentist
* Tesco Express
* M&S Food Hall
* Sainsbury's
* Dry Cleaning service
* Zipcar Car Sharing Club
* Fortnightly Farmers Market

Situated east of Greenwich, adjacent to Woolwich Town Centre (offering an array of main street shopping, including Sainsbury's, Tesco and a vibrant street market) the development is easily reached by road & rail.

The station is no more than a short stroll away, which offers a direct route to the City (London Bridge / Cannon Street) in a little over 20 minutes, via the Main Line and less than 25 minutes to Bank / Tower Gateway via the DLR.

London City Airport can also be reached in as little as 5 minutes, with Canary Wharf & Stratford also accessible in less than 25 minutes.

As far as leisure is concerned, a short cab ride will take you to nearby Blackheath, Greenwich or, the O2 - where you will be spoilt for choice in terms of food, drink and nightlife.

As an alternative to the train or car, the Thames Clipper river bus service also docks immediately adjacent to the development and provides additional links with The O2, Greenwich, Canary Wharf, Tower Bridge, Blackfriars, The Southbank (Tate Modern) and beyond.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
**stamp duty paid for first time buyers**

**Less than 10 apartments remaining- Don’t miss out**

Plot 166

Plot 166 is anintelligently designed 579 sq ft one bedroom apartment located in Charlton. It comes with a 30ft living area and a fully-fitted U shaped kitchen with integrated appliances and granite worktops. It also features outside space in the form of a 56 sq ft balcony.

Dimensions

Kitchen/Living/Dining

9.26m x 3.15m

Master Bedroom

3.53m x 3.48m

Total Area

53.8 sq m

The Area

Discover another side to city living. One that offers you a vibrant, modern community alive with things to see and do, alongside convenient transport connections. Together with a sea of green open spaces where you can relax and unwind, as well as inspiring places steeped in history. At Synergy, no sacrifices have to be made.

Step outside Synergy and you’ll be greeted with a wonderful range of high-street shops, supermarkets, and larger stores. The area’s heritage also brings a wide selection of historic attractions close to home, from the National Maritime Museum and the Cutty Sark, to the Royal Observatory Greenwich.

Take your pick from over 50 parks and open spaces in the Royal Borough of Greenwich and you’ll soon forget about the stresses and strains of modern life. Pack a picnic, pound the paths, turn the pages, whatever helps you relax, there are so many beautiful places in the neighbourhood to visit.

Travel Options

Synergy’s excellent transport links bring everything you find great about central London within easy reach. Be it the galleries, museums, theatres, sports, restaurants or entertainment. Although you don’t have to travel far to enjoy a wealth of amenities. Close by is everything from supermarkets, cinemas and historic attractions, to eateries, bars and gyms. The choice is yours.

What’s more, all you love about Central London is within easy reach too; both Westcombe Park Overground (Zone 3) and Charlton Overground (Zone 3) are only about a 10-minute walk.

The City

Many believe that London is the most dynamic and cosmopolitan city in the world. It’s an opinion of course, but what is certainly true is that London is a melting pot with districts as diverse as Soho and Mayfair or Westminster and Chelsea. It has a history that dates back over 2,000 years and is a treasure trove of shops, restaurants, galleries, museums and theatres.

A city such as this harbours a great deal of talent and ambition both in the past and present time. This is evident in the architecture, the enduring societies and guilds and the many celebrated seats of learning. The pioneering spirit that made London the capital of the British Empire and its appetite for art, fashion, music, tradition and innovation continues to this day and will continue indefinitely.

It’s little wonder that more than 8 million people call London their home.

About Synergy

A tale of two cities

Choose Synergy and youll discover it to be the perfect balance between city life and natural surroundings. This large, unique development effortlessly blends contemporary urban design with beautiful green landscaping to create a welcoming, attractive and lively community feeling. A feeling that you will discover extends into the surrounding, sought-after area of Charlton. A new home here will give you everything you could possibly need.

All you love about London is there for the taking

Travelling around London couldnt be easier from our new homes in Charlton. Both Westcombe Park Overground (Zone 3) and Charlton Overground (Zone 3) are around a 10-minute walk away, giving you simple access to all the City has to offer.

However, you dont have to go far to enjoy a wealth of amenities. Close to home is a good choice of supermarkets and high street shops alongside independent and well-established restaurants and bars. And for those with children, youll find a range of Ofsted-rated Good and Outstanding schools for all ages nearby.

Escape to a whole new world

Close to Synergy is another world. A green, tranquil one where you can easily escape to for those moments when you want to relax. With more than 50 beautiful, leafy parks and open spaces to enjoy close to our collection of property for sale in south east London, youll find Synergy really is the best of both worlds.

  • All you need and want within easy reach Synergys great transport links bring galleries, museums, theatres, sports, restaurants and entertainment closer, but youre also never far from plenty of parks to relax in.
  • Effortless journeys, to whatever part of the capital Synergy is really well connected, meaning you can be at Canary Wharf in 26 minutes and London Bridge in 16 minutes. Travelling by car is equally as simple with the South Circular just a few minutes away.
  • And in a moment, the City is left behind you theres a sea of green open spaces in the local area where you can go to escape the stresses and strains of modern life.
  • Take a short walk or drive to school whether your children are younger or older, youll find a variety of Good and Outstanding Ofsted-rated schools close by.
  • Live in harmony everything about Synergy has been carefully considered, from the contemporary urban design to the beautiful natural landscaping.

detailedDescription:
Set in this delightful private gated mews, is this spacious three bedroom, three bathroom, two reception room modern townhouse with a garage, conservatory and pretty garden, located close to the heath and Blackheath Royal Standard and sold chain free.

The property is in good decorative with sound proofed double glazed sash windows, solid oak flooring, air ventilation system, ample storage and gas fired central heating.

The accommodation is arranged over three floors and comprises; a large kitchen, dining room, conservatory and downstairs WC to the ground floor. The first floor boasts a large second reception room, (which could serve as a fourth bedroom if required), and a double bedroom with built in wardrobe and ensuite shower room. The top floor offers a fantastic master suite with large bedroom, built in wardrobes and a modern ensuite shower room, a third bedroom, that takes a double bed, and a modern family bathroom. To the rear of the property is a lovely 30ft garden with feature rear wall and timber framed greenhouse. The property also has a generous garage and an off street parking space in front.

This is a superb and versatile home and your immediate viewing is essential. There is no chain. Virtual tour can be seen at .

Belvedere Mews is a private gated development comprising of just 15 homes and located at the end of Langton Way, a sought after private lane just off the Heath. It is very convenient for transport links being 0.89 miles from Blackheath Station and Westcombe Park stations 0.62miles, buses for Greenwich (DLR) and North Greenwich (Jubilee Line), 1.7 miles. Blackheath Common (0.3 miles) and Greenwich Park (0.58 miles) are both just a short walk away, and the array of independent shops at Blackheath Standard are within 200 yards. £100,000 for a 25% share of £400,000 and a deposit as low as £10,000 and a minimum income of £46,000.

L&Q at Greenwich Square
Buying an apartment at Greenwich Square opens the door to a unique community and offers the perfect place to call home. Our homes are built around people and offer beautifully designed homes with a desirable specification and outdoor space to each apartment. These homes are also set around a beautiful garden square. The development has everything you could need on your doorstep making life that little bit more convenient. With every block distinct and individual, creating an intelligent balance between shared community and private space.

Shared Ownership
Under the Shared Ownership scheme you part-own and part-rent your home, making it possible for first-time buyers and families to get on the property ladder.
The minimum share you can purchase is 25% and the maximum is 75%. You will usually pay a mortgage on the part you own and a subsidised rent on the part you don’t own. As your income rises, you can increase the share you own until you eventually own 100%.

The minimum income required for a 1 bedroom apartment is £44,000
The minimum income required for a 2 bedroom apartment is £58,000
The minimum income required for a 3 bedroom apartment is £67,000
*Household incomes are based on joint applications. Single applications are able to apply but may need to increase their deposit contribution to meet shared ownership affordability requirements.

Viewings
For those who would like to and are able to visit us, the Show Home is now open on an appointment-only basis, with extra measures in place to ensure your wellbeing. Please call us to book your appointment. If you would prefer to speak to our Sales Team from your own home, they are still on hand and can conduct appointments via phone, email and by virtual tour. *We are taking extra precautions to ensure the health and wellbeing of our customers, staff and members of the public.
