title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This beautifully bright one-bedroom apartment has a private garden and is situated within a large Victorian townhouse on Shooters Hill, in the Royal Greenwich conservation area. The home’s period features have been sensitively preserved and restored, complemented by a neutral palette used throughout. Light pours in from sash windows at the front and rear, which enjoy spectacular views over verdant trees and the private garden beyond. The garden has been recently landscaped by Eden Restored and includes a wonderfully executed private annexe with electricity points and WiFi capabilities.

The Tour

The first-floor entrance opens onto a wonderfully light living and dining area with double-height ceilings and carefully restored period features, including a large mantlepiece at the centre. An abundance of natural light floods the space from double sash windows that face the private garden, illuminating the pared-back floorboards and whitewashed walls. The living area seamlessly flows into a recently refurbished galley kitchen with sleek white cabinetry and wooden work surfaces; a sash window opposite looks out over the trees beyond.

The sizeable double bedroom at the rear of the apartment mirrors the living room plan. Two large sash windows allow natural light to pour in and offer delightful glimpses of the garden’s outhouse. Understated built-in cupboards offer plenty of storage space and there is an immaculate en suite bathroom.

There is also private off-street parking at the front of the house.

Outdoor Space

Access to the garden is through a side gate and along a gravel pathway. A canopy of trees surrounds the plot, which has recently been landscaped by Eden Restored. The garden includes a cosy seating area with a built-in firepit at its centre and is enclosed by beautifully planted and maintained borders. At the rear is a charming private timber annexe with electricity points and WiFi capabilities. The double glazed doors open onto a terrace, which faces the manicured garden beyond.

The Area

Shooters Hill is a short walk away from the fields of Blackheath, which lead into the open spaces of Greenwich Park and Greenwich, towards the River Thames. The picturesque Blackheath Village and Greenwich have a plethora of independent shops, restaurants, pubs and delis, and a variety of cinemas and theatres. Neighbourhood favourites include The Blackheath Pantry and Buenos Aires Cafe.

The closest rail stations are Westcombe Park, with lines to London Bridge in 20 minutes, and Kidbrooke, with lines to Charing Cross in 25 minutes and Victoria in half an hour. There are multiple bus routes in this area travelling directly to Greenwich, Peckham and Camberwell.

Tenure: Share of Freehold
Lease Length: Approx. 994 years remaining
Council Tax Band: C

title: 4 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
This wonderful mid-century two-bedroom apartment with a communal garden, is situated on Hyde Vale; arguably one of the finest addresses in Greenwich with commanding views of the City of London, a short walk from Blackheath, Point Hill park and Greenwich park. Extensively renovated under the current ownership, the apartment is located on the fourth floor of a purpose-built apartment building, echoing the form of surrounding Georgian town houses.

The Tour

Entrance on the ground floor leads to a communal, concrete staircase with a hardwood balustrade. Exposed blue brickwork creates a striking contrast against curtain glazing at the front and rear of the building, providing a verdant view of tree-lined Hyde vale to the front and the communal garden to the rear.

The fourth-floor front door opens into a central hall with a light-well from which all rooms radiate. To the rear, are two north facing double bedrooms overlooking the garden. Also bathed in light from above, the bathroom lies in the centre of the buildings footprint and is subtly appointed with grey tiling, referencing the blue brickwork of the buildings fabric.

To the front, a large kitchen-living space extends over 18’x19’. South facing, the room is exceptionally bright courtesy of curtain glazing at the front. Original details such as the doors and hardware create an undercurrent of mid-century elegance. A compact and highly efficient l-plan kitchen benefits from a dishwasher, large fridge-freezer and gas stove.

Outdoor Space

A large, mature and verdant communal garden extends to the rear of the property with a large dining table and paved BBQ area.

The Area

The house is very well located mid-way along Hyde Vale, a ten-minute walk from the centre of Greenwich and a few minutes from the open expanses of Greenwich Park and Blackheath. The pretty old town, famous for its maritime history, has an excellent selection of restaurants, pubs and shops, as well as a Picturehouse cinema and a theatre. The Old Royal Naval College, designed by Sir Christopher Wren in the 18th century, hosts a popular programme of events in the gardens, including concerts, an open-air theatre and a jazz festival.

The closest station is Greenwich, running services to Canary Wharf and Bank on the DLR and rail services to London Bridge and London Cannon Street (taking eight minutes and 12 minutes respectively). The Thames Clipper can be boarded from Greenwich Pier and runs services to Westminster in one direction and the O2 arena in the other.

Tenure: Share of Freehold (Leasehold)
Lease Length: 114 years remaining
Service Charge: Approx. £200 per annum
Council Tax Band: D

The current owners have thoughtfully renovated and reconfigured the property to the highest of standards to create a wonderfully versatile space. Stairs take you up to a spectacular open plan living space. The room is steeped in light from the windows, floor to ceiling sliding doors and the large atrium roof light. At one end is the bespoke shaker style kitchen with central island, breakfast bar and utility area. Attractive wood block flooring runs through to a dining area where there is an original fireplace and a freestanding column radiator. Finally, is the large living room with doors out to a great private roof terrace.

A contemporary staircase brings you up to the next floor where you will find two double bedrooms and a jack and jill bathroom with a roll top bath and walk-in shower. The principle suite is on the top floor and consists a double bedroom, dressing area and a modern en-suite shower room.

Blackheath Village is within very close proximity and offers an array of shops, bars and restaurants. Beyond the village you will find the open expanse of the heath itself, which is a jewel of South East London. Blackheath station is ideal for commuting into town with regular services in to London Bridge, Charing Cross, Cannon Street and London Victoria. One stop down the line will bring you to Lewisham Station where the DLR service provides regular services into Canary Wharf and Bank.

The local area offers sought after riverside walking routes and an abundance of amenities. Cutty Sark DLR is also just a short walk away and offers easy access to Canary Wharf and the city.

The accommodation itself is in excellent condition throughout and offers approximately 1,118 sq ft of living space. The lower level comprises an entrance hallway with a storage cupboard and WC, a spacious open-plan living room/dining area and a modern fitted kitchen with integrated appliances.

The upper level hosts a master bedroom with fitted wardrobes and an en-suite shower room, one further double bedroom also with fitted wardrobes and a modern family bathroom. Viewing comes highly recommended to appreciate the accommodation on offer.

For Sale by Springbok Properties' using our "Buyer-Friendly" Premium Fast Sale Plus, which puts you in the driving seat thanks to Springbok's fast and secure way of buying.

Our sellers are motivated and willing to price their properties competitively in order to ensure a fast and secure sale.

You can now secure the sale with a reservation deposit of £2,500, this forms part of the final purchase price. It is not an extra cost.

An administration fee of £396 draws up an exclusive legally binding contract between the buyer and seller giving the buyer exclusive rights to purchase within a given timeframe.

Paying the reservation deposit ensures that the seller takes their property off the market as soon as the sale is agreed and reserves it exclusively for you, eliminating gazumping and the helps you avoid losing money and wasting time which most buyers like you may face with the traditional estate agent's approach.

You get a fixed exclusivity period (approximately 4 weeks) in which you can arrange surveys and prepare to exchange contracts, safe in the knowledge that you will not be gazumped by another buyer.

Get the best of both worlds: You get to buy properties with a mortgage which are normally reserved for cash-rich investors and cash buyers and you get the security of an exclusive buying transaction with a much smaller deposit.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Situated in this exemplary Royal Arsenal Riverside development is this superb three bedroom apartment.

The property itself is compiled at just shy of 1000 Sq. Ft and benefits from three private balconies, located on the ninth floor. The open plan kitchen and living space offers an abundance of natural light from the floor to ceiling windows, offering dual aspect panoramic views.

The main sleeping suite has the additional benefit of an en-suite and in-built storage cupboards, with a north facing balcony space adjoining to the room. The further two double bedrooms are well appointed with access to a family style bathroom unit which has a sleek, modern finish.

The development offers a 24 hour concierge, podium floor private garden and a health and well-being centre, as well a plethora of shops are on your doorsteps, Tesco, M&S Foodhall among many others.

Woolwich Arsenal Station is no more than a short walk away, which offers a direct route to the City (London Bridge / Cannon Street) in a little over 20 minutes, via the Main Line and less than 25 minutes to Bank / Tower Gateway via the DLR.

As an alternative to the train or car, the Thames Clipper river bus service also docks immediately adjacent to the development and provides additional links with The O2, Greenwich, Canary Wharf, Tower Bridge, Blackfriars, The Southbank (Tate Modern) and beyond.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
** Guide Price £825,000-£850,000 ** Words cannot describe this simply stunning three bedroom house within this very quiet and highly sought after riverside development.

Recently refurbished to the highest of standards and with no expense spared, the list of improvements is endless – but some of these include opening up the ground floor and replacing the kitchen with oak worktops and a custom fitted kitchen/bar, a full redesign of both bathrooms and cloakroom with Italian Marazzi tiles and Italian fixtures, a full rewire of the whole house by an niceic approved electrician, a full replumb by a gas safe engineer, new Vaillant combination boiler and radiators, rebuilt stairs, improved joists and sound insulation and even custom-built bedroom wardrobes. This just gives a small example to any potential buyer of the quality and attention to detail.

The property also has further potential to extend on the ground floor and loft conversion subject to planning permission.

Currently the accommodation offers a ground floor cloakroom, a very sociable open plan kitchen/living/dining room with access to an easily maintained level garden, and to the first floor is a landing with access to a useful boarded loft space, three good size bedrooms – one of which has an ensuite shower room – and family bathroom. To the front of the property is easy residents parking.

Location wise it is a commuters dream – a short walk over the bridge at the creek takes you past Waitrose and through to the DLR at the Cutty Sark for swift access to Canary Wharf, here too are all the amenities of Greenwich village and the beautiful open space of the royal park. All in all this is a wonderful house and as the original selling agents we can appreciate all the improvements made and would thoroughly recommend an early viewing.

What The Seller Says -

“It’s one of the very few freeholds in Greenwich West Ward that is on the river, and it has incredible potential to expand and increase the value of the house further by extending both in the loft and in the garden.

We love spending time in our garden, and we actually grow most of the veggies we eat ourselves. It’s like living a countryside lifestyle in Zone 2 London – brilliant! The area here is also a traffic-free zone, and particularly on the riverside it’s very, very quiet.

The area is safe, thanks to a gate and the CCTV managed by the management company and we also get up to two parking spaces in front of our home, concierge for packages when we are not home, well-tended gardens and lovely green areas.

It takes us around 10 minutes to walk to both Cutty Sark DLR or Greenwich DLR. Greenwich DLR station also has a train station next to it that takes us to Cannon Street and Bank in 10 minutes by train, and it costs as much as the tube because it’s within Zone 2 London.

We can be in Canary Wharf in 7 minutes by DLR and Bank in 10 minutes by train (or around 25 by DLR too).

Greenwich is the only place in this area of London where you can cross to the other side of the river without needing a car or having to take the tube, and we are 7 minutes away from the tunnel. It’s great that we can walk to Canary wharf in around 30 minutes from our doorstep. To top it off, Waitrose is nearby, as well as Asda on the other side of the river.

The riverside walk can take you straight to the O2 Arena as well – it’s around a 40 minute walk – or 20 minutes by bike. Between the Cutty Sark, O2, and Canary Wharf, we have everything we need very close by! The views over both Canary Wharf and the City are stunning, and of course Greenwich Park is beautiful; it’s great for picnics, running and playing tennis. We hope that the next owner(s) of this flat appreciate it as much as I have.”<br /><br />
title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
Beautifully presented and well laid out one bedroom ground floor apartment with spectacular partial river views and allocated parking, superbly situated in a river-side location in the heart of historic Greenwich next to the Old Royal Naval College. The property provides well appointed, bright and spacious accommodation with modern interiors, with features including light and spacious open plan reception/kitchen, stylish bathroom, laminate flooring with underfloor heating (also providing hot water), double glazing, video entry phone system, ample inbuilt storage, communal gardens and tennis court, external communal bins and bicycle storage, long lease and no onward chain.

Accommodation comprises entrance hall with inbuilt storage leading into the bright and spacious open plan lounge/diner/kitchen flooded with natural light from a large full height double glazed window and providing ample space for relaxing and dining. The kitchen area comprises a full range of beech wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, new induction hob with overhead extractor and electric oven, fridge/freezer, and washer 'Indesit'. Additionally, there is a generous double bedroom and a stylish family bathroom with 'Duravit' suite including an 'Hansgrohe' thermostatic shower over the bath with chrome glazed shower screen, grey ceramic tiled flooring and heated chrome towel radiator.

Viewings of this lovely property in a superb location are highly recommended.

General Information

“Owing to Government guidelines and the safety of our clients and potential buyers we have amended the way we carry out open days and have a strict one in one out policy. Please arrive with ppe and be respectful of social distancing whilst waiting your turn to view. We endeavour to give everyone fair and ample time to view and would welcome a second viewing if you feel you need more time”.

Location

The property is superbly located within just a short walk of Greenwich Villge with it's array of cafe's, bars and restaurants as well as an art house cinema, shops and markets. Maze Hill, Cutty Sark and North Greenwich stations are all within easy reach, offering excellent fast and frequent underground, overground and DLR connections into Central London and the City. Additioanlly, there are a variety of regular bus routes, and the Riverbus service available from Greenwich Pier. The O2 is also within eash reach providing a huge selection of restaurants and bars, as well as offering cinema screenings, events and concerts.

detailedDescription:
A river facing 3 bedroom home with private decked balcony and superb family accommodation arranged over one level. The floor to ceiling windows provide ample natural light and the engineered wood flooring with underfloor heating, the smart fitted kitchen and bathrooms, provide the style and comfort you'd expect from a new build home. The interior was designed by Knight Dragon, and has been inspired by the river, the rich palette reflects the natural materials found on the water's edge. The stained oak engineered wood floor with underfloor heating, complements the kitchen cabinetry and there are two very smart bathrooms with porcelain wall and floor tiling. The three generous double bedrooms, all enjoy river views and have fitted wardrobes, the master bedroom having a stunning en suite. There is ample space for a desk, for those who would prefer working from home in any of the bedrooms or reception room.
The gardens connected to the riverfront will have some fantastic restaurants, river cafes, retail outlets and lively public spaces, including London's first linear park, 'The Tide'. Upper Riverside neighbourhood links to Peninsula Square with access to North Greenwich Underground (Jubilee Line), 2 Mins to Canary Wharf and 8 Mins to London Bridge! The O2, with it's numerous international restaurants, Icon Designer outlet and buzzy social areas, and the soon to be completed Design District, are all within a few minutes walk of your home.

detailedDescription:
Chain free!

John Payne are delighted to present to the market this rare opportunity to purchase a beautiful, bay fronted five bedroom period family home located on Hyde Vale in West Greenwich, one of the area’s most sought after roads.

These houses are not available very often so this is an opportunity not to be missed! The property retains much of its character and period features throughout and enjoys far reaching views across Greenwich towards Central London.

The accommodation is arranged over three floors and requires some cosmetic updating throughout. On the ground floor you will find a great size hallway leading through to a large reception room with original fireplace, dining room, dual aspect kitchen and separate wc.

On the first floor you will find two double bedrooms both with built in storage, a fifth bedroom / study and a four piece family bathroom. On the second floor there are a further two double bedrooms with ample eaves storage and shower room.

The property benefits from fantastic views, facing onto greenery at the front while the rear bedrooms offer far reaching views to St Pauls and the London Skyline.

To the rear is a pretty, secluded, South West facing private garden.

Subject to relevant planning permissions the property can be extended and updated, there are currently drawings available and planning permission pending.

The house is situated in the desirable western part of Greenwich. Hyde Vale is one of the most sought after roads in Greenwich, a picturesque residential road which runs up from Royal Hill towards Blackheath. The property is located within moments of Greenwich Park and in close walking distance to both Greenwich and Blackheath Village, with the independent shops, bars and restaurants that the area has to offer. Greenwich station and the DLR serve frequently into London Bridge and Canary Wharf.

Residents permit parking is available.

Located in the Royal Borough of Greenwich, The development will benefits from being near to the thriving mix of shops and cafés based around the beautiful Royal Park as well as the intense regeneration of nearby Greenwich Peninsula. It also offers easy access to London City Airport, Greenwich University and the 02 Arena. Nearby North Greenwich Jubilee line station offers excellent transport links, just 3 minutes to Canary Wharf, 11 minutes to London Bridge and 21 minutes to Bond Street.

detailedDescription:
We are excited to market this immaculate 1 bedroom apartment in Noble House, located in the very modern development plot in Kidbrooke Village. This popular development is conveniently situated 3 minutes away from Kidbrooke train station and local amenities, making this property the ideal location for work and play. The property also benefits from a brand new on-site gym and 24hr concierge service inclusive within the property development.

The apartment consists of a spacious entrance with ample inbuilt storage facilities that accommodates the washing/dryer machine, clothing storage and additional space to keep the property neatly organised. The double bedroom space is very-generous with a very modern and elegant interior décor. The kitchen area comprises an ultra-modern and sleek range of matching white fronted wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, induction hob with overhead extractor and electric oven, and ample storage space for appliances. The kitchen is also fully equipped to a very high standard including dishwasher & fridge/freezer.

A benefit of this property is the private balcony that can be accessed from the living room. The apartment also offers bright and airy open plan living/reception space upon entrance to the property that is ideal for entertaining friends and family.

In addition, Kidbrooke train station runs regular trains directly to the main stations of Lewisham, London Bridge station, Waterloo East, Charing Cross and London Victoria, all of which are positioned on the main London Underground lines.

address: Noble House, Ottley Drive, Kidbrooke Village, London SE3
detailedDescription:
Comments from the owner:

What do you love most about your home?
We love the large floor to ceiling windows throughout the whole apartment, keeping the flat light all day long. We also love the open plan kitchen/living area so one of us can do the cooking whilst the other can keep them company from the sofa! As well as the large wraparound balcony that gives us privacy and somewhere to relax with a drink after a long day.

What do you love about the area?
We just love that Kidbrooke Village actually feels like a village, despite being 15 minutes from Central London. Everyone is incredibly friendly - whether it's your neighbours who become friends or the guys we run into every Saturday in the park with their sausage dogs, you feel like part of a community.

We love the local Pub, The Depot found inside the Village Square, where at the weekends we also have a wander to see the pop up food market and walk down into Blackheath. One of the great things about living here is that you can walk to everything you need! The gym we have access to, the local Sainsburys, the Pub, nice restaurants, lots of parks and free Tennis courts too!

I've always felt incredibly safe in Kidbrooke Village too - with round the clock security; communal gardens for the kids to play in and secure entrances to the buildings and floors, it's never been a place i've felt uncomfortable and not necessarily what you'd expect so close to London!

Property Details:

Offering beautifully presented, bright and spacious accommodation with high quality interiors and excellent inbuilt storage space, this superb fourth floor apartment in a fantastic central location.

Accommodation comprises entrance hall with inbuilt storage and wood effect flooring (evident through the majority of the property), leading into the bright and spacious, open plan dual aspect reception/kitchen, flooded with natural light from floor-to-ceiling windows and doorway leading out onto the wrap-around private balcony.

The kitchen area comprises a modern range of matching white fronted wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, induction hob with overhead extractor and electric oven below, and further space for appliances. There are three well sized bedrooms with ample space for free-standing furniture and modern en-suite to the master, plus a stylish family bathroom with white three piece suite and elegant tiling.

The property is conveniently located within easy access of Kidbrooke station, as well as numerous regular bus routes all providing excellent links into Central London, the City and the surrounding area. There are a variety of shops and amenities nearby, with nearby Blackheath, just a short distance away, offering a fashionable array of boutique shops, cafes, bars and restaurants. The area is well served by good local schools, as well as lovely open spaces.

The property is well presented and briefly comprises a stylish bathroom, a new bathroom suite with Japanese bath, fitted kitchen with appliances, master bedroom with Heath views and an elegant reception room with feature bay window overlooking the well maintained communal gardens.

There is unallocated resident's parking to the front of The Paragon in the crescent and to the rear there is an extensive parkland communal garden one of the finest and largest in the area.

This attractive property is close to Blackheath Village and its mainline station and also the excellent range of quality shops, restaurants, boutiques and bars found there; Historic Greenwich Park is also just a pleasant stroll away over the open heath.

detailedDescription:
This beautifully modern one-bedroom apartment is an absolute delight! On the second floor, enter the property through the wood grain panelled door and the apartment is bright and inviting. Nestled within the well planned Kidbrooke Village development, is our stunning apartment, where consideration for beauty and sustainable development go hand in hand.

As you enter immediately to your right is the spacious, classy bathroom; truly modern with contemporary tiles, wall mounted seamless W/C, shower and bath. The bedroom is well sized, with large wall to wall built in, fitted storage, complete with sliding doors. The feature windows run from ceiling to floor and has a door which opens onto a Juliet balcony. The lounge is spacious and opens out onto a balcony. The kitchen and lounge are open planned, and the kitchen is crisp and modern with fitted oven, hob, and fridge-freezer.

Property suitable for an investor 5% yield, available with tenant in-situ or with for a first time buyer with vacant possession.

Service Charge: £2200 pa

Lease Length: Approximately 900 years

Kidbrooke Village has a peaceful and serene ambiance, built within parkland and serviced by planned recreation and leisure amenities; including a residents only gym, a swimming pool, a movie room, as well as 24-hour concierge and a Zipcar car share club. Conveniently a new Sainsburys Local is now open.

Trains leave from Kidbrooke station for London Bridge, Waterloo East, Charing Cross and Victoria, connecting with the London Underground at these mainline Stations. Trains also connect to Lewisham providing links to the DLR to Greenwich, Canary Wharf and Stratford

detailedDescription:

***Excellent opportunity for first time buyers or investors***

Pointers are delighted to offer to market this splendid two bedroom ground floor flat situated within the desirable and conveniently located Bernard Ashley Drive private residential development in Charlton.

The development provides access via a private road with barrier entry where you will find a good amount of parking and communal gardens for the residents.

Inside, the property comprises entrance hallway with storage cupboard, two double bedrooms, family bathroom, spacious reception with wooden flooring, plenty of natural light and access to the kitchen. Added benefits include being within school catchment areas, well maintained throughout, double glazing windows and a long lease.

The location is perfect for commuters, being within walking to distance of Charlton over ground station and only a bus ride away from North Greenwich underground station. Local amenities are also close by, including Charlton retail park (Marks & Spencer, Costa, Sainsburys etc), North Greenwich & The O2.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This is a spacious two double bedroom top floor apartment in an attractive recently renovated Art Deco mansion block situated on the edge of the Heath and within easy access to Greenwich town centre, Blackheath Village and Lewisham Rail-dlr.
The apartment is well presented overlooking the communal gardens below and benefits from two good sized double bedrooms, bright and airy reception room, double glazing to most rooms and excellent storage space. The bathroom and kitchen whist still in good condition would benefit from upgrading in the future and this is reflected in the keen pricing of the property.
This impressive development has recently undergone a huge restoration programme which was complete in 2020 which included the full refurbishment and redecoration of all communal hallways including the installation of security entry phone systems. The exterior of the building has also been completely renovated to a very high specification. All the cabling has been completed for Hyperoptic (desirable super fast broadband). In our view, this handsome block is finally back to its former glory. Attractive communal gardens.
Residents parking and on street parking available via a residents parking permit in the surrounding roads.
Located within walking distance to Blackheath, Lewisham and Greenwich stations offering direct links into central London and the many wonderful amenities this desirable area has to offer. Chain Free. Energy Efficiency Rating C

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Comments from the owner:

What do you love most about your home?
We love the large sash windows throughout, the flat is South facing so we have light streaming into the flat at all times of the day which gives it a lovely bright feel. The open plan design also means you're not cut off in the kitchen which we love for entertaining.

What do you love about the area?
We didn't realise at first just how great a location the flat is in. We are spoilt for choice when it comes to lovely pubs and restaurants in both Greenwich and Blackheath. Our top picks for people new to the area are - Richard I a local's favourite with a cosy interior, The Cutty Sark for a great sunny spot overlooking the Thames, The Hare and Billet in Blackheath for the best Sunday Roast & The Pelton Arms for live music and a proper pub feel.

We're both runners, and love being only a few moments away from Blackheath Common and Greenwich park (the best park in London in our humble opinion) - in the summer we'll often head straight to the park as soon as we've finished work for a picnic dinner in the evening sunshine and a view over the Queen's house and the Thames. Royal Hill which has the loveliest of local butchers, greengrocers, fishmongers and cheese shop is just around the corner and Greenwich market is great for a bite to eat from the many market stall options at the weekend. For a change of scene, Deptford is also only a 10 minute walk for great cafes and bars along the buzzy railway arches.

The transport links are a definite bonus, we are a 10 minute walk to Deptford Bridge and Greenwich station where you can get a train to London Bridge in under 15 minutes or the DLR to Canary Wharf (15 mins) and Bank (30 mins). We are also only a 15 minute walk to Lewisham train station for trains into Waterloo and Charing Cross.

If you have a car the flat is perfectly positioned for escaping to the Kent coast at the weekends - you can reach Broadstairs and Whitstable in under an hour and a half.

Property Details:

Enjoying a sunny south facing aspect, as well as enormous character appeal with high ceilings and large sash windows, this beautiful period conversion flat set on the first floor of an attractive townhouse style property.

Accommodation comprises entrance hall with wood flooring (evident through the majority of the property, leading into the bright and spacious, open plan dual aspect reception/kitchen with dual shuttered windows and ample space for both relaxing and dining.

The kitchen area, with side aspect, comprises a modern range of matching wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, induction hob with overhead extractor and electric oven below, and further space for appliances. There is a generously sized double bedroom with full height inbuilt wardrobes, plus a modern family bathroom with white three piece suite and elegant tiling.

The property is enviably located within easy access of Greenwich station providing excellent overground and DLR connections into Central London and the City. Greenwich itself provides a vibrant array of shops, fashionable bars, cafes and restaurants, as well as a selection of regular markets, the iconic site of the Cutty Sark, beautiful Greenwich Park (just a short walk away) and the Royal Observatory.

Nearby Deptford, also with a railway station and DLR connections, offers a further eclectic mix of shops, bars, restaurants and artisan coffee shops, and Blackheath is also within easy reach with further fashionable amenities and beautiful open spaces.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
If you are looking for an immaculately presented apartment with a rarely available private parking space and extensive transportation links to provide the ultimate luxury city living, then look no further that this one bedroom property located in the highly sought after Greenwich Peninsula Development.

Internally, the property has been decorated to a high specification and boasts underfloor heating, ample storage, stylish open plan high gloss kitchen with integral appliances and a modern fitted bathroom suite complete with thermostatic shower and heated chrome towel rail. The property is high enough to sport some fantastic views from its location on the eighth floor.

This property has everything you would expect from a popular city development such as concierge service, video entry system and secure allocated parking. There is a local Co-op Food store a stone’s throw from the property together with a chemist, doctor surgery, hairdressers and other local stores all located within the gmv development.

The property is just down the road from The O2 Arena which has fantastic leisure facilities, multi-screen cinema, bowling alley and an array of restaurants and bars.

North Greenwich Underground station is a short walk away with links to both Central London and Canary Wharf.

The Thames Clipper stops at North Greenwich Pier and travels the river in both directions and the Emirates Cable Cars are also accessed from North Greenwich Pier and travel to the other side to Royal Victoria Dock.

title: 4 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
You enter via a porch into a central entrance hall that gives access to all rooms. Lovely wooden flooring runs through to a fantastic open plan reception space. This room has three distinct seating areas and enjoys triple aspect views through a bay window to the front, windows to the side and French doors out to the garden. This room also flows through to the dining area with another French door out to the garden, then onto the kitchen. The bespoke kitchen is made up of attractive wooden base units with a white stone work top and white gloss wall units. It is fully integrated with appliances and has a separate utility area and a door out to the side. Off the hall is a WC and a further reception room with parquet flooring that would make an ideal study or guest bedroom. An impressive floating staircase is a real feature to the living room and takes you up to the first floor where you will find three double bedrooms, one of which has an en-suite shower room and built in wardrobes, a further single bedroom and a shower room. The principle suite is at the end of the landing and boasts a stylish en-suite with a freestanding bath and a walk-in shower and has a separate dressing room with fitted wardrobes. Two sets of doors lead you out to from the main reception to a large, raised stone patio. Steps take you down to the beautiful landscaped garden, mainly laid to lawn with a stone path and surrounded by mature trees and shrubs. To the front is a stone drive and pretty front lawn.

Parkgate is a picturesque street on the prestigious Cator Estate. Blackheath Village with its array of shops, cafes, bars and restaurants is a short walk away. On the north side of the village is the open heath with Greenwich Park beyond. Blackheath station is ideal for commuters with regular services in to London Bridge, Charing Cross, Cannon Street and Victoria. One stop down the line will bring you to Lewisham where the DLR takes you to Canary Wharf and Bank. Local schools include the hugely popular and Ofsted Outstanding Brooklands Primary School, Heath House, Blackheath Preparatory School and The Pointers School.

Grade II listed: Utterly charming is the best way to describe this stunning four storey property, in excellent decorative order, located just yards from Royal Greenwich Park's Gate and the Queen's House.

This four bedroom house is located in a reserved road within the historic centre of Greenwich, moments from local amenities, bars and restaurants and excellent connections to Canary Wharf and the City.

The hall floor offers two double bedrooms, both with direct access to a modern shower room and access out onto a lovely secluded patio garden. On the lower level there is a very attractive contemporary and high gloss fitted kitchen alongside a generous dining room and guest WC. Upstairs comprises of a spacious double reception room, two further double bedrooms and modern family bathroom suite.

This is an exquisitely elegant family home and your earliest viewing is essential

detailedDescription:
**stamp duty paid for first time buyers**

**Less than 10 apartments remaining- Don’t miss out**

Fairview New Homes – Synergy

A brand new community of 1,2 and 3 bedroom apartments and 4 bedroom houses in Charlton



Plot 164

Plot 164 is a 758 sq ft two double bedroom apartment located in Charlton. Situated within walking distance of the High Street, residents enjoy the great amenities, such as M&S and Starbucks. It comes with a fully-fitted L shaped kitchen with integrated appliances and granite worktops and a master bedroom with en suite. It also features outside space in the form of a 78 sq ft balcony.

The Area

Discover another side to city living. One that offers you a vibrant, modern community alive with things to see and do, alongside convenient transport connections. Together with a sea of green open spaces where you can relax and unwind, as well as inspiring places steeped in history. At Synergy, no sacrifices have to be made.

Step outside Synergy and you’ll be greeted with a wonderful range of high-street shops, supermarkets, and larger stores. The area’s heritage also brings a wide selection of historic attractions close to home, from the National Maritime Museum and the Cutty Sark, to the Royal Observatory Greenwich.

Take your pick from over 50 parks and open spaces in the Royal Borough of Greenwich and you’ll soon forget about the stresses and strains of modern life. Pack a picnic, pound the paths, turn the pages, whatever helps you relax, there are so many beautiful places in the neighbourhood to visit.

Travel Options

Synergy’s excellent transport links bring everything you find great about central London within easy reach. Be it the galleries, museums, theatres, sports, restaurants or entertainment. Although you don’t have to travel far to enjoy a wealth of amenities. Close by is everything from supermarkets, cinemas and historic attractions, to eateries, bars and gyms. The choice is yours.

What’s more, all you love about Central London is within easy reach too; both Westcombe Park Overground (Zone 3) and Charlton Overground (Zone 3) are only about a 10-minute walk.

The City

Many believe that London is the most dynamic and cosmopolitan city in the world. It’s an opinion of course, but what is certainly true is that London is a melting pot with districts as diverse as Soho and Mayfair or Westminster and Chelsea. It has a history that dates back over 2,000 years and is a treasure trove of shops, restaurants, galleries, museums and theatres.

A city such as this harbours a great deal of talent and ambition both in the past and present time. This is evident in the architecture, the enduring societies and guilds and the many celebrated seats of learning. The pioneering spirit that made London the capital of the British Empire and its appetite for art, fashion, music, tradition and innovation continues to this day and will continue indefinitely.

It’s little wonder that more than 8 million people call London their home.

About Synergy

A tale of two cities

Choose Synergy and youll discover it to be the perfect balance between city life and natural surroundings. This large, unique development effortlessly blends contemporary urban design with beautiful green landscaping to create a welcoming, attractive and lively community feeling. A feeling that you will discover extends into the surrounding, sought-after area of Charlton. A new home here will give you everything you could possibly need.

All you love about London is there for the taking

Travelling around London couldnt be easier from our new homes in Charlton. Both Westcombe Park Overground (Zone 3) and Charlton Overground (Zone 3) are around a 10-minute walk away, giving you simple access to all the City has to offer.

However, you dont have to go far to enjoy a wealth of amenities. Close to home is a good choice of supermarkets and high street shops alongside independent and well-established restaurants and bars. And for those with children, youll find a range of Ofsted-rated Good and Outstanding schools for all ages nearby.

Escape to a whole new world

Close to Synergy is another world. A green, tranquil one where you can easily escape to for those moments when you want to relax. With more than 50 beautiful, leafy parks and open spaces to enjoy close to our collection of property for sale in south east London, youll find Synergy really is the best of both worlds.

  • All you need and want within easy reach Synergys great transport links bring galleries, museums, theatres, sports, restaurants and entertainment closer, but youre also never far from plenty of parks to relax in.
  • Effortless journeys, to whatever part of the capital Synergy is really well connected, meaning you can be at Canary Wharf in 26 minutes and London Bridge in 16 minutes. Travelling by car is equally as simple with the South Circular just a few minutes away.
  • And in a moment, the City is left behind you theres a sea of green open spaces in the local area where you can go to escape the stresses and strains of modern life.
  • Take a short walk or drive to school whether your children are younger or older, youll find a variety of Good and Outstanding Ofsted-rated schools close by.
  • Live in harmony everything about Synergy has been carefully considered, from the contemporary urban design to the beautiful natural landscaping.

detailedDescription:
Guide price £3,950,000- £4,250,000

“A rare opportunity to acquire this imposing Regency family home on one of the area’s finest roads complimented by a stunning parkland style garden”

Located in an excellent position only a short walk from the Village, the house sits back from the road with an ample gravelled, horseshoe drive providing good off-street parking as well as access to a double garage. The stunning South facing, garden extends to approximately 0.3 of an acre with an expansive paved terrace and extensive landscaped lawns and beautifully planted borders. Cleverly hidden from view is a well screened swimming pool with changing and shower facilities.

The house has been very well maintained by its current, longstanding owners and boasts a host of period features including period fireplaces, original ceiling cornice work and corbels, working shutters, original ceiling cornice work and corbels.

The main entrance is on the hall floor and opens onto a welcoming reception hall which in turn provides access to the two principle reception rooms, the rear of which offers lovely views over the stunning rear garden. Also on the hall floor level there is a spacious study, a rear room (currently used as a gym) and also a guest WC. On the garden floor there is a well fitted kitchen, a generous utility room, a walk-in store, a separated WC and access (via a door to the side) to the garage and garden.

On the first floor, off the spacious landing, there are three double bedrooms, a large, well-appointed family bathroom, a separated WC
and a further double bedroom on the mezzanine level. The attic level of the house is of good size and offers the potential to create two additional bedrooms along with ample eaves storage space.

At the rear of the house there is a stunning, parkland style, south facing garden which is beautifully landscaped with well stocked, mature planting complimented with the immaculate formal lawn. At the side of the house there is a 27’ x 16’ garage with a very useful equally sized first floor. The gravelled drive at the front of the house offers ample off street parking.

The property is well situated for London commuters with fast services from Blackheath Station to London Bridge, Cannon Street, Waterloo, Charing Cross and Victoria and DLR links to Canary Wharf and Bank one stop away at Lewisham. Blackheath Village with its restaurants, shops and station is 5 minutes’ walk away. The Heath and Greenwich Park are close by and shopping facilities at Bluewater and Canary Wharf are within easy reach.

Detailed Description

London apartments starting from £400,000.00

Off Plan development of stylish apartments situated in London. This is a fantastic investment opportunity, offering investors a return on investment per annum and excellent capital growth, the development also offers 2 bedroom apartments with stunning views.

An investment opportunity not to be missed - call our Sales/Investment team on for further information and to reserve an investment unit.

Nu: 1 Capital has a proven track record to provide a portfolio of investment properties to investors. We specialise in sourcing high income generating buy-to-let property investments. We offer a diverse range of property investments

We have residential properties and high yielding investments opportunities across the UK that include: Off Plan Residential, Off Plan btl - Life style & Care Homes - Hotels - Parking Spaces - Office Space - Blocks - Land and much more.

Why Invest In London?

Investing in London based property remains a great opportunity for international investors to benefit from the cities continued position as the worlds leading financial centre, a position backed up by its low tax regime for international buyers and its stable political, economic and legal systems.

Best European City for Business London has long been recognised as the leading European city for business as well as being a cultural and educational capital with large numbers of museums, theatres and other cultural attractions that brings visitors from around the world in their millions each year.

Investment - potential London based property continues to offer great potential due to the shortage in supply of new homes and an increasing demand for high-quality rental accommodation., a situation that shows no sign of improving any time soon, making investment in this sector hugely attractive.

London property (residential and commercial) is one of the largest and historically best performing in its asset class, providing excellent diversification benefits, particularly in a high-inflation economic environment.
We have residential properties and high yielding investments opportunities across the UK that include: Off Plan Residential, Off Plan btl - Life style & Care Homes - Hotels - Parking Spaces - Office Space - Blocks - Land and much more.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

address: Lower Mast House, Mast Quay, Woolwich SE18
detailedDescription:
Situated in a well sought after riverside development is this two bedroom apartment in Mast Quay

The property itself comprises a delightful open plan kitchen and living space, which from the private balcony space offers exemplary river views. Both of the sleeping suites are well sized, with the master offering a smart en-suite facility. Further benefits are the direct river facing windows offering an abundance of natural light. The family sized bathroom offers a sleek three piece unit, with shower over the bath.

Not only this, the property also has a 24 hour concierge service, a communal roof terrace facility and allocated off-street parking space. The Mast Quay development offers a tranquil setting with panoramic views of river Thames and views toward Canary Wharf and the City.

In terms of locality Woolwich Dockyard is just a six minute walk away and Woolwich Arsenal just 10 minutes from the property, with access to the DLR, Thameslink and Southeastern services. With the anticipated arrival of Crossrail direct access to Canary Wharf will take seven minutes and Liverpool Street in fourteen minutes.

This property would make for the ideal first time buyers home or investors opportunity.

The Property

EWS1 Compliant *** Chain Free***

Purplebricks are delighted to bring to market this immaculately presented, one bedroom apartment located in a sought after development.

There property briefly comprises of a large double bedroom with built-in wardrobes and a three piece modern bathroom suite.

Other features include ample storage, lift access, bike store, video entry system and concierge.

Within close proximity of the popular shopping amenities of Woolwich Town Centre offering a wide range supermarkets, shops, restaurants and bars. A short walk to Woolwich Arsenal for DLR, South-Eastern and Thameslink Lines easy connections into North Greenwich station for the Jubilee line.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

address: The Fulmar, 21 Reminder Lane, Lower Riverside, Greenwich Peninsula SE10
detailedDescription:
The perfect 1st time buyers' home, spacious, bright and airy and only a short walk to the River, Central Park and North Greenwich Underground (Jubilee Line). Located in the stunning Fulmar Building, just behind The Aperture with your residents gym and fitness studio, meeting rooms, business suite, Co-op supermarket and pan Asian restaurant.
The 538 square ft apartments' accommodation flows well from entry, with the reception room opening to a recessed fully fitted kitchen, a lovely decked balcony overlooking the gardens below, a double bedroom with fitted wardrobe cupboards and a smart bathroom. There is a useful utility cupboard for housing the washer/dryer, and storage. Underfloor heating completes this super home. The residents are very fortunate to have a stunning roof top terrace that spans the entire building with garden room, ample seating areas, and enjoys views across the River and to Canary Wharf.
Call us now to book your appointment to view.

detailedDescription:
John Payne are delighted to welcome to the market this stunning two bedroom apartment offered to the market with a share of freehold and chain free.

Internally the property has been upgraded by the current owner to comprises a bright and airy space. As you enter the property via your own private front door you are welcomed by a modern kitchen/reception room which offers ample living space and a fitted kitchen. You will find two bedrooms to the front off the property and a bathroom suite competes the apartment.

The property comes with a share of the freehold, private loft space and the property is listed chain free.

Locally you will find a good selection of transport links including both Westcombe Park and Charlton mainline station as well as frequent bus routes into Blackheath and Greenwich. For a weekend stroll you have both Greenwich Park, Charlton Park and the open heath at Blackheath.

For further information please contact our Blackheath Standard office today!

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
First phase of homes now fully reserved | New Phase launching autumn 2021

This brand new development of 1,2 & 3 Shared Ownership bedroom apartments situated along the River Thames is boasting parking and outside space for all homes. Residents will also benefit from 24 hour concierge service, landscaped gardens, a swimming pool, residents’ only gym, a games court, as well as outdoor children play area.. These high-specification properties are a short bus ride away from North Greenwich and Cutty Sark stations. Both serve fantastic access into Canary Wharf and The City – perfect for commuters.

Explore all Greenwich has to offer, take a walk along the River to popular areas like Greenwich Market & The Royal Observatory. Or if you fancy shopping, visit the newly opened icon outlet at the O2 in North Greenwich with a range of designer outlet stores, a short bus ride away from The River Gardens.

What is Shared Ownership?

Available to purchase through Shared Ownership, purchasers are able to buy as much of the property as they can afford, from 25 - 75%, paying a low cost rent on the remaining unpurchased 'share' of the home. What's more, your mortgage deposit is based on the value of the share you buy, not the full market value, making these high-spec homes even more affordable in such a sought after location.

Register your interest to be kept up to date with the progress of the Shared Ownership apartments at The River Gardens.

Offered to the market chain free is this two bedroom second floor apartment situated just off of Eltham High Street. Convenient for local shops, schools, bus routes and mainline station.

Eltham is a popular town in the Royal Borough of Greenwich, with £2 million being spent on a High Street revitalisation programme which include a new multi-screen cinema complex with restaurants and sky bar. There’s a mainline train station offering a direct route to London and the magnificent Art Deco Eltham Palace. The Heritage Restaurant & Bar at the Tudor Barn, a modern leisure centre, the Bob Hope Theatre and Well Hall Pleasaunce can all be found in the town.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
** long lease 118 years remaining **

New to the market and very rarely available is this stunning one double bedroom apartment which is located in a very attractive building which has bundles of character and history, the property is located on a popular road in Upper Abbey Wood.

The building was formerly a College and converted in 2008, the grounds are vast providing allocated parking for the apartment, visitors parking spaces, bike sheds and a large rear communal garden.

The property is also ideally located for local shops and transport including being within walking distance to Abbey Wood train station which will soon be the popular Crossrail.

Once you enter the property through the communal entrance hall you will be greeted by the spacious hallway, this gives access to the double bedroom, bathroom and the lounge/dining room which has great views, the kitchen is then off of the lounge/diner.

The property is great condition throughout which i'm sure will suit most tastes and therefore ready to move in to and has some great features too including high ceilings!

Externally as mentioned there is a large communal garden area which is to the rear of the building and provides a great bit of outside space to relax and to enjoy a BBQ for those summer evenings!

This certainly is a quirky property which i'm sure will get a lot of interest, so to not be disappointed call anthony martin now to arrange your viewing!

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Greens Property is delighted to present to the market this extremely spacious family home which is in immaculate condition throughout. The current owners have spent a lot of time, care and money in ensuring that this lovely home is ready for a family to move straight into.

An investor may also want to purchase this unusually spacious house, as it would make an ideal HMO.

Abbey Wood train station will soon have the new Elizabeth line opening which will offer hugely improved travel times for the commuter. Welling station is also within walking distance.

There are many open green spaces including Bostall Heath and Woods which is an area of 159 hectares of Woodland and also Lesnes Abbey Woods which is a unique green oasis 10 minutes walk from Abbey Wood station.

Call us now for further information or to arrange an appointment to view.

title: 4 bed end terrace house for sale

detailedDescription:
Purplebricks is delighted to present this stunning two double bedroom ground floor apartment which is in close proximity to Charlton Park. The property is in fantastic condition and will largely suit first-time buyers and professional couples.

The property comprises of a spacious entrance hallway leading to one of the double bedrooms, the recently refurbished family-sized bathroom and the master bedroom which has an exposed brick slip feature wall. This presents a modern feel to the home along with the large open plan kitchen/reception room which contains fully fitted units and appliances.

The living areas are light and airy and there is an abundance of built-in storage throughout the property.

The modern development contains well-managed grounds and this apartment benefits from access to the small communal garden area directly in front of the property. There is an allocated parking spaces for each flat.

They are great transport options nearby with Charlton station a short walk away providing excellent links into central London.

Visit the Purplebricks website directly to book your viewing 24 hours a day.

address: Cubitt Wharf, Storers Quay, London E14
detailedDescription:
Boasting nearly 1000 square feet of internal space is this truly special two bedroom on the second floor of a former warehouse believed to be from the Victorian era. It features the exposed brickwork walls that are synonymous with warehouse conversions and is a credit to its current owners who have superbly maintained and furnished the property. The spacious reception features ample space to dine and relax, and there are patio doors leading to a large balcony with spectacular and wide ranging viewings of the River Thames. The master bedroom benefits from abundant storage and a large en suite shower room, whilst the second bedroom has ample space for double bed and desk. Additional benefits include a separate kitchen, storage to the hallway and a secure, gated parking space, whilst there is also a lift to the development.

Cubitt Wharf is superbly located on the banks of the Thames towards the South East of E14 with each reach of all that the local area has to offer. The financial centre of Canary Wharf is easy accessible, as is the extensive shopping of Canary Wharf and a host of local shops and restaurants. The open spaces of Mudchute Farm and Island Gardens are a short walk away, with Docklands Sailing and Watersports Centre just slightly further afield. Nearby Island Gardens DLR facilitates fast and frequent access to key locations such as the City of London, Canary Wharf and historic Greenwich, whist car users will benefit from close proximity to the A13, A406 and Blackwall Tunnel.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
"A well presented and spacious four storey, four bedroom period house, close to the ever popular Halstow primary school.

We have loved living in Greenwich for the past 12 years and we will be sad to say goodbye to our amazing neighbours and friends. We moved into this property to start our family and enjoy the beautiful Greenwich park. We have watched the area flourish and have filled our family home with wonderful memories.

We have excellent transport links supplemented by nearby Westcombe park train station which is a 5 minute walk. This provides direct links to London Bridge (in 12 minutes) and direct trains to Cannon Street, Blackfriars and St Pancras which make for a speedy commute. With both Greenwich town centre, and nearby Blackheath on our doorstep we have been able to enjoy all the amenities and beauty of Greenwich.

This is a wonderful area and I know this will be a fabulous family home for someone else as it has been for us."

What The Agent Says -

Offering versatile accommodation to suit most growing families, this wonderful home is currently arranged as follows: Bedroom with en suite bathroom to the top floor, two further bedrooms, one with en suite to the first floor, fourth bedroom, reception room and bathroom on the raised ground floor and finally a lovely open plan family room and kitchen on the garden floor where from here you can access the sunny tiered rear garden.

Location wise it really couldn't be better; Westcombe Park mainline station is at the top of the road providing access to London Bridge and Cannon Street, North Greenwich Jubilee line tube station is a short walk away, and the little know parkland of Greenwich Pleasaunce is around the corner.

All in all this is a beautiful Victorian family house with no forward chain and early viewings are highly recommended.<br /><br />

Situated within the highly sought after Blackheath Quarter of Kidbrooke Village is this impressive and large three bedroom, two bathroom corner apartment with parking.

Found on the fifth floor the property is in good decorative order throughout with floor to ceiling, dual aspect double glazed windows, wood flooring and under floor heating.

The accommodation briefly comprises a very large entrance hall with storage and utility cupboards and a superb 21'8x16'10 open plan lounge diner with an attractive modern kitchen with integrated appliances. The large master bedroom boasts a luxury modern ensuite bathroom and dressing area with extensive built in wardrobes, there are two further double bedrooms and a modern shower room.

The living room allows access onto the large, wrap around corner balcony and there is also a second balcony via the master bedroom. There is also a large, and rarely seen in Kidbrooke Village, terrace area for which the apartment has exclusive access, and the flat boasts 180 degree panoramic views over leafy South London.

The property also has the benefit of a secure underground car parking and access to an on-site concierge service, gym, swimming pool and business centre.

This property is a wonderful apartment and your immediate viewing is highly recommended. Virtual tours can be seen at

Wallace court is located in the prestigious Blackheath Quarter of the modern Kidbrooke Village – an award winning Berkeley Homes development. This is a completely new and vibrant London community offering an outstanding choice of quality, sustainable new homes.

As well as new homes, it will offer new parks, sports facilities, shops, bars & restaurants, schools, healthcare and community facilities.

Transport links to central London are very close via Kidbrooke station with regular trains to London Bridge (16 minutes), Waterloo East (22 minutes), Charing Cross (26 minutes), Cannon Street (25 minutes) and Victoria (31 minutes). detailedDescription:
Superb three bedroom riverfront apartment in Norton House, part of the impressive and popular Royal Arsenal Riverside. This 6th floor apartment offers panoramic views of the river, with two large private balconies. The apartment comprises a spacious open plan living and dining room with fitted kitchen featuring integrated top of the range appliances, sleek contemporary fixtures and fittings, with three good sized three double bedrooms, one en suite with a large built in wardrobe and a guest bathroom. Residents benefit from an on site concierge and an exclusive Waterside Club with pool, jacuzzi, spa, gym and a private cinema room.
The Royal Arsenal Riverside development has on site pubs and restaurants, doctor and a dentist office, pharmacy, M&S Foodhall, Tesco Express and a Sainsbury's Local.

Greenwich Peninsula is a vibrant community offering a large variety of activities within short walking distance.'The O2' provides access to world class events, as well as offering a large selection of venues for food and drink. The 'icon Outlet' offers many designer stores, including Kurt Geiger, Hobbs, Nike, and Calvin Klein. Several large supermarkets (Sainsbury's, asda, Aldi, Lidl) are within a short walk on the Thames Path; the estate also houses an Ikea and B&Q. A local Co-op and Tesco are a few minutes walk of the flat.

Further afield, Greenwich Park and market are reachable via a short walk or cycle along the Thames Path. Away from the buzz, Blackheath provides a village feel with artisan bakeries, farmer's market, and shops.

North Greenwich Underground Station, within 0.4 miles offers car free pedestrian access to the underground and bus services.Your journey into central London couldn’t be easier, with 10 minutes journey time to London Bridge on the Jubilee Line. A 2 minute underground journey to Canary Wharf provides access to further shops as well as access to the DLR and, in the future, Crossrail.

The Thames Clipper offers a boat service into the City with various stops.

Access to North London is provided by the Blackwall Tunnel which is within 0.5 miles.

You will require a deposit to obtain a mortgage for this property

To meet the requirements for this property we require as a guideline, a minimum household income of £70,130 If you are offered the property, your ability to afford this property will be assessed at your financial interview. Please note that applicants should purchase the maximum share that they can afford and sustain.

Only applicants who are registered with London and Quadrant will be eligible to be offered a property in one of our schemes. Please visit our website to register. Please ensure to keep a record of your unique registration number.

Your home is at risk if you fail to keep up repayments on a mortgage, rent or other loan secured on it. Please make sure you can afford the repayments before you take out a mortgage.

These particulars are of opinion only, are intended to give a fair description and do not form the basis of a contract. The descriptions and all other information are believed to be correct as of June 2021.

detailedDescription:
2 bed apartments in Lewisham starting from £435,000

In partnership with Knight Frank, we’re delighted to offer the final collection of apartments at Arden, SE10. Lying at the southern point of the landscaping and gardens of Parkside, Arden will provide a selection of tranquil homes whilst surrounded by nature and boasting magnificent views of the capital.

Combining the historic charm of Greenwich, with open spaces of Blackheath and the energy of Lewisham, Arden is a place to call home in the heart of a growing neighbourhood. This stylish development of thoughtfully designed homes will boast modern interiors and high quality finishes throughout.

Arden integrates home life, work and wellness under one roof as residents can benefit from the generous amenities available at this stunning development. Experience a concierge service, co-working hub, the exclusive snug room which is a great place to unwind and enjoy. Encouraging a sense of wellness and wellbeing, Arden residents have access to a comprehensive fitness suite which includes a free weights room, spinning and yoga studios with a complimentary water station.

Help To Buy launching at Arden in Autumn 2021

detailedDescription:
Guide Price £600,000-£620,000. With a 75ft garden and superb potential to extend and enhance, is this spacious three bedroom semi-detached 1930's home in this popular location very close to Kidbrooke mainline station and sold chain free.

The property is in need of modernisation throughout although does benefit from gas fired central heating and double glazed windows.

The accommodation briefly comprises; entrance hall with understairs storage, downstaris WC and double doors to a good size front reception room, spacious rear reception room with patio doors to garden, kitchen and a lean too to the rear. Upstairs are two large double bedrooms, both with built in wardrobes, generous single bedroom, bathroom with separate shower and bath and a separate WC. To the rear is a 75ft ft garden with lawn, mature shrubs and two sheds. There with a garage to the side with both front and rear access and off street parking to the front.

Many neighbouring properties have had significant extensions and loft conversions. Any interest parties should satisfy themselves to any relevant planning consents.

This is a great family home with excellent potential and viewing is strongly recommended. There is no chain. Video tour can be seen at

Broad Walk is a popular residential road conveniently located just 540 metres from Kidbrooke Mainline station, (rebuilt in 2021) and is just 17 minutes to London Bridge with trains also running to Charing Cross, Victoria and Cannon Street. The property is located just 800 metres from the new and prestigious Kidbrooke Village and 1.1 miles to Blackheath Village (one stop on train) with its array of boutique shops, bars and restaurants. There are many parks and green open spaces to enjoy, including Hornfair Park (with the Charlton Lido, cafe, tennis courts and bmx track within its bounds), Charlton House (gardens, play area and skate park), Oxleas Woods, Shrewsbury Park, Blackheath Common and Greenwich Park.

detailedDescription:
Virtual viewing available
Unveiled to the SE18 market is this fantastic, recently renovated three bedroom Victorian property with garden, positioned in one of South East London's up and coming locations.

Internally this bright and airy maisonette comprises of a lounge with bay window, a further dining room, separate fitted kitchen, three piece bathroom suite and additional WC. Upstairs, you will find three double bedrooms, additional storage and loft access.

Additional benefits include gas central heating with smart thermostat, newly fitted double glazed windows, a 42ft shared rear garden and no onward chain.

This spacious property is located within close proximity to the amenities of both Plumstead High Street and Woolwich town centre which offer a wide range of supermarkets, shops, restaurants and cafes. The vast greens of Plumstead Common and Bostall Woods are a short stroll away, as is the newly renovated Plumstead Library and recently opened Plumstead Leisure Centre.

For the busy commuter, you are spoilt for choice with the transport facilities of Plumstead Rail Station getting you to London Bridge & Charing Cross in 25 minutes, and Woolwich Arsenal DLR providing easy access into Canary Wharf and Bank. The arrival of the nearby Crossrail will also be a welcomed addition at the beginning of 2022.

title: 3 bed maisonette for sale

detailedDescription:
Chain free! John Payne are delighted to bring to the market this substantial, immaculately presented, four storey, four bedroom, two bathroom, Georgian family home located in West Greenwich.

This beautiful property offers over 2,200 square feet of accommodation, it has been refurbished throughout by its current owners but retaining many of its original period features including stripped floorboards, sash windows, exposed brickwork, feature fireplaces and corniced ceilings.

To the lower ground floor you will find a beautiful open plan family area comprising a living area, dining area, fully integrated kitchen with island, walk in larder, separate utility space and separate WC.

On the ground floor you will find a large hallway leading onto a grand, dual aspect through reception room featuring a wealth of period features and a separate WC.

To the first floor there is a beautiful master suite, a large master bedroom with a bespoke fitted walk in wardrobe and four piece bathroom with his and hers sinks. On the second floor you will find a further three double bedrooms and a modern newly fitted shower room.

Externally to the rear and accessed from the lower ground floor and ground floor there is access to a private 77 foot garden which has patio, lawned and decked areas and benefits from tonnes of sunlight.

Further benefits include; additional storage in the loft & in the vaults at the front of the house, secondary glazing at the front of the property and air conditioning in the front two bedrooms.

Residents permit parking available on surrounding residential streets.

The property is well located in West Greenwich on the edge of the popular Ashburnham Triangle. Deptford Bridge DLR is moments away and Greenwich mainline rail, along with the town centre is just a short walk. All local amenities are within a short walk which include Greenwich Park and Observatory, Blackheath Village, Deptford Bridge and Greenwich DLR stations for easy access to Canary Wharf, Greenwich mainline station, historic village and Royal Park, including regular bus routes to the West End and Central London.

A viewing is highly recommended to appreciate the full beauty of this Georgian property, contact us now to reserve your slot.

Energy Efficiency Rating D.

detailedDescription:
A charming Victorian ground floor conversion property sitting on the slopes of Shooter’s Hill with views across London from the sitting room. Built-in 1890, this home exudes character both inside and out and is decorated to a high standard, meaning a new buyer could move straight in without doing any work if so desired. The building is set back slightly from the road with a hedge-lined front garden, ensuring privacy from the street and a leafy outlook from the front room.

The property comprises of: A hallway, including two large cupboards providing ample storage space; an inviting lounge-diner with room for a large dining table; a separate kitchen with white goods and induction hob; a generous bathroom with both a free-standing bath and a separate shower unit and a good-sized double bedroom. Moreover, the residence benefits from a private front door and a quarter share of the garden (the plot closest to the building, which could be fenced off should the owner wish) in addition to the patio area which the ground floor property has sole use of. The local area is a perfect balance between city and suburban life - a 0.7-mile walk from the beautiful Oxleas Woods and surrounding Green Chain Walk network yet only a mile away from the shops, pubs, and restaurants of both Woolwich town centre and Royal Arsenal Riverside, as well as Woolwich Arsenal DLR and Rail stations and the imminent Crossrail (Elizabeth line).

detailedDescription:
You enter into a spacious hall with the original exposed floor boards that run through to the two main reception rooms. Both reception rooms are over 20ft long with large bay windows and original fireplaces. Across the hall is a great study and the kitchen diner. The shaker style kitchen is made up of light coloured units with a contrasting stone work top. Bi-folding doors lead to out to a raised patio. There is a shower room off the hall and stairs down to a handy basement.

On the first floor are four bedrooms and a fantastic family bathroom with a freestanding bath and separate walk-in shower. The top floor has been opened up into one large bedroom with a living area. There is also a small kitchen and ample eaves storage so would make an ideal space for an Au pair. The stunning west facing garden is over 100ft in length and is mainly laid to lawn with a raised patio out from the house. The whole garden is surrounded by an array of mature trees and shrubs. To the front is a black paved drive and a handy garage that is used as storage.

Beaconsfield Road runs through the middle of the ever popular Westcombe Park Conservation Area. The house is conveniently located for access to various local amenities, only a short walk away from Westcombe Park station. Blackheath Standard and Greenwich Royal Park are both within easy reach. At Blackheath Standard you will find a Marks & Spencer Food Hall amongst a variety of independent shops and cafés. A stroll through Greenwich Royal Park will bring you into Greenwich town centre and transport to the City by road, rail or riverboat. Finally, Westcombe Park train station provides regular services into London Bridge and Cannon Street.

We are pleased to present this fantastic opportunity to acquire off-plan townhouse in Kidbrooke Village by Berkley Homes. The townhouse is due to complete by Q2 - 2021. The townhouse offers large private front patio, large open plan kitchen with a guest toilet, two spacious bedrooms on the first floor with master ensuite, large storage space, spacious bedroom on second floor with an access to private terrace and winter garden. Winter garden is being transferred into a study room which will benefit with heating, lights, sockets and flooring.

This is a great buy to live opportunity at the heart of The Village Centre and bordering the stunning Cator Park, with great local amenities, beautiful surroundings and quick links to the Capital, Centrum Court is a place to connect. detailedDescription:
Internal viewing is the only way of appreciating this stunning period conversion which has been tastefully refurbished throughout.

Location

Blackheath Village offers an array of bars, restaurants, boutique shops and mainline station. Trains from Blackheath to London Bridge take 10 minutes, and 25 minutes to Victoria. The heath is only 0.4 miles and Greenwich Park is within close proximity.

All times and distances are approximate.

Description

Set in this highly desirable tree lined road, is this fabulous period conversion which offers approximately 979 sq ft of well proportioned living accommodation. Internally the property retains all the original charm and character, boasting high ceilings, detailed cornicing and feature fireplaces, yet the owners have tastefully restored and upgraded the interiors to create this wonderful home, which needs to be seen to be appreciated.

Internally, there is a generous entrance hallway, a fantastic reception room which is flooded with natural light, which opens directly into a quality fitted kitchen which houses a range of high end appliances. Additionally there are two spacious double bedrooms, a luxurious re-fitted shower room, and there is direct access into a well maintained rear garden which provides access into a private garage.

Square Footage: 979 sq ft
