detailedDescription:
"The flat is convenience and luxury rolled into one! We also loved the river - being so close to the water for long river walks is something we will miss."

What The Seller Says -

"Most weekends we've never had to go far from home; there’s an amazing pub onsite as well as a gym, so it ticked all the weekend boxes.

Also, the Concierge staff are always helpful with day to day queries, and great for collecting our online spending sprees."

What The Agent Says -

This modern apartment deserves an internal viewing in order to truly appreciate its key features.

Located on the 5th floor of this recently built development, residents have the benefit of a 24 hour onsite concierge and residents gym.

The interior comprises two double bedrooms, the main bedroom benefiting from an en-suite bathroom and private balcony, main family bathroom suite with shower and fitted cabinets, a fully fitted open plan kitchen including integrated appliances (cooker, fridge freezer, dishwasher and microwave) and a spacious lounge diner offering direct access to another internal facing balcony.

Added benefits include a utility/storage cupboard housing washer dryer, wood flooring, underfloor heating, a MegaFlo system, video entry system and comes with a secure allocated underground parking space.

North Greenwich tube station (Jubilee line) is just under a mile away, transporting commuters directly into popular destinations such as Canary Wharf and London Bridge to name a few. The O2 centre is located next to the station and here you will find a wide range of shops restaurants and bars.<br /><br />

Caledonian Point is a one-bed, sixth floor apartment with balcony and an approximate size of 51 m2 in an eight storeys apartment block of similar flats, constructed in 2016. The time remaining on the lease is 120 years.

There are good transport links with Greenwich Station less than three minutes away.

A great selection of amenities are located within a 5 minute walk. A range of shops, fine bars and restaurants are located within close proximity of the property. For leisure, Greenwich Park is in walking distance.


  • Nearest Station: Greenwich Station


The property located on the sixth floor comprises:


  • Entrance: Hallway with large storage cupboards and entry phone system.
  • Living Room: Generous living area with lots of natural light, floor to ceiling windows and glass door to balcony. Engineered oak flooring.
  • Kitchen: Open plan kitchen with white wall units, grey worktop and a modern, white metro-tiled back splash. Integrated stainless steel oven, hob, dishwasher and fridge/freezer. Engineered oak flooring.
  • Bedroom One: Double bedroom with fitted wardrobe. Cream carpeted flooring.
  • Bathroom: White suite comprising panelled bath with shower over, WC, hand washbasin with shelving and large mirror over. Heated towel rail. Tiled flooring.
  • Outside: Private balcony and secured cycle storage


What happens after I register my interest?

After registering your interest for a Peabody home, you will receive an email confirmation from us. The email will confirm what you need to do next to secure a property viewing which includes completing a financial assessment with a mortgage advisor and completing the Shared Ownership Application Form.

If you don’t receive this email within an hour of your registration, please check your spam or junk folders and set your spam filter to allow incoming emails from Peabody. If you still haven’t received the email after checking here, please contact and our team will be able to help you.

John Payne are delighted to welcome to the market this stunning one bedroom garden apartment set within 'The Academy', a secure gated development with concierge services, and residents gym.

Internally the property comprises a spacious living room with direct access to a private rear garden, a fitted kitchen, a modern bathroom suite and a well proportioned double bedroom.

This superb apartment is found within 'The Academy' development which is steeped in military history. Each apartment has been meticulously crafted to retain as many period features as possible whilst offering luxurious and modern living. Surrounded by beautiful communal grounds, in a tranquil setting on the cusp of Woolwich Common. The development offers superb transport links, including nearby DLR and Tube routes; with access to London City Airport in 5 minutes, Canary Wharf in 17 minutes, and soon to be completed Crossrail will reduce travel times across London.

Further benefits include allocated parking and the property being offered to the market 'chain free'.

To avoid missing out please contact our Blackheath Standard team today.

detailedDescription:
**stamp duty paid for first time buyers**

**Less than 10 apartments remaining- Don’t miss out**

Plot 161

Plot 161 is anintelligently designed one bedroom apartment located in Charlton. It comes with a fully-fitted U shaped kitchen with integrated appliances and granite worktops. It also features outside space in the form of a 56 sq ft balcony.

Dimensions

Kitchen/Living/Dining

9.26m x 3.15m

Master Bedroom

3.53m x 3.48m

Total Area

53.8 sq m

The Area

Discover another side to city living. One that offers you a vibrant, modern community alive with things to see and do, alongside convenient transport connections. Together with a sea of green open spaces where you can relax and unwind, as well as inspiring places steeped in history. At Synergy, no sacrifices have to be made.

Step outside Synergy and you’ll be greeted with a wonderful range of high-street shops, supermarkets, and larger stores. The area’s heritage also brings a wide selection of historic attractions close to home, from the National Maritime Museum and the Cutty Sark, to the Royal Observatory Greenwich.

Take your pick from over 50 parks and open spaces in the Royal Borough of Greenwich and you’ll soon forget about the stresses and strains of modern life. Pack a picnic, pound the paths, turn the pages, whatever helps you relax, there are so many beautiful places in the neighbourhood to visit.

Travel Options

Synergy’s excellent transport links bring everything you find great about central London within easy reach. Be it the galleries, museums, theatres, sports, restaurants or entertainment. Although you don’t have to travel far to enjoy a wealth of amenities. Close by is everything from supermarkets, cinemas and historic attractions, to eateries, bars and gyms. The choice is yours.

What’s more, all you love about Central London is within easy reach too; both Westcombe Park Overground (Zone 3) and Charlton Overground (Zone 3) are only about a 10-minute walk.

The City

Many believe that London is the most dynamic and cosmopolitan city in the world. It’s an opinion of course, but what is certainly true is that London is a melting pot with districts as diverse as Soho and Mayfair or Westminster and Chelsea. It has a history that dates back over 2,000 years and is a treasure trove of shops, restaurants, galleries, museums and theatres.

A city such as this harbours a great deal of talent and ambition both in the past and present time. This is evident in the architecture, the enduring societies and guilds and the many celebrated seats of learning. The pioneering spirit that made London the capital of the British Empire and its appetite for art, fashion, music, tradition and innovation continues to this day and will continue indefinitely.

It’s little wonder that more than 8 million people call London their home.

Computer generated images depict the interior and exterior at Synergy and are indicative only. *Travel times sourced from TfL and Google Maps. Your home may be repossessed if you do not keep up repayments on your mortgage or any other debt secured on it. *Terms and conditions apply, please refer to the Fairview New Homes website for full details. Please ask your Sales Executive for details. Details and prices are correct as of October 2020.

Specification

General
  • Amtico sun-bleached oak flooring throughout (except to bedrooms, bathrooms and ensuites)
  • Hanging light pendant to lounge, dining area, hallways and bedrooms
  • TV/FM/Sat/Telephone socket to lounge
  • Video entry phone to hallway
  • Polished chrome/satin ironmongery throughout
  • Thermostatically controlled radiators
Kitchen
  • White high gloss handleless wall and base units
  • Soft close doors and drawers
  • Black granite worktops with drainer grooves for sink area
  • Stainless steel undermount sink with single lever mixer tap
  • Zanussi stainless steel built-in electric oven
  • Zanussi black induction hob
  • Smeg integrated cooker hood
  • Integrated Zanussi appliances including fridge/freezer, washer/dryer, dishwasher and microwave
  • Brushed aluminium downlights with ‘white light’ LED bulbs
  • Undercounter lighting
Bedrooms
  • TV socket
  • Secondary telephone socket to master bedroom
  • Grey carpet
  • Walls and ceilings decorated in matt emulsion with gloss white woodwork
Bathrooms
  • White sanitaryware by Ideal Standard
  • White water-saving bath
  • Chrome single-lever mixer tap to bath and basin
  • Thermostatic shower
  • Shower screen by Ideal Standard
  • Future Stone white porcelain tiles to wall and floor
  • Chrome downlights with ‘white light’ LED bulbs
  • Chrome heated towel rail
  • Shaver point
About Synergy

A tale of two cities

Choose Synergy and youll discover it to be the perfect balance between city life and natural surroundings. This large, unique development effortlessly blends contemporary urban design with beautiful green landscaping to create a welcoming, attractive and lively community feeling. A feeling that you will discover extends into the surrounding, sought-after area of Charlton. A new home here will give you everything you could possibly need.

All you love about London is there for the taking

Travelling around London couldnt be easier from our new homes in Charlton. Both Westcombe Park Overground (Zone 3) and Charlton Overground (Zone 3) are around a 10-minute walk away, giving you simple access to all the City has to offer.

However, you dont have to go far to enjoy a wealth of amenities. Close to home is a good choice of supermarkets and high street shops alongside independent and well-established restaurants and bars. And for those with children, youll find a range of Ofsted-rated Good and Outstanding schools for all ages nearby.

Escape to a whole new world

Close to Synergy is another world. A green, tranquil one where you can easily escape to for those moments when you want to relax. With more than 50 beautiful, leafy parks and open spaces to enjoy close to our collection of property for sale in south east London, youll find Synergy really is the best of both worlds.

  • All you need and want within easy reach Synergys great transport links bring galleries, museums, theatres, sports, restaurants and entertainment closer, but youre also never far from plenty of parks to relax in.
  • Effortless journeys, to whatever part of the capital Synergy is really well connected, meaning you can be at Canary Wharf in 26 minutes and London Bridge in 16 minutes. Travelling by car is equally as simple with the South Circular just a few minutes away.
  • And in a moment, the City is left behind you theres a sea of green open spaces in the local area where you can go to escape the stresses and strains of modern life.
  • Take a short walk or drive to school whether your children are younger or older, youll find a variety of Good and Outstanding Ofsted-rated schools close by.
  • Live in harmony everything about Synergy has been carefully considered, from the contemporary urban design to the beautiful natural landscaping.

detailedDescription:
A beautifully presented bright and airy top floor one bedroom apartment with a north east facing full length balcony situated within the renowned Royal Arsenal Riverside development.

Situated within the gated Royal Carriage Mews and comprising an open plan modern kitchen with integrated appliances and bright reception room with space for dining and direct access to the private balcony, the sizeable double bedroom also has direct access. The bathroom is bright and modern with tiling throughout. Further features include dark wood flooring throughout with carpets to the bedroom, large amounts of storage space in the hall.

West Carriage House is a highly sought after block within the development and is ideally situated for access to the popular amenities of the Royal Arsenal coffee shops, restaurants, bars and warm community. Further benefits include 24 hour concierge and on site gym. This riverside apartment is an ideal first home or investment and having been lovingly looked after by the current owner is ready to move into.

Transport links are plentiful with Woolwich Arsenal DLR/br station (0.2 miles), Woolwich Dockyard (0.9 miles), Woolwich Thames Clipper and Woolwich Ferry South Pier are also under 0.5 miles. The Cross Rail due to complete in early 2022 will also be a stone’s throw away.

Service Charge £1,725.92 pa
Ground Rent £300 pa

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This beautifully modern one-bedroom apartment is an absolute delight! On the second floor, enter the property through the wood grain panelled door and the apartment is bright and inviting. Nestled within the well planned Kidbrooke Village development, is our stunning apartment, where consideration for beauty and sustainable development go hand in hand.

As you enter immediately to your right is the spacious, classy bathroom; truly modern with contemporary tiles, wall mounted seamless W/C, shower and bath. The bedroom is well sized, with large wall to wall built in, fitted storage, complete with sliding doors. The feature windows run from ceiling to floor and has a door which opens onto a Juliet balcony. The lounge is spacious and opens out onto a balcony. The kitchen and lounge are open planned, and the kitchen is crisp and modern with fitted oven, hob, and fridge-freezer.

Property suitable for an investor 5% yield, available with tenant in-situ or with for a first time buyer with vacant possession

Kidbrooke Village has a peaceful and serene ambiance, built within parkland and serviced by planned recreation and leisure amenities; including a residents only gym, a swimming pool, a movie room, as well as 24-hour concierge and a Zipcar car share club. Conveniently a new Sainsbury's Local is now open.

Trains leave from Kidbrooke station for London Bridge, Waterloo East, Charing Cross and Victoria, connecting with the London Underground at these mainline Stations. Trains also connect to Lewisham providing links to the DLR to Greenwich, Canary Wharf and Stratford.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

address: No. 5, 2 Cutter Lane, Upper Riverside, Greenwich Peninsula SE10
detailedDescription:
A stunning 3rd floor family home providing some really well planned accommodation for the perfect family flow. A high level of specification and all the modern luxuries of a new-build home. Having floor to ceiling windows with amazing river views throughout, they provide that outdoor connection, so much more sought after in the current situation. The open plan kitchen, dining, living space and decked balcony all make for sociable, spacious living.
A 3 bedroom home fitted with integrated kitchen appliances, underfloor heating and an individual intercom system; meaning that your 24-hour concierge service is easily available, there is ample desk space available for those working from home too.
Located in Upper Riverside, one of five buildings designed by som, of Burj Khalifa fame, and each having its own interior designer. Knight Dragon having created the fantastic interior of Building 5, with colours, textures and natural palettes influenced by the ever changing river. These stunning buildings provide exclusive living with your own Upper Riverside Club, giving you access to a 15th Renew floor given over entirely to your well-being, with 20m pool and spa pool, steam room, two well equipped gyms, private dining room, business suite, cinemas and roof top terraces. A 24 hour concierge team is on hand to assist you in any way they can and you are surrounded by landscaped gardens.
Nb: Photographs and Virtual tour are of a similar unit on a higher floor

title: 3 bed property for sale

address: No.5, 2 Cutter Lane, Upper Riverside, Greenwich Peninsula SE10
detailedDescription:
This lovely 2 bedroom home with private decked balcony with views over the landscaped gardens has floor to ceiling windows, providing an abundance of natural light. From the engineered wood flooring with underfloor heating, to the smart fitted kitchen and bathrooms, this apartment offers quality and style throughout. There are 2 generous double bedrooms, both with fitted wardrobes, the master bedroom having a stunning ensuite, there is ample space for a desk for those who would prefer working from home in either bedroom or the reception room. The interior was designed by Knight Dragon, inspired by the river, the rich palette reflects the natural materials found on the water's edge. Stained oak engineered wood floor with underfloor heating, complements the kitchen cabinetry and there are two very smart bathrooms with porcelain wall and floor tiling.
Upper Riverside comprises a family of five light filled, glass and stone towers, with roof gardens cascading to the edge of the Thames, occupies one of the best riverside locations in London.
The gardens connected to the riverfront will have some fantastic restaurants, river cafes, retail outlets and lively public spaces, including London's first linear park, 'The Tide'. Upper Riverside neighbourhood links to Peninsula Square with access to North Greenwich Underground (Jubilee Line), 2 Mins to Canary Wharf and 8 Mins to London Bridge! The O2, with it's numerous international restaurants, Icon Designer outlet and buzzy social areas, and the soon to be completed Design District, are all within a few minutes walk of your home.

detailedDescription:
The Property

*** Coming Soon ***

Puprlebricks are delighted to bring to market this four bedroom mid terrace family home conveniently located for Woolwich Arsenal, mainline station and forthcoming Crossrail.

The property offers excellent potential to put your own stamp on and early viewings are highly recommended.

Plumstead and Woolwich are part of South East London’s big reinvention, with Woolwich town centre unrecognisable compared to 20 years ago. Already home to an excellent mainline rail service and the DLR, Woolwich’s Crossrail station is well underway. Together with the redevelopment of the Royal Arsenal, Woolwich is emerging as a new urban centre. Plumstead offers an altogether greener setting, with the vast commons and Oxleas Wood providing a perfect backdrop to some stunning period properties.

detailedDescription:
Internally the property offers over 900 square feet of accommodation comprising a spacious open-plan reception room, fitted kitchen and a modern bathroom suite. There are separate stairs to the bedrooms located on the top floor, one with an en suite shower and the second bedroom a spacious open-plan 'gallery' style room.

Within a gated courtyard steeped in history you are within easy reach of both Woolwich Arsenal train station and DLR. The property is also just moments away from Thames Clipper riverboat service and the new Crossrail station which is due to open early next year.

Additional benefits include gas central heating with cast iron radiators adding to the charm plus original sash windows and exposed brick walls. Other features include secure allocated parking, 24 hour concierge service and residents gym.

The immediate area offers picturesque walks along the river and green spaces including Wellington Park. The excellent amenities within the development itself creates a unique village atmosphere and a real sense of community.

Ground Rent: £200 pa

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
*****25% shared ownership property*****

***** full market value £340,000*****

Viewers are required to have a Financial Assessment prior to viewing. Visit tmp Mortgages. To register your details.

1 Bed Flat for Sale, Trinity Walk, Woolwich

A unique opportunity to purchase a 5th floor south-west facing 1-bedroom flat in the Trinity Walk Woolwich development. Completed in September 2017, this flat has been kept in great condition and is reluctantly offered to the market, chain-free, in fantastic condition.

Upon entry via a secure double entry door system and lift, the flat opens into a short hallway, offering three good sized washing machine utility and storage rooms. Ahead on the left lies the master bedroom, with plenty of space for a large king size bed, wardrobes, drawers and desk. To the right of the hallway is a generously sized bathroom, featuring both a shower and bathtub, sink, toilet, heated towel rail and a large 1.4m x 0.9m wall mirror, and stylish tiling throughout.

Between these two rooms is a very spacious and light-filled kitchen/living space, featuring a fully integrated kitchen and ample amounts of space for your sofa, TV and dining table. As the flat sits on the second to top floor (5th), the entire room benefits from large south-west facing windows and balcony, catching the sun all afternoon and into the evening, with space for balcony furniture and many months of summertime relaxation.

The flat in general is very well insulated from both heat loss and sound. There is also a flat-wide ventilation system which provides each room with a continuous supply of fresh air when doors and windows are closed for extended periods.

Location

This well appointed flat is located in Woolwich, SE18 - a short 5 minute walk to the DLR and National Rail station, Tescos and the Town Square, which features some quirky historic pubs and restaurants. A further few minutes walk and you can find a variety of local amenities such as Woolwich High Street, Post Office, gp, a well-equipped Better Gym (+ pool) and various other supermarkets. Head towards the river, and you’ll find Royal Arsenal Riverside, boasting beautiful riverside walks, cycle routes, markets, restaurants, brunch cafes, bakeries and other useful amenities.

Heading in the other direction, a 5 minute walk will have you stood in the middle of a beautiful open expanse of green space, Barrack Field, which faces the historic Woolwich Barracks. Further on allows access to Woolwich Common, Shooters Hill Golf Club and the stunning Oxleas Woods.

It also has great transport links, with regular services via DLR, National Rail trains and the eventual Crossrail Link, taking you from the station to:

DLR:
London City Airport - 5 minutes
Bank - 27 minutes (with Jubilee links)
Stratford - 23 minutes (with Central Line, District / H&C and Jubilee links)

National Rail:
London Bridge - 21 minutes (via Greenwich, continuing towards Farringdon, Kings Cross and Luton)

Crossrail:
Canary Wharf - 8 minutes
Farringdon - 17 minutes
Paddington - 26 minutes
Heathrow - 56 minutes

Lease Information

Rent (25% share): £587.56pm

Service charge: £103.51pm

Council tax: £103pm

Water (approx.): £10pm

Electricity (approx): £25pm

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This unique three bedroom Victorian house has been beautifully renovated by the current owners to create a stylish and modern home while still retaining much of its period charm. Positioned on the park end of the Burney Street terrace, the house is instantly recognisable with its Regency style stucco facade. The double reception room features over 10ft high ceilings and large original sash windows which flood the house with natural light and provides a fantastic entertaining or family space. While offering a more contemporary decor, many of the period features have been retained including the ornate cornicing, hardwood flooring and fireplaces which makes for a lovely blend of old and new. The kitchen to the rear offers a more traditional feel with solid wooden kitchen units and worktop, range cooker and Belfast sink although has been upgraded with a stylish tiled splashback and American style fridge/freezer (appliances included tbc). There is also a separate room which is plumbed in so that it can easily be made into a separate utility room or downstairs WC if required. The lovely walled rear garden is accessible from both kitchen and dining room and feels wonderfully secluded, low maintenance and great for summer barbeque parties. The upper floor continues the light and spacious feel with high ceilings, a generous landing and three good sized bedrooms. The largest bedroom features an ensuite bathroom with a bathtub and separate shower while there is also a family bathroom situated in-between bedrooms two and three providing both great space for family and guests as well as flexibility for a home study for a professional buyer. The house is a unique offering in both style, condition and location and an early viewing is highly recommended.

Situation
Burney Street is located in the heart of West Greenwich, moments from Greenwich Park and Greenwich Town Centre offering an array of local shops, restaurants, cafes and pubs for local residents to enjoy. Local points of interest include Greenwich Market, the Royal Observatory and the National Maritime Museum all of which are located a short walk away. The Cutty Sark DLR Station is located moments away for a swift commute to Canary Wharf while Greenwich Mainline Station offers direct connections to London Bridge, Cannon Street, Blackfriars and Kings Cross.

3 Bedroom Victorian House

Moments From Greenwich Park And Greenwich Town Centre

A Short Walk To Both Cutty Sark DLR And Greenwich Mainline Stations

Double Reception Room

Stunning Period Features

Patio Garden

Main Bedroom With Ensuite

detailedDescription:
***! 35% shared ownership purchase !***

A stunning one bedroom, third floor apartment set in the ever popular Kidbrooke Village Development, just 0.3 miles from Kidbrooke Station. Having been maintained to a high standard by the current owner, this property would make an ideal first time purchase.

The apartment comprises of entrance hall with utility/storage cupboard, a bright and airy open plan kitchen/living area with integrated appliances and access to a large private balcony, double bedroom with full length windows and a 3 piece suite with shower over bath.

The development benefits from an on-site concierge, gym, secure right to park parking, bike storage and a lift.
Shared ownership information

Share: 35%
Purchase Price: £122,500
Monthly Rent; £564.48
Please note, there is the option to purchase 35% or more up to full outright purchase (100%). *
Location

Kidbrooke is located in one of London's most popular locations, the Royal Borough of Greenwich and comprises of four distinct neighbourhoods, integrated seamlessly into one community.
Kidbrooke enjoys all the benefits of this culturally rich area, including the beautiful Greenwich Park, the Royal Observatory and Maritime Greenwich. Greenwich is a lively hub with something for everyone. In addition to the popular Greenwich Market there are high street brands and independent boutiques too. All tastes and budgets are catered for by a fine selection of restaurants and pubs, many of which are housed in historic buildings often with park or river views. Convenient public transport is an important part of the sustainability for Kidbrooke. Good train and bus connections are key elements of its sustainability. Trains leave from Kidbrooke station for London Bridge, Waterloo East, Charing Cross and Victoria, connecting with the London Underground at these mainline stations. Trains also run to Lewisham providing links via DLR to Greenwich, Canary Wharf and Stratford. A regular bus service provides connections for onward travels across London and there are safe pedestrian and cycle routes running through and from Kidbrooke Village.
Just around the corner from Kidbrooke is Blackheath. The heath itself is a wonderful place for walking, being one of the largest areas of open land in London. It supports many species of rare plants and wildlife and from its highest point you can see the towers of Canary Wharf.

Service Charge and Ground Rent: £2,760 per year*

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Set within a quiet residential Cul-de-sac just off the sought after Plumstead Common is this spacious one bedroom first floor purpose built flat.

This delightful property which is bright and airy throughout is well connected with shopping amenities of both Plumstead and Woolwich only a short distance away. Plumstead Common and Oxleas Woods are ideal for those searching for some greenery and transport links are plentiful with frequent buses in Woolwich Arsenal allowing easy access into London as well as Woolwich DLR and the soon to be Cross Rail.

Internally you will find an 18ft lounge, fitted kitchen with built in oven and hob, 13ft bedroom and a 3 piece bathroom suite with shower above the bath. Additional benefits include gas central heating, double glazing, communal parking and communal gardens.

This is an ideal first time buy or buy to let investment and is available with no onward chain.

Lease: 125 years from 25th September 1989
Service charge £500 pa approx. Including building insurance
Ground rent £10 pa

Energy Efficiency Rating C

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Nestled on the edge of the heath and in the heart of Blackheath Village, with outstanding views, is this four double bedroom Grade II listed Georgian home with a 70ft rear garden (with rear access) and a large front garden.

The current owners have carefully and sympathetically refurbished the house to a very high standard throughout. In addition to practical updates (the central heating system was replaced in 2014, for example, and the roof was replaced in 2011), their attention to detail has included reinstating architraves, skirtings and wooden panelled doors - using templates from originals. Features include; sash windows, solid wood flooring, Lefroy Brooks sanitaryware in the bathrooms, feature radiators, fireplaces and bespoke Chamber Furniture joinery.

Arranged over four floors, the accommodation comprises; an entrance porch and hallway leading to a 24'9 dual aspect through-reception with arched alcoves and bespoke solid wood cabinets. On a half landing is the utility room with modern fitted units, and back door out to the garden. The lower ground floor is home to a bespoke Greenwich Woodworks beech shaker kitchen, a 15'6 x 12'10 second reception room with built in alcove storage and access to the front door and a large dry storeroom sitting under the front garden.

Moving up, off the half landing, a stylish shower room with double walk in shower. On the first floor, a large bedroom spans the width of the house and is currently enjoyed as an additional reception room with built-in book shelving and superb views over the heath. Adjacent is a second double bedroom with alcove wardrobes and garden views. A second bathroom with bespoke panelling is found on the half landing up to the top floor. There is a large full width master bedroom which again boasts wonderful views and a fourth double bedroom to the rear. Both rooms have built-in alcove wardrobes.

To the rear is an East-facing garden extending to approximately 70 ft. It's paved in the main with well-established shrubs, plants and climbers, and is a really private retreat. Natural seating areas are by the house and at the foot of the garden. From the rear of the garden there is access onto Paragon Place where there is ample parking (residents permits) and the current owners rent a garage. You have gated access to your beautifully-bordered and lawned front garden.

This is an outstanding home in a fantastic location and viewing is an absolute must. Video tours can be seen at

Montpelier Row is a prestigious and sought after address nestled on the edge and directly facing the heath. Blackheath Village which offers an array of boutique shops, bars, restaurants and farmers market, giving a genuine feeling of village life inside London. Close by you will find the historic Greenwich town centre and Royal Greenwich Park can be seen from the house. There are several sought-after schools within a few minutes walk including Heath House, Blackheath Prep, Blackheath High School and the Pointer School. Blackheath Station gives access to London Bridge, Charing Cross and Victoria amongst others.

detailedDescription:

Register now to book a viewing

L&Q at Kidbrooke Village
Situated in the leafy green oasis of Kidbrooke SE3, a home at this development will offer you to escape and unwind from the demands of modern life. Built to a high specification, your new home will come equipped with a fully fitted kitchen featuring integrated appliances, built-in wardrobes to the master bedroom and outdoor space in the form of a balcony or terrace – everything you need for modern living.

As well as having a wonderfully crafted new home, you will benefit from some outstanding onsite facilities, surrounded by landscaped gardens, acres of open parkland and a flourishing new community. Convenience is at the heart of Kidbrooke. The Village Centre is home to retail shops, a supermarket, coffee shop, dentist, doctor and pharmacy.

Why choose L&Q when buying your perfect home?

When you buy a new-build home with us, we want you to know that you’re purchasing a home of the highest quality and that’s why we’re setting out our commitment to new customers in our New-build Homes: Quality Standard promise: We'll provide good quality homes and services for you, we'll make it easy for you to deal with us, we'll listen and act, we'll put things right & we'll keep you safe.

Shared Ownership at Kidbrooke Village

Shared Ownership is for anyone who currently doesn't own a home and is looking to get on the property ladder. If you cannot afford to buy outright in the open market, under the Shared Ownership scheme you part-own, part-rent your home. You can buy a 25% – 75% share of your new home. You’ll pay a mortgage on this and subsidised rent to L&Q on the remaining share. You need a deposit of 10% of the value of your share, meaning you can enjoy the stability of home ownership with a much lower upfront cost.

*T&Cs apply, please speak to our sales team for more information.

Enquire now to book a viewing!

Viewings
For those who would like to and are able to visit us, the Show Home is now open on an appointment-only basis, with extra measures in place to ensure your wellbeing. Please call us to book your appointment. If you would prefer to speak to our Sales Team from your own home, they are still on hand and can conduct appointments via phone, email and by virtual tour. *We are taking extra precautions to ensure the health and wellbeing of our customers, staff and members of the public.

Reliance Residential are proud to present this three bedroom end of terrace house situated in an excellent position for transport links, close to schools and near to Blackheath Village and Greenwich.

Accommodation comprises of a bright and spacious reception room to front, reception/dining room to back and a beautifully kitchen doors onto the large garden.

This is an excellent family home, view now to avoid disappointment.

title: 3 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
Superbly located, just a short walk from the heart of greenwich, is this extremely well presented 2 bedroom duplex apartment with 2 balconies. The accommodation is arranged over 2 Floors and briefly comprises: To First Floor - 15' Lounge onto 12' Balcony, Fitted Kitchen and Cloakroom. To Second Floor - 15' Bedroom onto 16' Balcony, Second Bedroom and Bathroom. This property is offered Chain Free and further benefits include 109-year Lease, Double Glazing throughout and Residents Parking. EPC Grade B.

Important note to purchasers:
We endeavour to make our sales particulars accurate and reliable, however, they do not constitute or form part of an offer or any contract and none is to be relied upon as statements of representation or fact. Any services, systems and appliances listed in this specification have not been tested by us and no guarantee as to their operating ability or efficiency is given. All measurements have been taken as a guide to prospective buyers only, and are not precise. Please be advised that some of the particulars may be awaiting vendor approval. If you require clarification or further information on any points, please contact us, especially if you are traveling some distance to view. Fixtures and fittings other than those mentioned are to be agreed with the seller.

title: 2 bed maisonette for sale

detailedDescription:
**guide price £390,000 - £410,000**

Proudly presented to the market is this great example of a two bedroom Victorian terrace house located on a sought after road just 0.4 miles from Zone 4 Plumstead train station.

Internal space comprises; spacious and welcoming entrance hall giving access to every room on the ground floor, to the front is the homes sprawling 14’11 by 12’10 reception complemented by a stunning bay window, to the rear of the house is the 13’4 by 10’ modern fitted kitchen with integrated appliances, which also offers direct access to the homes south facing garden. To complete the ground floor is a separate W/C, utility area with space for washing machine and tumble dryer, as well as an abundance of storage space.

Heading upstairs you are welcomed by a large and very modern family bathroom, on this floor you also have two well proportioned bedrooms, the second which measures in at 13’7 by 10’2 benefits from built in storage, the master which measures in at 12’3 by 10’11 benefits from an amazing space that is currently used as a walk in wardrobe with plenty of hanging space, shelves, drawers and space for a full length mirror, but could be easily be converted into a en-suite should you wish to.

Majendie Road is a sought after road within the SE18 postcode consisting of mainly Victorian terraced houses that is located just a short distance (0.4 Miles) from Plumstead Train station and Plumstead high street which offers an array for cafés and shops.

detailedDescription:
This unique and characterful three bedroom Georgian home is located in the heart of West Greenwich. The house has been lovingly renovated by the current owners to create a contemporary and modern home while enhancing the abundance of period features. You enter the house into the double reception room which provides a light and spacious family/entertaining area with striking chevron parquet flooring, two open fireplaces and bespoke hand-built alcove cabinets. There is a quite unique "orangery" style hallway which not only floods the house with natural light but also provides very useful storage or even space for a home office. The eat-in kitchen provides traditional shaker style kitchen units combined with high spec Miele appliances, granite worktops, marble flooring and cast iron radiators to create a very stylish finish with dining space leading onto the wonderfully secluded courtyard garden. There are three double bedrooms with one accessed privately via the kitchen creating a nice separation for guests, home study or older children. The family bathroom has also been renovated to create a very stylish yet traditional Burlington suite. There is ample storage throughout the house including a large loft room accessible via one of the bedrooms. The house is offered in excellent decorative order, ready to move straight into and perfect for a young family or professionals looking for additional space.

Situation
Circus Street is a residential road in the heart of West Greenwich moments from Greenwich Mainline and DLR Station offering a swift commute to Canary Wharf, The City and beyond thanks to the recent addition on the Thameslink Line. The area offers an array of local coffee shops, restaurants and pubs while the local greengrocers, butchers and bakery are located a few minutes’ walk on Royal Hill. The open green spaces of the Royal Greenwich Park are located nearby as are other local places of interest such as Greenwich Market and the National Maritime Museum.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
"The first thing that attracted us to the house were the period features like the beautiful high ceilings and the spacious nature of the rooms which create a really light and airy feel.

This really shines through in the living room, master bedroom and extended kitchen/diner which has space for the whole family.

The south facing garden is a lovely sunny place to relax and for the children to play (as well as a great place to dry your washing!). The generous side return has become an unofficial second living room in the warmer months; a surprisingly private space with plenty of room for al fresco dining.

One thing that really took us by surprise about the house is just how useful having side access would be. It wasn't a feature available on many of the houses we looked at but it has proven invaluable as we get used to living more of our lives outside. Great for routine housework, it really came into its own when we undertook renovations to the kitchen and bathroom.

The excellent location was the other standout quality of the house. Transport links are brilliant - from this house you can actually get to London Bridge in 20 minutes - door to door! The buses to North Greenwich (Jubilee Line - underground) are regular which is handy for nights out and soaking up everything London has to offer. We've also recently discovered the Thames Clipper as a great alternative to the tube. In fact, the transport links and increasing number of local amenities are so good that we didn't own a car for the first 5 years of living here. Although now we do, we realise how easily accessed the A2, M25 and Blackwall Tunnel are!

As our family has grown, we've been pleasantly surprised by the number of parks and green spaces all within walking distance. For adventurous days, even Blackheath and Greenwich Park are reachable on foot; something we regularly do with the children. Charlton Village has an award winning green grocer and the Old Cottage Coffee Shop (both mainstays during lockdown) all served up against the backdrop of Charlton Park and the Jacobean house.

Maryon Wilson Animal Park, which adjoins Charlton Park, has a number of different animals including deer! In the other direction, the children love taking their bicycles along the Thames Path to see the Thames Barrier or up to the O2 to get the cable car over the river!

For those thinking of family, there are a number of excellent nurseries and primary schools nearby. Our own children have attended (and are still attending) outstanding nursery and primary schools which they are able to walk to. Likewise, the local community is very family oriented and we are lucky to have some lovely neighbours, many of whom have lived on the road for decades. A number of the families have similar aged children who we often meet in the playground after school or on the walk home.

We are relocating with work but would have been very happy to stay in Charlton. When we first moved to the house we found everything we needed to have fun and relax. Furthermore, it's been a great place to raise a family - suffice to say, we're not looking forward to telling the children we're moving!"

The sellers perfectly describe the amazing family living space and the ease of location that their home offers any buyer. It also offers the opportunity to complete the improvements the house could benefit from, and add the finishing touches to your personal taste. To add, look out for the amazing potential of the property: Standing in the garden you can spot the space available for a double loft conversion or a side return kitchen extension if desired.

Highly recommended!<br /><br />
title: 3 bed detached house for sale

Upstairs offers three large double bedrooms and a family bathroom with shower, plus a fantastic loft with great potential for additional bedrooms or bathrooms if converted.

This is a well presented family home in a commuter-friendly spot. Charlton station is just around the corner, as well as handy bus routes to Blackheath, Greenwich and North Greenwich tube station. Highly recommended.<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
Offered in excellent decorative order with brand new hardwood flooring and carpets throughout, the property has been recently renovated to create a stylish and modern home while still retaining much of its period charm with its exposed wooden floorboards, sash windows and period fireplaces. The house offers great living space and a flexible layout with a reception room on the ground floor and an open plan kitchen and dining room on the lower ground floor leading out onto a beautiful west-facing rear garden. There are three double bedrooms on the upper floors, great for both families or professionals looking for space for a home office. Planning permission has also been approved for a full width extension to the rear to create a stunning open plan home.

Situation
Brand Street is a quiet and residential road in prime West Greenwich with some of the finest examples of Georgian terraced houses in the area. The property is located moments from Greenwich Mainline and DLR Station offering a swift commute to The City, London Bridge and Canary Wharf. The recent addition of the Thameslink Line provides further connections to Blackfriars, Kings Cross and Luton Airport while the Thames Clipper at Cutty Sark offers a more relaxing commute. Greenwich Park, Greenwich Market and the National Maritime Museum are located a short walk away as are the local shops such as the butchers, fishmongers and greengrocers on Royal Hill. title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Show home launching Saturday 5th June!

Interiors reflect the constantly changing light, texture and colour of the surrounding environment, from the engineered wood flooring in the entrance hall, kitchen and living areas, to the stunning floor-to-ceiling windows which draw in vast amounts of natural light. Bathrooms are beautifully finished with Minoli tiles and antique brass ironmongery, whilst en-suites come with matt black fixtures and fittings.

All apartments come with private terraces/balconies, perfect for a spot of al fresco dining, with selected apartments also benefitting from sweeping panoramic views over Canary Wharf and across the city skyline.

Proudly standing on the corner of Norman Road and Greenwich High Road in the heart of historic Greenwich, Valegro is a striking collection of one, two and three bedroom apartments offering modern, luxurious living in one of London's most desirable locations.

Just a 5 minute stroll, Greenwich station offers both DLR routes to Canary Wharf and Bank, and quick National Rail links to London Bridge, Cannon Street and Farringdon. For a slightly more interesting commute, the Thames Clipper boat offers services to Westminster, Embankment, London Bridge, City and Canary Wharf – with wonderful views along the way!

title: 1 bed flat for sale

address: Jefferies Lodge, 48-60 Footscray Road, London SE9
detailedDescription:
*** retirement apartment ***
Plot 30 is a one bedroom apartment on the second floor.
This beautiful apartment comes with a fully fitted kitchen, spacious living room, separate shower room and a large bedroom.

The kitchen has been designed for practicality, with a fitted fridge, freezer and a waist-height oven to save bending down. There’s also an integral washer/dryer fitted. The bedroom comes complete with fitted wardrobes as well as TV and telephone points, with even the smallest details considered.

About the Development

This stunning retirement development of one and two bedroom apartments is in a fantastic, central location, close to all the essential amenities and public transport. Jefferies Lodge is home to 38 apartments and includes an Owners' Lounge with a built-in coffee bar, creating the perfect location for socialising with like-minded neighbours. The development is within easy reach of the local shops, supermarkets and tourist attractions, so you can enjoy an independent, active retirement.

Social and communal lifestyle

Communal gardens are carefully landscaped, giving you the perfect place to relax and enjoy an afternoon cup of tea, without having to worry about the maintenance and upkeep that a large garden so often demands. The carefully designed Owners’ Lounge comes complete with a coffee bar and is a popular feature, providing the perfect venue for entertaining, participating in activities organised by your Lodge Manager, or just relaxing with a book. Events include everything from fish and chip suppers, to tea dances, giving you the chance to socialise as much as you like throughout the year.

The fully furnished Guest Suite provides an ideal space for your family and friends to stay over when visiting, while a lift to all floors is installed for your convenience.

Safety and security

This apartment comes complete with a 24 hour emergency Careline system, while a camera entry system is installed as standard, so you can feel safe and secure in your retirement. Intruder alarms and fire alarm systems are fitted throughout the Lodge, while a Lodge Manager is on hand to assist you with anything else you might need. EPC Grade B. Please note that all particulars and images are for marketing and illustrative purposes only. Advertising images may include upgrades as home specifications can vary.

Important note to purchasers:
We endeavour to make our sales particulars accurate and reliable, however, they do not constitute or form part of an offer or any contract and none is to be relied upon as statements of representation or fact. Any services, systems and appliances listed in this specification have not been tested by us and no guarantee as to their operating ability or efficiency is given. All measurements have been taken as a guide to prospective buyers only, and are not precise. Please be advised that some of the particulars may be awaiting vendor approval. If you require clarification or further information on any points, please contact us, especially if you are traveling some distance to view. Fixtures and fittings other than those mentioned are to be agreed with the seller.

address: Royal Herbert Pavilions, Gilbert Close, London SE18
detailedDescription:
Located within the historical and luxurious Royal Herbert Pavilions development is this three bedroom two bathroom share of freehold apartment.

This extremely well presented second floor apartment boasts views over the stunning grounds. Comprising three double bedrooms, a bright reception room with ample space for entertaining and plenty of space for dining. Further comprising a fully fitted modern kitchen with ample storage and a family bathroom. This property offers an abundance of natural light and space with exceptional high ceilings throughout. Further benefits include two allocated parking spaces.

The Royal Herbert Pavilions is a Grade II Victorian former hospital and is seeped in history, the grounds as well as the buildings are vast and grand. The development is built on a 7 acre plot surrounded by beautiful gardens which also incorporate tennis courts. Other facilities which residents enjoy include private swimming pool, gymnasium, sauna and bar. Energy Efficiency Rating D.

Viewings recommended as soon as possible!

Annual Maintenance: £1860 Per annum
Ground Rent: Approx. £200 Per annum
Council Tax Band D (Approx. £1,489.55 per year)
Energy Efficiency Rating D

detailedDescription:
Situated in the North Thamesmead area is this two bedroom mid terraced house.

The property is spacious and bright and has accommodation comprising of a good size reception room leading to the conservatory that leads to the garden and kitchen to the ground floor, two bedrooms and a family bathroom to the first floor.

Other added benefits include gas central heating (untested), double glazing, conservatory and a rear garden.

The property is conveniently located for bus routes, schools and parkland and a short bus journey to Abbey Wood Railway Station which is soon to benefit from the forthcoming Crossrail Link to Canary wharf the City and Heathrow.

This would make an ideal purchase for first time buyers or family looking to move into the area.

This home is sure to have a lot of competition so call now to arrange your viewing!

title: 2 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
Guide Price - £625,000 - £650,000. John Payne are delighted to welcome to the market this stunning two bedroom, two bathroom house forming part of the Vanbrugh Park Estate development designed by the world renowned architects Chamberlain, Powell and Bon, who were pioneers of the Brutalist movement, most notably the development at the Barbican.

Internally the entire property has been refurbished and upgraded to a very high standard throughout by the current owners. As you enter the property you are welcomed by a large contemporary open-plan kitchen/reception room leading through patio doors to a south/west facing landscaped rear garden with outside storage. To complete the ground floor you have a large storage cupboard. As you ascend to the first floor via a wrap around staircase you are welcomed by two sizeable double bedrooms. Both bedrooms boast built in wardrobes and one of the two rooms boasts its very own private en-suite shower room. To complete the first floor you will find a modern bathroom suite.

Located only a short distance to the beautiful Greenwich Park, the open heath and Blackheath Village for boutique shopping, independent cafés, bars and established eateries. You will find Maze Hill and Blackheath mainline stations close by, which will make this home ideal for commuters.

Virtual viewings available upon request.

For further information or to arrange a viewing please contact our Blackheath Standard office today!

title: 2 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
Located within Blackheath's prestigious and private Cator Estate, Parkgate remains one of SE3's most secluded and desirable turnings.

This stunning property has been exquisitely finished and boasts a recent
architecturally designed rear family space and converted third floor and is offered with no onward chain and early access.

The superb architecturally designed detached residence spans three levels providing versatile living options for the growing family. An appealing neutral finish showcases extensive bright accommodation and includes a modern kitchen, living areas with the back opening up to reveal the stunning landscaped and sizeable rear gardens and the adjoining entertainment deck.

Principally, the property offers a downstairs cloakroom and under stairs storage cupboard, reception room and larger open plan reception room with underfloor heating, stunning kitchen and utility with a range of high quality integrated and fitted appliances and further space for dining. Large bi folding doors open onto a pretty patio and landscaped garden. On the first floor the master ensuite, a further three bedrooms, along with the family bathroom. On the second floor a large bright room with extensive storage in the eaves and existing planning permission for further dormer windows, services for an additional bathroom.

To the front of the property you will find ample parking and a garage to the side. Located within walking distance (0.4 miles) to Blackheath Village shops, restaurants and coffee shops. EER: D.

Located within a desirable, modern, purpose built development is this wonderful, two bedroom apartment. Situated close to outstanding transportation and convenient shopping facilities.

The apartment is blessed with an abundance of natural light throughout and comprises; an open plan reception room which incorporates a modern fitted kitchen and access to a West facing private balcony. Two good sized bedrooms, of which the master boasts built in wardrobes, a three piece family bathroom suite and plenty of storage completes this wonderful home.

Located within easy reach of Maze hill mainline station (London Bridge, Cannon Street and Thameslink), North Greenwich(Jubilee line) and Greenwich village for further mainline and DLR connections. title: 2 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
Located on the second floor of Callis Yard development is this two bedroom apartment. The apartment offers an open-plan living and dining area and master bedroom with views towards north and second bedroom with south facing views.

Each apartment benefits from bespoke light oak veneer entrance doors, Karndean brushed oak flooring to the hallway and living spaces and underfloor heating throughout. The kitchen will offer silestone white worktops, under cabinet LED lighting and fully integrated stainless steel appliances. All bedrooms are carpeted and are fitted with full height white wardrobes with white glass sliding doors. The master is offered with its own ensuite bathroom which is fitted with grey porcelain floor and wall tiles, Villeroy and Boch sanitary ware and Hansgrohe taps. The apartment also has one further family bathroom.

Completed and ready to move in, Callis Yard comprises 120 spectacular 1,2 & 3 bedroom apartments and 3 bedroom townhouses. The development also includes a resident’s gymnasium, private roof terrace, landscaped roof-gardens and bicycle storage.

Callis Yard is located within a short walk of Woolwich Arsenal station, offering both National Rail and Docklands Light Railway services. Woolwich will also benefit from the forthcoming Crossrail, which will offer connections to Canary Wharf in just 8 minutes, the City in 14 minutes and the West End in 22 minutes. Furthermore, Callis Yard sits just 10 minutes from London City Airport via the DLR. The development is a 2 minute walk from Woolwich High Street which is home to a mix of local bars, cafes, restaurants and high-street shops.

Marketing suite and show home open five days a week, please call to book your appointment.

Journey times are estimates and taken from tfl.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
***Guide Price £585,000 - £620,000*** "It has been the ideal space for entertaining and relaxing with its high ceilings, creating a big and bright space looking out onto trees."

I have lived at Charter Buildings for several years and will miss it very much.

This quiet and peaceful location is part of the Ashburnham Triangle Conservation area, a warm and welcoming community which organises and promotes social occasions for Triangle residents and their families.

It is within walking distance to an array of shops, local parks and things to do as well as great public transport links into the centre of London.

I will be sad to leave, and hope the new owners love it as much as I have!"

What The Agent Says -

Beautiful Victorian school conversion, situated within a private gated development and featuring an off-street parking space and some communal gardens. Located within the prestigious Ashburnham triangle conservation area.

The building is very well-kept and is shared with several other distinct and uniquely designed flats.

The flat itself is located on the first and second floors, encompassing a mezzanine level, which has a double size bedroom and bathroom suite, with shower over bath.

Downstairs you will find a large bedroom, separate shower room, very spacious living room and open plan kitchen.

The property feels very spacious with its high ceilings and large period style windows, which overlook the pocket park on Catherine Grove.

Greenwich mainline and DLR stations are just a few minutes away on foot and the town centre, a further few minutes walk.

Also found here is Greenwich's royal park, covered market, some lovely river front pubs and a wide range of shopping facilities.<br /><br />
title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Detailed Description

A very well presented and extended five bedroom, semi-detached family home which has been finished to a very high specification by the current owners. The property benefits from a good-sized reception room, utility room, downstairs w/c, garage and a large open plan modern fitted kitchen and dining room which leads to the patio and mainly laid to lawn rear garden. There is also a small covered barbecue area. Furthermore, the first floor offers two good sized double bedrooms, and two single bedroom and a main family bathroom which is made up of a modern three-piece suite. The loft conversion has created a fantastic master bedroom with en-suite shower room and a walk-in wardrobe.
This property offers plenty of space and provides the opportunity for a growing family to transform the property into a perfect family home.
This property boasts plenty of internal living space and will make a superb home for a growing family. The property is situated on Sidcup Road which offers an easy walk to New Eltham rail station, plenty of local amenities and good schools close by.

Location:
New Eltham is a sought after suburb of South East London, located within the Royal Borough of Greenwich. The property is located conveniently adjacent for Eltham and Chislehurst High Streets. Eltham High Street contains many nationwide brands such as Marks & Spencer, Costa Coffee as well as a fine range of restaurants of varied cuisine, pubs and a popular, and newly developed six-screen cinema complex with a Nando's, Pizza Express and a sky bar within.

For the commuters, there is a direct train line from either of Eltham (which is approximately 10 minutes walk away), New Eltham or Mottingham Station, serving Lewisham (for DLR), London Bridge, Charing Cross, Cannon Street, Waterloo East and Victoria. Buses connect to all neighbouring towns with Woolwich Arsenal and Lewisham both benefitting from DLR services and Woolwich soon to include Crossrail (2018). For roads in and out of London you have the South Circular, A2/A102 (Blackwell Tunnel Approach), A20 and Rochester Way.

The Royal borough of Greenwich is renowned for being one of the greenest in London, offering a range of open parkland and recreational activities for the whole family to enjoy. Eltham Park South with its tennis courts, play park and tea hut is almost opposite whilst further along Glenesk Road is Eltham Park North, with a duck pond flanked by the ancient Oxleas Wood. The Well Hall Pleasance is a park within the former grounds of the Tudor Barn, now a pub/restaurant with the grounds doubling up as an open-air cinema in the summer months. Eltham Palace is adjacent to the High Street, once the childhood home to Henry VIII and the family home to the Courtaulds, now a national heritage site and one of the country's finest Art Deco homes often used as a backdrop in period dramas. Neighbouring is Eltham Warren Golf Course, one of two in the wider area, The Royal Blackheath being the oldest golf club in England.

detailedDescription:
This spacious and well-maintained 2 double bedroom, split level maisonette, which has its own private entrance on the ground floor, is located in Paragon Place, a sought-after, tranquil, residential road, at the pretty heath end of Blackheath village. Conveniently placed, near the centre of the village, the property is close to the open heath, Greenwich park and many shops, bars and restaurants. This bright and spacious apartment is nicely elevated with a lovely outlook to both front and rear.

The ground floor has a small entrance hall with stairs leading to a bright and airy reception room and a separate modern kitchen equipped with ample storage space, an overhead extractor and oven, gas hob, fridge/freezer. The top floor has two spacious double bedrooms and a modern bathroom. The property has gas central heating and double glazing and there are ample residents permit holder parking bays available to the front and rear.

There are a number of excellent primary and secondary schools nearby. The property is 5 minutes walk from Blackheath station which has direct links into Central London. The property has a long lease and is sold with no onward chain.

agency_name: Knight Frank - City & East New Homes
address: London Square Greenwich, Royal Hill, Greenwich, London SE10
detailedDescription:
Concierge, private communal gardens, and balcony or terrace space to all apartments.

London Square Greenwich is a bespoke collection of apartments superbly located and surrounded by history.
The striking new building is designed to reflect the local architecture, including the grade 2 listed former Greenwich town hall.
Residents will enjoy an exceptional lifestyle amid the heritage, culture, and convivial atmosphere in the heart of this truly unique and popular London village.
High-quality finishes, stylish design and careful attention to detail and craftsmanship make these homes to be proud of – and where you can relax in absolute comfort.
Open plan living spaces and stylish kitchens give you the perfect place for cooking, eating and socialising, with room for working too. Balconies extend from the living area into the outside, so you can relax in the fresh air and enjoy the local area views.

Centrally located in the heart of Greenwich, just minutes from Greenwich station, 2 minutes from Greenwich park and 10 minutes from Greenwich market.
Transport connections from the local area put all of London within easy reach. With Canary Wharf 10 minutes away on the DLR, and Bank only 21 minutes.
From classic to contemporary, Georgian to Victorian, Greenwich is full of architectural gems and historic buildings. Admire the elegant proportions of Inigo Jones' Queen's House, the Baroque details of Christopher Wren's Old Royal Naval College and the cloistered charm of Trinity Hospital – the oldest surviving building in Greenwich, founded in 1611.
Despite these treasures, Greenwich is no museum town. It is also home to leading contemporary architecture, such as the prize-winning Laban Building, the Sammy Ofer Wing of the National Maritime Museum, and the dynamic Planetarium building. Designed by Formation Architects, London Square Greenwich joins this tradition of exceptional architecture, combining aesthetic appeal with modern design to create a vibrant place for you to live.

*Please note CGI's are indicative only.

detailedDescription:
A beautifully presented 4th floor three bedroom apartment situated in the popular Greenwich Square development. The property offers fantastic living space with an open-plan kitchen and reception room featuring double aspect floor to ceiling windows and leading out onto the large "L" shaped private balcony. The modern kitchen features fully integrated appliances and there is plenty of space for a large family dining table. There are built-in wardrobes in each of the three bedrooms with the principal bedroom also featuring an ensuite shower room. The family bathroom is located off the hallway as well as a storage cupboard while the apartment also features underfloor heating throughout and high speed fibre-optic broadband available. The property is offered in excellent condition and is perfect for a family or professional buyer looking for additional space for a home study. The development also features a residents-only communal garden and secure bicycle storage.

Situation
Greenwich Square is located just off Vanbrugh Hill in East Greenwich moments from Maze Hill Mainline Station providing swift and regular services to Canary Wharf (change at Greenwich for DLR), London Bridge and Cannon Street while the recent addition of the Thameslink Line offers direct connections to Blackfriars, Kings Cross and Luton Airport. North Greenwich Tube Station is also easily accessible. There are wide range of local pubs, restaurants and cafes for residents to enjoy while larger shops such as M&S, Sainsbury’s and Ikea are located in the nearby Greenwich Retail Park. The Greenwich Centre is located onsite providing an array of services for residents of the Borough such as a gp, library, gym and swimming pool and nursery. There are also a number of good options available for local schools in the area.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
The property is set back from the road behind a paved drive and pretty front garden. You enter into a spacious hall with attractive wooden flooring that runs through to the two reception rooms. To the left is the dining room with a feature fireplace and impressive curved bay window. Across the hall is the living room with a contemporary gas fire and a stylish kitchen. The kitchen is made up of shaker style units with a marble worktop and integrated appliances including a range cooker. Both the kitchen and living room have floor to ceiling windows which flood the back of the house with light and have French doors out to the garden. Off the hall is a WC and a utility room with a door out to the side. Upstairs are four bedrooms, a modern fully tiled bathroom and an en-suite shower room to the main bedroom. Over the stairs is a large stained glass window that fills the landing and hall with light. Outside, the south facing garden has been thoughtfully landscaped to incorporate a stone patio out from the house and a raised lawn. The whole garden is fenced and surrounded by colourful shrubs and plants. To the front is a small garage with integral and extensive storage capacity and off street parking. The house has been fully renovated to a high standard in previous years (fixtures and fittings being Villeroy & Bosch, Hans Grohe etc), extensive re-wiring and plumbing and fully double glazed.

Ashridge Crescent is a no through road in the middle of the Shrewsbury Park Conservation Area. Woolwich Arsenal Station and DLR are approximately 1.2 miles away and regular bus services run directly from Shrewsbury Lane. Woolwich will also soon benefit from the Crossrail allowing passengers to travel directly to Canary Wharf, the City and the West End. There are several very good local primary schools including Christ Church (which is Ofsted outstanding) and Plumcroft within walking distance. You are also surrounded by many green spaces including Oxleas woods, Eaglesfield Recreation Ground and Shooters Hill Golf club & Lawn Tennis club.

address: London Square Greenwich, Royal Hill, Greenwich, London SE10
detailedDescription:
Concierge, private communal gardens, and balcony or terrace space to all apartments.

London Square Greenwich is a bespoke collection of apartments superbly located and surrounded by history.
The striking new building is designed to reflect the local architecture, including the grade 2 listed former Greenwich town hall.
Residents will enjoy an exceptional lifestyle amid the heritage, culture, and convivial atmosphere in the heart of this truly unique and popular London village.
High-quality finishes, stylish design and careful attention to detail and craftsmanship make these homes to be proud of – and where you can relax in absolute comfort.
Open plan living spaces and stylish kitchens give you the perfect place for cooking, eating and socialising, with room for working too. Balconies extend from the living area into the outside, so you can relax in the fresh air and enjoy the local area views.

Centrally located in the heart of Greenwich, just minutes from Greenwich station, 2 minutes from Greenwich park and 10 minutes from Greenwich market.
Transport connections from the local area put all of London within easy reach. With Canary Wharf 10 minutes away on the DLR, and Bank only 21 minutes.
From classic to contemporary, Georgian to Victorian, Greenwich is full of architectural gems and historic buildings. Admire the elegant proportions of Inigo Jones' Queen's House, the Baroque details of Christopher Wren's Old Royal Naval College and the cloistered charm of Trinity Hospital – the oldest surviving building in Greenwich, founded in 1611.
Despite these treasures, Greenwich is no museum town. It is also home to leading contemporary architecture, such as the prize-winning Laban Building, the Sammy Ofer Wing of the National Maritime Museum, and the dynamic Planetarium building. Designed by Formation Architects, London Square Greenwich joins this tradition of exceptional architecture, combining aesthetic appeal with modern design to create a vibrant place for you to live.

*Please note CGI's are indicative only.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Accessed via a secure gate on Catherine Grove, this much-loved family home is tucked away in a hidden corner of Greenwich's Ashburnham Triangle. With plenty of character throughout, the house features a spacious courtyard garden at the front but the property's defining feature is the stunning and secluded garden at the rear.

Entering the house, there is a double-aspect living room to the left with a feature fireplace and exposed brick chimney. French doors provide access to the garden as well as loads of natural light. All the windows, including the doors onto the garden, have been fitted with custom-made plantation shutters which are featured throughout the house. Back to the hallway, there is a downstairs loo and a cupboard with plenty of storage, before you reach the L-shaped kitchen/dining area.

The kitchen, in gloss white, was designed by a couple who love to cook and includes an integrated double oven and microwave tower, integrated dishwasher, induction hob, American-style fridge-freezer and a wine fridge. The huge cupboard in the newly decorated dining room, contains a large capacity washer/dryer as well as the boiler, hot-water tank and loads of drawers and shelves for storage. The room also has an abundance of natural light from the French doors which also lead into the garden.

The garden itself is south-west facing and, in addition to the jasmine covering most of the walls and fences, has half a dozen mature trees, including a fig, and raised beds with mature shrubs, standard and climbing roses and plenty of space for winter and summer bedding. There are outdoor sofas lining the sunniest wall and an oval-dining table which seats twelve. Among the cedar fencing there is a also hidden storage cupboard for garden essentials.

Upstairs, there are three double bedrooms - one is currently being used as a study and occasional guest room and another as a kids room - and these two rooms share the family bathroom with loo, bath, sink and shower and a spacious mirrored storage cupboard. The larger, master bedroom has recently been redecorated and has its own en-suite shower room. The en-suite was completely refitted by the current owners a couple of years ago and has a slate floor, breath-taking teal wall tiles, a Roper Rhodes double sink and vanity unit and enormous shower. It also features the exposed brick chimney extending from the living room below.

The dining-room, master bedroom, hallway, landing and stairs have all been recently redecorated and during their tenure the current owners have installed a new kitchen, the new en-suite bathroom to the master bedroom and several fitted cupboards and storage solutions in rooms throughout the house.

Returning to the front of the property, there is plenty of additional space for seating, a kids playhouse and the world's smallest allotment! The communal courtyard also provides access to a bike store, bin store and the cupboards containing the utility meters, etc. Which are shared with the other eight residences that make up The Toolworks development.

Unfortunately, due to Greenwich's extremely strict parking restrictions the property does not benefit from street parking, however, the owners have secured parking in the gated development opposite and would gladly share the details of this arrangement with any prospective purchasers.

For transportation, Greenwich Station is approximately 7 minutes walk with direct overground trains to London Bridge and Cannon Street as well as the DLR to Canary Wharf - which can also be reached via the slightly closer Deptford Bridge DLR station only 3 minutes away (as is the local Co-op and Tesco Express). Greenwich town centre and the river ferry is a 10-minute walk away with Blackheath (and Blackheath Village) a slightly further at 15-20 minutes on foot.
When enquiring please quote IATA15833

address: Westbrook Court, Kidbrooke Grove, London SE3
detailedDescription:
The accommodation comprises; entrance hall with entry phone and storage cupboard, a large living room with space for a dining table, a feature fireplace and two double glazed sash windows, a modern kitchen with a tiled floor and walls, a lovely bathroom with brick style tiling and a double bedroom with built in wardrobes. To the rear is an impressive landscaped communal garden and resident parking.

Kidbrooke Grove is a particularly popular location. It takes just a stroll of a few hundred yards to bring you to the heath. This vast green expanse is a true gem of South East London and provides a spectacular recreation area. Beyond the heath in one direction, Blackheath Village provides a wonderful array of shops, bars and restaurants. In terms of transport, Blackheath Station provides regular services into London Bridge, Cannon Street, London Victoria and Charing Cross. Alternatively, one stop down the line at Lewisham Station, the DLR has regular services into Bank and Canary Wharf. Looking north across the heath is Royal Greenwich Park with Greenwich’s historic town centre found through the north gates.
