title: 1 bed flat for sale

address: Hudson Building, Deals Gateway, Greenwich, London SE10 8Ea
detailedDescription:
Accommodation comprises entrance hall with ample inbuilt storage, leading into the bright and spacious, open plan reception/kitchen with ample space for both relaxing and dining. The kitchen area comprises a modern range of matching white fronted wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, induction hob with overhead extractor and electric oven below, and further space for appliances. There is a well sized double bedroom with inbuilt wardrobe, plus a stylish bathroom with white three piece suite and elegant tiling.

The property is superbly located moments' from Deptford Bridge DLR station with services into Canary Wharf within 12 mins and connections to the Jubilee line. Greenwich station is also just a short walk away with links to London Bridge (10 mins) and Cannon Street (15 mins), as well as Thameslink services into Central London and the City. Conveniently located on the corner of four districts, with just a short walk taking you into Greenwich and along the river to Greenwich Park and Blackheath Common, or to neighbouring Deptford and New Cross which offer a huge variety of bars, restaurants and artisan coffee shops, the property also enjoys easy access to local shops and amenities literally on the doorstep.
Ideal as a first time or investment purchase.

Owners Comments:

1) What do you love most about your home?
It has good storage space. It is well insulated and soundproofed, we can hardly hear our neighbours which is amazing during Covid when both of us are working from home.

2) What do you love about the area?
We particularly like the parks nearby in which we have spent most of our time during Covid. Brookmill Park is next to the development and we are within walking distance to Greenwich Park and Blackheath. We also like the small coffee shop across the road and we have become regulars. The flat is also very conveniently located, we have DLR, trains (Greenwich, St Johns, Deptford and New Cross) and overground all within walking distance. There are a lot of independent cafes and restaurants around Deptford and Greenwich, we are so lucky to have so many choices nearby.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

address: Building 50, Argyll Road, Royal Arsenal SE18
detailedDescription:
Contemporary two bed overlooking an attractive water feature, in a popular block, within this landmark development situated adjacent to the river, east of Greenwich. Fitted to a high specification throughout, this stylish apartment benefits from two good sized double bedrooms (master with en suite) spacious reception with private balcony, open plan kitchen with a range of integrated appliances, granite worktop and ample storage space. Price to include allocated parking.

Area

The Royal Arsenal is a former munitions factory & storage facility with a history dating back to 1671, that is being tastefully transformed to provide a blend of converted & new build residential properties, together with a central open space, bars, restaurants and an hotel.

Beautifully landscaped, the builder has taken great care to create a development that is a pleasure to live in, rather than yet another sterile 'stack of boxes'. It retains a real sense of community yet retains a high degree of peace and tranquility, away from the 'big smoke'.

The development currently offers

* 24 Concierge & Security
* Residents Gym
* Royal Resistance Boot Camp
* 7R CrossFit Gym
* Two Youngs "gastro pubs" The Dial Arch & The Guardhouse
* Con Gusto Italian Restaurant
* Craft Beer & Pizzeria, The Taproom
* Three on site cafés
* Health Centre
* Chemist
* Dentist
* Tesco Express
* M&S Food Hall
* Sainsburys
* Dry Cleaning service
* Zipcar Car Sharing Club
* Fortnightly Farmers Market

Situated east of Greenwich, adjacent to Woolwich Town Centre (offering an array of main street shopping and a vibrant street market) the development is easily reached by road & rail.

The station is no more than a short stroll away, which offers a direct route to the City (London Bridge / Cannon Street) in a little over 20 minutes, via the Main Line and less than 25 minutes to Bank / Tower Gateway via the DLR.

London City Airport can also be reached in as little as 5 minutes, with Canary Wharf & Stratford also accessible in less than 25 minutes.

As far as leisure is concerned, a short cab ride will take you to nearby Blackheath, Greenwich or, the O2 - where you will be spoilt for choice in terms of food, drink and nightlife.

As an alternative to the train or car, the Thames Clipper river bus service also docks immediately adjacent to the development and provides additional links with The O2, Greenwich, Canary Wharf, Tower Bridge, Blackfriars, The Southbank (Tate Modern) and beyond.

address: The Waterman, 5 Tidemill Square, Lower Riverside, Greenwich Peninsula SE10
detailedDescription:
An amazing one bedroom apartment that's worthy of an immediate viewing, it won't be around long!
Residents have access to a 23rd floor terrace with panoramic views of the Thames and London skyline, private workstations, wood-panelled 'residents' club' and cinema.
Greenwich Peninsula is big, eclectic and original. A whole new swathe of London that brings together design, community, the river, culture and stunning architecture against vast skies. A collection of seven neighbourhoods, 15,000 new homes and fascinating spaces in-between. Greenwich Peninsula doesn't pretend to be one thing - it's more interesting than that.
The Waterman is one of a collection of buildings that make up the Lower Riverside district which spans much of the Peninsula's eastern shore. Designed by Pilbrow & Partners, one of the UK's leading architecture practices. Interior design by Conran + Partners features parquet timber flooring, marble and stone bathrooms and high-quality kitchens with polished brushed brass splash backs. Located close to Central Park, the neighbourhood combines peacefulness with urban pastimes. At the heart of the district is Aperture, a new incarnation of the traditional 'village hall'. Award-winning architects and designers have created a light and open meeting place that provides important services and brings together residents for socialising and recreation including concierge, pan Asian restaurant, crèche, gym facilities and private event space.
Contact us for your appointment to view.

The town centre is within 5-7 minutes' walk and offers a wide selection of shops and restaurants, along with riverboat service and mainline rail.

detailedDescription:
We are delighted to present to the market this stunning Semi detached 1930's Chalet family 4-bedroom home, located within the residential road of Broad Walk, Greenwich and close boundary to both Eltham and Kidbrooke. Eltham and Kidbrooke village both have a vast array of restaurants, shopping centres and amenities making it easier to access variety of family needs.

The house consists of 4 separate bedrooms, one family bathroom upstairs with separate WC, a downstairs WC and a separate reception room and dinning room. Towards the rear of the property, the conservatory is great for friends and family entertainment and the kitchen is equipped with ample storage space, an overhead extractor and oven, gas hob, fridge/freezer, integrated dishwasher and ample storage space for kitchen appliances.

Rear garden is easy to maintain mainly laid to lawn.

Benefits to the property includes the off-street parking and garage also the property is within walking distance of the prestigious and Ofsted approved Kidbrooke Park Primary school and The Halley Academy, Kidbrooke playing fields, Shooters Hill sports and social club, Eltham Common and Oxleas Wood making it a fantastic location for family leisure and entertainment. The house is also within proximity from the following train stations, Eltham, Kidbrooke, Charlton as well as Woolwich Arsenal DLR which all have direct links into Central London.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

address: Building 36, Marlborough Road, Royal Arsenal SE18
detailedDescription:
Split level, Grade 2 Listed Conversion, in the heart of the "golden square" of this historic landmark development, situated adjacent to the river, east of Greenwich. Offering over 1,000sqft of floor space, with an abundance of exposed brickwork, original oak beams and large sash windows, the property genuinely has too much to mention so, needs to be seen to be appreciated. 24hr Concierge and secure allocated parking provide the icing on the cake.

Area

The Royal Arsenal is a former munitions factory & storage facility with a history dating back to 1671, that is being tastefully transformed to provide a blend of converted & new build residential properties, together with a central open space, bars, restaurants and an hotel.

Beautifully landscaped, the builder has taken great care to create a development that is a pleasure to live in, rather than yet another sterile 'stack of boxes'. It retains a real sense of community yet retains a high degree of peace and tranquility, away from the 'big smoke'.

The development currently offers

* 24 Concierge & Security
* Residents Gym
* Royal Resistance Boot Camp
* 7R CrossFit Gym
* Two Youngs "gastro pubs" The Dial Arch & The Guardhouse
* Con Gusto Italian Restaurant
* Craft Beer & Pizzeria, The Taproom
* Three on site cafés
* Health Centre
* Chemist
* Dentist
* Tesco Express
* M&S Food Hall
* Sainsburys
* Dry Cleaning service
* Zipcar Car Sharing Club
* Fortnightly Farmers Market

Situated east of Greenwich, adjacent to Woolwich Town Centre (offering an array of main street shopping and a vibrant street market) the development is easily reached by road & rail.

The station is no more than a short stroll away, which offers a direct route to the City (London Bridge / Cannon Street) in a little over 20 minutes, via the Main Line and less than 25 minutes to Bank / Tower Gateway via the DLR.

London City Airport can also be reached in as little as 5 minutes, with Canary Wharf & Stratford also accessible in less than 25 minutes.

As far as leisure is concerned, a short cab ride will take you to nearby Blackheath, Greenwich or, the O2 - where you will be spoilt for choice in terms of food, drink and nightlife.

As an alternative to the train or car, the Thames Clipper river bus service also docks immediately adjacent to the development and provides additional links with The O2, Greenwich, Canary Wharf, Tower Bridge, Blackfriars, The Southbank (Tate Modern) and beyond.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

address: Officers Gardens, Ashmore Road, Woolwich SE18
detailedDescription:
Located in the historic Royal Military Academy is this elegant grade II listed, two bedroom property.

From the secure, gated entrance you proceed to the well- maintained garden space only accessible by the residents in the Officers Gardens. The property itself is arranged over two floors. On entering you are welcomed by dual aspect open plan kitchen and living space, benefiting from an abundance of natural light. There is also a smart W/C and a superb use of internal storage space.

Accessed on the second floor are two double bedrooms, which are well appointed with superb high ceilings. The master bedroom boasts a deluxe en-suite bathroom with walk in shower facility. Further to this the mirrored, fitted wardrobes provide a perfect dressing space. You will also find a family-sized bathroom which has been modernised throughout.

Additional perks are include a covered, off-street parking spot, access to a residents' gymnasium and a concierge facility.

Woolwich itself, already a commuter hub is about to receive a massive boost from the opening of the Elizabeth line (Crossrail), bringing the heart of the city closer to your door. Currently Woolwich Arsenal DLR is the closest station to the property, where connectivity can be found to the business hub of Canary Wharf as well as Stratford International and Bank.

Double size bedroom and a modern bathroom suite, with shower over bath.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Detailed Description

An extremely well presented three bedroom, semi-detached family home which has been finished to a very high specification by the current owners. The property benefits from two good sized reception rooms and a stunning modern fitted kitchen. This property boasts plenty of internal living space and will make a superb home for a growing family. The property is situated on Sidcup Road which offers an easy walk to New Eltham rail station, plenty of local amenities and good schools close by.
The ground floor comprises a hallway, two spacious reception room, a large modern fitted kitchen, and a landscaped rear garden with a large patio area which is accessible through the kitchen via and/or the reception room. The ground floor also benefits a downstairs bath room.
Furthermore, the first floor offers two good sized double bedrooms. Internally this property offers plenty of space and provides the opportunity for a growing family to transform the property into a perfect family home. There is also the potential to extend STPP.

Location:
New Eltham is a sought after suburb of South East London, located within the Royal Borough of Greenwich. The property is located conveniently adjacent for Eltham and Chislehurst High Streets. Eltham High Street contains many nationwide brands such as Marks & Spencer, Costa Coffee as well as a fine range of restaurants of varied cuisine, pubs and a popular, and newly developed six-screen cinema complex with a Nando's, Pizza Express and a sky bar within.

For the commuters, there is a direct train line from either of Eltham (which is approximately 10 minutes walk away), New Eltham or Mottingham Station, serving Lewisham (for DLR), London Bridge, Charing Cross, Cannon Street, Waterloo East and Victoria. Buses connect to all neighbouring towns with Woolwich Arsenal and Lewisham both benefitting from DLR services and Woolwich soon to include Crossrail (2018). For roads in and out of London you have the South Circular, A2/A102 (Blackwell Tunnel Approach), A20 and Rochester Way.

The Royal borough of Greenwich is renowned for being one of the greenest in London, offering a range of open parkland and recreational activities for the whole family to enjoy. Eltham Park South with its tennis courts, play park and tea hut is almost opposite whilst further along Glenesk Road is Eltham Park North, with a duck pond flanked by the ancient Oxleas Wood. The Well Hall Pleasance is a park within the former grounds of the Tudor Barn, now a pub/restaurant with the grounds doubling up as an open-air cinema in the summer months. Eltham Palace is adjacent to the High Street, once the childhood home to Henry VIII and the family home to the Courtaulds, now a national heritage site and one of the country's finest Art Deco homes often used as a backdrop in period dramas. Neighbouring is Eltham Warren Golf Course, one of two in the wider area, The Royal Blackheath being the oldest golf club in England.

The property briefly comprises of two reception rooms, a sizeable kitchen, three generous sized bedrooms and a three piece family bathroom suite.

The well tended, stocked and quite private, sunny Westerly facing rear garden has a variety of plants and shrubs, rose garden and fruit trees.

Set well back from the road, this is a rare opportunity to purchase one of these deceptively spacious three bedroom terraced houses within close proximity of all amenities. Eltham station and the landscaped grounds of The Pleasaunce are within about three quarters of a mile or so, a wide variety of shops close to hand on Well Hall road which is well served by bus routes and sought-after St.Thomas More Catholic primary school under half a mile away.

detailedDescription:
A spacious and well presented, three double bedroom, Victorian family home, located in the Halstow school catchment area. This fabulous family house has high ceilings and retains some original Period features. Located close to great transport links and being sold Chain Free.

The property which is being sold chain free comprises a double aspect lounge with high ceilings, picture rails and original ceiling rose, double glazed bay window to the front, two open fireplaces, and double glazed French doors to the rear. There is a spacious kitchen/diner opening into a conservatory/sun room and access to a good size family friendly garden with lawn and patio, great for entertaining and al Fresco dining. To the first floor is the spacious master bedroom with a period fireplace, double glazed windows and built in storage, two further double bedrooms and a family bathroom. There is also potential to extend into the loft (STPP).

The property lies within the Halstow school catchment area and just minutes from East Greenwich Pleasaunce park, one of Greenwich's Green Flag Award-winning sites with a Café’ and children’s playground. Locally you are only a short walk to Westcombe Park mainline station (London Bridge, Cannon Street and Thameslink). There is also easy access to the Jubilee Line at North Greenwich. Local shopping facilities at Charlton retail park are just a short walk with a variety of shops including Sainsbury's superstore, M&S and Ikea. Greenwich Centre facilities which include a gym, gp, library and swimming pool and other amenities on the Greenwich Peninsula are nearby.

Energy Efficiency Rating C.

title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
This stunning home is well presented and finished to a high standard throughout. It is well configured for contemporary living with plenty of natural light and storage.
The home has a bright and airy feel with shutters for privacy and airflow, whilst still being cosy in the colder months. This home has recently been redecorated and is well very maintained. The ground floor has an open plan feel and layout with a spacious living area, perfect for entertaining family and friends.
The galley-style kitchen benefits from new worktops, an extra-large sink, and a stylish faucet. It is modern and highly functional with plenty of space for food preparation with wall-mounted units. It further benefits from a very new 5-ring gas hob and electric oven.
The bathroom is clean and modern consisting of a three-piece suite with a shower over the bath and a heated towel rail.
The boiler is brand new with a 10-year warranty, the kitchen and bathroom both benefit from strong water pressure.
Upstairs, there are two spacious double bedrooms with the second bedroom currently being used as a home office. The bedrooms both benefit from plenty of natural light and have fitted wardrobes and shelving.
There is also ample additional storage in the loft. The attic has been fully floored and serves as an excellent large storage space.
Roof has also been well maintained and just recently serviced. The home has brass hardware throughout. There is also potential to extend (STPP) as many of the long-term neighbours have done.
The options for entertaining are further enhanced by the rear enclosed private garden with a shed and newly installed decked area. Perfect for enjoying the warmer weather plus a safe space for children and pets to play. The garden also benefits from several delicious fruit trees and has an area great for home-growing veggies!
This house is in a sought-after location on a quiet no-through street. There are excellent transport links with Maze Hill Station providing links to London Bridge and St Pancreas as well as local bus routes and the ferry. There is an array of local amenities including three supermarkets, Greenwich Royal park, the River Thames, Canary Wharf, the O2, and many great pubs, bars, cafes, and eateries.
The home is available with no chain. Viewings here are a must!

detailedDescription:
With a private entrance and spanning 1,076 sq. Ft is this impressive two double bedroom, two bathroom, apartment occupying the entire lower ground floor of this magnificent double fronted detached Victorian house located just moments from the heath, Greenwich Park and Blackheath Standard.

The property is in excellent decorative order with sash windows, plantation shutters and gas fired central heating.

The accommodation comprises: A large central entrance hall, a huge 24'9 x 14'11 open plan lounge diner with bay window and an attractive modern kitchen with island and breakfast bar. There is a huge 17'0 x 14'10 master bedroom with bay window and stylish modern ensuite shower room, a very large 14'10 x 12'8 second double bedroom and a modern bathroom. There is also a separate utility/laundry room. To the rear is a superb and vast landscape communal garden.

The property is sold with a share of the freehold
This is an impressive apartment and is sold chain free. Immediate viewing is essential.

The property is very convenient for transport links with Blackheath train station (0.7 miles) and Westcombe Park station (0.62 miles) nearby and buses stopping for North Greenwich tube station (1.8 miles). Blackheath Common, (100 yards miles), and Royal Greenwich Park (500 metres) are both just a short walk. Blackheath Village with its array of boutiques, restaurants, bars, and farmers market is just a few minutes' walk and the daily conveniences of Blackheath Standard including M&S food hall only 200 yards away.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This spacious apartment has been completely renovated by the current owner and features an impressive reception room with attractive parquet flooring and original period features including a fireplace and a large sash window that overlooks the stunning communal gardens. Down the hall is the stylish shaker style kitchen with integrated AEG appliances and a white stone worktop. There are two double bedrooms and a modern tiled bathroom. Upstairs is the third double bedroom, a beautiful en-suite with a bath and walk-in shower and two large store rooms that would be ideal as a utility room and walk-in wardrobe. There is use of an amazing south facing communal garden, off street parking, a garage and a handy private store cupboard in the basement.

Blackheath Park is a picturesque, tree lined street found on the prestigious Cator Estate. Quite literally at the end of the road you will find Blackheath Village with its array of shops, cafes, bars and restaurants. In addition to these amenities, the Conservatoire is a family friendly hub of the local community offering art, drama and music classes as well as hosting various events. On the north side of the village is the open heath which is a jewel of South East London and makes an idyllic recreation area with Greenwich Royal Park beyond. Blackheath station is ideal for commuting into town with regular services in to London Bridge (13 minutes), Charing Cross, Cannon Street and London Victoria. One stop down the line will bring you to Lewisham Station where the DLR provides regular services into Canary Wharf and Bank. Those who are considering schools will have a number of options for both state and public education. Local schools include the hugely popular and Ofsted Outstanding Brooklands Primary School, Heath House, Blackheath Preparatory School and The Pointers School. Further afield, Eltham and Dulwich Colleges run a bus service directly from Blackheath Village

Spacious, modern, one bedroom apartment, situated on the second floor of a sought after well maintained purpose built block in the heart of the Greenwich Peninsula.

Internally the property offers spacious accommodation throughout, comprising; a 22 foot open plan reception room with a fitted, sleek and modern kitchen and access to your private balcony. A large double bedroom with built in wardrobes, partial river views and further access to your balcony. A three piece modern bathroom suite and a large storage cupboard complete this wonderful apartment.

The Fulmar building has the benefit of its own roof terrace where you can enjoy some stunning views of London whilst you relax. There is a concierge service and gymnasium available for residents to utilise.

Located on Greenwich Peninsula with the unique benefit of its own parkland, including the thriving Ecology Park, and the landscaped Central Park running the length of the Peninsula. The river Thames and Greenwich Yacht Club, Golf Range and the O2 with its array of bars and restaurants. There is also excellent local transport links with easy access to Canary Wharf and the Jubilee Line as well as Westfield Shopping Centre, the West End and City Airport.

detailedDescription:
Guide Price £1,100,000-£1,150,000. This beautifully presented and wonderfully bright and airy Victorian house is set over three floors with superb living space and flexible accommodation. The reception room has wooden floors, a lovely period fireplace and shutters, and double doors that can be closed to create a third bedroom if one wishes. The dining room leads onto a lovely contemporary kitchen which opens onto a stunning 40' landscaped garden, perfect for enjoying some sunny weather and alfresco dining. The two bedrooms on the top floor are a good size and have built-in wardrobes with the larger having wooden floors and fireplace. The house benefits from having a family bathroom on the top floor as well as a shower room on the ground floor. There is also a study area on the lower ground floor which is great for remote working. The property is offered in excellent decorative order, perfect for a young family or professionals looking for a readymade home on one of the area's most desirable roads.

Situation
Guildford Grove is located in the Ashburnham Triangle and joins Devonshire Drive to Egerton Drive. Greenwich Mainline and DLR Station is just moments away making it the ideal location for anyone working in either the City or Canary Wharf while there are also direct connections to Kings Cross and Luton Airport. All the shops, bars and restaurants of Greenwich are nearby as are the open spaces and historic buildings at Greenwich Park.

detailedDescription:
EWS1 certificate in place and no remedial works required

** Video Tours & Physical Viewings Available (Subject to Gov’ Guidelines being followed) **

Well presented one double bedroom sixth floor apartment with private balcony, set within a modern purpose built development, superbly situated close to excellent transport links and amenities. The property offers bright and spacious, well laid out accommodation with stylish interiors finished to a high standard throughout, including a beautiful open plan reception/kitchen with access out onto the balcony. Further features include district heating (via both radiators and heat recovery ventilation system), double glazing, recessed lighting, quality floor coverings, ample inbuilt storage, attractive communal gardens, concierge services, residents' gym and long lease.

Accommodation comprises entrance hall with inbuilt storage cupboard and access to useful bonus utility room, leading into the bright and spacious open plan reception/kitchen with wide double glazed window and access out onto the balcony. The kitchen area comprises a modern range of matching wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, electric induction hob with overhead extractor and electric oven, and further space for appliances. There is a spacious double bedroom with a useful inbuilt wardrobe, and a stylish bathroom with modern suite and elegant tiling.

The property is located within just a short distance of the Woolwich Ferry, as well as Woolwich Dockyard, Woolwich Arsenal and Plumstead stations offering DLR and mainline services to Central London, Canary Wharf and the City. The banks of the Thames are nearby providing pleasant riverside walks, and there are a variety of shops and amenities within a short distance.

Ideal as either a first time or investment purchase, viewings of this stunning property are highly recommended - please click 'brochure link' to book instantly!

Lease Information

We understand the lease on the property is 980 remaining. All prospective purchasers are advised to make their own enquiries and verify this information with a solicitor.

Service Charges

We understand the service charge on the property is circa £2000 p/a and the ground rent being £300 p/a. All prospective purchasers are advised to make their own enquiries and verify this information with a solicitor.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

address: No 5, 2 Cutter Lane, Upper Riverside, Greenwich Peninsula SE10
detailedDescription:
An absolutely super 12th floor 2 bedroom home, enjoying direct river views from both it's decked balconies off the reception and main bedroom. There are floor to ceiling windows throughout providing sight of that gorgeous Eastern sunrise and river aspect, and an abundance of natural light. From the engineered wood flooring with underfloor heating, to the smart fitted kitchen and bathrooms, this apartment offers quality and style throughout.

The interior was designed by Knight Dragon, and has been inspired by the river, the rich palette reflects the natural materials found on the water's edge. The stained oak engineered wood floor with underfloor heating, complements the kitchen cabinetry and there are two very smart bathrooms with porcelain wall and floor tiling. Both generous double bedrooms, overlook the river, and both have fitted wardrobes, the master bedroom having a stunning en suite. If you are still working from home there is ample space for a desk, and hopefully you won't get too distracted by the views.

Living in Upper Riverside is much more than living in your own individual apartment, you are part of something much greater. This stunning family of five light filled, glass and stone towers, with roof gardens cascading to the edge of the Thames, occupies one of the best riverside locations in London.

You will become part of the exclusive Upper Riverside Club, think of it as a relaxed, unstuffy and welcoming members club, with private access to the gyms, steam room and spa pool, a 15th floor swimming pool with panoramic views, rooftop terraces, shared spaces, cinema and more.

The gardens connected to the riverfront will have some fantastic restaurants, river cafes, retail outlets and lively public spaces, including London's first linear park, 'The Tide'. Upper Riverside neighbourhood links to Peninsula Square with access to North Greenwich Underground (Jubilee Line), 2 Mins to Canary Wharf and 8 Mins to London Bridge! The O2, with it's numerous international restaurants, Icon Designer outlet and buzzy social areas, and the soon to be completed Design District, are all within a few minutes walk of your home.
Nb: Some photographs used are of the Building 5 show apartment and any CGi's used are for indicative purposes only.

address: No.5, 2 Cutter Lane, Upper Riverside, Greenwich Peninsula SE10
detailedDescription:
Super First Time Purchase, an amazing 9th floor apartment with its own private balcony overlooking landscaped gardens. A stylish and spacious one bedroom home in the last building to be completed in the Upper Riverside neighbourhood. Floor to ceiling windows fill the home with natural light. The stained oak engineered wood floor with underfloor heating, complements the kitchen cabinetry and there is a very smart bathroom with porcelain wall and floor tiling. The kitchen is fully fitted, there is a smart bathroom and the useful utilities cupboard houses the washer/dryer.

Riverside living is more than just your home, Greenwich Peninsula gives residents places and spaces to connect with your neighbours and really become a community, with events organised by the lifestyle manager, exhibitions at the Now Gallery, Farmers markets, seasonal craft markets and a summer of activities.

Find this home in No. 5 Upper Riverside, designed by world-famous architects som, the 5 prism towers cascade along the riverfront. Located 300m from North Greenwich bus and tube station, adjacent to the Emirates Air Line and opposite North Greenwich Pier, transport links are readily available. Greenwich Peninsula is a growing community wrapped by a mile and a half of the river. A community that's bustling with new restaurants, cafes and retail, here you'll find all the necessities of a contemporary lifestyle.

detailedDescription:
This lovely home is well presented and finished to a high standard throughout. The home is well configured for modern living and has plenty of natural light. The kitchen is highly functional and has plenty of storage in the base and wall-mounted units. The living space is spacious and great for spending quality time with friends and family or enjoying individual pursuits. The home benefits from two spacious bedrooms with space for additional furniture. The master bedroom further benefits from a modern three-piece en suite with a walk-in shower. The main bathroom is also modern and consists of a three-piece suite with a bathtub. The home is set in extensive, well-maintained grounds to which all residents have access, and the on-site leisure club offers a swimming pool, exercise room, and tennis courts.

The home benefits from allocated parking and has excellent transport links including fast access to the A2. There is a bus stop immediately outside the development and Woolwich Arsenal DLR and train stations are just a 10-minute ride away. There is an array of local amenities close by including bars, cafes, eateries, green spaces, and Shooters Hill Golf Club. Viewings here are a must!

title: 2 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
A beautifully presented, rarely available, double-fronted Victorian townhouse situated on this pretty tree-lined road, close to Blackheath Village and within the Blackheath Conservation area. This stunning home has been tastefully and sympathetically renovated by the current owners.
The central hall gives access to a Dining room/library to the right and a lovely living room to the left, both fitted with solid oak flooring. The stylish and spacious bespoke, hand made kitchen enjoys direct access to the secluded and welcoming courtyard style garden. The kitchen also has access to the large wine cellar.

There is a WC on the half landing with marble tiling and a door out to a south west facing private roof terrace. Upstairs are two double bedrooms, both with attractive built in wardrobes and a luxuriously remodelled marble tiled bathroom and freestanding iron bath. Two further double bedrooms are found on the top floor along with a modern marble tiled shower room.

Quentin Road is a quiet road, tucked away in a pretty area conveniently located for Blackheath station. Blackheath Village, where you will find an array of shops, independent cafes and restaurants is just a few hundred metres away. Beyond the village you will find the open expanse of the heath itself, and Greenwich Park, which are jewels of South East London. Blackheath station is ideal for commuting into town with regular services in to London Bridge, Charing Cross, Cannon Street and London Victoria. One stop down the line will bring you to Lewisham Station where the DLR provides regular services into Canary Wharf and Bank. Energy Efficiency Rating E.

detailedDescription:
We are delighted to offer this superbly presented three bedroom, split level apartment measuring 1,000 sqft that features a large balcony and secure underground parking.
In outstanding condition throughout, the third and fourth floor property briefly comprises of a wonderful 27ft open plan kitchen living room, with floor to ceiling windows and door onto a large west facing balcony. The kitchen area is fully equipped to a high specification with all the appliances that one would expect. There is also a very useful utility storage cupboard and separate WC. From the welcoming entrance hallway the two generously sized double bedrooms and further single bedroom can be found, along with the family bathroom, which is again finished to a high standard. It is worth mentioning that the main two bedrooms have built in wardrobes, along with two smaller storage cupboards from the hallway. As mentioned, the property comes with secure underground parking and also has underfloor heating throughout. The development has a management office and the property is being offered chain free.
Greenwich Square is an immensely popular development found in East Greenwich, on the corner of Vanbrugh Hill and Woolwich Road. Greenwich leisure centre, with pool and gym is found onsite, along with a Public Library and an array of shops and a doctors surgery. The property is also equidistance to either Maze Hill or Westcombe Park mainline rail. The town centre and Royal Park are also close by. Your earliest viewing is recommended.

detailedDescription:
Spanning in excess of 1000 sq.ft and direct access onto a huge and beautiful 130ft communal garden, is this impressive three bedroom apartment occupying found on the hall floor of this impressive detached Victorian house.

The property is in excellent decorative order with high ceilings, period features, wood flooring, stunning fireplaces, cornicing, ample storage, gas fired central heating, radiator covers and sash windows.

Set on the raised ground (hall) floor, the accommodation comprises; a very large 17'7 x 15'9 reception room with alcove storage and large bay window with window seat and a large kitchen breakfast room with wooden worktops and direct access to balcony and steps down to the garden. There is a huge 15'5 x 12'8 dual aspect master bedroom, two further bedrooms and a modern bathroom with separate WC. To the rear is a fantastic 130ft walled communal garden, an external strorage cupboard and there is off street parking to the front.

This is a wonderful apartment, and your immediate viewing is essential. Video tours can be seen at

The property is very convenient for transport links with buses stopping for Blackheath Station, 0.7 miles, Greenwich and North Greenwich, 1.9 miles. Blackheath Common, (0.4 miles), and Greenwich Park, (0.8 miles), are both just a short walk and Blackheath Village with its array or restaurants, bars and boutique shops is only 0.6 miles.

detailedDescription:
Truepenny's are delighted to bring to the market this 3 bedroom terraced house situated on a quiet residential street in Westcombe Park.

The property stretches over four floors with two double bedrooms on the first floor and the loft converted into a third bedroom on the second floor.

The sleek and modern kitchen extends out into the second reception room with large double doors that open to a large private rear garden. The property also benefits from natural wooden flooring which covers the entirety of the ground floor, as well as a good size cellar on the lower ground floor.

The property is in the perfect location for several primary schools and also Blackheath High School, making it the ideal family home.

In an ideal location for transport links, the property is just a 5 minute walk from Westcombe Park station with trains to London Charing Cross and Cannon Street.

Also close to the property is a bus stop, where you can catch the 422 for 12 minutes to North Greenwich for the 02 and Jubilee line, or alternatively the 286 that takes you to Greenwich in 16 minutes.

detailedDescription:
A beautifully presented bright apartment located on the 5th floor of this popular apartment block within the Royal Arsenal Riverside. A landmark development, situated adjacent to the river, east of Greenwich.

Boasting a bright open plan fully integrated high gloss modern white kitchen and reception room with warehouse style exposed brickwork, a sizeable bedroom with fitted wardrobes and overlooking the communal gardens and a three piece bathroom suite with shower over bath and good storage. The reception area leads onto a good size balcony overlooking the communal garden space with tranquil water features and stunning greenery.

Situated within one of London's most up and coming areas and renowned riverside development and a stones throw from the very popular restaurants bars and public houses. Woolwich Town Centre offers an array of main street shopping and a vibrant high street market.

Woolwich Arsenal station is within 0.2 miles for the South-eastern, Thameslink and DLR, City Airport is within 7 minutes away, Buses to North Greenwich for Jubilee Line are in abundance as well as the Thames Clipper or a more luxurious journey into the city. The Woolwich Ferry South Pier is also under 0.5 miles. The Cross Rail due to complete soon will be on your door step.

Further amenities include easy access to Greenwich and Blackheath for further bars, pubs and restaurants as well as endless green spaces such as Oxleas Woods, Woolwich and Plumstead Common and both Blackheath and Greenwich Park.

Onsite the development you will find:

* 24 Concierge & Security
* Residents Only Gym
* Body Workshop Health & Wellbeing Centre
* Two Youngs "gastro pubs" The Dial Arch & The Guardhouse
* Con Gusto Italian Restaurant
* Craft Beer & Pizzeria, The Taproom
* Four on site cafés
* Health Centre
* Chemist
* Dentist
* Tesco Express
* M&S Food Hall
* Sainsburys Local
* Dry Cleaning service
* Zipcar Car Sharing Club
* Residents Website
* Fortnightly Farmers Market

Location

You’d be hard pushed to find a town more steeped in maritime history than Greenwich. Its Thames-side location is joined by the Cutty Sark and the National Maritime Museum. Greenwich Park is a Royal open space featuring the Royal Observatory and the prime meridian line.
The town centre is known for its craft and antiques markets, with bars, restaurants and the ‘Up The Creek’ comedy club attracting residents, tourists and Greenwich University students alike.

title: 4 bed terraced house for sale

address: Kidbrooke Park Road, Blackheath, London SE3
detailedDescription:
A stunning and spacious four bedroom semi-detached family home with an outstanding 120ft garden and garage, located close to Blackheath Village, mainline station and the heath and sold chain free.

The property is in excellent decorative order with solid oak flooring, fireplaces, ceiling recessed speakers, halogen lighting, double glazed window, gas fired central heating and partial underfloor heating.

The accommodation briefly comprises; entrance hall with downstairs cloakroom (WC), a 14'11 x 14'6 living room with bay window and feature fireplace with brick surround and a superb 12'5 kitchen diner to the rear. The attractive modern kitchen has wooden worktops, breakfast bar and integrated appliances including wine cooler. Upstairs are four bedrooms including a large 14'7 x 10'6 master with built in wardrobes and a modern family bathroom with jacuzzi bath. To the rear and with side access is, is a huge 120ft garden with large terrace, extensive lawn, mature shrubs, flower beds and storage shed. There is also a garage to the side via a shared driveway and off street parking to the front for several cars.

This is a wonderful family home with excellent potential for further extensions (STPP) and is sold chain free. Your immediate viewing is essential. Video tours can be seen at .

Kidbrooke Park Road is a popular road and the house is located just 580 metres from the newly rebuilt Kidbrooke Mainline station. Just 17 minutes to London Bridge with trains also running to Charing Cross, Victoria and Cannon Street. There is also easy access to bus routes which will take you to North Greenwich for the Jubilee line. The property is 650 metres from the new and prestigious Kidbrooke Village and 0.71 miles to Blackheath Village (one stop on train) with its array of boutique shops, bars, restaurants and farmers market. There are many parks and green open spaces to enjoy, including Hornfair Park (with the Charlton Lido, cafe, tennis courts and bmx track within its bounds), Charlton House (gardens, play area and skate park), Oxleas Woods, Shrewsbury Park and nearest of all Blackheath Common and Greenwich Park.

The current vendors have provided us with some background and thoughts on there their experience in the property which we feel would be very helpful to any perspective purchaser:

Bought as a couple in 2012 and it was our 2nd house purchase in London. We quickly learned that the area was a special find. Close enough to London bridge, Canary Wharf, Charing Cross but also had Blackheath and Greenwich on the door step.

As a couple the pull of the village with pubs, restaurants and farmers market was always only 20 mins away. As a family Greenwich park was a favourite being only a 25 min walk. The soft play and Sutcliffe centre as well as David Lloyd Gym all a short walking distance was a huge benefit. Shops are also convenient - the garage and shops around the corner (including post office). There is a small Sainsbury's, M&S and most recently B&M and Aldi.

When we purchased the house we were looking for space and that we got! The house has a 120ft Garden and boasts a large cheery tree as well as pear and apple tree along with many mature plants, shrubs and flowers. The patio area was paved in 2016 and quickly became our outdoor dining area over the summer as it captures the sun all day. There is also a cherry blossom tree in the front area and is the key focal point from the master bedroom.

We tried to respect the feel of the house maintaining the front door, internal doors handles and fireplaces. There is a stained glass window on the stairs which brings a huge amount of natural light to the landing. Modern kitchen and bathroom and wood floors throughout. There is a pull down ladder to the attic's and its floored with significant standing room and storage space. There are fireplaces in the living room, dining area, and two larger bedrooms. It is a four bedroom property and we used them as a master, spare, office (for important work from home space) and nursery.

Great neighbours with a mixture of retired and young families and great community spirit. Happy to take deliveries for each other, socialise, each other's security, even putting bins out becomes a shared chore. Great schools in the area. Also small crèche and preschool five doors up the road.
title: 4 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
This charming four bedroom house is located just moments away from oxleas woods, shooters hill golf course & shrewsbury park and offers ample living space perfect for home working.

Internally the property briefly comprises to the ground floor two bright and airy reception rooms and a sizeable kitchen/diner with two storage cupboards. As you ascend to the first floor you are welcomed by three double bedrooms with the master bedroom boasting its own private en-suite shower room and a family bathroom suite completes the floor. On the second and final floor you will find a further bedroom.

This charming home is nestled on one of the highest points in London, and offers ample bus links in to Greenwich, Blackheath Village and Woolwich for the DLR, so you can take advantage of the outstanding train links to City Airport in just two stops, bars, cafés and shopping facilities. You are also surrounded by many green spaces including the historic Oxleas Woods with a hidden Italian Café, Eaglesfield Recreation Ground and Shooters Hill Golf Course. The iconic Serverndroog Castle is only a short walk away so you can enjoy breath taking views of London and enjoy the newly refurbished tea rooms. Lastly this property will also benefit from the Crossrail Connection from Woolwich, which will take you into Tottenham Court Road within 25 minutes and London Heathrow within 40 minutes once completed.

Stunning three bedroom three storey town house situated on the popular Millennium Village development close to the Millennium Primary School (Ofsted rated ‘Outstanding’) and the Ecology Park. The property offers spacious accommodation with lots of light, dual aspect reception, double doors opening to the rear garden, modern fitted kitchen, downstairs cloakroom, the first floor offers two double bedrooms and family bathroom with the top floor boasting a master suite with built in storage. The development offers residents' parking in a secure block and 24hr concierge service, sold with no onward chain.

The 02 arena with an array of restaurants and bars and Greenwich Peninsular shopping park is close by, there is a superb local transport network into Canary Wharf (3 min), London Bridge (10 min), Waterloo (15 min), Stratford and the West End via North Greenwich Station on the Jubilee line, City airport is also within easy access.

location

You’d be hard pushed to find a town more steeped in maritime history than Greenwich. Its Thames-side location is joined by the Cutty Sark and the National Maritime Museum. Greenwich Park is a Royal open space featuring the Royal Observatory and the prime meridian line.
The town centre is known for its craft and antiques markets, with bars, restaurants and the ‘Up The Creek’ comedy club attracting residents, tourists and Greenwich University students alike.

detailedDescription:
Purple Bricks are delighted to present this beautiful 4 bedroom semi-detached family home in close proximity to Plumstead station.

This property has been renovated to a very high standard, and is suitable for a growing family. The property comprises of a nice generous hallway, to the right a modern and fully fitted kitchen/diner with direct access to a utility room and rear garden. To the left is a great size through lounge/dining room which also provides access to the rear garden. To the rear of the property is a great sized family bathroom with a fully fitted white suite. Upstairs, there are 4 good sized bedrooms, with the master bedroom a fabulous sized en-suite. There is a fantastic generous split level garden.

The property is surrounded by a wealth of green spaces, including Woolwich Common, Shrewsbury Park and Oxleas Wood. The property is situated in close proximity to Falconwood and Woolwich Arsenal Station. Its also in close proximity to Christ Church Primary School which is rated Ofstead outstanding.
Viewing is highly recommended.

title: 4 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
Upon entering this characterful family home you are greeted by a large open plan living room that offers both a flexible and versatile living space.
With plenty of room for large sofas as well as a dining or study area, this room offers an abundance of entertaining space and scope to accommodate the whole family. Moving to the rear of the property is a generous kitchen, with plenty of room for a dining table, and beyond this is a handy utility area that leads out onto the back garden. A convenient W.C. Completes this ground floor.

Upstairs are three good sized double bedrooms, with the main bedroom being positioned at the front of the property and boasts three windows that flood the room with natural light. Next to this is another good sized bedroom that enjoys views onto the garden. Finally, the third bedroom is positioned at the rear of the house and benefits from an en-suite bathroom. In addition, there is also a family bathroom that serves the entire floor. Many houses on the road have converted the loft so we believe this will be possible sttp, in addition, the sellers inform us that the loft has been partially converted already and features two Velux windows.

Eastcombe Avenue is ideally located for the ‘outstanding’ Sherington Primary School and Invicta Primary. A stroll along Charlton Road brings you to Charlton Park which is one of Greenwich's Green Flag Award-winning sites. The house is also conveniently located for access to various local amenities; with Westcombe Park station being less than half a mile away which provides regular services into London Bridge and Cannon Street. Alternatively, two stops away, Greenwich Station's DLR runs to Bank and Canary Wharf. Charlton station is also a short walk away with direct trains to Charing Cross and St Pancras. Also, close by is Greenwich Bugsby Way Retail Park and Blackheath Standard both have a Marks & Spencer Food Hall amongst a variety of large stores, independent shops and cafés.

title: 3 bed end terrace house for sale

detailedDescription:
A spectacular four double bedroom, four bathroom, four storey modern home with direct access to a double garage and set within the prestigious Blackheath quarter development opposite David Lloyd and very close to Kidbrooke Station.

This stunning house has under floor heating, double glazing, led lighting, feature glazed landings, solid wood doors and solid oak flooring. On the ground floor the impressive entrance hall opens onto a huge luxury fitted kitchen/dining room/family room, a utility room, downstairs cloakroom, and large storage cupboards. On the first floor there is a large living room with a south facing balcony, a large double bedroom with direct access to the rear terrace and a large modern bathroom. The second floor provides two further large double bedrooms, both with ensuite and the master having extensive built in wardrobes and south facing balcony. On the top floor there is a sunroom opening out onto a wonderful south facing roof terrace and a fourth double bedroom with ensuite shower room. There is a courtyard patio garden on the ground floor with direct access to a double garage and stairs up to a large rear terrace on the first floor. In the block opposite there is a 24 hour concierge, a gym, swimming pool and cinema room. There are beautifully landscaped gardens and ponds with local shops and Sutcliffe Park nearby.

This is an outstanding home and your immediate viewing is a must. There is no chain. Video tours can be seen at .

Tizzard Grove is part of the exclusive Blackheath Quarter of Kidbrooke Village - a new and vibrant London community which offers an outstanding choice of quality, sustainable new homes.

As well as high end apartments and houses, it will offer new parks, shops, bars, restaurants, schools, sports, healthcare and community facilities. Within 200 yards is a Sainsbury's local, a newly opened restaurant, pharmacy, convenience store and coffee shop. Sutcliffe Park with beautifully landscaped wetlands, sports facilities and ponds is just a few hundred yards away as is the new Cator park which has been created as part of Kidbrooke Village, including a large children's adventure play area and a multi-use games area. Blackheath Village, with its array of boutique shops, bars and restaurants, is also close by.
Transport links to central London are excellent with travel to London Bridge in just 15 minutes from nearby rebuilt Kidbrooke station. Direct trains to Victoria, Charing Cross, Waterloo East and Cannon Street also run from here.

Located in Kidbrooke Village, this flat benefits from a close proximity to Blackheath for a wealth of bars, restaurants and shops. Blackheath station is also close by offering frequent services into central London.

Pattinson Auction are working in Partnership with the marketing agent on this online auction sale and are referred to below as 'The Auctioneer'.

Auctioneers Additional Comments

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Superbly located for all of the attractions that North Greenwich has to offer, comes this one bedroom apartment with the added benefit of an up to date EWS1 certification.

The apartment is located on the second floor and comprises large entrance hall with built in storage cupboards, double bedroom with built in wardrobes, contemporary bathroom and an open plan fitted kitchen / reception room with access onto a balcony with far reaching views.

North Greenwich is close by with its excellent transport links: Jubilee Line, River Boat service and Westcombe Park. The peninsula is also home to the O2 arena and many restaurants.

Early viewings are highly recommended.
features: ['1 Bedroom', '1 Bathroom', '2nd Floor modern apartment', 'Balcony', 'Light and spacious', 'Approx. 645 sq ft (59.9 sq m)', 'Close to Jubilee Line for easy access into City and Canary Wharf', 'EWS1 Compliant', 'EPC: B']
title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
An amazing opportunity for cash buyers looking for a buy to let or a London pied-a-terre!

"Initially we bought the flat as it provided a great location for a quick and easy commute into the centre of London using public transport, the mainline station being just a five minutes’ walk away and North Greenwich tube station is a short bus ride away. The flat is light and airy and surprisingly spacious with two large bedrooms and there is plenty of internal storage. But what really sold it to us were the views across London from all of windows. With the afternoon sun the flat is well lit and warm throughout the year, and did I mention the views, especially as the sun goes down and at night to be able to see London lit up in front of you.

The flat is on the top floor of the building and also provides a great view of Charlton’s football pitch.

The building itself is clean and well maintained with a secure entry system and in the last year the flat has been fitted with a sprinkler system and new hot water/heating system. Being on the top floor there are only 2 other flats and so it is very quiet.

There are numerous shops, supermarkets and a cinema within walking distance of the flat plus several green parks and the Thames river walk to enjoy and of course the O2 with all of its own attractions.

Work circumstances have changed and it is time to move away but we have enjoyed our time in the flat and the Charlton area – and of course the views."

As the vendor says, this flat is so large and light, and views just take your breath away!

Chain free and highly recommended!<br /><br />
title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Quietly situated at the very end of Blackheath Park a rare, one of just nineteen, Eric Lyons T2AX design houses, built by 'Span' in 1967. It has full double glazing and gas fired central heating.

The brilliance of this design, which is one of the largest of the three bedroom/two storey 'Span' houses at almost 1000sq ft, is the versatile ground floor accommodation with an extra room, (an ideal home office) and downstairs cloakroom that project into the courtyard front garden. This is in itself a very pleasing feature of this design, being enclosed & south-facing and into which floor-to-ceiling windows of the reception room look. At the other end of this through room, windows and a glazed door open onto the garden at the rear, which is brick paved and has a door to the single garage.

Park End is the furthest point of Blackheath Park, a pleasant 10 minute walk to Blackheath station and slightly closer to the Heath via Morden Road.

The Accommodation Comprises:
Entrance Hall ● Cloakroom ● Study/Bedroom 4 ●Through Reception Room ● Kitchen ● Three Bedrooms ● Bathroom ● Enclosed Front & Rear Gardens ● Single Garage ● Double Glazed Windows ● Central Heating ● No Chain
features: ['Private garden', 'Single garage']
title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
**chain free**private parking**separate kitchen**transport links**virtual tour available**

This spacious recently decorated two bedroom maisonette, in the heart of Mottingham village is only a stones throw away from Mottingham station. The property offers two good sized bedrooms, separate reception, fully fitted kitchen, laminate flooring throughout, three piece bathroom suite and entry points at the front and rear of the property. The property also boasts, gas central heating, double glazed windows, residents parking and would suit both first time buyers or investors. Mottingham Station provides direct and easy access to London Bridge, Waterloo East and Charring Cross Stations. Mottingham has plenty of local amenities and is also the home to the prestigious Eltham College (Top 30 independent Secondary Schools, The Sunday Times). Please call now to arrange a viewing.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Desirable Pavilion Square in the prestigious Royal Arsenal Riverside development by Berkeley on the 4th floor . The property is an ideal family home with ample living space or good for working professionals with good links to Canary Wharf and the City.

The property is located in a secure building with restricted access and comprises:

Two bedrooms of which one has a modern en suite with bath, one bedroom overlooks the communal gardens of Pavilion Square and the other overlooks the Maribor Park,

A common modern second bathroom which is accessible from the hall,

Spacious open-plan kitchen/living area with an adjacent hall which is multi-purpose,

Utility cupboard & ample storage, and

A large spacious balcony that oversees the Maribor park .

To the outside are landscaped communal gardens with water features to one side and the Maribor Park to the other side. The flat also comes with a secure underground cycle storage room & gated underground parking (right to park) in the same building.

The flat is close to

- local amenities (Local Tesco, Sainsbury’s, Lidl and M&S Foodhall) are a couple of minutes away,

- the development has an onsite gp practice, Dental surgery, and nursery/day care

- close to bus routes and a 5 min walk away from the Woolwich Arsenal train station (DLR, South Eastern and ThamesLink services) and a couple of mins away from the forthcoming Elizabeth line Crossrail station. The Thames Clipper service also is close by with the Woolwich station being a few minutes walk away

- schools catchment area,

- close to a number of local parks and the Thames River walking path which is only a couple of minutes away.

A viewing is highly recommended.

The property benefits from the following at no additional cost

- A 24 hour concierge service

- access to the Waterside Club with the following facilities,

- well equipped resident's only gymnasium and exercise studio,

- 20m swimming pool,

- spa pool, steam room, and sauna

- massage treatment rooms

- his and her changing rooms with showers and lockers

- large cinema room with a kitchen.

These facilities are located in Pavilion square - same as the flat.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This 1,349 square foot 3 bedroom apartment is situated on the 2nd floor and comprises open plan kitchen/living dining with direct access to a south facing private terrace. Main bedroom with built in wardrobes and ensuite shower room also has direct access to the terrace, two further double bedrooms, both with wardrobes and one with study area, separate contemporary bathroom and ample storage throughout.

Located in Thamesmead, SE2, Southmere is a collection of one, two and three-bedroom apartments situated close to Abbey Wood station and the wide open spaces of Thamesmead. The development will include a new public square, library, fitness studio and café, with other commercial and community spaces to follow. Residents will also benefit from a concierge, lounge and co-working space within the development.

Southmere marks the start of a 30-year transformation of Thamesmead, an area the size of central London. £9 billion is due to be invested into the area which will result in the creation of up to 20,000 new homes.

Each apartment is finished to a high specification throughout. Contemporary two-tone handle-less kitchens by Symphony are complimented by integrated Bosch & Zanussi appliances. Hallways, living rooms and kitchens have light oak effect Amtico flooring while the bedrooms have soft grey carpets.

Built-in frosted glass wardrobes are provided in master bedrooms. Luxurious bathrooms have large format marbled ceramic tiles, built in storage and polished chrome brassware throughout.

All apartments come with underfloor heating and benefit from a private balcony or terrace.

The arrival of the Elizabeth Line at Abbey Wood station will offer exceptional travel times of 11 minutes to Canary Wharf, 17 minutes to Liverpool Street and just 25 minutes to Bond Street.

Southmere is the latest high-quality residential development by Peabody.

Highlights:
- Concierge
- Residents’ lounge and co-working space
- Balcony or terrace to all homes
- Cycle storage
- Parking available by separate negotiation for select units
- Abundance of green space and water - 150 hectares of parks and 30,000 trees, 5 lakes, 7km of canals and 5km of river frontage

Existing over ground services from Abbey Wood Station provide easy access to central London. Crossrail will further improve transport links as follows:
- Canary Wharf - 11 mins (Elizabeth Line)
- Liverpool Street - 17 mins (Elizabeth Line)
- Bond Street - 25 mins (Elizabeth Line)
- Heathrow - 16 mins (Elizabeth Line)

Anticipated completion: June 2021

detailedDescription:
'contract assignment' B&C Properties is pleased to offer this brand new two-bedroom two-bathroom ground floor apartment set within this exclusive and exceptionally high quality development within Royal Arsernal Riverside located in Greenwich.

'contract assignment' B&C Properties is pleased to offer this brand new two-bedroom two-bathroom ground floor apartment set within this exclusive and exceptionally high quality development within Royal Arsernal Riverside located in Greenwich.

This apartment has a spacious living area with impressive river view and has been decorated to an extremely high standard throughout. It comprises of a spacious entrance hallway with video door entry system, large open plan living, dining, kitchen area and a double bedroom with built in wardrobe. The large window opens onto a private balcony which offers lovely view. The kitchen is fully equipped to a very high standard including oven and fridge/freezer.

The Waterside Club is the exclusive residents' only* health and well-being centre. Located within Pavilion Square, residents can enjoy five-star facilities and pure relaxation right at the heart of Royal Arsenal Riverside.
• State-of-the-art fitness equipment • Vitality spa pool and 20m swimming pool • High-tech private cinema room • Massage treatment room • Sauna and steam room

This property is located a few minutes walk from Woolwich Arsenal National rail and DLR with easy access to the city centre and Canary Wharf.
• Crossrail
The forthcoming on-site Crossrail Elizabeth Line will offer dramatically reduced journey times to Canary Wharf (07 mins), Liverpool Street (14 mins), Bond Street (21 mins) and even Heathrow (56 mins).
• Trains
National Rail and DLR stations just 300m away from the development providing easy and direct access to the city of London and beyond for example, London City Airport (06 mins), Greenwich (13 mins), London Bridge (21 mins), Canary Wharf (19 mins), and London Charing Cross (35 mins).
• Air
London City Airport is only a short journey away (06 mins via DLR) from the development, with frequent journeys to Europe (Paris 1hr 35 mins) and beyond (New York 7 hrs 30 mins)
• Boat
The Thames Clipper riverboat service can be used from the on-site Woolwich Arsenal Pier providing direct routes to Greenwich (15-20mins), Canary Wharf (20-30 mins) or London Bridge (30-40 mins)

Please call us as soon as possible to book a viewing to avoid disappointment.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This stunning two-bedroomed riverfront apartment is located on the fifth floor of this sought-after modern development in the heart of Greenwich. Benefitting from amazing views over London, a wide range of convenient bars, restaurants and amenities and within walking distance of Greenwich Park.

The property comprises two very generous bedrooms equipped with useful and well-structured storage facilities. The master bedroom offers an en-suite bathroom with a luxurious free standing bath and built in wardrobes. There is also a modern family bathroom.

The open-plan kitchen area is a stunning recently-fitted integrated modern kitchen. It includes sleek contemporary units with integrated Neff and Bosch appliances - a double oven, hob, cooker hood, washing machine, fridge-freezer and dishwasher, along with ample wall and floor units.

The bright, airy and very spacious open plan lounge is ideal for entertaining friends and family. Views from the windows and balcony over London are unrivalled.

Further benefits to this property include two secure allocated underground parking spaces, concierge, underfloor heating, double glazing and its close proximity to Maze Hill, North Greenwich and Cutty Sark stations which offer easy access to Canary Wharf, Central London, and City airport.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

B&C Properties are pleased to offer this fantastic one-bedroom, one-bathroom modern apartment. Situated within the highly sought after Blackheath Quarter of Kidbrooke Village with concierge, gym and swimming pool. Easy access to Blackheath Village and Kidbrooke station.

B&C Properties are pleased to offer this fantastic one-bedroom, one-bathroom modern apartment. Situated within the highly sought after Blackheath Quarter of Kidbrooke Village with concierge, gym and swimming pool. Easy access to Blackheath Village and Kidbrooke station.

Wallace Court is located in the prestigious Blackheath Quarter of the modern Kidbrooke Village - an award winning Berkeley Homes development. This is a completely new and vibrant London community offering an outstanding choice of quality and sustainable new homes.

Located on the first floor, the accommodation comprises of an open plan lounge diner with an attractive modern kitchen with integrated appliances, a private terrace, double bedroom with built in wardrobes and and a luxury modern bathroom. The resident only podium garden is just outside the apartment and gives it a feel of having an exclusive beautiful manicured garden at the door step.

The property also has the benefit of access to an on-site concierge service, gym, swimming pool, Cinema room and a business centre.

Transport links to central London are very close via Kidbrooke station with regular trains to London Bridge (15 minutes), Waterloo East (20 minutes), Charing Cross (22 minutes), Cannon Street (20 minutes) and Victoria (28 minutes). Blackheath Village with its open green spaces offers an array of boutiques, daily conveniences, bars and restaurants and is only moments away.

detailedDescription:
Guide Price £500,000-£525,000. In this outstanding and tranquil location just 120 metres from the heath and in the heart of Blackheath Village, is this superb and spacious two double bedroom split level maisonette.

The property is in excellent decorative order with double glazed sash windows, plantation shutters, wood flooring and gas fired central heating. The accommodation, which arranged over the upper two floors, (first and second) with a private entrance on the ground floor, comprises; entrance hall, a spacious 16'6 reception room and a very attractive modern kitchen breakfast room. Upstairs are two double bedrooms both with built in wardrobes and including a very large master and a stunning modern bathroom with underfloor heating. The property further benefits from a newly extended lease (circa 177 years).

This is a lovely home perfect for a working professional, young family or buy to let investment and your earliest viewing is essential. Video tours can be seen at .

Paragon Place is a highly sought after and outstanding location in the heart of Blackheath Village with its array of boutique shops, restaurants and bars and is yards from Blackheath Station. Blackheath Station gives access to London Bridge, Charing Cross and Victoria amongst others. Close by are several sought-after schools including Blackheath Prep, Blackheath High School, the Pointer School and John Ball. Greenwich Park and the open heath are a short walk away.

detailedDescription:
A superb and extended four/five bedroom, two bathroom, semi-detached period home with a stunning modern kitchen diner and tiered south facing garden set in this popular location close to Maze Hill Station, Greenwich Park and Greenwich town centre.

The property is in excellent decorative order with original features, high ceilings, sash windows, wood flooring, period fireplaces and gas central heating.

The accommodation is arranged over four floors (inc cellar) and comprises; to the ground floor, a very large and beautiful open plan family space with lounge and dining areas, a utility room, WC and access to the cellar. To the rear, and built into the extension, is a stunning modern kitchen with large island, range style oven, built in breakfast/dining table, slate tiled floor, vaulted ceiling with skylight and electric blinds and bi-folding doors to the terrace beyond. Up to the first floor, there are three bedrooms including a large double to the front, and two further doubles with a modern family bathroom. There is also a study which could serve as a fifth bedroom. The loft has been converted to provide a large double bedroom with ensuite shower room and plenty of eaves storage. To the rear is a landscaped south facing garden which extends to approx. 30ft arranged over three tiers.

This is a wonderful family home and your immediate viewing is strongly advised. Video tours can be seen at

An outstanding location to take advantage of local amenities in almost all directions. Walking south east, just 0.92 miles, you will arrive in Blackheath village which offers an array of boutique shops, bars and restaurants giving a genuine feeling of village life inside London. 0.57 miles to the west you will find the historic Greenwich town centre, University of Greenwich, National Maritime Museum and Royal Greenwich Park is just 475 metres away. 0.61 miles to the southeast is Blackheath Standard, with daily conveniences including M&S Food Hall as well as many shops and restaurants. Turning north down Vanbrugh Hill you will reach Woolwich Road where you will find Greenwich Square Library and Leisure Centre which has a swimming pool. There is also range of Artisan coffee shops and bakeries as well as a Co-op, Sainsbury's and Tesco local. Other amenities such as the Cinema, Ikea and other large stores can be found at Greenwich Peninsula which is a 4 minutes' drive. Maze Hill Station are all just a short walk. With the DLR within easy reach from Greenwich along with the river boat and Jubilee Line at North Greenwich is just 1.23 miles away.

address: Spencer House, 23 Dartmouth Row, London SE10
detailedDescription:
A beautiful two bedroom apartment set on the top floor of this Grade ii-listed 17th century converted house on one of Greenwich and Blackheath's most sought after roads. Offering great living space and a wealth of period features combined with far reaching views of the London skyline and a private balcony. There is an eat-in kitchen/dining room and a separate reception room featuring exposed beams and brickwork, period wooden panelling and access to the lovely balcony overlooking the gardens. Both bedrooms offer stunning views across London with the main bedroom featuring built-in wardrobes, a walk-in wardrobe and an ensuite shower room. Another feature of the apartment is a number of large storage cupboards. The property has been well maintained by the current owner however offers the opportunity for a buyer to create their perfect home in an historic building on this leafy and quiet residential road.

Situation
Dartmouth Row, arguably one of SE10's most sought after addresses, is a leafy, tree-lined street located in between Greenwich ad Blackheath Village. The property is conveniently located within easy access of Greenwich Mainline and DLR Station, Blackheath Station and Lewisham Station for a swift commute to Canary Wharf, The City and West End. There is a wide array of local shops, restaurants and pubs in both Greenwich and Blackheath Village while the open green spaces of Greenwich Park and Blackheath are just moments away.

Moments From Blackheath And Greenwich Park

Private Balcony

detailedDescription:
Located on the third floor of the forthcoming Callis Yard development is this 773 sqft two bedroom apartment. The dual-aspect apartment will offer an open-plan living and dining area with east and south facing views.

Each apartment will benefit from bespoke light oak veneer entrance doors, Karndean brushed oak flooring to the hallway and living spaces and underfloor heating throughout. The kitchen will offer silestone white worktops, under cabinet LED lighting and fully integrated stainless steel appliances. Both bedrooms are carpeted and are fitted with full height white wardrobes with white glass sliding doors. The master is offered with its own ensuite bathroom which is fitted with grey porcelain floor and wall tiles, Villeroy and Boch sanitary ware and Hansgrohe Taps. The apartment also has one further family bathroom.

Set to complete in 2018, Callis Yard comprises 120 spectacular 1,2 & 3 bedroom apartments and 3 bedroom townhouses. The development will also include a resident's gymnasium, private roof terrace, landscaped roof-gardens and bicycle storage.

Callis Yard is located within a short walk of Woolwich Arsenal station, offering both National Rail and Docklands Light Railway services. From 2018, Woolwich will also benefit from the forthcoming Crossrail, which will offer connections to Canary Wharf in just 8 minutes, the City in 14 minutes and the West End in 22 minutes. Furthermore, Callis Yard sits just 10 minutes from London City Airport via the DLR. The development is a 2 minute walk from Woolwich High Street which is home to a mix of local bars, cafes, restaurants and high-street shops.

Marketing suite and show home open six days a week, please call to book your appointment.
