title: 5 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
Doorsteps are excited to market this stunning 4th floor 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom dual aspect apartment on the Greenwich Peninsula in South East London.

This beautiful 2-bedroom apartment is set in Bayliss Heights, in the Greenwich Millennium Village development, with nearly 1,000 sqft. Of living space. The apartment offers:

- 2 well sized double bedrooms

- 2 bathrooms

- excellent storage, plus utility room, and separate cupboard for cloaks etc.

- spacious contemporary open plan lounge/ kitchen and dining areas

- a large private balcony

- concierge and secure bicycle storage

- short walk to Jubilee Line (N. Greenwich) buses & Thames Clipper

- 15 mins to Canary Wharf, 25 to London Bridge

- Asda, Ikea, Next, Aldi, Lidl, Boots, jd Sports, Sainsbury’s, M&S, the O2 Arena and more are all within a 10-15 min walk or 5 min drive/cycle

- Nearby village green, ecology park and Greenwich Yacht Club

- Blackheath, Greenwich park, the Thames Barrier all walking distance

This is not to be missed.

Early viewing is advised.

Location

The apartment is based within a secure building offering a concierge, secure residents-only bicycle storage, a large lobby and lift access. The apartment is located just a short walk from a number of retail areas, and the O2 Arena with its array of shops, bars, restaurants and amenities.

The location has excellent local transport links with North Greenwich tube station (Jubilee Line) within a short walking distance offering connections to the rest of London, and 24-hour tube service at weekends. Easy access is also available to the A2, A12, Blackwall Tunnel, and Thames Clipper.

The Apartment

The apartment has been maintained to an excellent standard with abundance of natural lighting, modern integrated appliances, good internal storage cupboards and sleek flooring throughout.

The apartment is double aspect and boasts generous sized rooms, double-glazing, floor to ceiling windows, two double bedrooms and a built in, custom fitted wardrobe.

Having been built recently, it is still well-within its warranty and has a positive recent EWS1 review (A1). While perfect for couples or a small family, with two bedrooms and bathrooms it offers a great opportunity to host a lodger. The owner has previously let one of the rooms on a temporary basis for £750pcm plus bills.

Kitchen / Lounge

The space offers ample worktop space for food preparation and includes integrated appliances including a fridge freezer, dishwasher, hob, and two separate built-in ovens, one of which also offers combination microwave functionality.

It further includes a central island/breakfast bar, a dining area comfortably seating 6, and an exceptionally spacious open plan living room.

Bedrooms

The 2 bedrooms are both a great size allowing for at least a double bed, and space for a desk and/or storage. Bedroom 1 also has a fitted wardrobe and an en-suite. Both bedrooms have floor to ceiling windows and independent access to the balcony.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Located on the ground floor of the Callis Yard development. The 2 bedroom 1 bathroom apartment offer open-plan living and dining area, double bedroom, separate bathroom, patio and a terrace.

Each apartment benefits from bespoke light oak veneer entrance doors, Karndean brushed oak flooring to the hallway and living spaces and underfloor heating throughout. The kitchen will offer silestone white worktops, under cabinet LED lighting and fully integrated stainless steel appliances. All bedrooms are carpeted and are fitted with full height white wardrobes with white glass sliding doors. The bathroom is fitted with grey porcelain floor and wall tiles, Villeroy and Boch sanitary ware and Hansgrohe taps.

Callis Yard comprises 120 spectacular 1,2 & 3 bedroom apartments and 3 bedroom townhouses. The development also includes a resident’s gymnasium, private roof terrace, landscaped roof-gardens and bicycle storage.

Callis Yard is located within a short walk of Woolwich Arsenal station, offering both National Rail and Docklands Light Railway services. Woolwich will also benefit from the forthcoming Crossrail, which will offer connections to Canary Wharf in just 8 minutes, the City in 14 minutes and the West End in 22 minutes. Furthermore, Callis Yard sits just 10 minutes from London City Airport via the DLR. The development is a 2 minute walk from Woolwich High Street which is home to a mix of local bars, cafes, restaurants and high-street shops.

Marketing suite and show home open 5 days a week, please call to book your appointment.

Plumstead and Woolwich are part of South East London’s big reinvention, with Woolwich town centre unrecognisable compared to 20 years ago. Already home to an excellent mainline rail service and the DLR, Woolwich’s Crossrail station is well underway. Together with the redevelopment of the Royal Arsenal, Woolwich is emerging as a new urban centre. Plumstead offers an altogether greener setting, with the vast commons and Oxleas Wood providing a perfect backdrop to some stunning period properties.

detailedDescription:
Contemporary two bedroom apartment located on the first floor in the prestigious Sir Walter Raleigh Court development. This bright and spacious property benefits from an excellent location in the heart of Greenwich and is just 200 metres from the Thames and the lovely walkway along by the river. The development was completed in 2010, is well insulated, double-glazed and has underfloor heating throughout.

The apartment has two well-proportioned double bedrooms and a large open plan reception/kitchen with plenty of room to dine. The bathroom again is a good size, and the storage facilities complete the accommodation. Full height windows in each room give a light spacious feel throughout. The property benefits from an allocated underground parking space.

There are excellent transport links: You can reach Canary Wharf easily and Bond Street in just 17 minutes from North Greenwich Underground station (Zone 2) on the Jubilee line. London Bridge is reached in 13 minutes from nearby Maze Hill rail station and services carry on through to the Thameslink line. The nearby Thames Path has a range of cafes and bars and is the perfect way up to the heart of Greenwich and its famous market. There are both a Co-op and a Sainsburys Local on Banning Street, less than 100 metres away.

Greenwich has a special village feel to it and when it comes to eating, drinking and socialising, there is a vast amount of choice on your doorstep. Greenwich Park with its spectacular views of canary wharf is a fabulous place to while away a summers afternoon or take a brisk winter walk. The O2 Arena is just over a mile away, and a gp surgery, gym and swimming pool can be found at The Greenwich Centre within 0.3 miles.

EPC rating: B.
features: ['2 Double Bedrooms', 'Open Plan Living', 'Underground Parking', 'Great Location', 'Close to River', 'Chain Free']
title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Stunning one double bedroom ground floor apartment set within a popular modern development, superbly located close to excellent transport links and amenities. The property offers beautifully maintained and appointed, bright and spacious accommodation spanning some 646sqft, including a generous open plan reception/kitchen flooded with natural light from full height window and door onto a large external patio and front garden. Further features include stylish bathroom, quality flooring, recessed lighting, 'Airflow Duplex' ventilation system, high ceilings, ample inbuilt storage, existing NHBC warranty (since September 2015), and long lease.

Accommodation comprises entrance hall with inbuilt storage, leading into the bright and spacious open plan reception/kitchen with windows and door onto the external patio area. The kitchen comprises a modern range of wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, electric hob with overhead stainless steel extractor and oven below, and further space for appliances. Additionally, there is a well proportioned double bedroom and a stylish family bathroom with modern white three piece suite.

Viewings of this lovely apartment, superbly located and ideal for either first time buyers or as an investment, are highly recommended.

Location

The property is situated close to Woolwich Dockyard (0.3 miles, 20 mins to London Bridge), Woolwich Arsenal (0.5 miles, 10 mins to London City Airport) and the much anticipated Crossrail with its links into Canary wharf, the City and Heathrow Airport. It has fantastic bus routes on its doorstep to central London (15 minute bus ride to the O2 and North Greenwich underground, Zone 2, Jubilee line). It is also a short drive to popular shopping destinations such as the newly opened ikea Greenwich and Westfield Stratford City. The property is also a 5 mins drive from the newly upgraded Woolwich Ferry andThames Clipper in Woolwich Arsenal.

Woolwich is undergoing continued regeneration and is set to become one of London's most sought after cultural hubs with the introduction of Crossrail. This is a great opportunity to invest in this vibrant and transforming area of London!

Lease Information

We understand the lease on the property is 125 years from September 2015 - 121 years remaining. All prospective purchasers are advised to make their own enquiries.

Service Charges

We understand the service charge on the property is £160 per month. All prospective purchasers are advised to make their own enquiries.

detailedDescription:
Virtual viewing available. A spacious two bed (plus study) first floor apartment in an attractive 1930's landmark mansion block situated on the edge of the Heath, the flat being in the front block affording lovely heath views and located within easy access to Lewisham DLR, Greenwich town centre and Blackheath Village.

This impressive development has recently undergone a huge restoration programme which was complete in 2020 which included the full refurbishment and redecoration of all communal hallways including the installation of security entry phone systems. The exterior of the building has also been completely renovated to a very high specification. All the cabling has been completed for Hyperoptic (desirable super fast broadband). In our view, this handsome block is finally back to its former glory.

Located within walking distance to Blackheath, Lewisham and Greenwich stations offering direct links into central London and the many wonderful amenities this desirable area has to offer. Energy Efficiency Rating C.

title: 4 bed end terrace house for sale

detailedDescription:
John Payne are proud to present a selection of new apartments, located within the exclusive Upper Riverside Neighbourhood. Designed by world leading architects’ som, with the interiors curated by different interior designers such as Tom Dixon and Studio Ashby.

Upon entering each building you are met with a stunning lobby area, 24 hour concierge located in buildings 2 and 4, lounge seating and work space areas and lifts that operate to each floor. Internally each apartment from, studio to the penthouse offers spacious accommodation with the majority boasting some of the most breath-taking views, stretching across the City and/or the River. The highest quality materials have been used throughout by the developer to create beautifully crafted open plan homes for you to enjoy.

There are world class resident amenities which all owners are encouraged to enjoy include; Tom Dixon designed Renew floor on the 15th floor with a swimming pool and sundeck, as well as gyms, cinema, Karaoke room, business and meeting rooms and roof top terraces.

You are just one stop to Canary wharf and 10 minutes direct to London Bridge, with North Greenwich Jubilee Line a 3 minute walk, the Emirates Air Line and Thames Clipper service also on your door step.

The O2 is found within a 2 minute walk where you will be able to enjoy the events which are held there along with the bars, restaurants and other leisure facilities which surround the area.

John Payne are proud to present a selection of new apartments, located within the exclusive Upper Riverside Neighbourhood. Designed by world leading architects’ som, with the interiors curated by different interior designers such as Tom Dixon and Studio Ashby.

Upon entering each building you are met with a stunning lobby area, 24 hour concierge located in buildings 2 and 4, lounge seating and work space areas and lifts that operate to each floor. Internally each apartment from, studio to the penthouse offers spacious accommodation with the majority boasting some of the most breath-taking views, stretching across the City and/or the River. The highest quality materials have been used throughout by the developer to create beautifully crafted open plan homes for you to enjoy.

There are world class resident amenities which all owners are encouraged to enjoy include; Tom Dixon designed Renew floor on the 15th floor with a swimming pool and sundeck, as well as gyms, cinema, Karaoke room, business and meeting rooms and roof top terraces.

You are just one stop to Canary wharf and 10 minutes direct to London Bridge, with North Greenwich Jubilee Line a 3 minute walk, the Emirates Air Line and Thames Clipper service also on your door step.

The O2 is found within a 2 minute walk where you will be able to enjoy the events which are held there along with the bars, restaurants and other leisure facilities which surround the area.

detailedDescription:
A stunning two bedroom top floor apartment, that is part of this magnificent Grade II listed Georgian house, located on Crooms Hill, with direct views into Greenwich Park.

Measuring circa 915 square foot the property comprises a huge and bright, 33 ft reception room with open plan kitchen. This room is to the rear of the house and has lovely views toward Gloucester Circus. There are two large double bedrooms, with wonderful views into the Royal Park, and a well fitted bathroom, and also access to a large attic.

Crooms Hill is certainly the most desirable road in Greenwich, which runs from the top of the heath down to Greenwich town centre. It is also, arguably, one of the best roads in the south east of London. Local shops and restaurants, along with cinema and theatre are just a few moments away, as is mainline rail, DLR and riverboat service. Your earliest viewing is highly recommended.

detailedDescription:
A bright and spacious one bedroom conversion flat, on the top floor of this imposing Victorian building, originally named 'The Old Gentleman's Club'; a haunt for Victorian gents and included a large billiard room, now all converted. It is superbly situated in the very heart of Blackheath village, well presented with period fireplaces, original floorboards and tall sash windows in the 10' high ceilinged rooms, unusual for a top floor flat. The kitchen is well fitted with plentiful units, work surfaces and good quality appliances and is linked by a wide square arch to the reception room with a period fireplace. The bathroom is fitted with a contemporary white suite including a shower over the large centre draining bath, and the large double bedroom also has a period fireplace.

Detailed Description

This apartment has a large living area with stunning large floor to ceiling windows which lets in lots of natural light and shows off the Stunning river views! - you can also access your very own private balcony through the living area. This property is on the 8th floor of Duncombe House.

A beautiful, gated, peaceful development dating from 1761 set in wide open spaces by the river. The development also has Tesco Express, Boulangerie Jade, Marks & Spencer's, Sainsbury's, The Taproom (bar and pizzeria), The Dial Arch gastro pub, The Guard House (restaurant and pub), Con Gusto (Italian restaurant) park, Farmer's market, several Gyms, Yoga studio, Nursery and river walks.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A beautifully presented top floor conversion flat, set within the highly popular Westcombe Park conservation area. Easy and quick access Canary Wharf for someone seeking a pied-à-terre, and is Chain Free.

"We've lived at 106 Westcombe Park Road, a late Edwardian conversion built in 1920, for (nearly) five very happy years.

The house is extremely well-kept, and we've been lucky that our house neighbours are friendly and warm and care about the house and the people in it. This has been a wonderful first step onto the property ladder for us and we'll cherish our memories for years. Let me tell you why.

Our flat is unique in having a triple aspect living room, which is spectacularly lit on even overcast days, making the space both inviting and cheerful.

One of the charms of the conversion lay in the quirky storage spaces that nestle in the eaves, providing fantastic in-home storage. New double-glazed windows and engineered hardwood flooring were installed in Aug 2016; a new, modern bathroom with electric underfloor heating in Jan 2017; a new, modern kitchen with new appliances (washer/dryer, slimline dishwasher, fridge/freezer) in Feb 2018; a new oven in Nov 2020; and new radiators in Dec 2020.

We also added a foldaway ladder access to the unfinished attic space for further storage. You don't need a car to love and live in this neighbourhood (more on that in a bit), but if you do there's always parking right outside the house. The nearest overland train station going into London Bridge and Cannon Street is down the street – a 7-minute walk.

The Blackheath Royal Standard area has an authentic small village feel, centred on Batley Park, with coffee shops, M&S Simply Food, Boulangerie Jade, the excellent Blackheath Royal Standard pub, a hardware store, an independent café, and many other shops and services. The best thing about the area is that you can't help but come to know the shopkeepers personally.

Saying hello to Kam, Em, Andrew, and others while running errands makes for a truly neighbourhood feel. If you have a pet, or plan to get one, Blackheath Vets at the bottom of the hill will be there for you. Literally just around the corner is Mycenae House, offering a full program of arts, health and sports classes, from bridge and chess clubs, to yoga, opera, wine tasting, dancing, music concerts, and martial arts classes. There are several gyms and Blackheath Squash Club nearby.

There are lot of gorgeous green spaces nearby - Greenwich Park and the wonderful open spaces of Blackheath itself, where you can wonder over to watch the famous fireworks display in November. Blackheath is a pleasant 20-min walk and has some great restaurants, including The Ivy, Gail's Bakery, lovely local delis and shopping like Space nk. You will love it here."<br /><br />
title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Virtual viewing available! Chain free! John Payne are delighted to bring to the market this beautifully presented, two bedroom, end of terrace house with private parking & a garage set on a quiet and secluded cul-de-sac just off Hyde Vale in West Greenwich.

Since ownership the current owners have renovated the property throughout to a high standard, the ground floor accommodation comprises a 30ft open plan kitchen/dining/reception room and has a modern kitchen with fully fitted Bosch appliances including coffee machine, ample storage and a breakfast bar. The first floor comprises two double bedrooms, both with built in storage, three piece modern family bathroom and a very useful mezzanine loft storage area. Externally to the rear and accessed through sliding doors from the reception room there is a 33ft south east facing garden with gated side access, the garden is private, low maintenance, has a storage shed at the back and is bathed in sunlight throughout the day. Further benefits include private parking, garage & communal gardens.

Rangers Square is a quiet cul-de-sac with communal gardens located just off Hyde Vale in the sought after West Greenwich area. The house is located a short walk to Greenwich Mainline and DLR Station which offers a swift commute the London Bridge, The City and Canary Wharf thanks to the recent addition of the Thameslink Line. The shops on Royal Hill are moments away featuring a greengrocer, butchers, bakery and fishmongers. The green spaces of Greenwich Royal Park and Blackheath are nearby as well as the historical Greenwich Market and Maritime Museum.

title: 2 bed end terrace house for sale

detailedDescription:
The property

Spacious and airy duplex top floor apartment, close to the North Greenwich Tube Station, with stunning views of the O2, Canary Wharf and the City. The apartment has only one neighbouring flat which makes it very quiet and private, whilst being so close to Greenwich and Charlton.

On the 1st floor there is an entrance hall, a large bedroom with a king size bed and plenty of storage space for 2 people. Opposite there is a bathroom with an additional large storage area. On the 2nd floor there is a small landing leading to a large open plan kitchen and lounge, bathroom and a second storage area with a washing machine. Both floors have a balcony which is accessible through large glass doors, which make for stunning views of the city.

The flat has a 24 / 7 concierge service (handy for deliveries, holding onto spare keys, car parking spaces at weekends). Bike storage and Car Parking spaces can be rented (upon availability). Fibre Optic up to 1GB p/s internet available in the flat block through Hyperoptic, communal sky satellite.

The area

The flat is located on a residential street with excellent amenities just a few minutes’ walk away.

Medical Centre, Hairdresser, Pharmacy, Dentist, Dry Cleaners, Co-op are within 2 minute walk. Both Greenwich Retail Park (ikea etc. And Charlton Retail Park (Asda, Gym etc.) are within walking distance. The flat is well served by the O2 with cafes, food, drink and shopping outlets and Greenwich is only 30 minutes’ walk away.

Transport Links

Close to North Greenwich tube / bus station. Tubes start at North Greenwich every 10 minutes. Regular well served bus route with stop 200 metres from the flat. See below for distances:

• North Greenwich tube station (Jubilee line) is 0.5 m away

• North Greenwich bus station (Good links to city centre, East London, North London) is 0.5 m away

• Maize Hill train station is 0.9 m away

• Charlton train station is 1.0 m away

Sophisticated two bedroom apartment on the third floor with views over the podium garden. Accessed via a stylish, secure entrance lobby with a seating area for visitors and space for working, this apartment provides the perfect balance of style and practicality, ready for you to enjoy by yourself or with friends. What's more all residents will have access to the private podium garden and bookable games room providing a haven to escape too

Greenwich Millennium Village

Described as one of the most exciting new residential neighbourhoods in Europe, Greenwich Millennium Village is a contemporary development that offers a different quality of life. Situated on Greenwich Peninsula, a short distance from the historic charm of Old Greenwich, it is just one stop on the Jubilee line from Canary Wharf and four stops from London Bridge.

Greenwich Millennium Village offers 21st Century living in a peaceful green setting, just a short walk from the O2 and North Greenwich station. Swathes of open space include the established Ecology Park, a large central park and podium gardens, linked by green corridors and tree lined avenues. The layout of the village gives priority to people over cars, with lively and intimate streets and a Village Square forming a focal point. The master plan also includes the amenities that every thriving community requires, with shops and facilities within a short distance of every home, and an architecturally stunning primary school and health centre at the heart of the village.

Located on Bennett Park just moments from Blackheath station which allows access into London Bridge in just 12 minutes and perfect placed for making the most of the many independent coffee shops, restaurants, bars and boutiques found within the village and the popular farmers' market every Sunday. The property is offered to the market chain free and with a share of freehold. Viewings are immediately available, Energy Efficiency Rating D.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

address: Merlin Court, 28 Hadley Drive, London SE3
detailedDescription:
“An exceptionally well-finished two bed apartment, located within the highly acclaimed Blackheath Quarter of Kidbrooke Village. The apartment benefits from a wraparound private terrace and modern move-in appeal.”
Accommodation includes an entrance hallway with wooden floors, ample storage and a utility closet leading through to a generous reception room and open plan modern kitchen. The open plan reception is fitted with a modern kitchen, fully integrated with oven, hob, fridge/freezer and extractor. The reception is abundant in light from the five floor-to-ceiling windows; one of which is also a door leading to a large wrap-around terrace with a great outside dining space and entertaining area all semi-partitioned from the grass area in-front.

Being East and North facing this apartment feels bright, spacious and airy yet not too hot or cold with good circulation of air. Continuing through the accommodation there are two double bedrooms off the hallway. The main bedroom is a generous carpeted double-bedroom with ample space for a multitude of furniture. Another double-bedroom from the hallway has ample storage, large window and easily accommodates a King-sized double-bed also. Following on from the hallway, there is the main bathroom fully appointed with a bathtub and shower over bath, all modern and generously proportioned.

Positioned over the ground floor of this development, occupying approximately 798sqft internally no space has been wasted with an excellent flowing floorplan. This is an ideal home for a new family or couple who appreciates a safe and quiet location with ample greenery and excellent modern design. Residents are well positioned for the local amenities and excellent transport links. A 5-minute walk from Kidbrooke Station (Rail) providing quick and easy access to London Bridge, the City (Cannon St.), the West End (Victoria Station) and beyond. Peglar Square includes a Sainsburys and places to eat, drink and shop and further leisure facilities.

The Blackheath Quarter of Kidbrooke Village features world-class amenities including the 24hr concierge, full gym facilities, a heated swimming pool, private cinema and business centre. A short walk away is Blackheath with excellent restaurants, independent shops and wine-bars plus the heath itself which is ideal for exercise or relaxing and picnicking in the summer. Linked from Blackheath is Greenwich featuring a Royal Park with deer enclosure, incredible Naval history and wonderful views along the Thames.

Long-Leasehold 125yrs from Sept, 2016

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A well-presented second floor purpose built flat within this popular riverside development.

Offering two bedrooms, good size living/dining room, modern bathroom and fitted kitchen with integrated appliances this represents an ideal first time purchase or buy to let investment.

Ideally located the apartment is just a short walk over the bridge at the creek passing Waitrose on the way through to central Greenwich with its array of restaurants and craft markets. Access to the DLR at the Cutty Sark is also here providing swift access to Canary Wharf.

Further benefits include, entry phone security system, double glazed windows throughout, long lease and ample ad hoc off street parking.

Early viewings highly recommended by the owners sole agents.

What The Sellers Say -

"When we first moved to Greenwich we thought we would only stay for a few years but have loved it so much that we have been here for ten - and are reluctantly moving to upsize.

It is a buzzing town that has a bit of everything from its picture perfect Palace and Cutty Sark, to the best panoramic views of London from the top of the Royal Park. As foodies we love to eat street food from Greenwich market, grab a pub meal or stop off at our favourite Bakery, Gail's, in Blackheath.

A home in a friendly area with parking, and in easy reach of coffee and grocery shops was important to us - and the private development of Millennium Quay ticks all of the boxes. Situated on the riverfront, we regularly cycle along the London cycle path to the O2 arena.

Previously we had a long commute for work but having multiple routes that can get us to London Bridge door-to-door within 25 minutes has been fantastic for our work life balance."<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
“I was attracted to the flat by its location close to the town centre, Greenwich Park, Blackheath and transport links.

Its spaciousness and the large amount of light in the main rooms is great and having my own entrance, while still being part of a small ‘community’ with the other flats in Benyamin House.

As a duplex, the flat ‘feels’ like a house and having the bedrooms in the basement means they are very quiet and cooler in the summer. Having both my own outside space and use of the communal roof terrace brings the freedom for both private entertaining and with larger groups the addition of a roof top view.”

What The Agent Says-

Just as the owner has mentioned, this truly charming home has all the features and feels of a house, with its own entrance, split level and private courtyard garden.

Once you enter, you are greeted by a welcoming porch with WC just to the right. The bright and airy living space is found through the next door with double aspect windows allowing the light to flood in. A separate kitchen, boasting the main appliances, can be found off the lounge and there you have the option to open the dividing doors, to make the space greater, if you are hosting.

On the lower level are the two sizeable bedrooms, with main three piece bathroom suite on this floor too. The ensuite shower room can be found next to the main bedroom and the private courtyard garden can be accessed from both bedrooms. The beauty of the property is the space that is has to offer as you have plenty of room if you are working from home.

Locally there are a range of shops including supermarkets, eateries and coffee shops. Deptford Bridge DLR station is just a few minutes away on foot and Greenwich mainline/DLR stations, town centre and park are all within a short walking distance.

An internal viewing of this wonderful home is highly recommended.<br /><br />

title: 2 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
"We have created four spacious bedrooms, a large family bathroom and plenty of storage space to accommodate easy living. We have thoroughly enjoyed living here."

What The Seller Says -

"We have loved living in our home over the past 10 years, providing us with an excellent location and community, to thoroughly enjoy the Greenwich Peninsula, Thames Path, Greenwich Park and Blackheath village, all located on our doorstep. We love having so much green space nearby as well as a plethora of cafes, restaurants and pubs to take advantage of.

We have loved the ease of the location to access central London, by tube, train of boat, as well as great accessibility to enjoy outer London, especially to go walking in Kent. Outstanding schools in our local catchment area have been important for us.

We have thoughtfully extended and amended our home over time to provide a practical living space for our growing family to enjoy. This includes a large and light open plan living area, which opens onto an easy to maintain garden, great for our children to play and entertaining guests throughout the year."

What The Agent Says -

The current owners have extended this Victorian house to offer an abundance of space, making this an ideal family home with plenty of space to work from home and the sellers can sell chain free.

The loft conversion was completed just a few years back now and offers two decent size bedrooms, one of which features an en-suite shower room, storage in the eaves and a Velux window.

On the first level you will find a large main bedroom, a further double size bedroom and a spacious four piece bathroom suite, including bath and shower cubicle.

The entrance level offers a very, very spacious through lounge which includes plenty of space for dining, built in storage around the bay window and working fireplaces, which were swept approximately a year ago.

The kitchen is to the rear, offering direct access to a south facing garden.

Main benefits include double glazed windows throughout, gas central heating, recently fitted combination boiler and residents permit parking, purchased through Greenwich council.

Property is freehold and the owners are selling chain free.<br /><br />
title: 4 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
Virtual viewing available. A spacious and well proportioned, two double bedroom flat occupying the entire top floor of this elegant detached Victorian villa, set back from the road on an extensive gravel driveway. The flat has been beautifully renovated by the current owners and is well presented throughout. It also has the benefit of owning the vast loft space to the building, which already has one Velux window, and has the potential to extend (STPP).

Being on the top floor, the flat enjoys great light throughout the day and also has beautiful views over Blackheath, stretching to the Shard and Canary Warf. The property has tremendous charm and character with an impressive reception room featuring an 11’ wide bay window and an original Victorian fireplace. The main bedroom is an excellent size with fantastic storage space as it has both a walk-in wardrobe a bank of fitted wardrobes. It also has a well appointed kitchen, good sized second bedroom, a modern bathroom and a separate utility room with a new Vaillant boiler.

The garden and communal areas are well maintained and the management of the building is operated by the residents, who take an active interest in keeping the building in excellent condition. Located on a popular and leafy residential road and well placed within walking distance of both Blackheath Village and Kidbrooke mainline stations and also the shops and facilities of Royal Blackheath Standard.

This is a beautiful home and your earliest viewing is highly recommended.

detailedDescription:
Guide Price £700,000-£745,000. A huge and extended four/five bedroom semi-detached family home with off street parking and a south facing 75ft garden with a superb outbuilding set in this popular location close to Kidbrooke mainline station and sold chain free.

The accommodation briefly comprises; entrance porch and hall with understairs storage, a very large through reception room with glazed doors to a large kitchen diner. The garage has been converted form a good size fourth bedroom/study with modern ensuite shower room. Upstairs to the first floor are two large double bedrooms, both with built in wardrobes, a modern family bathroom and a large landing which is perfect as a study area and currently serves as a laundry area. Finally there are two double bedrooms, (one with restricted head height in places), eaves storage and a modern shower room.

To the rear is a superb 75ft south facing garden with a large covered terrace, lawn, flower beds, and a large outbuilding which is perfect for a home office of summerhouse.

This is a large family home and viewing is strongly recommended. There is no chain. Video tours can be seen at .

Broad Walk is a popular residential road and the house is conveniently located just 820 metres from Kidbrooke Mainline station, (which is due to be rebuilt in 2021/22) and is just 17 minutes to London Bridge with trains also running to Charing Cross, Victoria and Cannon Street. The property is located just 915 metres from the new and prestigious Kidbrooke Village and 1.19 miles to Blackheath Village (one stop on train) with its array of boutique shops, bars and restaurants. There are many parks and green open spaces to enjoy, including Hornfair Park (with the Charlton Lido, cafe, tennis courts and bmx track within its bounds), Charlton House (gardens, play area and skate park), Oxleas Woods, Shrewsbury Park, Blackheath Common and Greenwich Park.

title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
Pk Sales and Lettings are proud to bring to the market Shawfield, a luxury 5 bedroom detached house available to rent on Court Road adjacent to the Royal Blackheath Golf Club, London, SE9.

This beautiful property situated on the popular Court Road flaunts a lavish finish with a high specification throughout the interior. Built on a substantial plot, this stately residence offers over 4,600sqft of land boasting an impressive 5 double bedrooms, a spacious double garage and a south facing garden in excellent order.

The ground floor of the property consists of a grand entrance hall illuminated with an ornate hanging chandelier fixture, that leads to 2 reception rooms, one fitted with a reconstituted Portland Stone fireplace, currently used as a family room and a drawing room. A quiet office ideal for working from home, a sizeable cloakroom, a separate dining room perfect for post-covid dinner parties and a modern guest W/C.

The magnum opus of the ground floor being the modern Stoneham bespoke fitted kitchen with a separate utility area. Equipped with a comprehensive range of upscale appliances to include: A double oven, five burner gas hob, integrated dishwasher, microwave and tumble dryer; an American fridge freezer, warming drawer, wine cooler cabinet, washing machine, and separate integrated freezer located below the granite work tops. Laid with Minoli ceramic floor tiles throughout, the kitchen area allows floods of light in from the wide windows and the juliet double doors that lead to the spacious and well maintained turfed private rear garden.

The first floor of the property is preceded by a striking solid oak staircase, leading to 5 large double bedrooms, 3 of which boast en-suite bathrooms and walk-in wardrobes furnished with Vicaima light oak finish internal doors with chrome ironmongery. A separate three piece bathroom suite, all of which benefit from fitted water softeners, white Villeroy and Boch sanitary ware, remote shower controls and Minoli ceramic floor tiles and full height wall tiling.

The ample features of the property include: Pre-wired structured cabling; consistent gas central heating supply powered by 2 brand new serviced boilers; an On-q home networking tech system. Ideal security features inclusive of an alarmed garage, CCTV, a secure remote controlled wrought iron gate and separate personnel gate and internal security alarms with panic buttons.

An abundance of parking is available through the remote controlled double garage and spacious paved driveway, with off street parking available for up to 4 cars.

Eltham Area:
Court Road is ideally located within walking distance of many traditional pubs, popular wine bars and restaurants, for family or adult evenings out. During the day, local residents can take a walk at Sutfield Park, Fairy Park and visit the beautiful landscape, lake and 18th century ice house at The Tarn. Avery Hill Park is also in close proximity, with its famous walled rose garden and winter garden!

Eltham is a small but attractive village offering the best of both a town and country lifestyle. The architecture of Eltham reflects its long history which has been favoured by monarchs for many centuries. Most notably the medieval Eltham Palace is ideal for taking advantage of the fine views across the surrounding countryside. Shawfield directly neighbours The Royal Blackheath Golf Club, founded in 1608 A.D by King James I, and is known as the most prestigious and oldest golf club in England. The vibrant high street offers a range of amenities, including boutiques and well-known stores such as Marks and Spencer and Debenhams with local organic butchers, bakers and greengrocers.

Directions:
From the M25, exit at junction 3 for the A20 towards London and following this to the Fiveways junction. For frequent flyers, London City Airport is easily accessible for domestic and international air travel. There are several train stations nearby, the closest being Mottingham Station, which offers services to London Cannon Street, London Bridge, Waterloo East and Charing Cross in approximately 23 minutes.

Available for viewings by appointment only.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

address: Building 50, Argyll Road, Royal Arsenal, London SE18
detailedDescription:
Highly sought after two bed with two balconies, directly overlooking the river and inner Lagoon, in a popular block, within this historic landmark development, east of Greenwich. Recently refurbished throughout, including oak laminate flooring, the property benefits from two double bedrooms (master with en suite, dressing room & balcony) spacious reception and high quality kitchen with a range of integrated appliances & granite work surface. Price to include secure allocated parking.

Area

The Royal Arsenal is a former munitions factory & storage facility with a history dating back to 1671, that is being tastefully transformed to provide a blend of converted & new build residential properties, together with a central open space, bars, restaurants and an hotel.

Beautifully landscaped, the builder has taken great care to create a development that is a pleasure to live in, rather than yet another sterile 'stack of boxes'. It retains a real sense of community yet retains a high degree of peace and tranquility, away from the 'big smoke'.

The development currently offers

* 24 Concierge & Security
* Residents Gym
* BodyWorkshop Health & Wellbeing Centre
* Two Youngs "gastro pubs" The Dial Arch & The Guardhouse
* Con Gusto Italian Restaurant
* Craft Beer & Pizzeria, The Taproom
* Four on site cafés
* Health Centre
* Chemist
* Dentist
* Tesco Express
* M&S Food Hall
* Dry Cleaning service
* Zipcar Car Sharing Club
* Residents Website
* Fortnightly Farmers Market

Situated east of Greenwich, adjacent to Woolwich Town Centre (offering an array of main street shopping, including Sainsbury's, Tesco and a vibrant street market) the development is easily reached by road & rail.

The station is no more than a short stroll away, which offers a direct route to the City (London Bridge / Cannon Street) in a little over 20 minutes, via the Main Line and less than 25 minutes to Bank / Tower Gateway via the DLR.

London City Airport can also be reached in as little as 5 minutes, with Canary Wharf & Stratford also accessible in less than 25 minutes.

As far as leisure is concerned, a short cab ride will take you to nearby Blackheath, Greenwich or, the O2 - where you will be spoilt for choice in terms of food, drink and nightlife.

As an alternative to the train or car, the Thames Clipper river bus service also docks immediately adjacent to the development and provides additional links with The O2, Greenwich, Canary Wharf, Tower Bridge, Blackfriars, The Southbank (Tate Modern) and beyond.

detailedDescription: Set within the stunning Kidbrooke Village development this superb modern three bedroom flat offers generous living and entertaining space with a wonderful bright and airy interior and highly coveted views over Sutcliffe Park. This apartment enjoys perhaps the best position in the development with uninterrupted south west facing park views with a high degree of privacy. Offering generous proportions throughout, master bedroom with en-suite and fitted storage, two further double bedrooms with ample fitted storage, a separate utility room and closet in the hallway and high ceilings this apartment can be set up as an excellent family flat or let as a rental investment to sharers. Kidbrooke Village offers excellent connections into London with Charing Cross only 26 minutes away by train. You can enjoy a new retail experience at The Village Centre, escape along the tree-lined paths of Cator Park and emerge ready to explore the rest of London, with easy connections to the districts of Eltham, Blackheath, Greenwich and London Bridge. With two primary schools on site and a handful of others a short distance away, there is also a wealth of amenities to be found right beside Kidbrooke Station.
title: Property for sale

detailedDescription:
**stamp duty paid for first time buyers**

**Less than 10 apartments remaining- Don’t miss out**

Plot 208

Plot 208 is an intelligently designed three bedroom apartment with parking located in Charlton. Situated within walking distance of the High Street, residents enjoy the great amenities, such as M&S and Starbucks. It comes with a fully-fitted kitchen with integrated appliances and granite worktops and a master bedroom with en suite. It also features outside space in the form of a spacious 89 sq ft private balcony.

The Area

Discover another side to city living. One that offers you a vibrant, modern community alive with things to see and do, alongside convenient transport connections. Together with a sea of green open spaces where you can relax and unwind, as well as inspiring places steeped in history. At Synergy, no sacrifices have to be made.

Step outside Synergy and you’ll be greeted with a wonderful range of high-street shops, supermarkets, and larger stores. The area’s heritage also brings a wide selection of historic attractions close to home, from the National Maritime Museum and the Cutty Sark, to the Royal Observatory Greenwich.

Take your pick from over 50 parks and open spaces in the Royal Borough of Greenwich and you’ll soon forget about the stresses and strains of modern life. Pack a picnic, pound the paths, turn the pages, whatever helps you relax, there are so many beautiful places in the neighbourhood to visit.

Travel Options

Synergy’s excellent transport links bring everything you find great about central London within easy reach. Be it the galleries, museums, theatres, sports, restaurants or entertainment. Although you don’t have to travel far to enjoy a wealth of amenities. Close by is everything from supermarkets, cinemas and historic attractions, to eateries, bars and gyms. The choice is yours.

What’s more, all you love about Central London is within easy reach too; both Westcombe Park Overground (Zone 3) and Charlton Overground (Zone 3) are only about a 10-minute walk.

The City

Many believe that London is the most dynamic and cosmopolitan city in the world. It’s an opinion of course, but what is certainly true is that London is a melting pot with districts as diverse as Soho and Mayfair or Westminster and Chelsea. It has a history that dates back over 2,000 years and is a treasure trove of shops, restaurants, galleries, museums and theatres.

A city such as this harbours a great deal of talent and ambition both in the past and present time. This is evident in the architecture, the enduring societies and guilds and the many celebrated seats of learning. The pioneering spirit that made London the capital of the British Empire and its appetite for art, fashion, music, tradition and innovation continues to this day and will continue indefinitely.

It’s little wonder that more than 8 million people call London their home.

Computer generated images depict the interior and exterior at Synergy and are indicative only. *Travel times sourced from TfL and Google Maps. Please ask your Sales Executive for details. Details and prices are correct as of June 2020.

About Synergy

A tale of two cities

Choose Synergy and youll discover it to be the perfect balance between city life and natural surroundings. This large, unique development effortlessly blends contemporary urban design with beautiful green landscaping to create a welcoming, attractive and lively community feeling. A feeling that you will discover extends into the surrounding, sought-after area of Charlton. A new home here will give you everything you could possibly need.

All you love about London is there for the taking

Travelling around London couldnt be easier from our new homes in Charlton. Both Westcombe Park Overground (Zone 3) and Charlton Overground (Zone 3) are around a 10-minute walk away, giving you simple access to all the City has to offer.

However, you dont have to go far to enjoy a wealth of amenities. Close to home is a good choice of supermarkets and high street shops alongside independent and well-established restaurants and bars. And for those with children, youll find a range of Ofsted-rated Good and Outstanding schools for all ages nearby.

Escape to a whole new world

Close to Synergy is another world. A green, tranquil one where you can easily escape to for those moments when you want to relax. With more than 50 beautiful, leafy parks and open spaces to enjoy close to our collection of property for sale in south east London, youll find Synergy really is the best of both worlds.

  • All you need and want within easy reach Synergys great transport links bring galleries, museums, theatres, sports, restaurants and entertainment closer, but youre also never far from plenty of parks to relax in.
  • Effortless journeys, to whatever part of the capital Synergy is really well connected, meaning you can be at Canary Wharf in 26 minutes and London Bridge in 16 minutes. Travelling by car is equally as simple with the South Circular just a few minutes away.
  • And in a moment, the City is left behind you theres a sea of green open spaces in the local area where you can go to escape the stresses and strains of modern life.
  • Take a short walk or drive to school whether your children are younger or older, youll find a variety of Good and Outstanding Ofsted-rated schools close by.
  • Live in harmony everything about Synergy has been carefully considered, from the contemporary urban design to the beautiful natural landscaping.

address: Tideslea Tower, Erebus Drive, London SE28
detailedDescription:
Cash purchasers only,
Redwood Estates are pleased to present this 4th floor two bed, two bath with panoramic riverviews situated on the banks of the Thames. The property is located in the sought after Royal Artillary Quay development on Erebus Drive, just a 10 minute walk from the Woolwich Arsenal DLR station. The apartment features a large open plan living and dining area with double glazed doors to balcony and private patio, offering views west along the Thames to Canary Wharf. The property also has a bright and well presented kitchen, two large double bedrooms, bathroom, ensuite shower room, lift access, concierge service, communal gated gardens and an allocated parking space in a secure gated underground car park. With so much on offer this property is highly recommended!

The following services are close by:
River Service - Thames Clipper - The river boat takes you to Canary Wharf in approximately 23 minutes and to many stops through central London to Waterloo. The service leaves Royal Arsenal every 30 minutes from 06:00 - 09:00 Travel home again from 16:25 until midnight with a frequency of up to 15 minutes. Visit for information and timetable.

Main line Train - 10 minute walk fto Woolwich Arsenal Station with trains taking 20 to 30 minutes into the city centre - London Bridge, Cannon Street and Charing Cross Stations.

DLR - 10 minute walk to Woolwich Arsenal Station with trains taking approximately 25 to 30 minutes into London's Bank Station. Trains will be running approximately every 10 minutes from Monday - Saturday 05.30 - 00.30 and on Sunday 07.00 - 23.30 Expected journey times to the following destinations City Airport 5 minutes, Canary Wharf 19 minutes, Stratford 23 minutes.

Avaliable 02/08/2010

address: The Waterman, 5 Tidemill Square, Lower Riverside, Greenwich Peninsula SE10
detailedDescription:
On entering this well-proportioned home you are immediately impressed with a wide entrance hall, built in utilities cupboard, the warm neutral herringbone wood flooring with underfloor heating, and contrasting smart black woodwork. The interior design by Conran & Partners is inspired by the vibrancy of The Waterman's river and parkside surroundings and the colours create bold monochrome contrasts with the tactile brushed brass splashback, taps and light fittings.
With all the accommodation off the hallway, the rooms are light and airy with floor to ceiling windows providing an abundance of natural light. A large sliding door in the reception area to your private decked balcony, provides you an open aspect view where you can just sit, relax and unwind with that glass of red wine after your long day.

Additionally as a resident of Lower Riverside you have access to your own amenities building, The Aperture, where you will find your 24hr concierge, 3 floors of gym facilities including a fitness studio, meeting rooms available for hire and a business suite. The Waterman has its own cinema for residents, which is available for private hire via your concierge, additionally should you wish to work from home, without wanting to work in your apartment, then take advantage of the work stations on the mezzanine floor.

North Greenwich Underground (Jubilee Line) is a short walk away, reaching Canary Wharf in 2 minutes, and London Bridge in 10 minutes. The O2 with its Icon Designer Outlet is so temptingly close, along with concerts, bowling, and fantastic array of international restaurants. The soon to open Tide London's first-ever riverside linear park (same architects who delivered the New York Highline) will provide when finished, a 5km trail to run, walk, cycle and enjoy outside "charms" on its route.

We would suggest you book an appointment to view this super home in a great position on the Peninsula as soon as you are able!

The apartment is in superb conditions throughout and benefits from modern stylish décor, ample inbuilt storage in the entrance hall, leading to a bright and airy spacious open plan reception room and kitchen ideal for entertaining friends and family.

The accommodations’ features such as the kitchen is presented in excellent condition with a fully fitted kitchen with integrated appliances, immaculate sleek range of matching high gloss walls and base units with countertops and more inbuilt storage capabilities for more appliances.

The private balcony is an extension of the living/reception area. The spacious bedrooms have ample storage space, fitted storage facilities and a modern bathroom with elegant interior décor.

This property offers further benefits from a private balcony with stunning views of the sunset, 24hr concierge service, onsite gym and swimming pool, heating, double glazing and is located on this popular Blackheath Quarter development of Kidbrooke village with great transport links and convenient bars/restaurants within walking distances.

Residents are positioned within an excellent range of transport links; with a 5-minute walk from Kidbrooke Rail Station allowing for easy access into Central London, West End and other routes.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
We are pleased to present to the market this well presented one-bedroom apartment. Built around 2015 as part of the award-winning Greenwich Millennium Village, the apartment boasts a full width balcony (winter garden), stretching across and accessed by both the bedroom and lounge, as well as spacious open plan living and plenty of storage. The flat comes with a parking space and has ESW1 form in place (A2) confirming there are no outstanding fire safety issues.

Apartment Features

-Open plan living/dining room with space for home office area with access to covered balcony (winter garden) via double glazed doors from both bedroom and living room

-Spacious entrance hall with two good size storage cupboards

-Modern, fully fitted, Manhattan high gloss kitchen with white and dove grey split and glass splashback. Integrated appliances (fridge freezer, washer dryer, dishwasher, oven, ceramic hob and hood)

-Double bedroom with access onto balcony (winter garden)

-Fully fitted bathroom with Saloni wall tiles, panelled bath with overhead thermostatic shower facility and shower screen, wash basin and WC

-District central heating system

-Double glazing

-Video entry system

-Lift to all floors

-NHBC 12 year guarantee from date of construction

-Lease date: 125 years from 1 May 2015

-EPC rating – B (83)

-Prewired for Sky+

North Greenwich tube station is less than one mile away with links to Canary Wharf, London Bridge, Waterloo and Westminster. Greenwich Millennium Village features an abundance of landscaped green areas and riverside walkways. The development has a health centre, Outstanding primary school and local shopping facilities. Located by the O2 which hosts a wide variety of shows and events along with a wide selection of bars, restaurants and cinema. The Emirates cable car is also nearby. There are excellent transport links with easy access onto the A102, A2 and A13.

Please note the price of £332,000 is for an 80% share of the property, as is owned by the current residents, this is part of the shared ownership scheme (housing association – Moat). The property can also be purchased outright for the guide price of £415,000. If purchasing the 80% share, the buyer will need to fill in an affordability application, to ensure the buyer does not have a household income higher than £90,000 per year and does not own another property. If purchasing 80% share, rent on additional 20% owned by Moat is £125.49 per month. Service change for building is £204.09 per month.

A beautifully presented two bedroom apartment, found on the second floor of this modern development, measuring circa 759 square foot and featuring underground secure parking.
In superb condition throughout the property comprises a lovely 25ft open plan kitchen living room, with a recently updated kitchen and access on to a private balcony. There are two large double bedrooms, one with en-suite, with a further three piece family bathroom from the hallway. Added benefits include well-kept communal grounds, double glazing and gas central heating. As mentioned, the flat comes with secure underground parking.
Union Park is a popular development, located in East Greenwich, between Calvert Road and Annandale Road. Local shops are close by on Trafalgar Road, as is the town centre. Mainline rail at either Maze Hill or Westcombe Park is close by, with access to the Jubilee Line at North Greenwich and the O2 also in close proximity. The Royal Park is also a short walk away.
Your earliest viewing is recommended.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This unique home is arranged over three floors and entered into a spacious living room. This room has attractive wooden flooring, an open fire, ornate cornicing, built in cabinetry and a double height arched sash window overlooking the heath. A bespoke turned staircase takes you up to a decent double bedroom which also enjoys heath views. There is an en-suite tiled shower room and a dressing area. The kitchen is found of the bottom floor and is made up of solid wood units with a contrasting worktop and parquet flooring. The kitchen leads out to a conservatory and then into the second bedroom which is currently being used as a gym. Finally, there is a fully tiled bathroom, a handy cupboard and a great private patio.

The Paragon occupies a heath side location which means Blackheath Village and its array of shops, cafes, bars and restaurants are very close by. Blackheath station is ideal for commuting with regular services in to London Bridge, with Charing Cross, Cannon Street and London Victoria beyond. Further to this, one stop down the line will bring you to Lewisham Station where the DLR provides regular services into Canary Wharf and Bank.

Situated near the banks of the River Thames, in the Royal Borough of Greenwich, the homes will offer sensational Thames-side living. The development is located near to Woolwich Arsenal station, and the new to be completed Crossrail station.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
An outstanding period property which retains plenty of the original charm and character fronting on to Blackheath common.

Location

The Paragon is regarded as one of the most prestigious roads within Blackheath, given its premier location on the cusp of Blackheath common, and being within just 0.5 miles of Greenwich Park. There are a vast selection of shops, boutiques and various exclusive bars and restaurants all within close proximity. Blackheath station also provides swift connections into London Bridge and beyond.

All times and distances are approximate.

Description

The Paragon is an historic piece of architecture dating back to circa 1800, which comprises of a mixture of attractive Grade I listed houses, which are positioned in a private road on the fringe of Blackheath common. The property offers plenty of original charm and character and boasts well presented accommodation set across three floors, accessed by a feature spiral staircase.

Internally, there is a charming lounge, a fitted kitchen with integral appliances, which leads out into a conservatory / breakfast area, directly leading into a quaint courtyard.

Furthermore, the principal bedroom occupies the top floor and offers an en suite and dressing area, in addition to a generous second bedroom and modern bathroom.

Square Footage: 948 sq ft

Beautifully presented, three bedroom, two bathroom, Victorian family home. Situated on a popular residential street close to superb transportation and highly regarded schools.

The property is beautifully presented and decorated with a contemporary feel throughout. The accommodation comprises; double aspect, open plan living room with bespoke shutters, Period fireplace and built in storage. The stylish high specification kitchen has an island/breakfast bar and gives access onto an easily maintained paved garden, a stunning family bathroom with a Victorian style claw foot bath and utility cupboard completes the ground floor.

On the first floor there are three bedrooms, two of which are double sized, the third a single or ideal as an office. There is also a modern shower room. The property lies within the Halstow school catchment area and just minutes from East Greenwich Pleasaunce park, one of Greenwich's Green Flag Award-winning sites with a Café’ and children’s playground.

Locally you are only a short walk to Westcombe Park mainline station (London Bridge, Cannon Street and Thameslink). There is also easy access to the Jubilee Line at North Greenwich. Shopping facilities at Charlton retail park are just a short walk with a variety of shops including Sainsbury's superstore, M&S and Ikea. Greenwich Centre facilities which include a gym, gp, library and swimming pool and other amenities on the Greenwich Peninsular are nearby.

detailedDescription:
Detailed Description

Situated within the highly sought after development of Heath Court in New Eltham is this two bedroom apartment. The flat is set within well maintained communal grounds and is accessed via a secure entry phone system.

This apartment offers a perfect opportunity for all looking for an investment property with tenants in situ until December 2021!

Well presented throughout is this purpose built flat in a highly sought after, gated and secure, private development within New Eltham. The property offers two double bedrooms, a larger than average reception room, three piece family bathroom and fully fitted kitchen. The property offers double glazed windows throughout, an entry phone system and offered on an unfurnished basis. This well kept property is best suited for the every day commuter as New Eltham Rail station is only a short commute away. Enquire today for your earliest appointment.

Location:
New Eltham is an area of south east London, in the London Boroughs of Greenwich and Bexley. It lies south east of Eltham and North West of Sidcup. Home of many local amenities situated close to the railway station is the library, the Co-operative food store, a cluster of small shops and the Post Office. Larger chain stores may be found in nearby Eltham and Sidcup high streets. New Eltham rail station serves the area, with services to Central London and Gravesend. New Eltham is served by several Transport for London bus services connecting it with Beckenham, Bexleyheath, Bromley, Catford, Chislehurst, Eltham, Lewisham, New Addington, New Cross, Sidcup and Swanley. New Eltham is also home to many primary and pre-schools such as St. Olave's prep school, Crafty Wizards Pre-School, Wyborne Primary School and plenty more.

detailedDescription:
"The large garden catches the sun throughout the day and is so peaceful you would not think you are in London."

What The Seller Says -

"Moved to Greenwich only intending to spend 2 years, but 9 years later and still here!

The location is perfect to access the immediate delights of Greenwich - take a short stroll to the right and you will be by the riverside which is heavenly on a summer evening and refreshing on a winter's morning; stroll to the left and you have the useful shops of Trafalgar road and the gloriously green Greenwich Park.

The house itself could not be better positioned on a lovely road with ample on street parking and a 2 min walk from the River Gardens development for supermarkets, coffee shop and pubs.

With planning permission approved to create a large open plan kitchen/diner/living room and a separate study/guest bedroom, this home would be perfect for anyone wishing to make a long term home.

What The Agent Says -

Such a beautiful modern house, which has a period look to it and located on a very sought after residential street.

Considered by locals as a very quiet street for vehicle traffic and a great community feel.

Inside the house you will find a lovely modern kitchen which benefit from having some integrated appliances, a spacious living room which offers direct access to a very good size private rear garden.

Downstairs there is also a useful guest WC and upstairs you will find two double size bedrooms and a main bathroom suite, with shower over bath.

Further benefits include a mixture of wood floors and fitted carpets, ample storage, a lovely brick facade and the planning permission already in place to extend the house to rear.

Property is freehold and the owner may be willing to sell chain free.

Maze Hill mainline station and Greenwich park are just a short stroll away from this location. If you wish to take a walk to Greenwich town centre, where you will find the Cutty Sark DLR station, covered market and much more, you will pass some lovely river front pubs and cafes along the way, as well as the famous Royal Naval college.<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
++ no dogs permitted ++ chain free, share of freehold and proactive vendors are offering to the market this immaculate 3 bedroom apartment set within a Grade II listed development. With approximately 7 acres of maintained grounds, converted in 1995 into luxury residential accommodation from it's original military hospital use design inspired by Florence Nightingale (originally built in 1865). The property also benefits from an allocated car parking space, bike storage and on site security

The Royal Herbert Pavilions offers wonderful views over the listed grounds and access to a private health club, which includes a gym, swimming pool, sauna/steam room, residents bar area with pool table and tennis courts (£760pa). Close proximity to the equally green open spaces of Greenwich and Blackheath all within the Royal Borough of Greenwich.

The property itself has an abundance of character and storage, current vendors have spared no expense and present the property to a future owner with peace of mid that you can move straight in, boasting:

  • Bamboo wood flooring, luxury carpet and underlay throughout
  • Fitted bespoke curtains and shutters
  • Integrated appliances and separate utility area below the master bedroom mezzanine
  • Fully tiled bathroom with separate double walk shower and bath.
  • Extra mezzanine space above second bedroom, with stair access
  • Additional storage space above third bedroom
  • External fitted storage for pram, paint, toys, shoes etc.


Band D for Council Tax £1640pa.

For further information on the development

detailedDescription:
A superb, five bedroom semi-detached home that has been thoughtfully extended and renovated by the current owners.
The ground floor has an open plan feel with a spacious bay-fronted lounge leading through to a stunning kitchen/diner. The white high-gloss kitchen units, including a central island, have integrated appliances and black granite work surfaces. Bi-folding doors span the length of the room and an atrium window floods the room with light. A utility room and WC complete this floor. The first floor has three bedrooms, an en-suite to the master and a stylish, fully tiled, family bathroom. Two further bedrooms and a bathroom are found on the top floor.

The landscaped rear garden is south-west facing and boasts a fantastic stone patio with steps down to a large grassed area. A block paved drive to the front offers off street parking for two vehicles.

The property is situated in a quiet close off Broad Walk, just a short walk to the open spaces of Eltham Common. Both Eltham and Kidbrooke Stations are approximately one mile away and offer regular services into London Bridge, Charing Cross and Victoria.

detailedDescription:
Offered to the Woolwich market is this bright and airy one bedroom, top floor apartment, situated in the exclusive Trinity Walk development close to superb transportation and convenient shopping facilities of Woolwich Town Centre.

Internally this extremely well presented apartment is bright, spacious and comprises; a large open plan reception with access to a private south east facing balcony and incorporates a high end integrated kitchen. There is a great sized double bedroom with luxurious fitted wardrobes (comes with approx. 9 years guarantee from Metro Wardrobes) and a ultra-modern three piece Jack and Jill bathroom suite with fitted large LED mirror cabinet which completes the property. There is also ample storage! Added benefits include warranty with the builder, Lovell, until mid-December 2021 and a NHBC warranty (approx. 8+ years remaining). In addition a parking permit in the site for this apartment is allocated for approx. 1 year.

Situated only a short walk to Woolwich town centre, which offers an array of shopping, leisure and transportation facilities such as; Woolwich Arsenal Station for London Bridge, Cannon Street, Thameslink and DLR station and many frequent bus links. The Thames clipper and Ferry are also highly sought after. North Greenwich is within easy access for Jubilee line.

The buildings have been carefully considered to create a strong visual impact, accentuated with sensitive design details to provide a sense of individuality and style. The apartment has been built to maximise space and light and finished with a high specification to ensure an excellent level of comfort, security and quality.

EWS1 compliant.

detailedDescription:
This stunning five bedroom house is located just moment away from oxleas woods & hornfair park. The property is offered to the market chain free.

The property has been refurbished to an extremely high standard throughout including a large front facing reception room with bay window, impressive extended kitchen diner with porcelain floor, granite worktops and integrated multi ovens, American style stainless steel fridge freezer and feature centre island. The kitchen breakfast room also benefits from having a sizeable ceiling light well and bifold doors opening onto newly laid lawned garden. Finally to the ground floor is a large utility room and guest WC. As you ascent to the first floor you are welcomed by three bedrooms including an impressive master bedroom with its own en-suite shower room. You will find a modern bathroom suite to complete the floor. On the second floor you will find two further bedrooms and a bathroom.

Further benefits include double glazing throughout, gas central heating and off street parking.

The house is well positioned for beautiful green spaces including Eltham Common and Oxleas woods. There are many bus links from Shooters Hill and Well Hall road which will take you to Greenwich, Blackheath, Eltham and Woolwich for mainline stations, DLR, Jubilee line and The Elizabeth Line (due for completion in 2019).

For further information or to arrange a viewing please contact our Blackheath Standard office today.

detailedDescription:
**price range £500,000 - £550,000 **

Anthony Martin are delighted to offer to the market this very well presented three/four bedroom mid terrace townhouse property. The location is second to none and offers everything a growing family might need, from the peace and quiet of the development itself to being is close distance to local schools, shops and transport including both Greenwich and Blackheath Train Stations.

The accommodation on offer comprises of a good size entrance hall which gives access to all of the ground floor space, to the front of the property there is a very useful room which could have many uses, currently this is used as study but could easily be used as bedroom four if needed, back off the entrance hall there is a handy wet room and to the rear of the home there is an open plan kitchen/dining room, this also gives access to the low maintenance rear garden.

To the first floor, to the front of the home is a good size lounge which spreads across the width of the property whilst to the rear there is a nice size double bedroom.

To the second floor the space continues with a very open feeling landing with built in cupboards, bedroom one to the rear of the property, bedroom three to the front of the the home which is a good size double bedroom and the newly fitted modern bathroom.

Externally there is an allocated parking space to the front and as mentioned a low maintenance rear garden with a decking seating area and a sought after summerhouse which would be ideal if your working from home.

I'm sure this property will continue to make a great family home and tick a lot of boxes, so to not miss out, call anthony martin now to arrange your viewing!

detailedDescription:
2-bedroom apartment available at Hawthorne Crescent for £148,750
Register now to book a viewing

Hawthorne Crescent - Apartment C6.05
2 bedroom 8th-floor apartment offering 80 sq.m of internal floor area with outdoor space. Contact a member of our sales team now to view our new show home.
148,750 for a 25% share of £595,000 and a deposit as low as £14,850 and a minimum income of £71,000.

L&Q at Greenwich Square
Buying an apartment at Greenwich Square opens the door to a unique community and offers the perfect place to call home. Our homes are built around people and offer beautifully designed homes with a desirable specification and outdoor space to each apartment. These homes are also set around a beautiful garden square. The development has everything you could need on your doorstep making life that little bit more convenient. With every block distinct and individual, creating an intelligent balance between shared community and private space.

Shared Ownership
Under the Shared Ownership scheme, you part-own and part-rent your home, making it possible for first-time buyers and families to get on the property ladder.
The minimum share you can purchase is 25% and the maximum is 75%. You will usually pay a mortgage on the part you own and a subsidized rent on the part you don't own. As your income rises, you can increase the share you own until you eventually own 100%.

The minimum income required for a 1 bedroom apartment is £49,000
The minimum income required for a 2 bedroom apartment is £58,000
The minimum income required for a 3 bedroom apartment is £67,000
*Household incomes are based on joint applications. Single applications are able to apply but may need to increase their deposit contribution to meet shared ownership affordability requirements.

Viewings
For those who would like to and are able to visit us, the Show Home is now open on an appointment-only basis, with extra measures in place to ensure your wellbeing. Please call us to book your appointment. If you would prefer to speak to our Sales Team from your own home, they are still on hand and can conduct appointments via phone, email and by virtual tour. *We are taking extra precautions to ensure the health and wellbeing of our customers, staff and members of the public.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Doorsteps are excited to market this spacious, recently refurbished, two-bedroom ninth floor apartment in the Vista Building located in Woolwich town centre.

The modern apartment offers an expansive 381sqft kitchen/lounge/diner, two well-sized double bedrooms (one with an en suite), a family bathroom (with bath & shower), a hallway with great storage facilities and a large private balcony which looks out onto the river.

Positioned in the heart of Woolwich, the Vista Building offers secure entrance doors, lift access and a 24-hour concierge. It is excellently located, with a wide range of supermarkets, shops and eateries less than 5 minutes’ walk away.

A variety of transport links are in close proximity including DLR, rail and Thames Clipper. Woolwich Arsenal station (rail and DLR) is a short walk, connecting to London City Airport (7 mins) and Canary Wharf (20 mins). CrossRail will soon add to these existing options, offering direct travel to Liverpool Street (14 mins) and Bond Street (21 mins).

The apartment is a must see and would be ideal for couples, families or as an investment opportunity.

Early viewing is advised.
