title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This stunning four bedroom townhouse located in the West Greenwich Conservation Area has been completely renovated by the current owners combining a contemporary finish with beautiful period features including exposed brickwork, original oak floorboards, sliding sash windows and wooden panelling. Offering fantastic living and entertaining space, the double reception room leads through to the incredible rear kitchen extension with a handcrafted steel and tempered glass roof flooding the house with natural light. The bespoke Plain English kitchen complete with solid stone worktops provides exceptional storage with an additional built-in pantry and high-spec appliances include an oven and stove, fitted double fridge and underfloor heating. The kitchen tiles have been extended through to the patio creating a stunning extension of the living space for the summer months with the West-facing garden having been landscaped to provide both entertaining and family space complete with an outdoor lighting system. The principal bedroom and two further bedrooms are situated on the upper floors all featuring solid walnut fitted wardrobes while the four-piece family bathroom offers a more traditional style with a roll top bath tub and separate walk-in shower. The lower floor has been designed to offer flexibility for both a home study and guest room providing a fold-down bed, ensuite shower room, utility room and a separate wine cellar. The attention to detail is obvious to see, with additional features such as oak shutters and new cast iron radiators installed throughout the house. This is the perfect readymade home, moments from all of the incredible amenities the area has to offer.

Situation
Royal Hill is located in the heart of West Greenwich, moments from the open green spaces of Greenwich Park. Greenwich Mainline and DLR Station is a few moments’ walk offering a swift commute to Canary Wharf, London Bridge and Cannon Street while the Thameslink Line offers direct connections to Blackfriars, Kings Cross and Luton Airport. There are a wide array of amenities for local residents to enjoy including the Royal Hill shops which feature an independent greengrocers, butchers and fishmongers while a number of popular restaurants and pubs are located nearby.

4 Bedroom Georgian Townhouse

Moments From Greenwich Park

0.3 Miles From Greenwich Mainline And DLR Station

West-Facing Rear Garden

Rear Extension With Hand Crafted Kitchen

Lower Ground Floor Guest Suite

title: 2 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
Built in 1926, a substantial semi-detached house that has been greatly extended by a loft conversion and ground floor additions at the rear, to create a very spacious family home with a south-facing garden of over 100ft in depth.

The house is entered via an extremely generous entrance hall off which are the two original good sized reception rooms, a cloakroom and a breakfast room which leads in turn to the kitchen extension, with door and south-facing windows opening onto the garden at the rear. The first floor provides two good double bedrooms and two singles
and a family bathroom, and on the top floor there is one enormous bedroom with air-conditioning and a second bathroom. At the far end of the long and secluded south-facing garden is a useful garden summer house, presently used as an office/gym. With off-street parking to the brick paved driveway for up to three vehicles. The house has full gas central heating and uPVC sealed unit double glazed windows throughout.

Westbrook Road is a short residential turning just off Kidbrooke Park Road, less than half mile walk from the eastern edge of The Heath and a little further from Greenwich Park, Blackheath & Kidbrooke mainline railway stations and Thomas Tallis School.

The accommodation comprises ● Entrance Hall ● Three Reception Rooms ● Kitchen ● Cloakroom ● Five Bedrooms ● Two Bathrooms ● Driveway Parking ● 110ft South-Facing Rear Garden ● Full Gas Fired Central Heating ● Double Glazing

The spacious and bright accommodation offers a versatile layout over a number of levels with some 1350 Sq Ft. The property also has the added benefit of two, secure underground parking spaces.

The property benefits from a central Greenwich location, early viewings are highly recommended.

detailedDescription:
***Guide Price £1,300,000-£1,350,000*** A substantial five bedroom late Victorian end terrace family home with no forward chain.

Arranged over just three floors, this well presented house offers flexible and adaptable accommodation to suit most growing families.

The layout is briefly as follows; with the ground floor comprising of an entrance hall, dual aspect living room and good size kitchen / breakfast room with bi-folding doors to an easily maintained rear garden. On the first floor is the main bedroom and large contemporary family bathroom, together with a further guest bedroom with en-suite shower room. The top floor has three further bedrooms, the rear of which provides access to a terrace.

Situated in the highly sought after Ashburnham Triangle conservation area, all amenities are on your doorstep, and Greenwich mainline / DLR stations are literally just around the corner for swift access to the city and Canary Wharf with the markets, bars and restaurants of Greenwich village being a short stroll further. Also close by are the traditional shops on Royal Hill such as the butchers, greengrocers, fishmongers and cheeseshop.

All in all this is a lovely house ready for the next owner to move in and enjoy.

Early viewings highly recommended.

The Sellers Say: "We’ve been really happy living in this house. Opening up the folding doors in the kitchen brought the outside in and often the inside out when we wheeled the dining table into the garden.

Period features such as the fireplaces and coving give it a cosy feel that’s balanced by the modern finishes of the kitchen and bathrooms. Set in a tranquil location near the heart of Greenwich it’s also really close to the station for DLR and mainline train services.

The neighbourhood is quiet but has a great sense of community. Opposite the house is the traffic-free play street which is fun for kids, has a pub for grown-ups and is also the regular setting for the Ashburnham Triangle Association’s annual summer party.

We’ll really miss the house but we’re sure the next owners will love living there as much as we did."<br /><br />
title: 5 bed end terrace house for sale

detailedDescription:
Set on the top floor (ninth) is this stunningly designed two bedroom apartment with two private balconies offering panoramic views.

Boasting a stylish finish throughout, the apartments is complimented by a spacious open plan living area illuminated by the private balcony.

The modern fully fitted kitchen is perfect for entertaining, with both a dining area & additional island for storage.

The two double bedrooms are generously sized and well presented, with the master bedroom offering fitted wardrobes & en suite bathroom.

The sleek family bathroom offers both shower and bathtub. Ample storage is offered with a pantry and utility cupboard to the hall.

Resident benefits include video entry system, off street allocated parking with electrical charging point and underground secure bike storage. NHBC warranty included. Concierge service is also soon to be on site.

The surrounding area offers an abundance of fantastic bars & restaurants to enjoy, a great selection of greenery including Barrack Field & Woolwich Common.

Perfectly located for travel links with Woolwich Arsenal Station a short walk away offering Thameslink, South-eastern lines and DLR. The Thames Clipper and Woolwich Ferry are also close by. Additional accessible links are the popular City Airport and soon to be completed Crossrail/Elizabeth Line making Woolwich a highly desirable and central location to live.

detailedDescription:
Set between the well established Sutcliffe Park and the completely new Cator Park in Meridian Gate, Kidbrooke Village, is this bright and well-proportioned 7th floor one bedroom property with a distinctive green rounded balcony. The property comprises an entry hall leading to the open plan kitchen/ living room which in turn extends onto the balcony, an ample bedroom also with access to the balcony, and a modern bathroom. detailedDescription:
Don't miss out on the final three 2-bed apartments at Royal Arsenal Riverside. All homes come with private outdoor space and are move in ready. Benefit from the 6 months rent-free incentive.

Location

Crossrail available on site - less than 3 minute walk
DLR and Train station - less than 10 minute walk
20 minutes from Canary Wharf
5 minutes from London City Airport
Thames path cycle and walk route - less than 5 minute walk
Artisan patisserie and café on your doorstep
Close to unique bars and restaurants
Local shops and food hall available on site
Close walk to high street

Description

The apartments at Royal Arsenal boast high specification throughout and are ready to move into straight away. All homes have a private balcony or a terrace.

The area
Royal Arsenal Riverside is home to the new ‘cultural quarter’, giving it a creative and vibrant feel. Exciting developments in the area will include a 450 seat theatre and a performance courtyard. Within the development there is a wide array of restaurants, bars and pubs suited for all dining preferences, plus numerous opportunities to enjoy the great outdoors.
In addition to this there are several schools located in Royal Arsenal Riverside that provide high levels of education. St Peters Primary School achieved an outstanding report from Ofsted. There is also the Millennium Performing Arts College and the University of Greenwich within close distance.

Travel*
Royal Arsenal Riverside provides a quick commute thanks to the fantastic transport links into the City. Woolwich Arsenal station is just 300 metres away.

• 19 mins to Canary Wharf
• 19 mins to Bank
• 25 mins to London Bridge
• 32 mins to Liverpool Street

*All travel times are approximate and have been taken from Google Maps.

Square Footage: 786 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 0 years remaining

detailedDescription:
This large mixed use freehold development is offered in a prominent location on the corner of Camrose Street and Plumstead High Street.

Offering a gia of approximately over 3000 sqft, the site currently comprises of a ground floor commercial space with basement storage currently trading as an off license. There are 3 good sized flats on the upper floors. There is also a garage located on the lower ground floor.

Plumstead and Woolwich are part of South East London′s massive regeneration project, with Woolwich town centre almost unrecognisable compared to just a few years ago. Transport links are within easy reach, with an excellent mainline rail service and DLR just a stone′s throw away from the apartment. The exciting new Cross Rail project is also due for completion during March 2021. This will offer unrivalled links into Canary Wharf and Central London. Plumstead itself is within a pleasant green setting featuring the vast commons and Oxleas Wood, which provide a perfect backdrop to some stunning period properties.

If you would like to book an appointment to view this fantastic investment opportunity, then please contact Kallars today.

detailedDescription:
This beautifully presented five/six bedroom family home which offers versatility and space throughout, arranged over four storeys and spanning over 1,800 sq ft.

Located just a stones throw away from Blackheath Standard the house is perfectly positioned for all your everyday needs and also has Blackheath Village, Greenwich Park & Westcombe Park Station all within walking distance.

Arranged over four storeys the property briefly comprises of; a large and extended (34'11x16'8)open plan kitchen/ family room with separate bedroom and wet room on the lower ground floor.
The ground floor consists of a lovely through reception room and a room currently used as a gym that could also be a study or bedroom if required.
On the first floor is two large double bedrooms and one single bedroom or study as well as the main family bathroom.
The second floor is another great size (15'8x11) bedroom with a huge amount of eaves storage.

To the rear is a well maintained landscaped garden and to the front is off street parking for multiple cars, there is also side access.

This is a beautiful family home with an enormous amount of versatility whether it be for people needing one or more home offices, a growing family or just someone looking for more space it really does tick every box.

Your earliest viewing is highly recommended. Virtual tours can be seen at .

The property is very convenient for transport links with Westcombe Park station nearby and buses stopping for Blackheath train station (0.9 miles) and North Greenwich tube station (1.7 miles). Blackheath Common, (0.1 miles), and Royal Greenwich Park (0.2 miles) are both just a short walk. Blackheath Village with its array or restaurants and bars is only 0.9 miles away and the daily conveniences of Blackheath Standard only 150 yards away.

detailedDescription:
"I have lived in Charlton for over 40 years, and 15 of those at Erwood Road. I always liked Charlton, with so many parks, lots of well known sites nearby and the London marathon going thought it.

It is also good for commuting and Erwood Road, has bus stops nearby, which I take to the rail station, underground or DLR.

The house has everything you need, a big kitchen diner, large nicely shaped living room, big double bedrooms with fitted cupboards, a second toilet down stairs and double radiators making it cosy. Some what modernisng is needed, which is perfect to make it your own.

This is such an ideal first time purchase, as the vendor says. Offering ideal living space, a low maintenance garden, and in a cul-de-sac too.

Perfectly located for transport, with Woolwich Dockyard Station nearby, and a choice of buses to North Greenwich tube station, Woolwich Station, DLR and new Elizabeth Line tube station from 2021.

Offered completely chain free and highly recommended.<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
Situated within easy reach of Woolwich Town Centre, Station, DLR, and Crossrail (2022) is this 2 double bedroom 1970's Built House. This property is double glazed, has a 19ft kitchen/diner, and a 1st floor bathroom. The property also has central heating and a 20ft rear garden.

Lounge: 12' 8" x 11' 10" (3.86m x 3.61m) Double glazed door to rear with double glazed sliding panels leading to garden. Radiator. Laminate flooring.

Kitchen/diner: 19' x 8' 11" (5.79m x 2.72m) Double glazed window to front. Radiator. Understairs cupboard. Wall and base unit with work surface over. Stainless steel sink and drainer unit. Vinyl floor tiles. Plumbed for washing machine. Tile splash.

detailedDescription:
With absolutely breathtaking panoramic views over London and found on the 15th and 16th floors of this newly built block, is this huge three bedroom, two bathroom, duplex penthouse spanning in excess of 1,300sq.ft within the prestigious Kidbrooke Village. EWS1 approved.

With a south and west facing aspect the views from this home are probably the best we have seen and you can take in many of London's landmarks including; St Pauls Cathedral, The Shard, The Wembley Arch, The BT Tower, Canary Wharf, The 02 and Blackheath common and Greenwich Park aswell as Kent. The property is immaculately presented throughout with floor to ceiling windows in every room and plenty of light.

The accommodation comprises; a large entrance hall with storage and utility cupboards, shower room and a very large and bright reception room leading to a modern open plan kitchen and a large private terrace. Upstairs is a large master bedroom with built in wardrobes and ensuite bathroom with two further double bedrooms. Further benefits are an underground car parking space, 24 hour concierge, communal gardens and gymnasium.

This is an outstanding penthouse apartment and your immediate viewing is essential. Video tour can be seen at

Hopgood Tower is part of the sought after Kidbrooke Village development - a new and vibrant London community which offers an outstanding choice of quality, sustainable new homes.

As well as high end apartments and houses, it will offer new parks, shops, bars, restaurants, schools, sports, healthcare and community facilities. Downstairs at Hopgood Tower is a Sainsbury's local, a newly opened restaurant, pharmacy, convenience store and coffee shop. Sutcliffe Park with beautifully landscaped wetlands, sports facilities and ponds is just a few hundred yards away as is the new Cator park which has been created as part of Kidbrooke Village, including a large children's adventure play area and a multi-use games area.

Transport links to central London are excellent with travel to London Bridge in just 15 minutes from nearby rebuilt Kidbrooke station. Direct trains to Victoria, Charing Cross, Waterloo East and Cannon Street also run from here. Hopgood Tower also has direct access to Kidbrooke Station ticket office and onto the platform for trains into London. Blackheath Village, with its array of boutique shops, bars and restaurants, is also close by.

detailedDescription:
Purplebricks are delighted to present this stunning two bedroom, 5th floor apartment in the highly desirable Royal Arsenal Development; which provides “lifestyle living” with an immaculate onsite gym, swimming pool, spa, cinema and 24-hour concierge.

The property is beaming with light and airiness throughout with dual aspect river views. The property comprises of a spacious entrance hallway with a high end luxury shower room, large open plan kitchen / living room. Kitchen is fully integrated with designer appliances built in and finished with a high specification quartz worktop. There are two large double bedrooms with the master consisting of a stunning en-suite shower room.

The property benefits from a long 997 year lease and a large balcony overlooking the community farmers market.

The property is located 300m from the new Woolwich Crossrail station and 200m from the Thames Riverboat pier with direct access to the O2 and Central London. It is within close proximity to other excellent transport links including Woolwich Arsenal Rail and DLR stations. The Woolwich Car Ferry is 500m away.

Viewing of this stunning apartment is highly recommended.

Lease Information

Outstanding Lease: 997 years

Ground Rent: £425 pa

Service Charges: £3500 pa (giving Residents Club access inclusive of gym, swimming pool, spa, cinema, concierge)

detailedDescription:
Guide Price £2,000,000-£2,250,000. An impressive four double bedroom, three reception room, two bathroom Grade II listed Georgian House spanning over 2,500sq.ft set on this sought after road and just 320 metres from Blackheath Village.

The property has been well maintained by the current owners over the past 36 years and is in very good decorative order, although still offers scope to enhance. Features include high ceilings, period features, wood flooring, sash windows, feature fireplaces and gas fired central heating.

The accommodation is arranged over four floors and comprises; an entrance porch and large entrance hall, two large reception rooms with interconnecting doors which are currently used as a beautiful large dual aspect through reception room with verandas to the front and rear. There is a new conservatory/garden room beyond the hall . Downstairs is a large kitchen diner with a beautiful handmade Greenwich Woodworks kitchen, wood burner and inter connecting doors to a large third reception room. There is also a utility room and downstairs cloakroom. The first floor offers two huge double bedrooms, both with built in wardrobes, a bathroom and shower room. There are two further large double bedrooms on the top floor and ample eaves storage. To the rear is a lovely and mature 85ft garden with a summer house. The large front garden provides off street parking with mature trees and shrubs.

This is a wonderful period family home and is sold chain free. Your immediate viewing is essential.

The property is located on just 320 metres from Blackheath Village with its array of bars, restaurants, boutique shops and mainline station. Trains from Blackheath to London Bridge take approximately 10 minutes, and approximately 25 minutes to Victoria. The heath is only 0.33 miles and Greenwich Park just a short walk away. The Ofsted outstanding Brooklands, (0.25 miles) and John Ball Primary Schools, (0.3 miles) are very close as are several sought-after private schools including Blackheath Prep, Blackheath High School and the Pointer School.

address: Warehouse Court, No 1 Street, London SE18
detailedDescription:
Extending to approximately 726 square feet, the property is finished to a high specification and comprises a bright open plan reception area with a feature exposed brickwork wall and floor to ceiling windows (with access to a private balcony), a contemporary fully integrated kitchen, two generous double bedrooms, the larger with a dressing area and en-suite bathroom, a modern fully tiled bathroom with a walk-in shower and excellent built in storage throughout. The property also benefits from views over to the River Thames and across the historic Artillery Square. The property also comes with a car parking space in the secure underground carpark. The apartment also has use of a lovely communal garden with fountains.

There are as many reasons to look at this property as an investment as there are as a home. The most notable change being the Elizabeth Crossrail line, which arrival is imminent, offering dramatically reduced journey times to Canary Wharf (8 mins), Liverpool Street (14 mins), Bond Street (22 mins) and even Heathrow (50 mins).

In addition to the future improvements, there are an abundance of on-site facilities available today. These include a 24hr concierge, residents gym, cafe's, pub's, shops and medical centre. There are also a number of outside spaces to enjoy such as the lawn and formal gardens of Wellington Park through to green corners, wide avenues and broad squares, the forthcoming 4 acre Waterfront Park and over 1km of river walks. Those travelling to the city can do so by various, easily accessible means, including rail, road and river boat.

detailedDescription:
Purplebricks are proud to present this high specification, interior designed 3 double bedroom, 2 bathroom, fourth floor apartment overlooking The River Thames. This property is located within the highly desirable Royal Arsenal Development; which provides “lifestyle living” with an immaculate onsite gym, swimming pool, spa, cinema and 24-hour concierge.

The property is beaming with light and airiness throughout with dual aspect river views from its two large balconies. The property comprises; large entrance hallway, three large double bedrooms with the master containing a luxurious en-suite bathroom, a large family bathroom and the well-proportioned open plan kitchen / living room. The kitchen contains fully fitted and integrated appliances. The riverside balcony runs the width of the apartment. There is another extra hallway storage cupboard and utility room with fibre broadband connectivity.

The specification of the apartment has been significantly enhanced with floor-to-ceiling built in wardrobes in every bedroom and the hallway, contemporary wallpaper / feature walls created in each of the bedrooms and the living room. There is also an outstanding in-ceiling wireless sound system throughout the apartment with built in speakers in all rooms; and high-quality floor to ceiling curtains throughout.

The property comes with an allocated parking space valued by the developers at £25,000.

The property is located 300m from the new Woolwich Crossrail station and 200m from the Thames Riverboat pier with direct access to the O2 and Central London. It is within close proximity to other excellent transport links including Woolwich Arsenal Rail and DLR stations. The Woolwich Car Ferry is 500m away.

There is an abundance of award winning restaurants and bars nearby and a regular farmers community market which brings all of the locals together. The apartment is located adjacent to Maribor Park and fountains.

Viewing of this stunning apartment is highly recommended.

Lease Information

Outstanding Lease: 995 (of original 999) years

Ground Rent: C.£525 p/a

Service Charges: C.£4000 p/a (giving Residents Club access inclusive of gym, swimming pool, spa, cinema, concierge)

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. detailedDescription:
""Guide Price £290,000 - £310,000** "I have loved living in this flat, waking up with the sun shining into the bedroom and then at the end of the day the sun shining into the sitting room, looking out at the quiet trees and garden."

What The Seller Says -

"It’s great being so close to Greenwich, Blackheath, the park and going into the city, but still being off the main road on a quiet street and with lovely neighbours - a perfect home."

What The Agent Says -

A truly beautiful modern flat, impeccably re-designed interior, located on the ground level and residents enjoy free off street parking.

The interior comprises a spacious living room, with plenty of space to dine and direct access to a recently fitted kitchen. Inside the kitchen you will notice a fresh look with lovely colour schemes and integrated appliances.

The bedroom is a double size, benefiting from having fitted wardrobes and one of the stand out features of this modern home, has to be the recently fitted bathroom suite, featuring a unique wash hand basin, with shower over bath.

Communal gardens, directly to the rear of the building are an added bonus and there is a long lease remaining on the property.

Deptford Bridge DLR station is only a few minutes away on foot, making the walk to Greenwich mainline station just over five minutes and town centre a further few minutes, where you will find the covered market, royal park and a wide choice of restaurants, river front pubs, supermarkets and much more.<br /><br />
title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
"We have loved living and bringing up our children in this family home that we have lovingly extended and renovated to provide a practical and open living arrangement."

What The Sellers Say -

This includes a large and light kitchen diner with bifold doors leading out to a modern and well looked after garden, suitable for children playing and entertaining guests throughout the year.

We have created lots of storage space without compromising the size of the rooms.

This location is ideal for commuting to central London, by tube, train or boat, with easy access to outer London, including Kent and Essex. Excellent schools, both primary and secondary.

East Greenwich has a lovely community feel, is a stone’s throw to Greenwich Peninsula, Thames Path, Greenwich Park and Blackheath Village, which have an abundance of cafes, restaurants and pubs and we, as a family, have thoroughly enjoyed living here.”

What The Agent Says -

An extended mid terrace house, of a later Victorian period and has been tastefully refurbished by the current owner.

The loft extension has allowed for the house to flow better and offer an abundance of space, making this an ideal purchase for those wanting space and to have a bunch of amenities on their doorstep.

On the ground level you will find a reception room featuring lovely bay window to front, good size and modern bathroom suite with roll top bath and walk in shower.

The kitchen is one of the showcases of this amazing home, having been extended with Velux windows and bi-folding doors leading out to a good size south facing garden, a real sun trap.

There is plenty of dining space in the kitchen and the new owner will benefit from having integrated appliances.

On the first level you will find two double size bedrooms and another set of stairs leading you up to the loft conversion, which includes a study/TV area, a double size bedroom and an en-suite shower room.

Further benefits include ample storage, double glazed windows, gas central heating, a mixture of wood flooring and fitted carpets and internal space is over 1,000 square feet.

Westcombe Park mainline station is approximately half a mile away, making this a nice easy stroll. One of the nearest parks is Greenwich Pleasuance, which is a little further along and Greenwich town centre can be reached quite easily.

North Greenwich tube station, which is on the Jubilee line, is just over a mile away, where you will also find the O2 centre.

Within a few minutes walk locals enjoy the benefits of a few local shopping parks, which include major supermarkets such as Marks & Spencer and Sainsbury's.<br /><br />
title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
"Located within the beautiful Millennium Village, our flat sits in a quiet residential street connecting to the Greenwich Yacht Club and river Thames."

The area is safe and welcoming, and upon visiting you'll see how well maintained the entire development is. The flat itself is still brand new, very spacious and well built. We've done very little to the flat so presents itself as a blank canvas.

This is our first home and are sad to move on, if we were looking again would pick this place no questions!

A five minute walk will get you onto the Thames cycle path, Ikea and B&Q. Ten minutes to the enormous Charlton retail park. Fifteen minutes to the O2 and its brand new outlet centre, alongside North Greenwich jubilee line. If you walk in the other direction you can reach Charlton and Westcombe Park train station in the same amount of time. And for those like ourselves will love to know that the heart of Greenwich is within a 25 minute walk and has a wonderful route past London's Meantime brewery, local pub 'Cutty Sark', royal naval college and tonnes of other local amenities and historic landmarks - we recommend doing this every weekend, it really is spectacular."

What The Agent Says -

This owner occupied home really does tick a lot of boxes, with floods of natural light coming into this first floor flat, very spacious interior and good size balcony, so you have your own outside space.

The interior briefly comprises a very spacious living room, with a large dining space, direct access to balcony and an impressive open plan kitchen, which benefits from having integrated appliances and a centre island.

The bedroom is a very good size and features a floor to ceiling fitted wardrobe, a modern bathroom suite with shower over bath. Further advantages include wood flooring, ample storage and on-site concierge service.

Locally residents enjoy an easy life when it comes to shopping, with two shopping parks within a short walking distance and the Icon outlet at the O2 centre, which is a brisk walk or a very short bus ride or cycle away.

North Greenwich tube station, which is on the Jubilee line, is adjacent to the O2 centre which is great for commuters. Greenwich town centre and its beautiful royal park, covered market and many river front pubs are also within easy reach.

This property is also EWS1 compliant.<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
This is an amazing location and just opposite the Royal Greenwich Park, a rare opportunity to acquire a detached, three bedroom period cottage, known as ‘Limes Cottage.’ The current owner of this beauty has cherished so many great memories for the past 30 years and now he believes it should be made available for the benefit of the next homeowner(s).

"Pevsner's 1952 London II Volume classified Croom's Hill as the pride of domestic architecture in Greenwich. There are not many streets near London which give so goo and sustained an idea of the well-to-do private house from the C17 to the early C19."

Want to be part of this ever growing incredible history in the centuries to come? I have this fantastic opportunity for you.

Freehold

Detached Period Cottage

Wrap-around Private Garden (1,872 sqf / 173.9 sqm)

Original Features

Great Amenities

Spectacular Location

3 Bedroom (1,058 sqf / 98.3 sqm)
--


The house was originally built in the late 1800's to accommodate various very important people who attended the Royal Naval College in Greenwich. It's been said that 'The Limes Cottage' was graced by royalty when the Prince of Thailand may have resided in there during the 1890’s while studying at the Royal Naval College to later become "The Father of our Thai Navy."

The cottage is set back from the road and sits behind the original brick walls making it extremely private and secluded. The accommodation is arranged over two floors and the property retains much of its original character and features, including its fireplaces and stained glass windows, and has a secluded wrap around garden which benefits from the sun all day long.

To the ground floor there is a grand dual aspect reception room measuring 18ft by 16ft with great high ceilings, original working fireplace (gas), making this the most perfect living and entertaining space. Still on the ground floor you will find the fitted kitchen as well as a bedroom which could be used as a home office if chosen to.

Upstairs to the first floor there is a large dual aspect master bedroom just above the reception room again with extremely high ceilings and original fireplace, another bedroom and a three-piece bathroom. There is also a large landing space at the end of the staircase which would make the perfect reading spot with a lovely armchair or study area. Further benefits include residents permit parking.

Crooms Hill is one of the oldest and most sought after roads in London and runs down from the Heath into Greenwich town centre. It is extremely well placed and is arguably one of the best positions in the south east of London. You can even travel to the centre of London (City, Tate Modern, the Embankment) by Uber Boat (by Thames Clippers) from the Greenwich Pier. Another attractive transportation link nearby is the Emirate's Airline Cable Car.

Your next home is situated just across to the majestic Greenwich Royal Park. Attractions nearby include the world-famous Royal Observatory, Cutty Sark, Maritime Museum, Queens House, Greenwich Market, Royal Naval College, Eltham Palace and O2. It is nearly upon the historic Greenwich Meridian Line. Fascinating events can be observed in the Royal Park, including the start of the London Marathon, Yearly Tall Ships parade, annual classic car rallies, and on one occasion the preliminary stages of the Tour de France and the 2012 Olympic games (Equestrian games).

This house is a wonderful base for enjoying the rich cultural and academic institutions situated nearby (Blackheath Halls, Trinity Laban Conservatoire, Deptford Theatre, University of Greenwich) or just enjoy the myriad of eating, cinema and sporting opportunities nearby, which are all within walking distance whether at trendy Greenwich or elegant Blackheath. Enjoy wonderful walks and safe cycling next to this historic river. There is something for everyone to enjoy.

Myriads of historical figures, writers, and artists were born or lived nearby, from King Henry VIII (Tudor) to Cecil Day-Lewis, General James Wolfe, and the author Edith Nesbit. This tradition continues to the present day.

Contact me for more details or to arrange a viewing!

*Please quote reference "nso" upon enquiry

detailedDescription:
The Property

Purplebricks are delighted to bring to market this well presented and beautifully maintained four bedroom period style terraced family home with delightful mature private garden.

Conveniently located in a popular residential road, the property offers bright and spacious accommodation including three separate reception rooms - elegantly furnished and retaining an air of period style - along with a well equipped kitchen and first floor family bathroom. Features include gas central heating, double glazing and ample inbuilt storage.

The property is very conveniently located within easy access of Plumstead station, providing excellent services into Central London, with nearby Woolwich also offering the DLR service for fast and frequent City connections. The Cross Rail service is also shortly to be coming to the area for further commuting ease. Plumstead itself offers a variety of shops, eateries and amenities, as well as lovely open spaces, and excellent local schools.

*** Viewings are highly recommended ***

address: Wyberton House, 7 Lee Terrace, Blackheath, London SE3
detailedDescription:
Set on the sought after first floor of this impressive Victorian home spanning 957 sq.ft, is this stunning two double bedroom apartment. The Grade II listed Wyberton House, is the former Italianate-style home of Thames Embankment's engineer William Webster.

The property is in excellent decorative order with features including; very high ceilings, stripped floorboards, sash windows, ornate cornicing and gas fired central heating with feature radiators. The accommodation comprises; an entrance porch and entrance hall, a bright and elegant 23'2 x 17'0 reception room and a luxury modern kitchen. There are two double bedrooms to the rear with lovely views and a stylish modern bathroom. The property also benefits from gated off street parking, a share of the freehold and large communal gardens.

This is an outstanding home and immediate viewing is essential. Virtual tours can be seen at

Wyberton House is conveniently located just a 6 minutes' walk from Blackheath station, within easy reach of London Bridge (12 minutes), Cannon Street (23 minutes), Charing Cross (25 minutes) and Victoria (29 minutes). Lewisham station, with direct DLR connection to Canary Wharf, is also easily accessible.

Blackheath Village, with its array of bars, restaurants, boutique shops, is just a few minutes' walk away. Greenwich Park and the Heath itself are also both just a short stroll away.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
John Payne are delighted to welcome to the market this beautiful two bedroom, two bathroom apartment located within the Royal Military Academy estate. The Royal Military Academy offers vast outside spaces, private gardens and the historic cricket ground all housed within a secure boundary.

With 5 metre high beautiful ceilings, this property is spacious, well appointed and provides flexible accommodation. Recently converted, it offers an open plan kitchen/dining/living area, a bright and airy reception room with a great social feel, with the kitchen boasting a number of high-end built-in appliances. The master bedroom has been beautifully integrated within the building’s turret and has a bespoke staircase to the palatial ensuite shower room (wetroom). The second double bedroom is located on the mezzanine floor, overlooking the reception room, and benefits from access to the second bathroom/cloakroom (also a wetroom). The property also benefits from access to private gardens at the rear of the building.

This superb apartment is located within the iconic central building of the Royal Military Academy, with its turrets on each corner, overlooking the parade ground & cricket ground. The Academy offers a perfect combination of living within this historic setting with all the benefits that modern day living demands. Beyond the private facilities of the Academy, which also includes a concierge, gym and bicycle store, it is on the cusp of Woolwich Common and just a short walk to Sevendroog Castle and Oxleas wood.

The Academy is also very well positioned for transportation with DLR, overground, Thames Clipper and numerous bus routes all just a short walk away. With the introduction of the local CrossRail station in Woolwich Arsenal access to Canary Wharf (8 mins) and the West End (18 mins) makes this area a perfect location to be.

Further benefitting from a long lease, allocated parking and great transport links, this is a must see property.

To avoid missing out please contact our Woolwich office today!

Leasehold: 237 Years
Ground Rent £350
Service Charge: £2,011

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
With uninterrupted views over the River Thames and The Greenwich Peninsula Ecology Park, this pristine 2 bedroom apartment is enviably situated along the western edge of Hugero Point, in the highly sought after Greenwich Millennium Village. With North Greenwich Underground station close by, this property provides easy access to Canary Wharf and London Bridge, whilst also being walking distance to the O2 Arena and Greenwich Village.

With modern contemporary interiors, this beautiful home provides a high specification with hardwood flooring to the living area and floor to ceiling windows throughout.
The apartment boasts 935 square feet of bright, well-planned living accommodation, and comprises a spacious open plan living / dining room with sleek fully integrated kitchen including Smeg appliances and composite stone worktops.
Main bedroom with en-suite shower room and fitted wardrobes, further double bedroom, family bathroom with full length bath and overhead shower, and a 20 foot balcony accessed via the living room as well as both bedrooms, and with views over the ecology park and the River Thames.
Residents will also benefit from secure fob entry, access to an on site concierge and secure cycle storage.

Hugero Point sits on the edge of The Greenwich Peninsula Ecology Park, comprising of 2 lakes with a meadow, marsh and woodland, set within a network of wooden boardwalks, bird hides and special features to attract wildlife. The Greenwich Yacht Club with its scenic clubhouse and drinks terrace over the River Thames is just a stone’s throw away from the apartment - the Yacht Club was founded over 100 years ago and endeavours to provide affordable sailing to its members.
Popular gastropub The Pilot is approximately 0.3 miles away, and the apartment is conveniently located within easy reach of the O2 Arena and its eclectic mix of bars and restaurants.
Greenwich Millennium Village Square is circa 0.1 miles with its convenience store, dry cleaners, pharmacy and hair salon, as well as an Ayurvedic health and beauty spa with a vegetarian café. Greenwich Millenium Village also beneifts from a school and health centre.
The closest Tube Station is North Greenwich which serves the Jubilee Line providing easy access to Canary Wharf (1 stop), London Bridge (3 Stops) and The West End (7 stops).

Guide Price: £625,000
Tenure: Leasehold approx 996 years remaining
Service Charges: Approx £2,200 per annum
Ground Rent: £200 per annum
Local Authority: London Borough of Greenwich

detailedDescription:
This well presented and spacious two bedroom, two bathroom modern apartment positioned within a highly sought after development in Woolwich town centre.

Well proportioned throughout this property comprises an open plan living area and modern fully integrated high gloss grey kitchen to include a full size dishwasher, two double bedrooms of which the master boasts an en suite shower room and fitted wardrobes. Bedroom two benefits from a built in work space perfect for two people working from home and there is still space for guests. Further benefitting from a fully tiled family bathroom with shower over bath and two large storage cupboards and an additional utility cupboard. Added benefits include a double width private terrace, large communal terrace on the first floor, video entry system and secure bike store.

This property is an ideal home if you are looking for a fantastic community, large green spaces, a busy town centre with many shops, restaurants, bars, and superb transport facilities to include the Thames Clipper, DLR, South Eastern and Thameslink lines, easy access to City Airport and the much anticipated Crossrail.

The buildings have been carefully considered to create a strong visual impact, accentuated with sensitive design details to provide a sense of individuality and style. The apartment has been built to maximise space and light and finished with a high specification to ensure an excellent level of comfort, security and quality.

detailedDescription:
Virtual viewing available! EWS1 Compliant! John Payne are delighted to bring to the market this immaculate, larger than average, three double bedroom, two bathroom duplex maisonette with allocated parking situated within the popular New Capital Quay development.

Accessed via the private ground floor entrance, the accommodation is over two floors. To the ground floor, through the spacious hallway, you will find a larger than average reception room, fully integrated kitchen, separate downstairs WC and two large storage cupboards. On the first floor there is a large master bedroom with built in storage and en-suite modern shower room, further two double bedrooms and a three piece modern family bathroom. Further benefits include 24 hour concierge, an allocated parking space in the secure underground car park and a private balcony.

Dowells Street is just off Creek Road which leads into central Greenwich and all the shops, bars and boutiques that the area has to offer, as well as the Docklands Light Railway at Cutty Sark which gives fast and convenient access to Canary Wharf and the City. Within a short walk is the Thames Clipper at Greenwich Pier which provides convenient access to Canary Wharf, the City, Blackfriars, the South Bank, Westminster, the O2 and other prominent stops along the Thames. The River Thames is a stone’s throw away providing access to the Thames Path which makes a fantastic walk and perfect for those who love fresh air! There is a Waitrose in the development and several pubs and restaurants nearby, as are the various historical sights and open spaces of Greenwich Park.

detailedDescription:
Comments from the owner:

What do you love most about your home?
The location is superb, we have ample greenspace right on our doorstep - The Point, Greenwich Park and all 211 marvellous acres of Blackheath common - as well as all the shops and amenities that Greenwich and Blackheath have to offer.The apartment itself has fabulous high ceilings, large bedrooms, and the dual aspect, top floor position means that we don't have neighbours above or either side of us - very rare for a flat in London!

What do you love about the area?
Blackheath, with it's cosy village vibe, is what drew us to the area to begin with but when we found this flat we were sold! The location, in West Greenwich on Blackheath Hill, means that we have access to so much outdoor greenspace that we can enjoy at any time but we don't have to maintain! The Point, with it's amazing views across London, is right on our doorstep, beautiful Greenwich Park is 5 mins walk, and all 211 acres of Blackheath common begin just across the road!

Property Details:

Accommodation comprises the entrance hall with inbuilt storage, leading into the bright and spacious reception room, flooded with natural light from dual windows, and offering inviting space for relaxing, entertaining and dining. The separate kitchen comprises a modern range of matching white fronted wall, base and drawer units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, gas hob with overhead extractor and electric oven below, and further space for appliances. There are two well sized double bedrooms, both with a wonderful dual aspect, plus a stylish family bathroom with contemporary style free-standing bath suite and separate shower unit.

The property is enviably located within easy access of Greenwich station, providing excellent overground and DLR connections into Central London and the City. Greenwich itself provides an array of shops, fashionable bars, cafes and restaurants, as well as a selection of regular markets, the iconic site of the Cutty Sark, beautiful Greenwich Park and the Royal Observatory. Blackheath Village is also only a short distance away with its boutique shops and cafes, as well as the open expanse of the common. Right on the doorstep 'The Point' provides further beautiful open spaces in this fantastic central location.

detailedDescription:
A beautiful Victorian mid-terraced property which has been extended and completely renovated to create a spacious and modern family home. Offering fantastic living space, there is a double reception room and a kitchen/diner to the rear providing great family space with a dining area and an integrated kitchen complete with a range cooker and central island. Bi-fold doors lead out onto the private and secluded rear garden which, with lovely green planters and artificial grass, becomes an extension of the living space in the summer months great for barbeques and entertaining. There are three good sized bedrooms on the first floor as well as the family bathroom, providing great flexibility for both growing families and a home office. The principal bedroom is located on the top floor providing plenty of built-in storage, an ensuite shower room, juliet balcony and stunning views towards the O2 and Canary Wharf. There is also a spacious cellar providing excellent storage space. Quite simply, a lovely and readymade family home within moments of all the local amenities, transport links and schools the area has to offer.

Situation
Fingal Street is a popular residential road in East Greenwich moments from Westcombe Park Station offering a swift commute to Canary Wharf (via DLR change at Greenwich), London Bridge and Cannon Street. There are also direct connections to Blackfriars, Kings Cross and Luton Airport via the Thameslink Line. There is a wide array of local shops and cafes while larger supermarkets such as Sainsbury’s and M&S are close by in the Greenwich Retail Park. The property falls within the catchment area of a number of local schools including the sought-after and "outstanding" rated Halstow Primary School. All the historical attractions surrounding Greenwich Park are a short walk away as is the East Greenwich Pleasuance, a local park extremely popular with local residents.

detailedDescription:
Superb upper floor maisonette with its own garden and private entrance.

This property offers a great size lounge with room for dining, creating a lovely social space, and a separate modern kitchen. The two double bedrooms are generous in size and there are fitted wardrobes to the main room. A newly fitted stylish bathroom completes the inside of this home. Outside is a fantastic private garden which is certainly going to be enjoyed this summer!

Located close to parks, leisure facilities and just over a mile to a choice of three different railway stations, this property ticks lots of boxes.

What The Seller Says

We have often taken full advantage of the 10-minute stroll to Chislehurst, which is a delightful village setting surrounded by plenty of wooded areas, green spaces, independent boutiques, coffee shops, bars & restaurants. Making it a perfect destination for a Sunday stroll or a summers evening walk. The monthly farmers market is a must visit if you are fond of local produce, we can certainly recommend the local honey and seasonal fruit and veg. For convenience the co-op on White Horse Hill is only a 5-minute walk away and has parking for those days that you’d rather use the car if you have one. We have always found it to be well stocked and is open until 11pm for those last-minute bits you may have forgotten. William Barefoot Drive is also well stocked for convenience and we regularly use the ‘Post Office’ and ‘Front Page News’ for their parcel collection, postage and return services. Both Walden rec and Chislehurst rec are easily within walking distance, perfect for young families and adults seeking to get away for some quick R&R.

detailedDescription:
Chain free!

John Payne are delighted to bring to the market this immaculately presented, three storey, four bedroom, three bathroom, Victorian family home set in the Ashburnham Triangle Conservation area.

This family home measures over 1700 sq ft and has been lovingly looked after and renovated throughout by its current owners.

The property can be accessed from the lower ground or ground floor, the accommodation on the lower ground level comprises an open plan kitchen dining room with fully integrated appliances, breakfast bar and bespoke storage, separate utility room, under the stairs storage larder cupboard and additional storage.

On the ground floor you will find a beautiful reception room which features a bay window, working log burner and bespoke storage, four piece modern family bathroom and a double bedroom.

To the first floor you will find the master suite which consists of a large double bedroom, fully fitted walk in wardrobe and en-suite modern shower room, a further two double bedrooms and a separate WC.

Externally to the rear there is a private, low maintenance, landscaped garden. With plenty of space to enjoy the sun and entertain you will find a decked area, patio area, flower beds and Astroturf.

Further benefits of the property include beautiful bay windows, high ceilings, sash windows with shutters, under floor heating, loft access and residents permit parking.

Langdale Road can be found in the heart of West Greenwich within a minute’s walk to Greenwich Station and DLR making it the ideal location for anyone working in either the City or Canary Wharf. The Royal Park and Greenwich Village are also only a few minutes away within easy walking distance.

address: Penthouse, Garda House, Cable Walk, London SE10
detailedDescription:
Description

Citywharf is proud to present this top floor Penthouse apartment located in the modern Enderby Wharf development in Greenwich. This stunning 3 bedroom apartment comprising a large double aspect living area with modern kitchen, a master ensuite bedroom, 2 double bedrooms all with fitted in wardrobe and access to the balcony.

Apartment
Generous light and space throughout. Interiors features fully-fitted German kitchens, Roca sanitary ware in bathrooms and ensuites, comfort cooling in living areas and main bedrooms and underfloor heating.

Local Area
Greenwich enjoys the Royal Borough status and has a unique feel to it. When it comes to travelling, eating, drinking and socialising, there is a vast of choice on your doorstep. Enjoy a morning run in Greenwich Park and, from the top of the hill, some great views of the Thames with the unmistakable backdrop of Canary Wharf.

Other planned amenities at Enderby Wharf include a private residents' fitness suite, 24 hour concierge, a crèche, landscaped gardens and 200 metres of rejuvenated Thames Path, open to everyone.

Transport
Situated right on the banks of the river and well served by road, rail, air and boat, Enderby Wharf has an enviable location to come to and go as you please. Greenwich Park is a short stroll away, while westbound along the river are London Bridge (8 min) Canary Wharf (12 min) and the City (20 min).

You can also take to the skies and cross the river via the Emirates Air Line cable car. Connecting Greenwich peninsula with the Royal Docks area to the north the cable car affords unique view of the Thames meandering beneath your feet.

Situated in Central London zone 2, you're well connected to all parts of the city via the public transport serving North Greenwich Underground and Cutty Sark DLR stations.

Enderby Wharf is also well connected by road, with London Bridge and the City 20 minutes away. M25 is only 20 minutes to the south, or 30 minutes to the north.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A beautiful and truly exceptional 18th century grade II listed Georgian building, surrounded by a tranquil and secluded courtyard in the heart of a private neighbourhood in Woolwich.

The sellers say: "Greenhill Court is a charming conversion of an old military school, which was used to educate children and officers from the Royal Artillery Regiment for over 100 years.

Now a Grade II listed building, the old school has been converted into a number of properties that share the same unique heritage of the original building. The property overlooks a shared garden and courtyard, which has been fantastic in the past for hosting friends and family, and more recently, perfect for relaxing in a tranquil green space even in the height of lockdown. Greenhill Court is an excellent development, with the double height ceilings and mezzanine bedroom creating a rare sense of space in a Zone 3 property. The bathroom was recently re-done to a high standard, and along with refreshed floors, provides modern living standards in a building that exudes history.

Only a few minutes walk from a number of stations for access to central London (including the forthcoming Crossrail), and with night buses that run to the crossroads right outside your front door, Greenhill Court has excellent links into central London, and has been a fantastic base for the past 7 years. With amenities just a stone's throw away (such as the Royal Arsenal, the O2 Arena and Canary Wharf), it is my hope that the house will serve the next buyer as well as it has served me, acting as both a base for central London, and as a home when needing to switch off from the hustle and bustle.

Combined with a strong sense of community amongst other property owners in the complex (all properties own a share of freehold and provide input on community projects), this flat offers a rare combination of all the best bits of London."<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
We are excited to market this immaculate 1-bedroom south facing apartment located on the 3rd floor at the heart of Greenwich Village. With Westcombe Park, North Greenwich and the DLR stations within walking distance, and a few minutes train to London Bridge, this makes this property the ideal location for work and leisure.

The property comprises of a very-generous double bedroom space equipped with ample inbuilt storage facilities, a modern and elegant interior décor and even more storage space. A benefit of this property is the private balcony that can be accessed from the living room. As the property is south facing the views of the development plot and all-day sun is a nice touch. The property is also situated next to the Greenwich Ecology Park and Thames river walk.

The apartment also offers bright and airy open plan living/reception space upon entrance to the property that is ideal for entertaining friends and family.

The kitchen area offers stunning sleek matching interior décor for the high gloss walls and base units with work surfaces that incorporates modern kitchen facilities such as an induction hob with overhead extractor, electric oven, dishwasher, ample storage space for kitchen appliances and a built-in pantry, and an inset sink unit.

This property also comes with central heating, 24hr concierge, allocated parking, double glazing, and it is close proximity from the 02 Arena, iconic sites at Cutty Sark, Greenwich Park and also the very convenient restaurants and bars access to Canary Wharf, Central London and The City Airport.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

detailedDescription:
A super 3rd floor, 1 bedroom home with direct river views and floor to ceiling windows, flooding the property with natural light. From the engineered wood flooring with underfloor heating, to the smart fitted kitchen and bathroom, this apartment offers quality and style throughout. The interiors were designed by State of Craft who were responsible for the interior design of London's The Shard. There is a generous double bedroom, with river views, imagine waking up to that super view every morning? There are fitted wardrobes with drawer, shelving and hanging space. A comprehensively fitted kitchen sits neatly at the end of the large open plan living area, and there is a built in double utilities cupboard cleverly hiding the washer/dryer.
Living in Upper Riverside is much more than living in your own individual apartment, you are part of something much greater. This stunning family of five light filled, glass and stone towers, with roof gardens cascading to the edge of the Thames, occupies one of the best riverside locations in London.
You will become part of the exclusive Upper Riverside Club, think of it as a relaxed, unstuffy and welcoming members club, with private access to the gyms, steam room and spa pool, a 15th floor swimming pool with panoramic views, rooftop terraces, shared spaces, cinema and more.
The gardens connected to the riverfront will have some fantastic restaurants, river cafes, retail outlets and lively public spaces, including London's first linear park, 'The Tide'.
Upper Riverside Neighbourhood links to Peninsula Square with access to North Greenwich Underground (Jubilee Line), 2 Mins to Canary Wharf and 8 Mins to London Bridge!
The O2, with it's numerous international restaurants, Icon Designer outlet and buzzy social areas, and soon to be completed Design District, are all within a few minutes walk of your home.
Please call us for more information and to arrange a presentation.

detailedDescription:
*Guide Price £260,000-£270,000*

Connaught Mews is situated just outside the heart of Woolwich and contributes a lot to the rich history of Woolwich, forming part of the local Millennium Heritage Trail. This unique, one bedroom lower ground floor apartment is offered chain free to the sales market.

A beautifully presented apartment situated within this former Royal Artillery Maternity Hospital and the first in England built in 1801. This bright and modern one bedroom conversion apartment comprises an open plan ultra-modern kitchen, bright reception room, larger than average 17ft bedroom and contemporary good size bathroom. There is a communal courtyard garden and allocated off street parking. The property offers plenty of natural light and is an ideal first time buy or investment.

Set back from the road within an exclusive gated development and just 0.3 miles to Woolwich Arsenal Station and 0.7 miles to Woolwich Dockyard Station for DLR, Thameslink and South-Eastern Lines and soon to come Crossrail (due for completion 2021). Further transport links are the Thames Clipper for a luxurious journey into the City, a 7 minute train journey into City Airport and the renowned Woolwich Ferry. detailedDescription:
Ideally situated for access to Kidbrooke station is this large and bright two double bedroom ground floor apartment.

Having been maintained to a high standard by the current owners, this property would make an ideal first time purchase.

The development benefits from on site concierge, gym and secure right to park parking.

The heart of this home is the open plan lounge diner which is bright and spacious and offers direct access to a private terrace.

This beautiful home is sure to generate a lot of interest as Blackheath is within a 15 minute walk or three minutes by train. Famous for the expansive Blackheath Common, it’s a fantastic spot for a walk or jog and a major centre for kite flying!

Blackheath village is ideal for a relaxed weekend brunch or browse. You’ll find a wide variety of independent shops, including a bookseller, fishmonger, greengrocer, butcher, baker and wine merchant.

Blackheath has a number of excellent cafés and restaurants - Argentinian, Modern British, Indian, Portuguese and Thai are just some of the cuisines on offer - along with numerous popular pubs such as The Hare & Billet, The Princess of Wales and The Railway.

For more details or to arrange your viewing, call now.

detailedDescription:
B&C Properties is pleased to offer this bright and spacious three-bedroom two-bathroom apartment on the 10th-floor with added General Right to Park, set within this exclusive and exceptionally high-quality development within Kidbrooke Village located in the village centre.

B&C Properties is pleased to offer this bright and spacious three-bedroom two-bathroom apartment on the 10th-floor set within this exclusive and exceptionally high-quality development within Kidbrooke Village located in the village centre.

This apartment has been decorated to an extremely high standard throughout. The apartment comprises of a large open-plan living, dining and kitchen area with separate Island. There are floor to ceiling height window opening onto a private balcony. The kitchen is fully equipped to a very high standard including oven, fridge/freezer and microwave.

The apartment is situated right next to Kidbrooke train station, which runs to Lewisham in 6 minutes, London Bridge station in 15 minutes, Waterloo East in 20 minutes, Charing Cross in 25 minutes and 28 minutes to London Victoria, all of which are positioned on the main London Underground lines.

The development benefits from a vast amount of parkland and it is situated in the immediate vicinity of some of the most vibrant areas of London, Blackheath Village and Greenwich, both featuring an array of boutiques, restaurants and bars.

Guide Price £995,000-£1,075,000 An absolutely stunning and extensively renovated two/three bedroom, one/two reception room apartment set in this magnificent detached Cator Estate house once the residence of renowned Philosopher John Stuart Mill and also of Lord Aberdeen, the Prime Minister.

Found on the top (second) floor, the property has been extensively refurbished, within the last 3 years, by the current vendor to a very high standard. Features include; complete rewiring, usb sockets, cornicing, solid oak flooring, insulated and sound proofed floors, dual zone Nest controlled gas fired central heating with new Combi boiler, feature radiators, underfloor heating to the bathroom and lounge diner, integrated speaker system including 5.1 surround in living room, sash windows and plantation shutters.

The accommodation comprises, an elegant 24'4 x 16'7 living room with feature marble fireplace and bay window and open plan to a gorgeous luxury kitchen. The kitchen includes a solid quartz worktop and high end integrated Siemens and Miele appliances including; wine cooler, induction hob, coffee machine, microwave oven, oven and steam oven, dishwasher and washing machine. There is a very large dual aspect master bedroom with built in wardrobes, a good size second double bedroom and a third double bedroom/second reception room currently used as a dining room and study. The property boasts a superb luxury modern bathroom with free standing bath, double walk in shower and feature wash hand basin. To the rear is a vast and gorgeous 190ft x 95ft communal garden and to the front is a concealed driveway on the approach to the house. The property also benefits from off street parking with a garage.

This is an outstanding apartment finished to the highest specification and your earliest viewing is vital. Video tours can be seen at .

Blackheath Park is the flagship road of the prestigious private Cator Estate. The Ofsted outstanding Brooklands Primary School is within a few minutes' walk and several sought-after schools including Blackheath Prep, Blackheath High School and the Pointer School are all close by. The property is located just 0.49 miles from Blackheath Village with its array of bars, restaurants, boutique shops and mainline station. Trains from Blackheath to London Bridge take approximately 10 minutes, and approximately 25 minutes to Victoria. Greenwich Park and the Heath are both just a short walk.

agency_name: Urban Spaces Loft Living & Unique Properties
detailedDescription:
Steeped in history, 546 square feet, one bedroom, south facing apartment, located in the Royal Military Academy within the gated community.

The Royal Military Academy was established in 1741 to train officers for the Royal Artillery and Royal Engineers regiments in the British Army. Many famous officers were trained at the facility including Churchill and Kitchener.

The development is a collection of Grade II listed buildings which have been carefully refurbished to create a mix of apartments, duplexes and town houses, within the retained structures. The work has been completed in collaboration with English Heritage so nothing of importance is lost and a unique community is created. The refurbishment works started in 2008 with final stages completing in 2019.

A beautiful park and arguably the oldest cricket pitch in England was restored and sits proudly in front of the development overlooking castle like structures of the Academy.

The apartment itself is south facing within one of the Academy buildings in the middle of the development overlooking “the village” church with a feeling of being in a countryside whilst moments away from the hustle and bustle of urban Woolwich and Shooters Hill. To the front of the Royal Military Academy is a vast gravelled communal space where residents during the summer take their deck chairs out and enjoy the outdoor living and numerous cricket matches just outside their doorstep.

The interior of this apartment offers very generous living space occupying 546 square feet in total with 3.1 meter ceilings throughout which is exceptionally rare to find. The apartment comprises of; a spacious kitchen area which is linked to the equally spacious living room, a family sized bathroom and a large bedroom. Stained glass windows adorn both living room and bedroom areas adding to the charm of this apartment.

This property comes with allocated parking space. The Royal Military Academy development is gated with 24 hour security, day time concierge and access to residents only gym.

Woolwich Arsenal DLR station offers easy access into Canary Wharf and Bank. Woolwich will also soon benefit from the forthcoming Crossrail station providing easy access into London, including Liverpool Street, Paddington and Bond Street.

detailedDescription:
A bright and well proportioned luxurious apartment within the highly sought after Pavilion Square of the renowned Royal Arsenal Riverside development, Woolwich.

A sophisticated and bright two double bedroom apartment with South West facing balcony overlooking lovely green spaces. Comprising a dual aspect open plan reception room with a light grey matt finish fully integrated kitchen to include Bosch appliances (dishwasher, electric oven & hob and fridge freezer), ample space for dining and well thought out breakfast bar, two double bedrooms one of which has an en suite bathroom with shower over bath and fitted wardrobes, and a further shower room with double width cubicle. This property has a high spec finish with high quality wood flooring to the lounge, kitchen and hall, carpets in bedrooms and fully tiled bathrooms.

Further benefits of buying this impressive home is access to the exclusive Waterside Club which includes residents only gym with state of the art fitness equipment, vitality spa pool and 20m swimming pool, sauna and steam room, treatment rooms, high tech private cinema and 24 hour concierge. Positioned in the heart of Woolwich, which is rapidly emerging as one of London's bright spots and forms part of long stretch of waterfront homes.

The arrival of the on-site Crossrail station will add to the already fantastic travel options available to the residents of Royal Arsenal Riverside. Woolwich Arsenal station is within 0.2 miles for the South-eastern, Thameslink and DLR, City Airport is within 7 minutes away, Buses to North Greenwich for Jubilee Line are in abundance as well as the Thames Clipper for a more scenic journey into the city. The Woolwich Ferry South Pier is also under 0.5 miles.

The amenities of both Greenwich and Blackheath are easily accessible via a lovely river walk or via transport for further enjoyable amenities and plenty of green spaces to include Wellington Park within the development and Woolwich Common.

This property is ideal for someone looking to be a part of a great community and close to excellent amenities, green spaces and Thameside.

The second bedroom measures 14'6 x 13'6 and finally a luxury bathroom has part tiled granite surround. To the rear of the property is a vast communal garden and a private shed with off street parking to the front.

We strongly recommend your earliest viewing as this is sure to be very popular. Virtual tours can be seen at

Located on a sought after beautiful tree-lined road, the property is very convenient for transport links with Westcombe Park station nearby and buses stopping for Blackheath train station (0.8 miles) and North Greenwich tube station (1.8 miles). Blackheath Common, (0.1 miles), and Royal Greenwich Park (0.3 miles) are both just a short walk. detailedDescription:
"Our charming first floor flat has been converted from a Victorian house into two flats. It is full of character and this is just one of the reasons we have stayed here for over 12 years!

It’s hard to get tired of the period features - high ceilings with original cornicing and Victorian fireplaces in the (living room and bedroom).

Our hallway has original wooden floorboards and we have freshly decorated with a new carpet fitted on the stairs and the living room. As well as the period features, it also has a welcoming contemporary feel with a modern fitted kitchen and bathroom with a large heated mirror. Our master bedroom room has fitted storage units and there is a second bedroom at the rear of the property.

We have recently had a new boiler fitted with a 5yr guarantee. The flat has access to a large floored storage space in the loft, which can be accessed by a drop down ladder.

We are a two minute walk from the main supermarkets, shopping development and amenities, as well as a short walk to Charlton train station. Greenwich main town and O2 is a 10min bus ride. Our road has on street parking and our neighbours are friendly and welcoming."

As the sellers say, this is an ideal first time buy!

Offered chain free and highly recommended.<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
A rare opportunity to acquire this exceptionally elegant Grade II* listed house located in the historical Royal Military Academy, Woolwich, a highly sought-after development on the edge of Woolwich Common. Founded in 1741, this gated development now comprises an eclectic combination of contemporary and historical design, including this beautifully presented two bedroom family home.

Upon entering the property, you are welcomed by a bright, dual aspect and spacious open plan living area with space for dining and a fully integrated modern kitchen. This quiet, light-filled space allows for easy transitioning between daily use and entertaining. An adjoining WC and utility/storage cupboard are set to one side.

Two generously proportioned double bedrooms are organised across the second floor, of which the master boasts an en-suite bathroom with walk-in shower and a dressing area including fitted mirrored wardrobes. There is also a separate family bathroom.

The house benefits from high ceilings, original stained-glass arched windows, bespoke shuttering, an abundance of natural light and exclusive access to separately gated gardens available only to the other houses within Officers Gardens.

Additional perks include an allocated (covered) off-street parking space, access to a private gym (subject to membership) and concierge.

The gated community which has been created here sits to the east of Woolwich Common just off Shooters Hill and Academy Road. Within several acres of communal parkland, the house enjoys access to the Academy’s cricket pitch and tranquil communal gardens which are an important factor to the friendly community here.

The Academy grounds are a short walk or bus ride to central Woolwich with DLR & trains to central London (and the forthcoming Crossrail Station, offering excellent access to Canary Wharf (7 mins), Liverpool Street (14 mins) and Bond Street (21 mins)). Neighbouring Blackheath Village is a short drive away (5 mins), with its local markets, renowned high street, cafes, restaurants, bars and open spaces.

Viewings available from 27th March 2021, enquire within to arrange your appointment!

detailedDescription:
We are delighted to present to the market a great opportunity to acquire this chain free, 3 double bed maisonette with Share of Freehold located on the prestigious road, Vanbrugh Park, directly facing onto The Heath.

The property is arranged over 3 floors. On the first floor you will find the light and sizeable living room with wonderful views of the heath, perfect for entertaining friends and family, a stunning modern kitchen with high end integrated appliances and plenty of storage space. A downstairs WC in excellent condition. The property also benefits from a private west facing patio fronting the heath.

The property comprises of 3 spacious bedrooms and an upstairs family bathroom with modern interior décor and even more storage space. The property benefits from a very long lease with 948 years remaining, £21PA Ground Rent [fixed] and low service charges, an integrated garage for off-street parking, very convenient for transport links with Blackheath and Westcombe Park stations nearby, offering easy access to Central London. Also, en-route from the regular bus routes allowing for further use of close by stations, Blackheath, and North Greenwich.

Vanbrugh Park is just a moments’ walk from Blackheath village, several exemplary Ofsted rated schools, Royal Greenwich park and also in close proximity to the convenient restaurants/bars for nightlife or for a family outing. The property is in a Conservation Area.
