A unique semi-detached house situated in the heart of Greenwich Millennium Village with easy access to The o2 and Canary Wharf. The accommodation compromises a first floor open plan reception room that is flooded with natural light from the large four main windows and double height ceilings, kitchen with integrated appliances and breakfast bar, mezzanine level that is ideal for guest overnight stays, cloakroom, the ground floor offers two spacious bedrooms both with en suite bathrooms. Communal outside space which is ideal for entertaining. Must be seen to fully appreciate.
Location

You’d be hard pushed to find a town more steeped in maritime history than Greenwich. Its Thames-side location is joined by the Cutty Sark and the National Maritime Museum. Greenwich Park is a Royal open space featuring the Royal Observatory and the prime meridian line.
The town centre is known for its craft and antiques markets, with bars, restaurants and the ‘Up The Creek’ comedy club attracting residents, tourists and Greenwich University students alike.

What is shared ownership?
Under the shared ownership scheme you part-own and part-rent your home, making it
possible for first-time buyers and families to get on the property ladder.
The minimum share you can purchase is 25% and the maximum is 75%. You will usually pay a mortgage on the part you own and a subsidised rent on

title: 1 bed flat for sale

address: Warehouse Court, No.1 Street, Royal Arsenal SE18
detailedDescription:
Highly sought after, 5th floor one bed, situated in a popular block, at the top end of this landmark development, adjacent to the river east of Greenwich, with private balcony overlooking landscaped gardens below. Reception with feature red brick wall, Karndean wood effect flooring, high gloss kitchen with range of integrated appliances & granite work surface, sliding door from reception providing access to the balcony. Finished to a high specification throughout.

Area

The Royal Arsenal is a former munitions factory & storage facility with a history dating back to 1671, that is being tastefully transformed to provide a blend of converted & new build residential properties, together with a central open space, bars, restaurants and an hotel.

Beautifully landscaped, the builder has taken great care to create a development that is a pleasure to live in, rather than yet another sterile 'stack of boxes'. It retains a real sense of community yet retains a high degree of peace and tranquility, away from the 'big smoke'.

The development currently offers

* 24 Concierge & Security
* Residents Gym
* Royal Resistance Boot Camp
* 7R CrossFit Gym
* Two Youngs "gastro pubs" The Dial Arch & The Guardhouse
* Con Gusto Italian Restaurant
* Craft Beer & Pizzeria, The Taproom
* Three on site cafés
* Health Centre
* Chemist
* Dentist
* Tesco Express
* M&S Food Hall
* Sainsburys
* Dry Cleaning service
* Zipcar Car Sharing Club
* Fortnightly Farmers Market

Situated east of Greenwich, adjacent to Woolwich Town Centre (offering an array of main street shopping and a vibrant street market) the development is easily reached by road & rail.

The station is no more than a short stroll away, which offers a direct route to the City (London Bridge / Cannon Street) in a little over 20 minutes, via the Main Line and less than 25 minutes to Bank / Tower Gateway via the DLR.

London City Airport can also be reached in as little as 5 minutes, with Canary Wharf & Stratford also accessible in less than 25 minutes.

As far as leisure is concerned, a short cab ride will take you to nearby Blackheath, Greenwich or, the O2 - where you will be spoilt for choice in terms of food, drink and nightlife.

As an alternative to the train or car, the Thames Clipper river bus service also docks immediately adjacent to the development and provides additional links with The O2, Greenwich, Canary Wharf, Tower Bridge, Blackfriars, The Southbank (Tate Modern) and beyond.
features: ['Contemporary 5th floor one bed apartment', 'Balcony overlooking communal gardens below', 'Karndean wood effect flooring', 'Exposed brickwork', 'Semi open plan kitchen with range of integrated appliances & granite work surface', '24hr Concierge & security', 'On site cafés, two Young\'s "gastro pubs", pizzeria & Italian restaurant, Tesco and M&S Food Hall', 'Residents gym', 'On forthcoming crossrail route', 'Walking distance from Town Centre, station & Thames Clipper']
title: 1 bed flat for sale

address: No 3, 8 Cutter Lane, Upper Riverside, Greenwich Peninsula SE10
detailedDescription:
Stylish, 3 bedroom family home offering you 1,101 Sq Ft of space and light, finished in Studio Ashby's Harrison palette, where the riverside was the inspiration in terms of colour and materials used. The Harrison palette has traditional and coordinating cabinetry to the kitchen with sleek dark and lighter finishes, and has contrasting work surfaces over. The smart family bathroom has porcelain floor tiles and ceramic wall tiles with Corian splash back, and a white 3 piece suite. There is an ensuite to the master bedroom with similar fittings
Warm engineered oak wood flooring with underfloor heating flows through the reception room and kitchen. The bedrooms have a 100% wool carpet adding to the natural warmth of the apartment and with full height windows, and fitted custom wardrobes, great places to relax. An amazing 970sq ft private roof terrace leading off the reception room has a fantastic panoramic river view.
Are you currently working from home? There is ample space to accommodate your home work station, of if you prefer not to work in your home then there are custom workstations located on the ground floor.
Find this home in No.3 Upper Riverside, in Greenwich Peninsula's Upper Riverside neighbourhood. Designed by world-famous architects som, the 5 prism towers cascade along the riverfront. Located 300m from North Greenwich bus and tube station, adjacent to the Emirates Air Line and opposite North Greenwich Pier, transport links are readily available. Residents of No.3 Upper Riverside enjoy the full set of exclusive residents' amenities.

As the UK's largest area of urban regeneration, Greenwich Peninsula will be transformed over the coming years. There's £8.4 billion being invested in this new area for London. Don't miss this opportunity, call us now to arrange your presentation.
features: ['970sq ft Private Roof Terrace with River Views', 'Secure Allocated Parking Bay', 'Co-Working Spaces & Private Meeting Rooms', 'Residents Roof Terraces with BBQ Features', 'Cinema & Media Room', 'Swimming Pool with Gym & Spa', 'Central Park adjacent', '2 Minutes from Canary Wharf', '8 Minutes from London Bridge (Jubilee Line)', '24-Hour Concierge & Lifestyle Services.']
title: 3 bed property for sale

detailedDescription:
A stunning and elegant Grade II listed two bedroom split level apartment forming part of this imposing historical building. Located within the highly sought after Royal Arsenal Riverside development, Woolwich.

This sophisticated and bright two bedroom apartment previously a chemistry laboratory was one of the first custom built in the Arsenal in 1984. Having been carefully restored and converted into apartments retaining many of the original features.

Comprising double height ceilings throughout and boasting ample natural light, a highly desirable brand new kitchen in keeping with the style of property, a generous reception room with space for dining and large arched windows with secondary glazing and shutters installed uniformly throughout this stunning building. The grand entrance hallway is impressive with the original dog-leg staircase and plenty of storage under stairs, with further storage in a utility room. A second door leads you to the private car park to the rear of the property where you will have an allocated space.

The second floor has a substantial landing which is ideal for a home work space as beautifully demonstrated by the current owners. There are two larger than average bedrooms of which the master comprises a modern en suite shower room. There is a further walk in wardrobe to the hall and period stylish family bathroom with roll top bath and overhead shower.

A further benefit of buying this impressive home is access to the exclusive on site facilities, community and location! Building 20 is a rare and unique apartment conversation and is not to be missed.

Positioned in the heart of Woolwich and Royal Arsenal Riverside, which is rapidly emerging as one of London's bright spots and forms part of long stretch of waterfront homes. The arrival of the on-site Crossrail station will add to the already fantastic travel options available to the residents of Royal Arsenal Riverside. Woolwich Arsenal station is within 0.2 miles for the South-eastern, Thameslink and DLR, City Airport is within 7 minutes away, Buses to North Greenwich for Jubilee Line are in abundance as well as the Thames Clipper for a more scenic journey into the city. The Woolwich Ferry South Pier is also under 0.2 miles.

The amenities of both Greenwich and Blackheath are easily accessible via a lovely river walk or via transport for further enjoyable amenities and plenty of green spaces including Wellington Park within the development and Woolwich Common.

Lease Length: 999 Years from 2001

Onsite the development you will also find:

* 24 Hour Concierge & Security
* The Guardhouse and The Dial Arch gastro pubs
* Con Gusto Italian Restaurant
* Craft Beer & Pizzeria, The Taproom
* Four on site cafés including Boulangerie Jade & The Black Cab Coffee Co
* Health Centre
* Chemist
* Dentist
* Tesco Express
* M&S Food Hall
* Dry Cleaning service
* Zipcar Car Sharing Club
* Fortnightly Farmers Market
*A Fantastic Community

title: 2 bed flat for sale

address: Roan Court, 60 Devonshire Drive, Greenwich, London SE10
detailedDescription:
A beautiful and large one bedroom flat which is part of this gorgeous grade II listed Victorian school conversion, found on this quiet road on the supremely popular Ashburnham Triangle, moments from the town centre and Greenwich station. With off street parking and a lovely communal garden.

The property boasts a large 29ft open plan kitchen/lounge, large bedroom and a huge bathroom and also benefits from secure off street parking (gated development) to the rear plus well maintained communal gardens. There is also visitor parking and a bike rack. This superb space has high ceilings and is approximately 68 square meters. As an added benefit the property is also a Share of Freehold.

Central Greenwich has many attractions which include the royal park with Observatory, River boat service and of course the array of shops and restaurants. The town centre, mainline rail and DLR are all within a 5-10 minute walk. Your earliest viewing is essential.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Perfectly placed within an exclusive community and on a quiet private road, within walking distance to highly regarded schools, local shops and amenities. New Eltham train station is also just a short stroll away and there are also other fantastic commuter links nearby.

The property itself is unique in many ways and offers a large bright living dining area, modern fitted kitchen with some built in appliances, two double bedrooms and family bathroom. Further benefits include gas central heating and brand new double glazing along with Air Conditioning throughout. Externally you have your own front garden and the use of the communal gardens shared with the other residents.

Properties on Craybury End are always popular and we expect this one to be no different no please register your interest straight away. EPC Grade D.

title: 2 bed end terrace house for sale

Offered in immaculate condition throughout and includes underground allocated parking. The lower level comprises a bright double bedroom, WC and large under stair storage cupboard and utility cupboard, the upper floor offers a further double bedroom with en suite shower room and built in storage, third small double bedroom/study has access to a south west facing private balcony, and a further family bathroom suite. The bright and modern open plan kitchen includes integrated appliances and the generous reception area includes an air conditioning system, boasts an abundance of natural light leading onto a further balcony capturing a stunning river and historical views over Wellington Park.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
The property has been beautifully maintained and appointed by the current owner, offering bright and spacious accommodation, finished to a high standard throughout with stylish interiors and neutral décor.

Features include an impressive open plan reception/kitchen opening onto a private balcony, underfloor heating, a large bathroom with bath suite and separate shower, wood effect 'amtico style' flooring, double glazing, secure underground parking. The property further enjoys superb views towards Canary Wharf and the City from all windows and private balcony.

Accommodation comprises entrance hall with inbuilt storage, leading into the bright and spacious, open plan reception/kitchen with direct access onto the delightful enclosed private balcony and ample space for both relaxing and dining. The kitchen area comprises a modern range of matching white high gloss wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, induction hob with overhead extractor and electric oven below, and further space for appliances.

There is a generously sized double bedroom, with space for free-standing furniture, plus a stylish family bathroom with white three piece bath suite and a separate shower.

The property is conveniently located within easy access of Westcombe Park and Charlton stations, as well as numerous regular bus routes serving the surrounding area and providing links to North Greenwich, Greenwich and Woolwich for Jubilee Line, DLR and Elizabeth Line connections.

There are a range of shops, eateries and amenities close-by, with fashionable Greenwich and Blackheath only a short distance away with a variety of stylish pubs, cafes and restaurants. The area is also well served by excellent local schools and lovely open spaces, including Charlton and Hornfair Parks and beautiful Woolwich Common.

The lease has 109 years remaining.

The property is being sold chain free.

Viewings recommended.

Beautifully presented throughout and lovingly looked after by the current owners is this large one bedroom third floor modern apartment within the renowned Trinity Walk development. Comprising a large 24’9 sq ft open plan reception room leading onto the North West Facing balcony with parquet wood decking and modern fully integrated kitchen which has been stylishly designed, a large double bedroom with built in wardrobes, fitted plantation shutters and a bathroom with a characterful Victorian free standing bath and shower. This property further benefits from a secure video entry system and a parking permit.

This unique flat is positioned within close proximity of the popular shopping amenities of Woolwich Town Centre offering a wide range supermarkets, shops, restaurants and bars. A short walk to Woolwich Arsenal for DLR, South-Eastern and Thameslink Lines easy connections into North Greenwich station for the Jubilee line. Ideal for the daily and leisurely commuter.

The buildings have been carefully considered to create a strong visual impact, accentuated with sensitive design details to provide a sense of individuality and style. address: Maltby House, Ottley Drive, Kidbrooke Village, London SE3
detailedDescription:
Guide Price £350,000 to £370,000

Comments from the owner:

What do you love most about your home?
What I love about this place at first sight is how much light that comes through the windows in the afternoon sun. Sitting by the window, we really enjoy looking at lovely view of the park and lake. Quietness away from the city, with easy train access to city centre. Access to long stretch of park that is on the door step. The communal garden on the same floor as the apartment providing easy access.

What do you love about the area? The local market in the square with a different food stall every day. The 3 parks with lakes and the local pub, all within walking distance. Easy access to Blackheath village and Greenwich park that is 10 min drive away or 3 min train ride.

Property Details:

Accommodation comprises entrance hall with in built storage and utility cupboard with additional storage, leading into the bright and spacious, open plan reception/kitchen with direct access onto the delightful private balcony, and ample space for both relaxing and dining. The kitchen area comprises of a modern range of matching off white fronted wall and base units with LED countertop lighting, glass splashback and stone worktop incorporating inset sink unit, electric hob with overhead extractor and electric oven below, and further space for appliances. There is a generously sized double bedroom with an in built wardrobe also sharing access onto the private balcony, plus a stylish bathroom with white three piece suite and elegant tiling and inbuilt vanity.

The property is very conveniently located within easy access of railway stations at nearby Kidbrooke and Lee, as well as numerous regular bus routes, including a direct bus route to Greenwich Tube Station. The area is well served by an array of shops and amenities as well as beautiful open spaces including neighbouring Cator and Sutcliffe Parks. Fashionable Greenwich and Blackheath Village are also within a short drive/train journey offering a further variety of boutique shops, cafes, bars and restaurants.

Reserve this one bedroom apartment at Wandsworth Exchange before 31 July and receive a bespoke interior design package worth up to £3,000*, contact our team to find out more - 1 bedroom apartment available at Hawthorne Crescent for £107,500!
Register now to book a viewing

Hawthorne Crescent - Apartment C5.03
1 bedroom 3rd-floor apartment offering 51 sq.m of internal floor area with outdoor space. Contact a member of our sales team now to view our new show home.
107,500 for a 25% share of £430,000 and a deposit as low as £10,750 and a minimum income of £50,000.

L&Q at Greenwich Square
Buying an apartment at Greenwich Square opens the door to a unique community and offers the perfect place to call home. Our homes are built around people and offer beautifully designed homes with a desirable specification and outdoor space to each apartment. These homes are also set around a beautiful garden square. The development has everything you could need on your doorstep making life that little bit more convenient. With every block distinct and individual, creating an intelligent balance between shared community and private space.

Shared Ownership
Under the Shared Ownership scheme you part-own and part-rent your home, making it possible for first-time buyers and families to get on the property ladder.
The minimum share you can purchase is 25% and the maximum is 75%. You will usually pay a mortgage on the part you own and a subsidised rent on the part you don’t own. As your income rises, you can increase the share you own until you eventually own 100%.

The minimum income required for a 1 bedroom apartment is £49,000*
The minimum income required for a 2 bedroom apartment is £58,000*
The minimum income required for a 3 bedroom apartment is £67,000*
*Household incomes are based on joint applications. Single applications are able to apply but may need to increase their deposit contribution to meet shared ownership affordability requirements.

Viewings
For those who would like to and are able to visit us, the Show Home is now open on an appointment-only basis, with extra measures in place to ensure your wellbeing. Please call us to book your appointment. If you would prefer to speak to our Sales Team from your own home, they are still on hand and can conduct appointments via phone, email and by virtual tour. *We are taking extra precautions to ensure the health and wellbeing of our customers, staff and members of the public.

detailedDescription:
A stunning four storey end of terrace house situated in a sought after street adjacent to the Royal Park.

The house has been finished to the highest order throughout by the current owners. The stylish, contemporary finish compliments the character of the house, yet it still retains all of the charm.

The accommodation offers skilled craftmanship with new oak flooring throughout the property, extensive paintwork on all doors, doorframes, ensuite bathroom and all staircases. The top floor offers two double bedrooms with triple glazed sound proof sash windows and bespoke custom made built in wardrobes. First floor also has two double bedrooms with triple glazed sound proof sash windows and bespoke custom made built in wardrobes, ensuite shower room to the master bedroom and a separate family bathroom.

On the ground floor, there is a 22’0 reception room from front to back which offers a custom built gas fireplace and media wall, which leads onto a balcony and a separate shower room. Leading down to the lower ground floor, comes a stunning kitchen which benefits from a large island, dining area and utility room. All opening onto a landscaped garden to rear.

The property is well located for Maze Hill mainline station, a short walk to Greenwich for the mainline and DLR stations, Royal Greenwich Park, close to schools and historic Greenwich.

detailedDescription:

Truly stunning, four double bedroom, high-specification, modern townhouse, offering well-proportioned flexible living over three floors. Located in a peaceful location situated close to outstanding transportation and conveniently placed for wonderful amenities.

Internally the property is presented in beautiful order including bespoke fitted shutters and under floor heating. The accommodation comprises an ultra-modern fitted kitchen, family bathroom and en-suite shower room. A large open/plan reception room opens on to a pleasant low maintenance South facing garden and a guest cloakroom completes the ground floor. To the first floor there is an exceptionally spacious master bedroom with floor to ceiling windows with fitted bespoke shutters and en-suite shower room, second double bedroom with large glass door opening onto a balcony. On the top floor you will find two further double bedrooms, one with a Juliet balcony. There is ample storage throughout the house.

Hawthorne Crescent forms a modern exclusive development only a short walk to the Greenwich centre where you will find a pool, gym and library. Transportation is close by, including Maze Hill mainline station(London Bridge, Cannon street and Thames Link) also frequent bus links in to Greenwich Village and North Greenwich for DLR and the Jubilee Line. Many highly regarded schools are found locally including the ofsted outstanding Halstow Primary school.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
"We absolutely love living at the Mill. When you close the gate behind you and walk through the cobbled courtyard with its charming landscaped roof garden, you’re in another world.”

What The Seller Says -

"It’s a warm and friendly community and our long-standing concierge Aldo looks after us all really well.

Long Mill only has two apartments on each floor, so it is very quiet and private. Our apartment has a real sense of calm, tucked away from the main road on the corner of the creek. We still remember how amazed we were when we woke up on our first morning nine years ago to the sound of ducks and geese.

The building has been attractively converted and our big sash windows let in lots of light. We never tire of the views or of the way the creek changes character during the day.

Our roof garden is very well looked after by the gardener and it’s great to pop up for coffee during the day or to have friends and family over at weekends.

Greenwich is a fantastic place to live and has so much to offer including the park and river. It’s also great to be in walking distance of Deptford as its quirky cafés and bars have their own vibe.

Being close to the DLR and having a choice of train stations nearby including the Overground means it’s really easy to get to work or into town and beyond.

We can honestly say it’s the best place we’ve ever lived and we will miss it very much – we are only moving as we need to be nearer family who live outside London."

Sarah and Brendan

What The Agent Says -

The old Mumford flour mills is one of the most beautiful looking re-developments in the local area, with its grand brick facade, the old lettering dating back to when the mill was built.

Internally there is an abundance of space and comprises useful size entrance hall, family bathroom, main bedroom featuring an en-suite shower room, further double size bedroom, which also offers direct access to the very airy and spacious living room, with plenty of room to dine and an open plan kitchen, which comes with some integrated appliances.

Included and featured are the wood floors throughout, sash windows, access to the communal roof terrace and on-site concierge, as well as bicycle storage and a separate storage cage in the next building.

Greenwich mainline and DLR stations are just a few minutes away on foot, as well as Greenwich park and town centre. Deptford Bridge DLR is just a few moments away, for very quick access.<br /><br />
title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
** Shared ownership option available** An impressive two-bedroom corner apartment, located on the fourth floor of this new build development, offering direct views onlooking Greenwich Park and the Royal Observatory as well as being only a seconds walk from the River Thames and Greenwich town centre.

The property comprises of two double bedroom spaces, two bathrooms including an en-suite connected to the master bedroom. All with modern and elegant interior décor and storage space. The kitchen includes modern, fitted appliances including an oven, dishwasher and washing machine.

The apartment also offers bright and airy open plan living/reception space that is ideal for entertaining friends and family. The private balcony can be accessed from the reception room and is wrapped around the property, providing views of Greenwich and ample room to sit and relax.

A benefit to this property is the allocated secure underground parking slot, 24hr concierge facilities, central heating, double glazing and the onsite Waitrose and Costa Coffee. The apartment complex is also within close proximity from the O2 Arena, Greenwich Station and Cutty Sark DLR which offers easy access to Canary Wharf, Central London and The City Airport.

detailedDescription:
Located in the sought-after St Joseph’s Vale development in Blackheath, is this modern two-bedroom end of terrace family home situated on a private road.

The property has a modern fully fitted kitchen and a separate spacious family lounge on the ground floor that is ideal for entertaining friends or family. The kitchen leads to a large and well-maintained private garden at the rear of the property which has also external access via a side-gate.

The two generous double bedrooms are all located on the first floor of the house and accessed via the modern spiral staircase which currently provides artistic value to the main living area. The family bathroom is also on the first floor.

A benefit to the property is the private garage, gas central heating, double glazing, and the range of Ofsted approved schools nearby. Located within walking distance to Greenwich Park, Blackheath Village and Blackheath station providing excellent transport links into Central London.

address: Jubilee Court, 8 Wood Wharf, London SE10
detailedDescription:
This light and spacious apartment offers great living space with an open-plan kitchen and reception room and floor to ceiling windows providing views towards the River and the O2. The modern kitchen is fully integrated providing plenty of worktop space and plenty of room for a dining area. The bedroom is of a good size and features built in wardrobes while the contemporary bathroom mirrors the contemporary design of the apartment. This is the perfect property for any buyer looking for a swift commute to the City and Canary Wharf while being moments from the many attractions for historical Greenwich.

Situation
Jubilee Court forms part of the New Capital Quay Development which is located moments from Central Greenwich and all the shops, bars and boutiques that the area has to offer, as well as the Docklands Light Railway at Cutty Sark which gives fast and convenient access to Canary Wharf and the City. Greenwich Mainline Station is also a short walk away which provides quick and easy access to The City and London Bridge. The Thames Clipper at Greenwich Pier also provides an alternative and convenient access to Canary Wharf, the City, Blackfriars, the South Bank, Westminster, the O2 and other prominent stops along the Thames. There is a Waitrose and Costa Coffee within the development and several pubs and restaurants nearby, as are the various historical sights and open spaces of Greenwich Park.

detailedDescription:
A simply stunning period conversion which offers a perfect blend of charm and character whilst coupled with a cool and contemporary interior.

Location

Ideally located for everyday amenities and within easy reach of Woolwich Arsenal Rail Station, which includes the DLR and soon to be Cross Rail, connectivity to both Canary Wharf and beyond is made easy. City airport is less than a 15 minute journey on the DLR, whilst Blackheath and Greenwich are only a short bus journey away where there are a range of shops, bars and restaurants.

All times and distances are approximate.

Description

This stunning three bedroom apartment offers plenty of wow factor, and needs to be viewed internally to be appreciated. The apartment offers approximately 1102 sq ft of living space and features vast double height ceilings, cast iron radiators and large windows, but blends this effortlessly with a luxury modern interior. Internally there is large open plan living area which spans 26ft x 15ft comprising of a high specification kitchen with a range of designer appliances, plus there are three generous double bedrooms and two designer bathroom suites. Additionally, there is engineered wooden flooring to the living areas, lots of fitted storage space, and secure parking included. The property also benefits from expansive communal grounds.

The Academy is an exclusive development which comprises of Grade II listed historic barracks and buildings converted into trendy residential homes. The development is privately gated and situated in impressive grounds, with plenty of greenery surrounding the area. Residents will also benefit from access to a concierge and access to fully equipped gymnasium (small charge applies).

Square Footage: 1102 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 237 years remaining

address: No. 1, 18 Cutter Lane, Upper Riverside, Greenwich Peninsula SE10
detailedDescription:
This super apartment comes tastefully decorated and ready to move into. Our clients have added a smart custom made breakfast bar with storage by Schmidt to the fully fitted kitchen, with all appliances integrated. Offering an amazing amount of natural light through the full height windows with a river facing aspect and views across The Tide, London's first Linear Park, inspired by the New York Highline. Open plan living provides defined areas for dining, cooking and relaxing, with warm neutral toned engineered wood flooring throughout. There is underfloor heating, a smart well appointed family bathroom and en suite to the master bedroom with fitted wardrobes. A second double bedroom also comes with fitted full height wardrobes with hanging space and drawer unit.
Living in Upper Riverside is much more than living in your own individual apartment, you are part of something much greater. This stunning family of five light filled, glass and stone towers, with roof gardens cascading to the edge of the Thames, occupies one of the best riverside locations in London. You will become part of the exclusive Upper Riverside Club, think of it as a relaxed, unstuffy and welcoming members club, with private access to the gyms, sauna, a 15th floor swimming pool with panoramic views, rooftop terraces, shared spaces and more. The gardens connected to the riverfront will have river cafes, different types of retail and lively public spaces. Upper Riverside links to Peninsula Square with access to the Underground at North Greenwich (Jubilee Line), the O2, friendly restaurants and buzzy social areas, and of course the soon to be launched Design District.
Call us to arrange your appointment to view.

address: Maltby House, 2 Ottley Drive, Blackheath, London SE3
detailedDescription:
Guide Price £425,000-450,000. With lovely views over the communal gardens, is this stylish two double bedroom two bathroom apartment with a corner terrace set within the prestigious Kidbrooke Village development.

The property is in excellent decorative order throughout.

Found on the third floor, with a lift, the accommodation comprises; a large and airy reception room with large windows, an open plan and very attractive modern kitchen with integrated appliances and a private terrace. There is a large master bedroom with built in wardrobes and an attractive modern ensuite bathroom, a second double bedroom, a modern shower room and utility cupboard housing washing machine/tumble dryer as well as an additional storage cupboard.

Further benefits are well kept communal gardens, gymnasium and a 24 hour concierge.

The property is sold chain free and your immediate viewing is essential. Video tours can be seen at

Maltby House is part of the sought after Kidbrooke Village development - a new and vibrant London community which offers an outstanding choice of quality, sustainable new homes.

As well as new homes, it will offer new parks, shops, bars, restaurants, schools, sports, healthcare and community facilities. Already established and just a two minute walk is a Sainsbury's local, pharmacy, convenience store and coffee shop. Sutcliffe Park with beautifully landscaped gardens and ponds is just 100 yards away.

Transport links to central London are excellent with travel to London Bridge in just 15 minutes from nearby Kidbrooke station. Direct trains to Victoria, Charing Cross, Waterloo East and Cannon Street also run from here. Blackheath Village, with its array of boutiques, daily conveniences, bars and restaurants, is also close by.

Guide Price £425,000-£450,000.

detailedDescription:
Beresford Residential are delighted to offer this stunning, recently renovated three bedroom house situated on a peaceful road in Plumstead, just an 8 minute walk from Plumstead overground station.

Plumstead is one of South East London's up and coming locations and this spacious house is ideally positioned for the shopping amenities of both Plumstead High Street and Woolwich town centre. Offering a wide range of supermarkets, shops, restaurants and pubs as well as excellent primary and secondary schools which are in close proximity. There are fantastic transport facilities at Plumstead Rail Station and Woolwich Arsenal which has links into London Bridge and Charing Cross as well as DLR that gets you into Canary Wharf, Liverpool Street and Bond Street. Cross Rail is also fast approaching and will be a welcomed addition in 2022.

The ground floor of this property comprises of a brand new modern kitchen including dishwasher, living room and separate dining room or bedroom that leads out to a beautiful garden. Upstairs there are two double bedrooms one with an ensuite and a further three piece, family bathroom. On street parking is available for the property. This immaculate property would be couple or family looking for their perfect home.

detailedDescription:
Located on the 1st Floor of the Building is this charming and characterful two bedroom, two bathroom duplex apartment situated in a historical warehouse conversion within the popular Royal Arsenal Riverside, Woolwich.

The ground floor of this remarkable conversion comprises a hallway with spiral staircase, an open plan living/dining room with two large arched original windows, a sizeable open plan kitchen with fitted appliances and a ground floor shower room. The first floor boasts two well proportioned bedrooms and an en suite bathroom. The property benefits from beautiful green communal areas along the river which is ideal for a summer picnic.

Additional benefits include original arched windows, exposed brick work throughout, 24 hour concierge service and an on site gym for residents only.

This property has a wealth of potential and is nestled within a secluded and gated part of rar just a stones throw from the Thames path for leisurely walks and jogs.

Royal Arsenal is one of South East London's up and coming areas and is positioned within close proximity of shopping amenities including Marks & Spencers and Tesco local supermarkets, several gastro bars and restaurants, fortnightly farmers market and a medical centre.

For the bust commuter, you are spoilt with the fantastic transport facilities of Woolwich station and DLR which has links into London Bridge and Cannon Street, Bank, Canary Wharf, Liverpool Street and Bond Street. The arrival of the prnding Crossrail/Elizabeth Line will also be a welcome addition!

title: 2 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
Detailed Description

***Guide Price £375,000 - £400,000*** A fantastic opportunity to take advantage of the stamp duty holiday in a Town that has seen continued development over the last few years. This modern, immaculately presented two-bedroom, two-bathroom apartment is located off the ever-popular Eltham High Street and comes with secure, underground, gated parking. Internally the property boasts a large open plan kitchen / reception room, family bathroom, storage facilities, a private rear balcony and two double bedrooms, one of which offering an en-suite. The property is offered with no-onward chain. Call today for your earliest appointment.

Location:
Eltham is a sought after suburb of South East London, located within the Royal Borough of Greenwich. The property is located conveniently adjacent to Eltham High Street. Eltham High Street contains many nationwide brands such as Marks & Spencer, Costa Coffee as well as a fine range of restaurants of varied cuisine, pubs and a popular, and newly developed six-screen cinema complex with a Nando’s, Pizza Express and a sky bar within. Nearby in Archery Road is the Eltham Centre, a leisure centre and library whilst plenty of good schools are also around.

For the commuters, there is a direct train line from either of Eltham (which is approximately 10 minutes walk away), New Eltham or Mottingham Station, serving Lewisham (for DLR), London Bridge, Charing Cross, Cannon Street, Waterloo East and Victoria. Buses connect to all neighbouring towns with Woolwich Arsenal and Lewisham both benefitting from DLR services and Woolwich soon to include Crossrail (2018). For roads in and out of London you have the South Circular, A2/A102 (Blackwell Tunnel Approach), A20 and Rochester Way.

The Royal borough of Greenwich is renowned for being one of the greenest in London, offering a range of open parkland and recreational activities for the whole family to enjoy. Eltham Park South with its tennis courts, play park and tea hut is almost opposite whilst further along Glenesk Road is Eltham Park North, with a duck pond flanked by the ancient Oxleas Wood. The Well Hall Pleasance is a park within the former grounds of the Tudor Barn, now a pub/restaurant with the grounds doubling up as an open-air cinema in the summer months. Eltham Palace is adjacent to the High Street, once the childhood home to Henry VIII and the family home to the Courtaulds, now a national heritage site and one of the country's finest Art Deco homes often used as a backdrop in period dramas. Neighbouring is Eltham Warren Golf Course, one of two in the wider area, The Royal Blackheath being the oldest golf club in England.

detailedDescription:
Duplex 3 bed, 3 bath apartment in riverside block - no upper chain
To be sold furnished with 3 x excellent sitting tenants.

A wonderfully located modern, split-level duplex apartment on the exclusive riverside Royal Arsenal development in Woolwich.
Spacious, ground floor apartment with its own private entrance. Located in a modern riverside block, with a large private terrace off the lounge and balcony from the master bedroom, overlooking a beautiful lagoon and water feature. Three larger than average bedrooms and three bathrooms high quality Villeroy & Boch fittings and rain showers make this a perfect apartment for rental.

Included with the apartment is one secure underground gated parking space, conveniently located under the building.

Open plan high spec kitchen, lounge with dining area which is spacious and light with beautiful views of the lagoon. Water facing, sunny terrace with comfortable rattan furniture to enjoy the fresh air. Laundry cupboard with washing machine.

The Royal Arsenal Riverside site spanning 76 acres has been tastefully transformed from a former munitions factory & storage facility with a history dating back to 1671. It has its own substantial community with cafes, pubs, restaurants, central open spaces, doctor's surgery, dentist, gym, car hire, Tesco and M&S Food. In addition there is an excellent 24 hour concierge and comprehensive security to provide waterfront living at its very best.

Transport options are fantastic - DLR and Thames Clipper boat pier are just a few minutes walk away with links to Canary Wharf, London Bridge and Charing Cross and onsite CrossRail is coming soon!

Free visitor parking is available on site.

detailedDescription:
This new 1 Bed apartment with fitted kitchen is located in London SE3 Kidbrooke Village development within walking distance to Kidbrooke Station.

Kidbrooke Village is located in one of Londons most popular locations, the Royal Borough of Greenwich and comprises of four distinct neighbourhoods, integrated seamlessly into one community. These include: The Village Centre (Birch House, Centrum Court and Agora Court), Meridian Gate, Blackheath Quarter and City Point.

Regular trains from the on-site Kidbrooke Station to London Bridge (in 16 mins), Waterloo East (19 mins), Charing Cross (25 mins) and Victoria Stations (28 mins). Trains also connect to Lewisham, providing DLR to Greenwich, Canary Wharf, Stratford and London City Airport.

Kidbrooke Village provides 86 acres of new parkland and open space, where youll soon find your favourite spots for a walk, ride or run. The waterways of Cator Park in particular make Kidbrooke Village a landmark destination. As a haven for wildlife, these diverse habitats have been protected in partnership with London Wildlife Trust.

- Located in zone 3
- On-site Kidbrooke station
- Only 16 minutes from London Bridge
- New train station facilities forthcoming
- Brand new Sainsburys and Youngs Pub & Dining
- Surrounded by over 86 acres of open parkland

- Individually designed kitchens
- Access to residents only gym & 24 hour Concierge

- Available with London Help to Buy
- Purchase with a 5% deposit

address: Waterman Gardens, 3 Tidemill Square, Lower Riverside, Greenwich Peninsula SE10
detailedDescription:
An amazing one bedroom apartment that's worthy of an immediate viewing, it won't be around long!
Located in Waterman Gardens on the riverfront, this low level building forms part of Tidemill Square, with this particular home looking into the landscaped communal gardens. On entering the home you find yourself in a spacious entrance hall with large built in utilities cupboard and smart well appointed bathroom. The 22ft Reception and Kitchen is filled with natural light from the floor to ceiling windows and doors to the decked balcony. A double bedroom with fitted wardrobe cupboards and windows looking into the gardens completes this spacious home.
Residents have access to a 23rd floor terrace with panoramic views of the Thames and London skyline, private workstations, wood-panelled 'residents' club' and cinema.
Greenwich Peninsula is big, eclectic and original. A whole new swathe of London that brings together design, community, the river, culture and stunning architecture against vast skies. A collection of seven neighbourhoods, 15,000 new homes and fascinating spaces in-between. Greenwich Peninsula doesn't pretend to be one thing - it's more interesting than that.
The Waterman is one of a collection of buildings that make up the Lower Riverside district which spans much of the Peninsula's eastern shore. Designed by Pilbrow & Partners, one of the UK's leading architecture practices. Interior design by Conran + Partners features parquet timber flooring, marble and stone bathrooms and high-quality kitchens with polished brushed brass splash backs. Located close to Central Park, the neighbourhood combines peacefulness with urban pastimes. At the heart of the district is Aperture, a new incarnation of the traditional 'village hall'. Award-winning architects and designers have created a light and open meeting place that provides important services and brings together residents for socialising and recreation including concierge, pan Asian restaurant, crèche, gym facilities, private event space and local Co-Op market.
Contact us for your appointment to view.

detailedDescription:
"The lovely character of this flat is why we have been here for over 7 years! I’m sad to see the flat go but our family has grown and need to find a bigger place and hopefully staying within the Charlton postcode.

The quick stroll to the Thames Path and the beautiful river walks are fantastic, lovely parks nearby and so handy for public transport being stones throw away from Charlton Rail Station and a bus ride from North Greenwich tube. A great array of shops in walking distance too.

The flat comes with loads of built in storage which is so handy and the service charge is so little and we split the maintenance directly between the 3 flats when needed."

We agree with the seller - this is such a charming split-level top floor that is ideally located for the commuter!

This flat offers a large living room, double bedroom, white bathroom, spacious fitted kitchen, excellent storage and loft space. Full of character, eaves, dormer windows, quirk and soul.

Benefits include full double glazing and gas central heating, plus a long lease. The flat retains responsibility for the roof also.

Lease is approx 153 years.
Service charge is contribution of approx £285p.a. For buildings insurance and £40p.a. For hallway electricity.
No ground rent.<br /><br />

A smart and well-presented two double bedroom conversion apartment, set on the top floor of this beautiful Victorian house in West Greenwich.

Occupying the entire top floor, it comprises of a large, open plan kitchen/living area, two good size, bright double bedrooms overlooking the back, and a modern family bathroom. There's an abundance of light throughout the property, emphasised by the sky light window on the landing.

Greenwich DLR and Mainline station is only a few minutes away, with links to Canary Wharf, the City and Central London. The Royal Park and the Village are only a stone's throw away and offer ample choice of shops, pubs, restaurants and supermarkets, making this apartment a great investment as well as a beautiful first time buyer home.

Your earliest viewing is highly recommended.

detailedDescription:
The Property

Purplebricks are delighted to bring to market a stunning and truly unique 2 bedroom apartment situated in this stunning Grade II listed Old Fire Station.

The development was formerly London's oldest operational fire station and the conversion is finished to an exceptionally high standard.

Added benefits include high ceilings, period features, allocated parking and rear decking seating area perfect to unwind in the evenings.

Woolwich has developed more rapidly than any other area in London, and is now one of the most thriving areas in South East London. Rich in history, Woolwich’s excellent transport connections and new luxury apartments make it top of the list for commuters and investors.
An unprecedented amount of regeneration over recent years has made historic Woolwich an exciting place - today, the famous Royal Arsenal and its historic buildings are now a residential quarter.

As part of Woolwich’s transformation, residents can enjoy a revitalised town centre, which is set to create 46,450 square metres of new retail floor space, 1,500 new homes and over 1,000 new jobs in the next five years.

But it’s not just Woolwich’s redevelopment that is drawing investors and first time buyers to the area – its close proximity to Canary Wharf, London City Airport, and Stratford add to its appeal, further fuelled by the on-going regards that East London saw during the 2012 Olympic Games.

*** Viewings are highly recommended ***

location

You’d be hard pushed to find a town more steeped in maritime history than Greenwich. Its Thames-side location is joined by the Cutty Sark and the National Maritime Museum. Greenwich Park is a Royal open space featuring the Royal Observatory and the prime meridian line.
The town centre is known for its craft and antiques markets, with bars, restaurants and the ‘Up The Creek’ comedy club attracting residents, tourists and Greenwich University students alike.

detailedDescription:
Greenwich Millennium Village

Described as one of the most exciting new residential neighbourhoods in Europe, Greenwich Millennium Village is a contemporary development that offers a different quality of life. Situated on Greenwich Peninsula, a short distance from the historic charm of Old Greenwich, it is just one stop on the Jubilee line from Canary Wharf and four stops from London Bridge.

Greenwich Millennium Village offers 21st Century living in a peaceful green setting, just a short walk from the O2 and North Greenwich station. Swathes of open space include the established Ecology Park, a large central park and podium gardens, linked by green corridors and tree lined avenues. The layout of the village gives priority to people over cars, with lively and intimate streets and a Village Square forming a focal point. The master plan also includes the amenities that every thriving community requires, with shops and facilities within a short distance of every home, and an architecturally stunning primary school and health centre at the heart of the village.

detailedDescription:
Guide price £240,000 - £250,000

The perfect first time purchase or investment, close to Eltham Station, modern décor throughout, a choice of two communal outdoor spaces & great views across London. Located on Tattersall Close, not only does this property have great access to all amenities within the local area, but offers great space and transport connections for those wanting a bit more room in London.

The property has a spacious entrance hall with an abundance of storage, a newly fitted modern kitchen, separate spacious living room overlooking gardens which is ideal for working from home. It’s also 0.2 miles from Eltham Railway Station offering fast and frequent commutes on two lines into Central London (giving direct connections to Lewisham (for DLR), London Bridge, Waterloo East, and Charing Cross, as well as Peckham Rye and Victoria). Many buses also start from Eltham Railway Station for routes to North Greenwich (for the O2 and Jubilee Line), Woolwich, Bromley and Greenwich University at Avery Hill.

The local area includes a parade of shops with a well-stocked Co-op, local coffee shop, doctors surgery and other essentials. Within half a mile is the newly revamped High Street where there is a new cinema, restaurants, supermarkets including Marks and Spencer, and monthly farmers market. The Eltham Centre offers a community hub with gym, fitness classes, pool, spa, and library.

Just a short walk from the flat is Well Hall Pleasaunce with beautiful gardens, one of Greenwich's Green Flag Award-winning sites. Also with The Tudor Barn within the grounds that dates back to the 16th Century, which is now a restaurant that caters for park users and is available to hire for private functions. Great for afternoon tea or bottomless brunch. Adjoining Well Hall Pleasaunce is Blackheath Rugby Club and sports grounds for Greenwich University. For more greenery you are also ten minutes walk from the Green Chain Walk and Oxleas Wood.

Ground Rent: £10 P/A

detailedDescription:
A very well presented two bedroom terraced house with side access, tucked away facing a small green and enjoyed by the current owner for the last 16 years for the community spirit and convenient location within half a mile of Kidbrooke station giving access to London Bridge and Charing Cross and within a few hundred yards walk of buses taking you to the 02. With an extensively fitted kitchen with some integrated appliances and very good sized garden of 87' widening to 46' at the rear where a substantial recently built timber shed could provide a variety of uses including workshop or home working space. With a stylishly fitted bathroom and original treated flooring to the first floor, the property is located within half a mile of Ealdham and Henwick primary schools and with Thomas Tallis secondary school just a little further. No onward chain!

lean to Space for washing machine, door to garden.

First floor

landing Loft access with retractable ladder (boarded and insulated we believe from the vendor) treated floorboards.

Bathroom 7' 5" x 6' 2" (2.26m x 1.88m) Windows to rear, white suite comprising panelled bath with shower above, wash basin, wc., heated towel rail, tiled walls, tiled floor.

Purplebricks are delighted to bring to market this attractive two double bedroom Victorian terraced property with large private garden, conveniently located in a popular residential road within easy access of excellent transport links and amenities.

The current owner has maintained the property to a really high standard and some of the works include, new roof, new three piece bathroom suite, and a new boiler too.

Added benefits include gas central heating, fully double glazed, new front and back doors and a generous sized rear garden approximately 100ft - 140ft

The property is located within easy reach of regular bus routes providing links to the local area and a night bus into central London. Within easy walking distance roughly 7 minutes, you will find Woolwich Arsenal DLR and mainline services for excellent links to Central London, Canary Wharf and the City. detailedDescription:
The property has been extended and renovated by the current owners to create a stylish, light and modern family home with great living space set within a secure, gated community. The reception room has been extended to create an open-plan family space which is also great for entertaining. Sliding patio doors lead out onto the beautiful yet low maintenance garden which feels private and secluded literally creating an extension of your living space in the summer months. The kitchen has been upgraded with integrated high-spec appliances, granite worktops and contemporary units which complement the modern feel of the house. On the first floor of the house you will find two equally sized spacious bedrooms with the front room benefitting from built-in wardrobes and an ensuite shower room while the rear bedroom has use of the family bathroom. On the top floor of the house is the impressive principal bedroom featuring an ensuite shower room and providing additional space for a dressing area or home study space if required. There is ample storage throughout the house with the further benefit of both an off-street parking space and garage attached to the property. The house would make the perfect purchase for any discerning buyer looking for a turnkey ready home within moment of all the amenities the local area has to offer.

Situation
Admirals Gate is a secure, gated development located in the Ashburnham Triangle Conservation Area in West Greenwich. Greenwich Mainline and DLR Station is located a short walk away offering a swift commute to the City, Canary Wharf and further to Kings Cross thanks to the recent addition of the Thameslink Line. The open green spaces of both Greenwich Park and Blackheath are located nearby as well as offering a wide array of independent shops, restaurants and pubs for local residents to enjoy.

What is shared ownership?
Under the shared ownership scheme you part-own and part-rent your home, making it
possible for first-time buyers and families to get on the property ladder.
The minimum share you can purchase is 25% and the maximum is 75%. You will usually pay a mortgage on the part you own and a subsidised rent on
the part you don't own. Over time, you can increase the share you own until you eventually own 100%

L&Q at Kidbrooke Village
Situated in the leafy green oasis of Kidbrooke SE3, a home at this development will offer you to escape and unwind from the demands of modern life. Built to a high specification, your new home will come equipped with a fully fitted kitchen featuring integrated appliances, built-in wardrobes to the master bedroom and outdoor space in the form of a balcony or terrace – everything you need for modern living.

As well as having a wonderfully crafted new home, you will benefit from some outstanding onsite facilities, surrounded by landscaped gardens, acres of open parkland and a flourishing new community. Convenience is at the heart of Kidbrooke. The Village Centre is home to retail shops, a supermarket, coffee shop, dentist, doctor and pharmacy.

Greenwich Connections
From the onsite Kidbrooke Station, you can reach London Bridge in 16 minutes* and Waterloo East in 19 minutes* connecting to London Underground mainline stations enabling you to get into and out of the city.
There are also safe pedestrian and cycle routes across the development.

Viewings
For those who would like to and are able to visit us, the Show Home is now open on an appointment-only basis, with extra measures in place to ensure your wellbeing. Please call us to book your appointment. If you would prefer to speak to our Sales Team from your own home, they are still on hand and can conduct appointments via phone, email and by virtual tour. *We are taking extra precautions to ensure the health and wellbeing of our customers, staff and members of the public.

address: No 5, 2 Cutter Lane, Upper Riverside, Greenwich Peninsula SE10
detailedDescription:
The open-plan living and dining area is fitted with a linear kitchen designed to maximise the space. Designed with terrazzo kitchen worktops and integrated appliances, the wealth of storage space is both functional and expertly designed. Natural textures are also reflected in both bathrooms, that are fitted with elegant brassware and high-quality stone.

Find this home in No. 5 Upper Riverside, the final building to complete Greenwich Peninsula's Upper Riverside neighbourhood. Designed by world-famous architects som, the 5 prism towers cascade along the riverfront. Located 300m from North Greenwich bus and tube station, adjacent to the Emirates Air Line and opposite North Greenwich Pier, transport links are readily available. Residents of No. 5 Upper Riverside will be the first to enjoy the full set of exclusive residents' amenities listed above.

As the UK's largest area of urban regeneration, Greenwich Peninsula will be transformed over the coming years. There's £8.4 billion being invested in this new area for London, which will include:

* 15,000 new homes in an area that's twice the size of Soho
* 7 new neighbourhoods over 150 acres
* 13,000 new jobs

* 34,000 new settlers, within a diverse and eclectic community
* The Tide, a 5km linear park that wraps around the Peninsula

It's a growing community wrapped by a mile and a half of the river. A place that's already bustling with new restaurants, cafes and retail. On Greenwich Peninsula, you'll find all the necessities for contemporary living.

title: 2 bed property for sale

detailedDescription:
Chain Free Sale

Property Details:

Accommodation comprises an entrance hall leading into the bright and spacious reception room,
flooded with natural light from triple front aspect windows, and offering ample space for
entertaining, relaxing and dining. The separate kitchen comprises a modern range of matching wall
and base units with hardwood work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, gas hob with overhead
extractor and electric oven, and further space for appliances. There is a spacious double bedroom
with space for free-standing furniture, and a modern bathroom with white suite and elegant tiling.

The property is conveniently located within easy access of Westcombe Park and Charlton stations,
as well as numerous regular bus routes serving the surrounding area and providing links to North
Greenwich, Greenwich and Woolwich for Jubilee Line, DLR and Elizabeth Line connections. There
are a range of shops, eateries and amenities close-by, with fashionable Blackheath only a short
distance away with a variety of stylish pubs, cafes and restaurants. The area is also well served by
lovely open spaces including Charlton and Hornfair Parks, and the beautiful Blackheath Common.

What do you love most about your home?
I was immediately struck by the light and airy feel of the flat. With a south-facing aspect the light streams in through the triple sash windows in the living room with views of the playing fields opposite. It's a very well proportioned flat, the living room is so spacious and comfortably holds a dining table for 6-8 people as well as a large L shaped sofa making it perfect for entertaining. The bedroom has plenty of storage with built in wardrobes and has a tranquil feel as it looks out over the communal garden. To not be overlooked from the front or back of the property gives a real sense of privacy. Being on the top floor and the only entrance on this level made me feel very safe and secure. It is a beautiful building and the other owners are genuinely lovely people, they are by far the nicest neighbours i've had! Finally, Hervey Road is a very quiet and wide tree lined road just off Shooters Hill Road and is part of a conversation area. The road has a number of large detached family homes and there are no high rise developments which is a rarity in London these days.

What do you love about the area? T

The best thing about living in this part of London has to be the abundance of green space from the playing fields across the road to nearby Greenwich park and the open space of Blackheath a short stroll away. There's even an Olympic sized outdoor heated swimming pool a few mins walk away so no matter if you are an avid runner, keen cyclist or even a tri-athlete you'll be able to enjoy these pursuits on your doorstep. Don't worry though if leisurely strolls is more your thing then you won't be disappointed either.

I will never tire of watching the seasons change as I stroll through Greenwich Park, stop to take in a wonderful view of the city before a mooch around the market and indulge in some churros. I'm no history buff but you can't help but be impressed by all the history in Greenwich from the Royal Observatory, Royal Naval College & it's Painted Halls to the Maritime Museum & Cutty Sark. Millions come from all over the world to visit these attractions each year but living so close you can explore each one at your leisure. I'd recommend going on a rainy afternoon in winter when you can while away hours exploring and feel like you have the place to yourself!

Blackheath is one of only a handful of villages in London and has some wonderful independent shops, bars & restaurants. Brunch at boulangerie Jade followed by a platter of cheese and wine at Le Bar a Vin a few doors away is the perfect way to spend a Saturday in my book and on a Sunday there is the farmers market which has lovely fresh produce and exceptional baked goods :-)

* 48 acres of public green space

It's a growing community wrapped by a mile and a half of the river. A place that's already bustling with new restaurants, cafes and retail. On Greenwich Peninsula, you'll find all the necessities for contemporary living.

detailedDescription:
South facing one bed on the 3rd floor of a popular purpose built block, within this landmark development adjacent to the river, east of Greenwich. Fitted to a high specification throughout, this stylish apartment benefits from a well appointed kitchen, with a range of integrated appliances & granite work surface, light & bright reception overlooking period conversion and tree lined street below, decent sized double bedroom & well appointed bathroom.

Area

The Royal Arsenal is a former munitions factory & storage facility with a history dating back to 1671, that is being tastefully transformed to provide a blend of converted & new build residential properties, together with a central open space, bars, restaurants and an hotel.

Beautifully landscaped, the builder has taken great care to create a development that is a pleasure to live in, rather than yet another sterile 'stack of boxes'. It retains a real sense of community yet retains a high degree of peace and tranquility, away from the 'big smoke'.

The development currently offers

* 24 Concierge & Security
* Residents Gym
* Royal Resistance Boot Camp
* 7R CrossFit Gym
* Two Youngs "gastro pubs" The Dial Arch & The Guardhouse
* Con Gusto Italian Restaurant
* Craft Beer & Pizzeria, The Taproom
* Three on site cafés
* Health Centre
* Chemist
* Dentist
* Tesco Express
* M&S Food Hall
* Sainsburys
* Dry Cleaning service
* Zipcar Car Sharing Club
* Fortnightly Farmers Market

Situated east of Greenwich, adjacent to Woolwich Town Centre (offering an array of main street shopping and a vibrant street market) the development is easily reached by road & rail.

The station is no more than a short stroll away, which offers a direct route to the City (London Bridge / Cannon Street) in a little over 20 minutes, via the Main Line and less than 25 minutes to Bank / Tower Gateway via the DLR.

London City Airport can also be reached in as little as 5 minutes, with Canary Wharf & Stratford also accessible in less than 25 minutes.

As far as leisure is concerned, a short cab ride will take you to nearby Blackheath, Greenwich or, the O2 - where you will be spoilt for choice in terms of food, drink and nightlife.

As an alternative to the train or car, the Thames Clipper river bus service also docks immediately adjacent to the development and provides additional links with The O2, Greenwich, Canary Wharf, Tower Bridge, Blackfriars, The Southbank (Tate Modern) and beyond.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Bettermove are delighted to welcome to the market this stunning one bed third floor apartment for sale in Greenwich, available with no forward chain.

The property has been granted an EWS1 for A2 result.

This is a leasehold property with 996 years remaining on the lease. There is an annual service charge which varies year-on-year, the most recent bill was approximately £1700; the ground rent is £150 every six months.

The interior of this beautifully-presented property comprises a large open plan living/dining room/modern kitchen with integrated appliances, a double bedroom and modern bathroom. The exterior boasts a private balcony, perfect for enjoying the summer months.

Located in the sought after borough of Greenwich, the property is close to a wide range of local amenities, including shops, supermarkets, restaurants and cafes. Transport connections can be found from Westcombe Park train station as well as North Greenwich tube and the A102 Blackwall Tunnel.

This exciting opportunity should not be missed and enquiries can be made through Bettermove.

You can now secure the sale with a reservation fee of £1,000 which gives you exclusive rights to purchase within a given timeframe.

Paying this fee ensures that the seller takes their property off the market and reserves it exclusively for you, therefore eliminating gazumping and aborted costs.

detailedDescription:
This is a beautifully presented and very characterful first floor, one double bedroom conversion flat on this highly regarded residential road, just a short walk from the open heath and Blackheath Village beyond whilst also close to the shops and facilities of Blackheath Standard too.

The property features an impressive south facing reception room with two large sash windows which flood the room with natural light and afford lovely views over the immaculate communal gardens to the rear, an attractive fireplace and built in bookshelves. Other features include beautiful wooden floors, a recently installed and attractive, modern open plan kitchen, a gorgeous and very spacious bedroom with fitted wardrobes and a period style bathroom.

There are many elegant original features throughout this delightful and airy apartment including very impressive high ceilings and attractive sash windows.

Additional benefits include a lovely and extensive communal garden and residents' parking to the front. Energy Efficiency Rating D

Situated on a quiet residential road and within walking distance to highly regarded schools, town centre and multiple train stations, this superb family home must be seen to be fully appreciated.

Offered to the market for the first time in over 20 years, in good condition and with the added benefit of being chain free, internally you will find a spacious open lounge kitchen dining area, family bathroom, three double bedrooms complete with en-suite to the master in the converted loft. Properties like this on Campfield Road are always popular and and internal viewing comes highly recommended. EPC Grade C.

detailedDescription:
EWS1 form in place

Stunning one bedroom apartment situated in Landmann Point in the immensely popular Greenwich Millennium Village development, North Greenwich. Of internal floor space and comprises of a spacious lounge with a sleek and stylish open plan kitchen, large double bedroom and modern bathroom. title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
• 30% shared ownership, also available at full value of £530,000.

  • No Chain, Conveyancer Nominated.

  • Current Service Charge: £204 per month

  • Current Rent for the remaining 70%: £538 per month (extremely low compared to market rate rent)

  • Video available on request.

Situated in a riverside development above Waitrose supermarket, the two-bedroom fifth-floor apartment is a stone throw away from vibrant Greenwich Town Centre, DLR and railway station. This corner apartment benefits from windows on two adjacent walls – natural light floods the living space with warmth and brightness.
Immaculately presented, the property offers ample living space over a generously sized lounge with partial river view from the sitting area, two spacious double bedrooms, a separate kitchen, a modern bathroom with shower over bath. This property also benefits from an allocated parking space directly below the building, in a secured, gated car park.
Property description


  • Lounge: A generously sized lounge with partial river view from sitting area. With floor to ceiling windows facing north (river side) and another window facing east, the lounge benefits from ample natural light.

  • Large bedroom: 4.04m x 3.21m, east facing double bedroom with two windows, with generous space for furniture and storage.

  • Second double bedroom: 3.77m x 2.99m, east facing windows with large windowsill (window seating potential). Designed to comfortably fit a double bed with power sockets and bedside tables on both sides.

  • Hallway: Spacious L-shaped hallway with large, shelved storage cupboard near the front entrance. Exceptionally bright when bedroom doors are opened.

  • Kitchen: Fully-fitted modern u-shaped kitchen with large work surfaces on both sides of the cooker.

  • Bathroom: Modern family bathroom with shower over bath.

Other Details


  • Length of Lease: Approx. 118 Years

  • Council tax Band: Greenwich Council – Band D

  • Gross Internal Area: 68.9m2

Local area information




  • Buzzing bars and cafes of Greenwich and its stunning Royal Park, while also being a short journey to both Canary Wharf and the City of London.

  • Just a 3-minute walk from Cutty Sark DLR station and 5 minutes to Greenwich station for the mainline and DLR. Also close to the Thames Clipper at Greenwich Pier.

  • Bus links to North Greenwich, Lewisham, Surrey Quays, Bermondsey and Central London just steps away make this apartment even more well connected.

  • A short wander to the riverfront also provides views of the legendary fireworks display from the London Eye at New Year.

  • There are many local primary and secondary schools, including St Alfege with St Peter C of E Primary School and James Wolfe Primary School just a short walk away.

  • The prestigious New Capital Quay development is also home to Little Elms Nursery, a large onsite Waitrose (open till 10pm), a gym, a dentist, and restaurants including Costa Coffee, The Sail Loft and The Oyster Catcher.

detailedDescription:
Proudly presenting this amazing 3 Storey house set in a private gated development it is an amazing house with loads of potential and allocated parking - with 3 large double bedrooms, amazing open plan kitchen living, 2 bathrooms, 1 WC and an amazing master suite on the top floor.

Set out over 1500sqft this property has an amazing open plan kitchen dining area on the ground floor opening out onto a stunning private garden space. Further to this there is a lovely reception room and WC. As you head upstairs there are two large double bedrooms both having access to one of the many bathrooms. Continuing to the top floor of the property where the stunning master suite is situated along with another smaller bedroom, potential office or nursery space and the final bathroom.

In regards to transport there are some fantastic links for bus routes to North Greenwich for the Jubilee line, Woolwich Arsenal, Woolwich DLR and the forthcoming Crossrail.

This property would make a perfect rental investment or alternatively with a little tlc a beautiful family home.

title: 4 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
This 1065 square foot 3 bedroom apartment is situated on the 2nd floor and comprises of an open plan kitchen/living dining with direct access to a private inset balcony with fantastic views over Cygnet Square and towards Southmere Lake beyond.

Located in Thamesmead, SE2, Southmere is a collection of one, two and three-bedroom apartments situated close to Abbey Wood station and the wide open spaces of Thamesmead. The development will include a new public square, library, fitness studio and café, with other commercial and community spaces to follow. Residents will also benefit from a concierge, lounge and co-working space within the development.

Southmere marks the start of a 30-year transformation of Thamesmead, an area the size of central London. £9 billion is due to be invested into the area which will result in the creation of up to 20,000 new homes.

Each apartment is finished to a high specification throughout. Contemporary two-tone handle-less kitchens by Symphony are complimented by integrated Bosch & Zanussi appliances. Hallways, living rooms and kitchens have light oak effect Amtico flooring while the bedrooms have soft grey carpets.

Built-in frosted glass wardrobes are provided in master bedrooms. Luxurious bathrooms have large format marbled ceramic tiles, built in storage and polished chrome brassware throughout.

All apartments come with underfloor heating and benefit from a private balcony or terrace.

The arrival of the Elizabeth Line at Abbey Wood station will offer exceptional travel times of 11 minutes to Canary Wharf, 17 minutes to Liverpool Street and just 25 minutes to Bond Street.

Southmere is the latest high-quality residential development by Peabody.

Highlights:
- Concierge
- Residents’ lounge and co-working space
- Balcony or terrace to all homes
- Cycle storage
- Parking available by separate negotiation for select units
- Abundance of green space and water - 150 hectares of parks and 30,000 trees, 5 lakes, 7km of canals and 5km of river frontage

Existing over ground services from Abbey Wood Station provide easy access to central London. Crossrail will further improve transport links as follows:
- Canary Wharf – 11 mins (Elizabeth Line)
- Liverpool Street – 17 mins (Elizabeth Line)
- Bond Street - 25 mins (Elizabeth Line)
- Heathrow - 16 mins (Elizabeth Line)

Anticipated completion: June 2021

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
B&C Properties is delighted to present this luxury bright, spacious two bedroom, two bathroom apartment with parking in Campbell Court, Kidbrooke Village, offering magnificent views of the beautiful Sutcliffe Park.

B&C Properties is delighted to present this luxury bright, spacious two bedroom, two bathroom apartment located on the 1st floor with parking in Campbell Court, Kidbrooke Village, offering magnificent views of the beautiful Sutcliffe Park. Your earliest viewing is advised to avoid disappointment.

This apartment has been decorated to an extremely high standard throughout. The apartment comprises of a large open plan living, dining and kitchen area with floor to ceiling height windows opening onto a large balcony. The kitchen is fully equipped to a very high standard including a dish washer, fridge/freezer. The master suite comes with built in wardrobes with ensuite bathroom, there is a further double bedroom and a luxury modern family bathroom. Off of the hallway there is a utility cupboard to house the washing machine. The currant owner has also installed air conditioning into the apartment making those hot days much cooler.
The apartment is situated right next to the beautiful Sutcliffe Park, with lake, children's playground and athlete track. Sainsbury's Local supermarket is onsite too. The apartment benefits from 24hr Concierge and onsite residence only Gym access.

This property is only a 5 minute walk to Kidbrooke train station which runs to London Bridge station in 15 minutes, Waterloo East in 20 minutes, Charing Cross in 25 minutes and 28 minutes to London Victoria, all of which are positioned on the main London Underground lines. The development benefits from a vast amount of parkland and it is situated in the immediate vicinity of some of the most vibrant areas of London, Blackheath Village and Greenwich, both featuring an array of boutiques, restaurants and bars.

Royal Arsenal Riverside is one of South East London's most exciting riverside addresses, sitting at the heart of Woolwich, which is rapidly emerging as one of London's bright spots; occupying prime location along the River Thames and offering a buzzing retail hub. With a forthcoming on-site Crossrail station, an on-site Thames Clipper Pier, plus the National Rail and DLR stations only 300m away, Royal Arsenal Riverside is one of the best connected developments in South East London.
