detailedDescription:
*** Chain Free ***

*** Guide price £325,000 to £340,000 ***

Purplebricks are delighted to bring to market this stunning One Bedroom Ground Floor Apartment with its own private terrace, set in a high end new development and offers a fantastic opportunity to take that first step onto the property ladder.

The building is only 18 months old, so still comes with over eight years of NHBC warranty and is still inside the builders 'snagging' cover until the end of June 2021. Throughout the entire property, the standard of decor is very high. The colours are all neutral meaning they can work with any type of furniture you wish to have. A fantastic mix of carpet and wooden flooring mean you have comfort and style in every room.

The stunning open plan living space gives you the space for all your living and dining room needs. There is ample room for sofas, arm chairs, a dining table and lots of floor space to spare. The kitchen area is set to the rear of the room and offers modern units for storage as well as space for all your white goods and kitchen utilities. The large private terrace offers you that precious outside space, to sit out on and enjoy on those long summer evenings.

Location
The location for this property couldn’t be better, as it is only 5-7 mins walk from the DLR and train station, making the daily commute that little bit easier.

The property will also benefit from access to an on-site concierge, street parking available within the development & secure bike storage below the building.

The Crossrail/Elizabeth Line is expected to open in a year or so, which will significantly reduce the travel times to Canary Wharf, the City & Central London and beyond.

Woolwich as a town is currently in the middle of a huge regeneration process. The shopping parade and areas surrounding will all be getting an upgrade to make the shopping experience as impressive as the living accommodation.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

detailedDescription:
Guide price - £500,000 - £550,000

As you step into the entrance hall the laughter and love that this gorgeous family home has experienced over the years echoes from room to room. On the ground floor you will find bedroom one which is currently being used as an office, downstairs WC/shower room and kitchen.

The modern fitted kitchen comes complete with high gloss units and ample space to fit a dining table and chairs.

Moving upstairs you find bedroom two with views overlooking the garden and living room that spans an amazing 208 sq ft.

The third floor brings a third double bedroom, main bathroom with an elegant grey and white colour scheme and master bedroom commanding an impressive 180 sq ft.

The south facing garden provides raised decking and simple landscaped grass area making a perfect space for alfresco dining or evening socialising.

Bell Street is located off of the iconic Shooters Hill, known historically as part of the "London Stop Line General" which was the last arterial defence point for London in wwii. With a wide range of local amenities and shops located minutes from the doorstep not to mention easy access to Greenwich and Blackheath town centres with their shopping outlets, bars, restaurants and transport links including DLR and soon to be Cross Rail this property had everything to offer both inside and out.

The property is also within walking distance to a number of ofstead rated outstanding schools as well as a number of local points of interest such as; Oxleas Woods, Hornfair Park, Greenwich Park which is home to the Royal Observatory and The National Maritime Museum.

Viewings are by appointment only

title: 4 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
A unique one bedroom Victorian Conversion flat located in the centre of Woolwich SE18.

Beautifully presented throughout and boasting plenty of character and located on the lower ground floor of this imposing Victorian terrace conversion. Comprising a cosy reception room with large bay window and feature cast iron fire place, separate modern integrated kitchen beautifully finished with wooden work tops, brass unit handles and traditional Victorian style floor tiling. The bedroom is bright and sizeable with built in floor to ceiling wardrobe and over looks the private outdoor space allowing plenty of natural light, a good size lobby for storage and a bright modern bathroom to the rear of this flat. The private outdoor space is South facing and is easy to maintain. Ideal for a little dog and for your morning coffee!

Retaining many of its period features this would make an ideal first time buy or investment property.

Woolwich is a vibrant location with plenty of eateries, bars restaurants and shopping facilities. Just 5 minutes to Woolwich Arsenal station offering Thameslink and South-eastern lines as well as DLR and London City Airport is only two stops; ideal for the jetsetter. The arrival of Crossrail will provide direct access into Canary Wharf (7 mins), Liverpool Street (14 mins) and Bond Street (21 mins). Only a short scenic stroll to the river boat (23 mins to Canary Wharf).

Tenure: Share of Freehold
Council Tax Band: B

detailedDescription:
** long lease **
** EWS1 certificate granted **

Anthony Martin are excited to market this stunning two double bedroom 4th floor apartment which is located within the very sought after Royal Arsenal Development.

The property is in show home condition throughout and certainly gives plenty of room with a bright and airy feel, on top of this the property is ideally located for everything you might need from an on site residents gym to a range of shops, bars, restaurants and transport including being within walking distance to the local station and clipper making your journey into Canary Wharf or the city itself effortless.

The property is located on the 4th floor as mention and offers a great view of the attractive water feature from your very own balcony.

The accommodation on offer comprises of a two double bedrooms with the master bedroom benefiting from your own en suite bathroom, off the hallway you will find a shower room and a good size storage cupboard, the lounge area is open plan to the kitchen and certainly has a good amount of space to incorporate a dining area, from here you can access your balcony and take in the view.

There is also underground secure parking and a 24hr Concierge on site.

This should be at the top of your viewing list so call anthony martin now to arrange!

detailedDescription:
Reserve this one bedroom apartment at Wandsworth Exchange before 31 July and receive a bespoke interior design package worth up to £3,000*, contact our team to find out more
1 bedroom apartment available at Hawthorne Crescent for £100,000!

Hawthorne Crescent - Apartment E4.05
1 bedroom 4th-floor apartment offering 48 sq.m of internal floor area with outdoor space. Contact a member of our sales team now to view our new show home.
£100,000 for a 25% share of £400,000 and a deposit as low as £10,000 and a minimum income of £46,000.

L&Q at Greenwich Square
Buying an apartment at Greenwich Square opens the door to a unique community and offers the perfect place to call home. Our homes are built around people and offer beautifully designed homes with a desirable specification and outdoor space to each apartment. These homes are also set around a beautiful garden square. The development has everything you could need on your doorstep making life that little bit more convenient. With every block distinct and individual, creating an intelligent balance between shared community and private space.

Shared Ownership
Under the Shared Ownership scheme you part-own and part-rent your home, making it possible for first-time buyers and families to get on the property ladder.
The minimum share you can purchase is 25% and the maximum is 75%. You will usually pay a mortgage on the part you own and a subsidised rent on the part you don’t own. As your income rises, you can increase the share you own until you eventually own 100%.

The minimum income required for a 1 bedroom apartment is £44,000
The minimum income required for a 2 bedroom apartment is £58,000
The minimum income required for a 3 bedroom apartment is £67,000
*Household incomes are based on joint applications. Single applications are able to apply but may need to increase their deposit contribution to meet shared ownership affordability requirements.

Viewings
For those who would like to and are able to visit us, the Show Home is now open on an appointment-only basis, with extra measures in place to ensure your wellbeing. Please call us to book your appointment. If you would prefer to speak to our Sales Team from your own home, they are still on hand and can conduct appointments via phone, email and by virtual tour. *We are taking extra precautions to ensure the health and wellbeing of our customers, staff and members of the public.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
***Guide Price £750,000 - £800,000*** cash buyers only please! Words truly cannot describe this amazing apartment, measuring some 3200 Sq. Ft in total!

Forming part of this 1930's, art-deco style converted cinema is this incredibly light and spacious first floor apartment. Covering just one floor, the apartment features the largest kitchen / living / dining area we have ever seen! Furthermore, three double bedrooms are fixed towards the rear of the property, with the main bedroom readily equipped with walk-in dressing room and en suite, two further modern bathrooms one of which is en suite to the second bedroom.

In terms of location, it really couldn’t be better! Everything is literally on the doorstep and the local area offers fantastic bus routes – providing easy access to North Greenwich tube station – local shop, and a short walk further ahead takes you to Maze Hill mainline station. Greenwich Royal park and the historic Greenwich town centre with its many restaurants and craft markets is marvelously close, and Cutty Sark DLR station is also close by for easy access to Canary Wharf.

To note, the electrics inside this apartment have been fully tested, and certified in March 2020. Not only this but a new fuse box has been fitted too. Two climate control units have been fitted in the main living area, purchased new in June 2020 with a 5 year warranty. Each of the three bedrooms are fitted with an electric heater, and all bathrooms include stylish and convenient towel rack radiators.

The 6m x 4m bay window is fitted with custom thermal lined drapery and net curtains, and high security custom steel doors have been fitted towards the front and back. Along with this is are multiple low voltage ceiling spotlights throughout the apartment. In March 2020, high-end white goods were purchased which include a Bosch dishwasher, Samsung washing machine, induction hob with counter mounted motorised pop up extractor fan, AEG double oven, as well as a separate 6ft fridge / freezer unit. A super useful video entry-phone system has also been installed, with 2 receiver phones ready for use at all times.

Although there is no on-site parking, the current owners have a Residents’ Permit to park in the surrounding side streets. Last – but certainly not least – there is no Service Charge to pay, however there is a portion of the Buildings’ Insurance, and this is currently £600 Per Annum!

All in all, this is a unique property that is being sold with the benefit of no chain and early viewings are highly recommended!

Owners Notes -

The property was converted from a restaurant to a residential property in 2011 by the previous owner. He still holds the head lease but did not secure a change of lease to a residential one. The current lease which is for 125 years from 1999 ( about 103.5 years remaining ) states that the property can be used for any reasonable purpose with permission and that permission can not be unreasonably withheld. There are current negotiations ongoing between the head lease holder and the freeholder to secure the correct permissions and to create a deed of variation. The head lease owner has already agreed to change the use and has permitted the use as residential.

What the Sellers Say -

"We feel so lucky to have lived here... It is the biggest flat we have ever seen.

Based in the heart of the community you are right down the road from Greenwich Park and the Thames.

The train station is only a 5 minute walk away which is so convenient to get into the city and beyond.”<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
A beautiful home set within an elegant Victorian building positioned on Morden Road in Blackheath Cator Estate.

This charming home is offered chain free and configured over 1135 sq ft. The living room is decorated in neutral tones and measures over 20 ft. The space feels calm and restful largely due to the light which floods through large timber sash windows. There is original wood flooring and plenty of fine detail including an original built in book case, an ornate fireplace, deep skirting, a ceiling rose, picture rail, and a useful bespoke handcrafted media unit which neatly stores things away.

The master bedroom features a spectacularly giant bay window complete with window seat to take in the incredible views overlooking beautifully mature evergreens, grasses and interesting plants which are set within a lush green landscaped garden. The bedroom measures over 18 ft and feels restful, one of the nicest things that can be fully appreciated is the breath-taking view of an astonishing Cedar tree. Hand crafted bespoke carpentry allows for ample storage and the details continue with a fireplace, high skirting, ceiling rose and coving. The second bedroom is over 16 ft in length and is decorated in a relaxed pink hue. The bathroom features a luxurious freestanding roll top bath, a large basin with granite top and cabinet in addition to a walk in shower. The room is decorated in a deep hue and decorative tiles with a pretty motif.

Also overlooking the garden is the kitchen with magnificent high ceilings, timber floor and an exquisite bespoke sky blue kitchen complete with marble worktop. There is a fabulous dresser, Butler’s sink and a central island which is a perfect entertaining space whether enjoying drinks with friends or sitting at for a relaxed bite to eat.

Situated on Morden Road, this beautiful home is perfectly located on Blackheath Cator Estate, a private estate comprising of 282 acres just south of Blackheath Village.
Blackheath is a bustling London village, home to an expansive heathland brimming with wildlife and nature. In the heart of Blackheath is the village which is home to a superb choice of independent restaurants, boutiques, cafes and shops. There is a weekly farmer’s market on Sunday’s and throughout the year a wide variety of events and festivals which take place on the heath.

Blackheath train station is ideal for commuting to the City and West-End with frequent services to London Bridge, Charing Cross, Cannon Street and London Victoria. The area is popular with families due to superb choice of local and independent schools including Blackheath High School, Heath House, John Ball, The Pointer School and Colfes. There are also bus services which can be accessed from Blackheath to Dulwich College, Eltham College, jags and Alleyn’s.

Conveniently close by is Greenwich which sits on the banks of the River Thames. Greenwich is a World Heritage Site steeped in royal and naval history. Greenwich Park extends across 74 hectares and is home to wild deer and beautiful gardens. Greenwich a hive of activity and is much loved by locals and visitors.

Benefits include laminate flooring throughout, a large outside storage shed, full double glazing and combi boiler.

Positioned in the heart of Woolwich, which is rapidly emerging as one of London's bright spots with a vibrant high street and traditional markets, as well as a leisurely river walk into riverside to benefit from the restaurants and bars the rar has to offer. Woolwich is surround with green spaces as well as Greenwich and Blackheath for more green spaces and amenities.

Under 0.5 miles to ofsted 'Outstanding' Cardwell and St Peters Catholic Schools and 'Good' Mulgrave and St Mary Magdalene C of E.

detailedDescription:

The location is easily commutable with trains from Maze Hill to London Bridge in just 11 minutes and buses to North Greenwich (Jubilee Line) in under 15 minutes.

detailedDescription:
A stunning three bedroom, four storey, Victorian house, that is end of terrace and measures circa 1661 square foot. Located on this popular and quiet road, just moments from the open heath!

In excellent order throughout, the property comprises of a fabulous, open plan, kitchen diner on the lower level, that leads onto a good sized garden. On the entrance floor there is a lovely through reception room, separate WC and boot room. Then on the upper floors is a large master bedroom, which has its own dressing area and ensuite. There is also a family bathroom and then two further double bedrooms on the top floor. It's worth mentioning that this is the largest house on the terrace and also features secure outside storage to the front. Planning permision has been granted to extend it further.

Dartmouth Hill is an extremely pretty road that is found just off the heath, and conveniently on the cusp of Greenwich, Blackheath and Lewisham. This means it is perfectly located for quick access to all three town centres, which give a wide selection of shops and restaurants, along with mainline rail and DLR. Greenwich Park, with its Observatory is also close by.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Guide Price £1,150,000-£1,250,000. A fantastic and vast, three bedroom, two bathroom Georgian apartment with a private terrace and spectacular views set within this historic heath facing Grade l listed building with off street parking and amazing communal gardens.

The Paragon is an exceptional Grade I listed crescent of houses linked by colonnades fronting a private roadway off the Heath and built around 1798 by Michael Searles, having been the subject of post war restoration by Bernard Brown. The Paragon is described by Professor Abercrombie as the most important surviving example of Georgian architecture in the country.

Found on the second and third floors, the property is in excellent decorative order with feature windows, wood flooring, period features and gas fired central heating. The accommodation briefly comprises; a large and beautiful living room with feature window overlooking the vast communal gardens and beyond and a large kitchen breakfast room with a luxury handmade kitchen. There is also a shower room and a third bedroom which with its superb views over the open heath would serve as an excellent study. Upstairs are two very large double bedrooms including a wonderful master bedroom with access to a private roof terrace and a luxury modern bathroom with free standing bath. The views are outstanding, there is off street parking, a private bicycle store and incredible and huge communal gardens.

This is an amazing homes extremely rare to the market. There is no chain and your immediate viewing is essential.

The Paragon is arguably Blackheath's most prestigious addresses and located just 20ft from the heath and 800 metres from Greenwich Park. Blackheath Village with its array of boutiques, bars, restaurants and station is just a few hundred yards. Blackheath Station gives access to London Bridge, Charing Cross and Victoria amongst others. Close by are several sought-after schools including Blackheath Prep, Blackheath High School, the Pointer School and John Ball.

detailedDescription:
Don't miss out on the final 2-bed apartment at Royal Arsenal Riverside with a parking space and a terrace! On reservations made by the 20th July, receive 6 months rent paid worth £4,014.

Location

5 minutes from London City Airport

Description

Don't miss out on the final 2-bed apartment with parking and a spacious private terrace!

Flat 4 is a large 2-bed apartment based on the ground floor of the development and is move in ready. It has 2 spacious double bedrooms with an en-suite to the master bedroom. Residents will also benefit from the spacious kitchen/living room with fully integrated kitchen appliances and a storage cupboard as well as a utility cupboard with a washing machine.

Reserve this home before 20the July and benefit from 6 months rent-free incentive worth £4,014.

The area
Royal Arsenal Riverside is home to the new ‘cultural quarter’, giving it a creative and vibrant feel. Exciting developments in the area will include a 450 seat theatre and a performance courtyard. Within the development there is a wide array of restaurants, bars and pubs suited for all dining preferences, plus numerous opportunities to enjoy the great outdoors.
In addition to this there are several schools located in Royal Arsenal Riverside that provide high levels of education. St Peters Primary School achieved an outstanding report from Ofsted. There is also the Millennium Performing Arts College and the University of Greenwich within close distance.

Travel*
Royal Arsenal Riverside provides a quick commute thanks to the fantastic transport links into the City. Woolwich Arsenal station is just 300 metres away.

• 19 mins to Canary Wharf

• 32 mins to Liverpool Street

address: Naval House, Victory Parade, Royal Arsenal SE18
detailedDescription:
Stylish, contemporary apartment, in a recently constructed block, at the top end of this landmark development, adjacent to the river, east of Greenwich. Fitted to a high specification, open plan kitchen with range of appliances, reception with access to spacious balcony, sleeping area / bedroom with fitted wardrobe & additional storage cupboard. 24hr Concierge & residents gym complete the package.

Area

The Royal Arsenal is a former munitions factory & storage facility with a history dating back to 1671, that is being tastefully transformed to provide a blend of converted & new build residential properties, together with a central open space, bars, restaurants and an hotel.

Beautifully landscaped, the builder has taken great care to create a development that is a pleasure to live in, rather than yet another sterile 'stack of boxes'. It retains a real sense of community yet retains a high degree of peace and tranquility, away from the 'big smoke'.

The development currently offers

* 24 Concierge & Security
* BodyWorkshop Health & Wellbeing Centre
* Two Youngs "gastro pubs" The Dial Arch & The Guardhouse
* Con Gusto Italian Restaurant
* Craft Beer & Pizzeria, The Taproom
* Three on site cafés
* Health Centre
* Chemist
* Dentist
* Tesco Express
* M&S Food Hall
* Sainsbury's
* Dry Cleaning service
* Zipcar Car Sharing Club
* Fortnightly Farmers Market

Situated east of Greenwich, adjacent to Woolwich Town Centre (offering an array of main street shopping, including Sainsbury's, Tesco and a vibrant street market) the development is easily reached by road & rail.

The station is no more than a short stroll away, which offers a direct route to the City (London Bridge / Cannon Street) in a little over 20 minutes, via the Main Line and less than 25 minutes to Bank / Tower Gateway via the DLR.

London City Airport can also be reached in as little as 5 minutes, with Canary Wharf & Stratford also accessible in less than 25 minutes.

As far as leisure is concerned, a short cab ride will take you to nearby Blackheath, Greenwich or, the O2 - where you will be spoilt for choice in terms of food, drink and nightlife.

As an alternative to the train or car, the Thames Clipper river bus service also docks immediately adjacent to the development and provides additional links with The O2, Greenwich, Canary Wharf, Tower Bridge, Blackfriars, The Southbank (Tate Modern) and beyond.

The Royal Herbert Pavilions is a historical gated private development and sits within 7-acres of beautifully maintained communal grounds. A highly-sought after location offering concierge service seven days a week, leisure facilities to include fully equipped gym, sauna & steam room, swimming pool and tennis courts on site, and a private residents bar. Further benefits include a lovely warm community and places of which you can gather and BBQ in the summer!

For the busy commuter there are buses right outside the development that take you to Woolwich, North Greenwich, Charlton, Blackheath and Lewisham. As well as the acres of communal grounds you are a short walk from some beautiful green spaces such as Oxleas Woods, Shrewsbury Park, Woolwich Common and much more.

detailedDescription:
Doorsteps is excited to market this charming and spacious 4th-floor apartment (there is no other flat above) in the Greenwich area of South East London. Offered in mint condition; this property is approximately 6 years old and still has 993 years lease on it, with approx. 4 years of NHBC Buildmark warranty remaining.

The apartment offers 2 double bedrooms (one is en-suite), a modern bathroom, a large kitchen/ diner, a well-sized lounge with balcony access and good storage room. This 2-bedroom apartment is set within a no-through private residential development offering parking (including covered parking and ev charging points) and lift access. With this property, there is a parking permit that allows free parking anywhere on the development. There are also a number of small park/playground areas for children.

In the block, there is a bicycle storage area. There is also a member of staff available on-site during working hours for any support needed.

The property would suit a family, commuting professionals, or make an excellent buy-to-let investment with rental income.

Location and Transport

The apartment is located very close to local amenities offering local shops, supermarkets, cinemas, restaurants and parks. It is just a 5-10 minute walk to a plethora of retail parks (Greenwich and others) that include a high-quality, diverse range of retailers like Sainsbury’s, M&S, Asda, Primark, Next, TKMaxx, Boots, Decathlon, Ikea, B&Q etc. And caterers like Starbucks, McDonald's, and Nandos.

The location boasts excellent transport links (zone 3) with Westcombe Park (5-7 minute walk) and Charlton stations within a short walking distance. These stations serve the Thameslink and SouthEastern Rail lines with direct service to London Bridge and Kings Cross St Pancras within 18-25 mins.

There are also surrounding bus links (5 min walk to bus stop) and road links to the nearby Blackwall tunnel, A2, A20 and A205. The bus takes you to the O2 and the North Greenwich tube station within 10-15 mins.

Furthermore, the apartment is within walking distance to schools with outstanding Ofsted rating, such as Our Lady of Grace Catholic Primary School and Sherington Primary School.

The Apartment

The apartment is well-maintained with an abundance of natural lighting. It comes with modern integrated kitchen appliances, good internal storage cupboards and two double bedrooms. The property is well insulated with double-glazed windows, requiring very little if any heating. On summer days you can enjoy the breeze due to the north to south openings and veranda.

The flat has excellent views to both the north and the south as it is not obstructed by any other building. To the north, you can see the Shard, the O2, and the London Banking District buildings. To the south, you can see a pleasant view of the Charlton village.

Additionally, there is a refuse area downstairs and an intercom system for opening the door and ringing the bell remotely. The lift is also of good quality (Schneider) and well-maintained.

In general, the flat feels bright and has great ventilation. The water pressure is also excellent, with the central heater/boiler providing almost instant water heating.

The Lounge

The lounge is spacious, bright and allows for direct access to the outdoor balcony. As there is no other flat on top, the balcony has no issues with dripping rainwater from above. There are also satellite provisions for the TV.

The Kitchen

The kitchen space offers ample worktop space for food preparation and includes integrated appliances such as the hob/oven. The kitchen is fitted with a granite surface. Together with the property, the oven, the electric hob, the dishwashing machine, and the fridge are all part of the sale. The fridge, the dishwashing machine and the extractor fan are all Zanussi. The kitchen sink is also fitted with a garbage eater.

Bedrooms

The 2 bedrooms are both of great size. Each bedroom has floor to ceiling wardrobes. The master bedroom also has an en-suite shower room.

Bathrooms

The family bathroom consists of a bathtub with a shower, a hand washbasin, a toilet, a towel heater and a wall-mounted mirror.

Both bathrooms have good quality towel heaters and due to the excellent boiler, you can enjoy a nice hot steaming shower with excellent pressure.

Running Expenses

The flat has a relatively low cost of maintenance. There is a ground rent of approx. £30 per month and the service charge is one of the lowest in this grade of developments for this level of service (approx. £100-150 per month but may vary due to the block needs) to keep the block in excellent condition.

This apartment is not to be missed, it is still relatively new and in mint condition.

Viewing is advised!

Nb: The EWS1 rating (cladding) of this block is classified as B2. The block management is currently waiting for the cost of remedial works to increase the rating of the cladding to the new government specifications. Please consult your bank for mortgage options. As soon as the cost of the remedial works is known, the post will be updated. On the other hand, cash buyers will not have this issue.

detailedDescription:
Hopton Road on the ever-popular Royal Arsenal development is the location for this new instruction. This superb 3-bedroom Duplex, Penthouse has been recently updated with modern fixtures and fittings, and at just over 1400sqft is one of the largest apartments you will find on site.

Arranged over two floors, you enter the flat to find the 3 big double bedrooms on this level with the modern family bathroom and an additional en-suite shower room adjoining the master bedroom.

The property contains generous storage space, with 3 walk-in cupboards, and a further space extending under the stairs, meaning you will have plenty of places to keep things clear and tidy. A rare find on this development!

The upper level is dominated by an expansive open plan living area with stunning views across the River Thames. Floor to ceiling windows make up one entire wall of the property, allowing you to take in the view from anywhere in the room. The west-facing balcony runs the whole width of the property and enjoys sunlight from 2pm until sunset creating a beautiful view up the Thames looking towards Canary Wharf and the London skyline. Ideal for a glass of wine on the balcony after a long day at work.

The kitchen was refitted in 2016 with spacious soft-close units that have granite work tops above. Built-in Neff appliances include a ceramic hob and extractor hood, built-in oven, tall standing fridge/freezer and integrated dishwasher.

Upstairs there is also a useful utility room which has an additional w.c. And wash basin, with enough space for a separate washer and drier.

The property also comes with its own parking space, located securely at bay 4 inside the Building’s inner courtyard.

This is an exciting opportunity to buy a large, unique and modern 3-bedroom penthouse, with amazing river views and tremendous amounts of space.

The Development

One of the 1st Buildings on the Royal Arsenal to be restored and regenerated was the former Shot and Shell Store or Building 45.

This is a well designed mix of the original North & South buildings seamlessly linked by the new West addition.

For the commuters amongst you the Royal Arsenal puts you minutes away from access to the enviable commuter links of the area, with Canary Wharf 19 minutes away on the DLR, the O2 accessible in 8 minutes by the Thames Clipper and London Bridge can be reached in 23 minutes by South East Trains. All this means that you are spoilt for choice when it comes to access to culture, cuisine and shopping!

This will be further enhanced with a Cross Rail Station opening on site in the coming years, slashing journey times by as much as 50%.

Spring 2022 will see the arrival of Woolwich Works - an on-site cultural hub containing large-scale flexible performance and event spaces that will be home to a number of local, national and internationally-renowned resident artistic companies.

Location

A new Civic Centre on Wellington Street provides a new library, post office and cafe/bar.Behind the centre a brand new Tesco's has recently opened alongside a town centre car park and 1000 new homes.The flagship store is due to have a farmers market selling local produce and 2 children's playgrounds.

At the western end of the Powis Street, there is an area known as the 'Woolwich Triangle'.Construction will commence for the new shopping centre with a major retailer taking centre stage.The Triangle includes, leisure space (cafes, restaurants; the area covers around 300,000 sq ft.The redevelopment will revitalise the whole western end of the town centre and will be a car free zone.

The high st will also benefit from the restoration of the Grade II listed buildings which will give character and focus to Woolwich High Street.Once refurbished these historic buildings will accommodate new retail brands and major high street names, the whole area will become more vibrant during the day and in to the evening with new coffee bars and restaurants.

£6.6million was recently spent on the redesign of General Gordon Square and Beresford Square near to the DLR and Train stations.This is now complete and features include new landscape planting, seating areas, a large digital media display ready to show sporting events which have included the 2012 Olympics, and other public events and a new water feature.Major improvements to lighting, paving and the layout of Woolwich market.

Crossrail funding was approved in July 2013 in terms of the station box fit out at Royal Arsenal. Crossrail is a major engineering project to provide new railway connections under central London.Trains will run from Maidenhead and Heathrow in the west to Shenfield and Abbey Wood in the east, taking over the existing stopping services on those routes.The first trains, 10-coach trains are due to run at high frequencies of up to 24 trains per hour during peak hours.

Transport

Being on this development, you are just a 5 to 10 minute walk from Woolwich's high street, cafes and market. Its the perfect place for anyone wanting to trade crowded central London for the space and style while keeping with easy commuting distance.

Train - 8 minute walk to Woolwich Arsenal Station and 20 to 30 minutes into the city centre - London Bridge, Cannon Street and Charing Cross Stations.

DLR - 8 minute walk to Woolwich Arsenal Station and around 25 to 30 minutes into London's Bank Station. Trains run approximately every 10 minutes from Monday-Saturday 05.30 - 00.30 on Sunday 07.00 - 23.30 Destinations include City Airport 5 minutes, Canary Wharf 19 minutes, Stratford 23 minutes.

Tube - North Greenwich Station - Jubilee Line is easily accessible by bus and boat.

Boat - Thames Clippers - The river boat takes you to Canary Wharf in approximately 23 minutes and many stops through central London and Waterloo Visit - for information and timetable. It's perfect for the 02, Canary Wharf, City and West End, now taking the Oyster Card

Access to City Airport - City Airport is only stops away by DLR - its close enough for convenience but we do not have overhead flights.

Open Plan Living

Balcony

detailedDescription:
Being Sold by Online Auctions

Starting Bids from: £425,000.

Buy it now option available

Please call or visit Online Auctions for more information.

This property is for sale by Modern Method of Auction. The Modern Method of Auction is a flexible buyer friendly method of purchase. The purchaser will have 56 working days to exchange and complete once the draft contract has been issued by the vendors solicitor. Allowing the additional time to exchange and complete on the property means interested parties can proceed with traditional residential finance. Upon close of a successful auction or if the vendor accepts an offer during the auction, the buyer with be required to put down a non-refundable reservation fee. The fee will be a fixed fee including the Vat, this secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. The buyer will be required to agree to our terms and conditions prior to solicitors being instructed. Copies of the Reservation form and all terms and conditions can be found on the online Auction website or requested from our Auction Department.

Please note this property is subject to an undisclosed Reserve Price which is typically no more than 10% in excess of the Starting Bid. Both the Starting Bid and Reserve Price can be subject to change. Our primary duty of care is to the vendor. Terms and conditions apply to the Modern Method of Auction, which is operated by goto Auctions.

To book a viewing visit Online Auctions.

General Information

Auctioneer's Comments

This property is for sale by Online Auction which is a flexible and buyer friendly method of purchase. The purchaser will not be exchanging contracts on the fall of the virtual hammer but will be given 56 working days in which to complete the transaction, from the date the Draft Contract is issued by the seller’s solicitor. By giving a buyer time to exchange contracts on the property, means normal residential finance can be sort.

The Buyer’s Premium secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. Fees paid to the Auctioneer may be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property and be included in the calculation for stamp duty liability. Further clarification on this must be sought from your legal representative. The buyer will be required to sign a Reservation form to confirm acceptance of terms prior to solicitors being instructed. Copies of the Reservation form and all terms and conditions can be found in the Info Pack which can be downloaded for free from our website or requested from our Auction Department.

Upon close of a successful auction or if the vendor accepts an offer during the auction, the buyer will be required to make payment of a non-refundable Buyers Premium of £5,400 including VAT plus an administration charge of £354 including VAT, a total of £5,754. This secures the transaction and takes the property off the market.

The Buyer’s Premium and administration charge are in addition to the final negotiated selling price.

Purplebricks are delighted to bring to market this stunning two bedroom two bathroom 5th Floor Apartment. Located in the sought after Greenwich Peninsula development and offering breath taking river views makes this an opportunity not to be missed.

If you need to commute into the City of London, the Jubilee line is only a short walk away which will also be one stop away from the new crossrail line. Or, if you want a more unique journey into work why not catch the Thames clipper, or the Emirates cable car.

detailedDescription:
A marvellous two bedroom, two bathroom modern apartment located within a highly sought after development in the centre of Woolwich. Offered in immaculate condition throughout with high spec fixtures and fittings and a whopping 19x1.37 meter wrap around decked balcony! Offered chain free!

Having lovingly been looked after by the current owners this bright and extremely well presented property comprises an open plan dual aspect reception room with floor to ceiling windows and sliding doors onto the show stopping balcony with tranquil lagoon views, a high gloss fashionable integrated kitchen and ample space for dining and entertaining, two double bedrooms of which the master boasts an en suite shower room. Both bedrooms also boast built in wardrobes and direct access to the balcony. There is a further ultra-modern three piece bathroom suite and excellent storage space.

As well as this impressive living space and balcony you will be able to enjoy river walks or jogs along the Thames path, access to the onsite facilities and 24 hour concierge. Positioned in the heart of Woolwich, which is rapidly emerging as one of London's bright spots and forms part of long stretch of waterfront homes. The arrival of the on-site Crossrail station will add to the already fantastic travel options available to the residents of Royal Arsenal Riverside. Woolwich Arsenal station is within 0.2 miles for the South-eastern, Thameslink and DLR, City Airport is within 7 minutes away, Buses to North Greenwich for Jubilee Line are in abundance as well as the Thames Clipper for a more scenic journey into the city. The Woolwich Ferry South Pier is also under 0.5 miles.

Further amenities include easy access to Greenwich and Blackheath for further bars, pubs and restaurants as well as endless green spaces such as Oxleas Woods, Woolwich and Plumstead Common and both Blackheath and Greenwich Park.

detailedDescription:
A simply stunning two bedroom apartment located on the 4th floor of one of the area’s most sought after new developments within moments of North Greenwich Station. The open-plan kitchen and reception room offers great living and entertaining space and leads out onto two separate balconies featuring fantastic views of both the river and Canary Wharf. The master bedroom features an ensuite shower room and ample wardrobe space while the second bedroom is a good size and has use of the family bathroom. The apartment has a contemporary feel with both kitchen and bathrooms having been finished to an impressively high specification with interior fittings by Jasper Conran. Further benefits to the development include 24 hour concierge, a communal roof terrace and a residents only gym and cinema. Situated moments from North Greenwich Station, this would make a fantastic purchase for a professional looking for a swift commuter.

Situation
Tidemill Square forms part of the Greenwich Peninsula which has seen some fantastic redevelopment over the years and is now one of London's most sought after new build developments. North Greenwich Station is located 0.4 miles away and is on the Jubilee Line which offers swift links to Canary Wharf (one stop) and the West End. The O2 Arena is also located on Greenwich Peninsula which is world famous for live concerts and sporting events as well as offering a fantastic array of restaurants, bars and shops including the new retail shopping outlet.

detailedDescription:

The ground floor of this property consists of a spacious hallway that leads to a 105sqft kitchen, a spacious living area, a double bedroom and a guest W/C and shower room. On the first floor, the property boasts two double bedrooms and a single bedroom which is currently used as an office and a family bathroom. The property also benefits from a large private garden.

This property benefits from an approved planning permission for a large outback building; a six meter extension to the back of the building and a loft conversion; which comprises of a big master bedroom with a walk-in wardrobe and en-suite bathroom with a shower. Located close to Charlton Park and Charlton town centre, this property is also a short distance from Queen Elizabeth Hospital. address: No 5, 2 Cutter Lane, Upper Riverside, Greenwich Peninsula SE10
detailedDescription:
This 3-bedroom penthouse has floor to ceiling windows throughout. With panoramic views that overlook the river Thames, natural light fills the space.

Designed by Design Haus Liberty, the interiors have been inspired by Greenwich Peninsula's unique water-flanked position on the Thames. There are sculptural curved walls alongside textured materials such as exposed concrete that complements the natural materials found along the riverbank, overlooked from the private terrace.

The walls of the open-plan living and dining area fold and flow to maximise the space for modern living. Designed with green-veined marble kitchen worktops and integrated appliances, the wealth of storage space is both functional and well designed. Natural textures are also reflected in the bathrooms, that are fitted with distressed brass and raw timber.

Find this home in No. 5 Upper Riverside, the final building to complete Greenwich Peninsula's Upper Riverside neighbourhood. Designed by world-famous architects som, the 5 prism towers cascade along the riverfront. Located 300m from North Greenwich bus and tube station, adjacent to the Emirates Air Line and opposite North Greenwich Pier, transport links are readily available. Residents of No. 5 Upper Riverside will be the first to enjoy the full set of exclusive residents' amenities listed above.

As the UK's largest area of urban regeneration, Greenwich Peninsula will be transformed over the coming years. There's £8.4 billion being invested in this new area for London, which will include:

* 15,000 new homes in an area that's twice the size of Soho
* 7 new neighbourhoods over 150 acres
* 13,000 new jobs
* 48 acres of public space
* 2 new schools for 2,000 pupils
* 34,000 new settlers, within a diverse and eclectic community
* The Tide, a 5km linear park that wraps around the Peninsula
* 48 acres of public green space

It's a growing community wrapped by a mile and a half of the river. A place that's already bustling with new restaurants, cafes and retail. On Greenwich Peninsula, you'll find all the necessities for contemporary living.

detailedDescription:
B&C Properties is pleased to offer this bright and spacious one-bedroom one-bathroom apartment on the 5th-floor set within this exclusive and exceptionally high-quality development within Kidbrooke Village located in the village centre.

B&C Properties is pleased to offer this bright and spacious one-bedroom one-bathroom apartment on the 5th-floor set within this exclusive and exceptionally high-quality development within Kidbrooke Village located in the village centre.

This apartment has been decorated to an extremely high standard throughout. The apartment comprises of a large open-plan living, dining and kitchen area with floor to ceiling height window opening onto a private balcony. The kitchen is fully equipped to a very high standard including oven, fridge/freezer and microwave.

The apartment is situated right next to Kidbrooke train station, which runs to Lewisham in 6 minutes, London Bridge station in 15 minutes, Waterloo East in 20 minutes, Charing Cross in 25 minutes and 28 minutes to London Victoria, all of which are positioned on the main London Underground lines.

The development benefits from a vast amount of parkland and it is situated in the immediate vicinity of some of the most vibrant areas of London, Blackheath Village and Greenwich, both featuring an array of boutiques, restaurants and bars.

detailedDescription:
The most recent times have proved that your home is no longer just your home, it is now also your work station. This means that most of us will now spend more time at home than ever before.
Nevertheless this flat offers everything you need without even being necessary to leave the development. You can go for a quick swim with your partner, or maybe burn some calories and play some tennis. If you fancy a drink afterwards you can also pop into the bar located within the development. Not to mention that you have your own in-house gym that will save you commuting to and back from the gym on a daily basis.
All in all this flat offers amazing interior space throughout, with a special mention to the extremely high ceilings and gorgeous double height windows.
Both bedrooms are spacious and the ceiling height can be used for additional storage, the living space is ideal as you can cook and spend time together with friends and family simultaneously.
EPC grade E

detailedDescription:
Large well placed apartment currently vacant and viewings welcome. Offering views over the restored stables - the centerpiece of this new development.

Woolwich among property hotspots tipped for further growth when the Elizabeth line launches next year. The apartment makes for a perfect buy to let or first home.

The development sits just 450 metres from the new Woolwich Arsenal Crossrail station and will include a rooftop terrace, concierge and gymnasium. Woolwich has a rich history and a cosmopolitan mix of shops, restaurants and bars to enjoy. Callis Yard sits close to the banks of the Thames, with apartments on upper floors enjoying Canary Wharf and river views.

Facilities Include:
Private Residents' roof terrace
Private Residents' gym
Concierge services
Bicycle storage

Riverside Greenwich is steeped in history, with the world’s largest maritime museum, the monumental Cutty Sark and the Royal Observatory only moments away. Locally, independent new bars and restaurants are re-energising the palate, and the General Gordon and Beresford squares are becoming destinations in their own right. Open-air dining, organic cafés and thriving farmers markets add colour and variety, whilst new gastro-pubs, pizzerias and the vast Tesco supermarket promise a flourishing future for the district.

5 min (0.3 miles) walk from Woolwich Arsenal Station (DLR and National Rail)
7 min walk (0.3 miles) from Woolwich Ferry
6 minute (0.3 miles) walk from Woolwich Arsenal (tfl Clipper)

The development is located on a quiet cul-de-sac within a short walk of Greenwich mainline and DLR Station offering a swift commute to London Bridge, the City and Canary Wharf. detailedDescription:
Stunning one double bedroom apartment situated on the third floor of this much sought after modern development on the Kidbrooke Village site. Accommodation comprises entrance hall with inbuilt storage cupboard, leading into the bright open plan reception/kitchen with ample space for relaxing and dining, and full width double glazed windows and door leading out to the private feature balcony with far-reaching parkland views. The kitchen area comprises an ultra-modern and sleek range of matching white fronted wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, induction hob with overhead extractor and electric oven, and further space for appliances. There is a spacious double bedroom with inbuilt wardrobe and a stylish bathroom with modern suite and elegant tiling.

The property is conveniently located within easy access of Kidbrooke station, as well as numerous regular bus routes all providing excellent links into Central London, the City and the surrounding area. There are a variety of shops and amenities nearby, including an array of on-site facilities, with nearby Blackheath, just a short distance away, offering a fashionable array of boutique shops, cafes, bars and restaurants.

detailedDescription:
Moments from Greenwich DLR & National Rail station, this modern two bedroom, two bathroom apartment is ideal for those looking to be close to the historic heart of Greenwich. Located in Bellville Place, part of the Prime Place development, the property c.767 sq ft is located on the 6th floor and comprises an open plan kitchen living area, two double bedrooms, family bathroom, ensuite and south east facing balcony. Residents of Bellville Place benefit from concierge service and lift access.

Bellville House is part of the modern Prime Place development, perfectly located to enjoy everything that makes Greenwich so sought after. A 10 minute walk will have you browsing the many bars, restaurants and museums on offer as well as the famous Greenwich Market. Arguably one of the best parks in London, Greenwich Park is on your doorstep offering ideal weekend walks and breathtaking views across the City. Bellville House also boasts excellent transport links with Greenwich DLR & National Rail station on your doorstep.

detailedDescription:
A well-presented two bedroom flat, that is found on the 8th floor of the purpose built block, located just moments from local shops and Charlton mainline rail.

The property is presented in good order throughout and briefly comprises a good size living room, which leads onto a balcony which has fabulous views. There are two double bedrooms, a fitted kitchen and a modern shower room. There is also a large storage room off the entrance hallway. It's worth mentioning that the property is perfect for any discerning football fan, as the block sits adjacent to Charlton Football Stadium. The Kitchen also has almost uninterrupted views of the pitch.

Valliant House is located on Valley Grove. Not only is it moments from mainline rail, it's also extremely close to Charlton Village, along with a huge Sainsbury and Mark and Spencer. There is no chain!

The building has recently been given a £3million upgrade including: A new fire sprinkler system, fire doors, a new boiler/heat interface system and extensive redecoration in the common parts. The exterior of the building is made of brick/concrete and does not have any form of cladding.

A short walk away from the flat are a number of amenities including: Coffee shops (e.g. Costa Coffee and Starbucks), gyms (e.g. Pure Gym and Anytime Fitness), restaurants (e.g. Nandos and Frankie & Benny's) and shops (e.g. Primark, ikea, Boots) and an imax cinema. A short 10min drive/bus ride away is the o2 with countless restaurants, bars, shops etc.

detailedDescription:
Godwin House on the ever popular Royal Herbert Pavilions development is the location for this stunning property. This is a beautiful and spacious two double bedroom, ground floor apartment in a fantastic position within the historic grade II listed development. The apartment comes with a share in the freehold and an allocated parking space.

The property is located in an enviable position within the development in an end of wing position which gives triple aspect windows and views of the surrounding grounds. The accommodation comprises a light and spacious living/dining room, an attractive modern kitchen with ample work surfaces. There are two good size double bedrooms including a very large master bedroom and ample sized second bedroom and a modern bathroom. This is a beautiful apartment and viewing is highly recommended. Virtual tours are also available.

Built in 1865 the Royal Herbert Pavilions is a magnificent converted Grade II listed military hospital by Oxleas Woods. Set in approximately seven acres of private wooded grounds the development provides a fitness centre, swimming pool, steam room, sauna, gymnasium, tennis court and residents private bar.

Location

The properties location is a further benefit including an allocated parking space, easy access to transport links from Shooters Hill for Woolwich, North Greenwich, Blackheath and Lewisham and a share of the freehold.

The Royal Herbert Pavilions is a historical gated private development and sits within 7-acres of beautifully maintained communal grounds. A highly-sought after location offering concierge service seven days a week, leisure facilities to include fully equipped gym, sauna & steam room, swimming pool and tennis courts on site, and a private residents bar. Further benefits include a lovely warm community and places of which you can gather and BBQ in the summer!

For the busy commuter there are buses right outside the development that take you to Woolwich, North Greenwich, Charlton, Blackheath and Lewisham. As well as the acres of communal grounds you are a short walk from some beautiful green spaces such as Oxleas Woods, Shrewsbury Park, Woolwich Common and much more.

detailedDescription:
An outstandingly good flat with two bedrooms on the top floor (second) of this extremely sought after, sixties 'Span' built block at the entrance to Blackheath Park at the top end of the village. Well-tended communal gardens surround the development.

The flat has recently undergone the most comprehensive refurbishment to an exactingly high standard of finish that includes gas fired wet underfloor central heating throughout. The standout feature is the kitchen / dining / living room; a 28' open-plan double aspect space with a full wall of south-facing windows that flood it with natural light and offer a breath-taking tree-top panorama, which the main bedroom also enjoys. The second bedroom has a quiet view of Blackheath Halls to the front on Blackheath Park, the view also shared by the exquisitely fitted bathroom. The open plan kitchen is beautifully fitted with white units and quality integrated appliances.

Situated on the private Cator Estate, Spangate is the most highly desired 'Span' building on the Cator Estate, found at the junction of Blackheath Park and Lee Road, within 200 yards of the centre of Blackheath Village, station and the Heath.

The accommodation comprises ● Entrance Hall ● Kitchen / Living / Dining Room● Two Bedrooms ● Shower Room ● Separate W.C. ● Communal Gardens ● Wet Underfloor Heating ● Garage En-Bloc

detailedDescription:
EWS1 compliant

This modern apartment boasts two double bedrooms a large kitchen diner, terrace & allocated parking. Entered via a communal hallway (with a entry phone system), the entrance hall serves each of the rooms and benefits from a spacious built in storage cupboard. The generous family bathroom comprises a white three piece suite, The living area is semi divided with a kitchen/diner as you first enter, ideal for entertaining or for family meals. There is a modern fitted integrated kitchen flanking one side and a partition wall separates the main living area which features a double glazed door leading out to a private terrace to the rear of the development.

Viewings are highly recommended - Please click 'brochure link' to book instantly!

Owing to Government guidelines and the safety of our clients and potential buyers we have amended the way we carry out open days and have a strict one in one out policy. Please arrive with ppe and be respectful of social distancing whilst waiting your turn to view. We endeavour to give everyone fair and ample time to view and would welcome a second viewing if you feel you need more time.

Location

For commuters, Charlton Station is the nearest taking advantage of fast trains into town with connections via Greenwich, London Bridge, Cannon Street & Charing Cross. Greenwich and Woolwich Arsenal also have the DLR, whereas the nearby North Greenwich O2 Arena is home to the Jubilee Line (one stop into Canary Wharf). Buses directly outside take only 20min straight into North Greenwich underground station for the Jubilee Line.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

address: Conduit House, Hyde Vale, London SE10
detailedDescription:
Rare to the market, this spacious apartment is set in a prominent position on one of Greenwich's premier roads featuring large bay windows flooding the living space with natural light and views towards Rangers House, Greenwich Park and nearby Blackheath. The apartment is very well configured to offer a reception room and 3 very generous sized double bedrooms which can easily be changed to increase the living space if required. There is a separate kitchen and bathroom both in excellent condition while the solid oak flooring and modern decor are in keeping with the style and period of the property. The hallway is spacious enough to accommodate a home office or separate dining area if required and there are french doors opening out directly onto the well maintained communal gardens with a beautiful communal secret garden available to residents. There is off-street parking available on a "first come, first served" basis while on-street parking is widely available and affordable via the local authority.

Situation
Conduit House is a stunning Art Deco mansion block situated on a prominent position on Hyde Vale, one of West Greenwich's most sought after locations. Located a short walk from Greenwich Mainline and DLR Station, this provides a swift commute to London Bridge, The City and Canary Wharf while the recent addition of the Thameslink Line provides direct access to Blackfriars, Kings Cross and Luton Airport. Greenwich Park and Blackheath are moments away as are the popular Greenwich Market and Blackheath Village offering an array of local restaurants, pubs and independent coffee shops.

address: Montana Building, Deals Gateway, Lewisham, London SE13
detailedDescription:
Offers in excess of £475,000. An outstanding and bright two bedroom penthouse that is part of this popular development, located next to Deptford Bridge DLR, and featuring superb communal leisure facilities.

In wonderful condition the property measures circa 750 square foot. Briefly comprising a large open plan kitchen living room, which has access via sliding doors onto a west facing balcony. There are two double bedrooms, a family bathroom and an ensuite. Added benefits include ample storage, video entry and concierge service. The leisure facility is located central to the development and offers a lap swimming pool and a fully equipped gymnasium.

Greenwich town centre is only a short walk away which offers a superb selection of shops and restaurants, along with mainline rail, riverboat service and the royal park. The development also lies adjacent to Deptford Bridge DLR.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Spacious and well presented split level conversion garden flat occupying the lower two floors of this attractive four storey period house.

The accommodation briefly comprises, two bedrooms the main with steps up to the garden and the second with access to a small terrace, there is also a modern bathroom suite on this floor. The ground floor comprises a dual aspect living room with period fireplaces and kitchen/dining room leading to a 35 ft easily maintained rear garden solely used by this flat and perfect for al fresco dining.

In terms of location it couldn’t be better, Greenwich mainline and DLR stations are a few hundred yards away making it a commuters dream to Canary Wharf or the City. A short stroll further takes you through to Greenwich Park and historic Greenwich village with its many restaurants and markets.

All in all this is a ready to move in to property sold with the benefit of the freehold interest and as mentioned before exclusive use of the rear garden so important nowadays.

What the Sellers Say -

"We have spent many magical years in this fantastic garden flat, which has felt like a house of its very own.

Abundant with Victorian charm, from the original fireplaces to the high ceilings, cornicing and the solid brickwork; ‘they don’t build ‘em like they used to’ is an expression that certainly comes to mind.

The garden has been a wonderful source of tranquillity to get away from it all and a great place to have some al fresco dinner while watching the sun go down after a busy day. It also turned us into keen gardeners, which came as a surprise!

With everything at our doorstep from restaurants, shops, an amazing selection of transport links, not to mention all of the beautiful historic buildings and the famous Royal Park, we have felt very lucky to be able to call this place home.

We know that this one will be a hard property to say goodbye to, but we‘re sure the next owner will love it just as much as we have and make some incredible memories of their own."<br /><br />
